verses.latin: Post mortem Achab, rebellavit Moab contra Israel.
verses.english: After Ahab died, the nation of Moab revolted against Israel.

verses.latin: Cecidit autem Ochozias per cancellos cenaculi sui, quod habebat in Samaria, et aegrotavit: misitque nuntios, dicens ad eos: Ite, consulite Beelzebub deum Accaron, utrum vivere queam de infirmitate mea hac.
verses.english: Ahaziah fell through the lattice of his upper chamber, which he had in Samaria, and he became very ill. He then sent messengers, telling them: "Go, consult Beelzebub, the idol-god of Ekron, to see if I will recover from this sickness."

verses.latin: Angelus autem Domini locutus est ad Eliam Thesbiten, dicens: Surge, et ascende in occursum nuntiorum regis Samariae, et loqueris ad eos: Numquid non est Deus in Israel, ut eatis ad consulendum Beelzebub deum Accaron?
verses.english: However, the Angel of the Lord spoke to Elijah the Tishbite, saying: "Get up and go meet the messengers of the king of Samaria. Then you shall say to them: 'Is there truly no God in Israel that you must go to consult Beelzebub, the idol-god of Ekron?'"

verses.latin: Idcirco haec dicit Dominus: De lectulo super quem ascendisti non descendes, sed morte morieris. Et abiit Elias.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord says: 'You will not leave the bed upon which you have climbed, but you will surely die.' And Elijah then departed.

verses.latin: Reversique sunt nuntii ad Ochoziam. Qui dixit eis: Quare reversi estis?
verses.english: And the messengers returned to Ahaziah. He asked them: "Why have you returned?"

verses.latin: Responderuntque ei: Vir occurrit nobis, et locutus est ad nos, dicens: Ite, et revertimini ad regem qui misit vos, et loquimini ei: Haec dicit Dominus: Numquid non est Deus in Israel, ut mittas ad consulendum Beelzebub deum Accaron? Idcirco de lectulo super quem ascendisti non descendes, sed morte morieris.
verses.english: They answered him: "A man met us and spoke to us, saying: 'Go, and return to the king who sent you, and speak to him: Thus says the Lord: "Is there truly no God in Israel that you send to consult Beelzebub, the idol-god of Ekron? Therefore, from the bed upon which you have climbed, you shall not descend, but you will surely die."'

verses.latin: Qui dixit eis: Cuius figurae et habitus est vir ille, qui occurrit vobis, et locutus est vobis verba haec?
verses.english: Ahaziah asked them: "What was the appearance and manner of that man who met you and spoke these words to you?"

verses.latin: At illi dixerunt: Vir pilosus, et zona pellicea accinctus renibus suis. Qui ait: Elias Thesbithes est.
verses.english: And they told him: "He was a hairy man, with a leather belt wrapped around his waist." The king immediately knew and said: "It is Elijah the Tishbite!"

verses.latin: Misitque ad eum quinquagenarium principem, et quinquaginta qui sub eo erant. Qui ascendit ad eum: at ille sedebat in vertice montis. Et locutus est ad eum: Homo Dei, rex praecepit ut descendas.
verses.english: So the king sent a captain of fifty soldiers with his fifty men to Elijah. The captain went up to him, and Elijah was sitting on the top of a mountain. And the captain spoke to him: "Man of God, the king commands that you come down!"

verses.latin: Et respondens Elias, dixit quinquagenario: Si ego homo Dei sum, descendat ignis de caelo, et devoret te, et quinquaginta tuos. Descendit itaque ignis de caelo, et devoravit eum, et quinquaginta qui erant cum eo.
verses.english: And Elijah responded, saying to the captain of fifty: "If I am a man of God, then let fire descend from the sky and consume you and your fifty men." And immediately fire descended from the sky, and it consumed him and the fifty men who were with him.

verses.latin: Rursum misit ad eum principem quinquagenarium secundum, et quinquaginta qui erant cum eo. Qui locutus est illi: Homo Dei, haec dicit rex: Festina, descende.
verses.english: Again, the king sent to him a second captain of fifty soldiers with his fifty men. He spoke to Elijah: "Man of God, this is what the king says: 'Hurry, come down!'"

verses.latin: Et respondens Elias, ait: Si homo Dei ego sum, descendat ignis de caelo, et devoret te, et quinquaginta tuos. Statimque descendit ignis de caelo, et devoravit illum, et quinquaginta qui erant cum eo.
verses.english: And Elijah responded, saying: "If I am a man of God, then let fire descend from the sky and consume you and your fifty men." And immediately fire descended from the sky, and it consumed him and the fifty men who were with him.

verses.latin: Rursum misit principem quinquagenarium tertium, et quinquaginta qui sub eo erant. Qui cum venisset, curvavit genua ante Eliam, et deprecatus est eum, et locutus inquit: Homo Dei, noli contemnere animam meam, et animam servorum tuorum horum quinquaginta.
verses.english: Again, the king sent a third captain of fifty soldiers with his fifty men. When he came, he knelt before Elijah and pleaded with him, saying: "Man of God, please do not despise my life, nor the lives of these fifty servants of yours."

verses.latin: Ecce descendit ignis de caelo, et devoravit duos principes quinquagenarios primos, et quinquagenos qui sub illis erant: sed nunc obsecro ut miserearis animae meae.
verses.english: He continued: "Behold, fire has descended from the sky and consumed the first two captains of fifty and the fifty men who were under each of them. But now, I beg you, have mercy on my life!"

verses.latin: Locutusque est angelus Domini ad Eliam, dicens: Descende cum eo, ne timeas. Surrexit ergo, et descendit cum eo ad regem,
verses.english: And the Angel of the Lord spoke to Elijah, saying: "Go down with him, do not be afraid." So Elijah rose up and went down with him to the king.

verses.latin: et locutus est ad eum: Haec dicit Dominus: Quia misisti nuntios ad consulendum Beelzebub deum Accaron, quasi non esset Deus in Israel, cuius interrogaretur sermo: idcirco de lectulo super quem ascendisti non descendes, sed morte morieris.
verses.english: And Elijah spoke to the king: "Thus says the Lord: 'Because you sent messengers to consult Beelzebub, the idol-god of Ekron, as if there were no God in Israel whose word could be inquired of, therefore you will not leave the bed upon which you have climbed, but you will surely die.'"

verses.latin: Mortuus est ergo juxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus est Elias, et regnavit Joram frater eius pro eo, anno secundo Joram filii Josaphat regis Iudae: quia non erat illi filius.
verses.english: So Ahaziah died according to the word of the Lord which Elijah had spoken. And Joram, his brother, reigned in his place in the second year of Jehoram, son of Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, because Ahaziah had no son.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Ochoziae, quae operatus est, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: As for the rest of the deeds of Ahaziah, and what he accomplished, are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Post mortem Achab, rebellavit Moab contra Israël.
verses.english: After King Ahab died, the kingdom of Moab rebelled against the kingdom of Israel.

verses.latin: Cecidit autem Ochozias per cancellos cœnaculi sui, quod habebat in Samaria, et ægrotavit : misitque nuntios, dicens ad eos : Ite, consulite Beëlzebub deum Accaron, utrum vivere queam de infirmitate mea hac.
verses.english: Now King Ahaziah fell through the lattice of his upper chamber, which he had in Samaria, and he became very sick. He then sent messengers, telling them, 'Go, inquire of Baal-Zebub, the god of Ekron, whether I will recover from this illness.'

verses.latin: Angelus autem Domini locutus est ad Eliam Thesbiten, dicens : Surge, et ascende in occursum nuntiorum regis Samariæ, et dices ad eos : Numquid non est Deus in Israël, ut eatis ad consulendum Beëlzebub deum Accaron ?
verses.english: But the Angel of the Lord spoke to Elijah the Tishbite, saying, 'Arise, and go up to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria, and you shall say to them: Is there no God in Israel, that you go to inquire of Baal-Zebub, the god of Ekron?'

verses.latin: Quam ob rem hæc dicit Dominus : De lectulo super quem ascendisti, non descendes, sed morte morieris. Et abiit Elias.
verses.english: Therefore, this is what the Lord says: 'From the bed upon which you have climbed, you shall not descend, but you will surely die.' And Elijah went away to deliver this message.

verses.latin: Reversique sunt nuntii ad Ochoziam. Qui dixit eis : Quare reversi estis ?
verses.english: So the messengers returned to King Ahaziah. And he said to them, 'Why have you returned so quickly?'

verses.latin: At illi responderunt : Vir obviavit nobis, et dixit ad nos : Ite, et revertimini ad regem qui misit vos, et dicetis ei : Hæc dicit Dominus : Numquid non est Deus in Israël, ut mittas ad consulendum Beëlzebub deum Accaron ? idcirco de lectulo super quem ascendisti, non descendes, sed morte morieris.
verses.english: And they answered, 'A man met us and said to us: 'Go, and return to the king who sent you, and you shall tell him: This is what the Lord says: Is there no God in Israel, that you send to inquire of Baal-Zebub, the god of Ekron? Therefore, from the bed upon which you have climbed, you shall not descend, but you will surely die.''

verses.latin: Qui dixit eis : Qualis erat vir, qui obviavit vobis, et locutus est hæc verba ?
verses.english: And the king said to them, 'What kind of man was he who met you and spoke these words?'

verses.latin: At illi descripserunt : Vir pilosus, et zona pellicea accinctus renibus ejus. Qui ait : Elias Thesbitis est.
verses.english: And they described him, saying, 'He was a hairy man, with a leather belt fastened around his waist.' And the king immediately realized, 'It is Elijah the Tishbite.'

verses.latin: Misitque ad eum quinquagenarium principem, et quinquaginta qui sub eo erant. Qui ascendit ad eum : et ecce ipse sedebat in vertice montis : et locutus est ad eum : Homo Dei, rex præcipit ut descendas.
verses.english: So the king sent a captain of fifty men, with his fifty soldiers who were under him, to Elijah. The captain went up to Elijah; and behold, Elijah was sitting on the top of a mountain. And the captain spoke to him, saying, 'Man of God, the king commands that you come down.'

verses.latin: Respondensque Elias, ait principi quinquagenario : Si homo Dei sum, descendat ignis de cælo, et devoret te, et quinquaginta tuos. Descendit itaque ignis de cælo, et devoravit eum, et quinquaginta qui erant cum eo.
verses.english: And Elijah answered the captain of fifty, 'If I am a man of God, let fire come down from the sky and consume you and your fifty men.' So fire came down from the sky and consumed him and the fifty men who were with him.

verses.latin: Rursum misit ad eum principem alterum quinquagenarium, et quinquaginta cum eo. Qui locutus est illi : Homo Dei, hæc dicit rex : Festina, descende.
verses.english: Again, King Ahaziah sent another captain of fifty men and fifty with him. And that captain spoke to Elijah, 'Man of God, the king says this: 'Hurry, come down!''

verses.latin: Et respondens Elias, ait illi : Si homo Dei sum, descendat ignis de cælo, et devoret te, et quinquaginta tuos. Descendit ergo ignis de cælo, et devoravit illum, et quinquaginta qui erant cum eo.
verses.english: And Elijah answered him, 'If I am a man of God, let fire come down from the sky and consume you and your fifty men.' Therefore, fire came down from the sky and consumed that captain and the fifty men who were with him.

verses.latin: Rursum misit principem tertium quinquagenarium, et quinquaginta qui erant cum eo. Qui cum venisset, curvavit genua ante Eliam, et deprecatus est eum, et locutus est : Homo Dei, noli despicere animam meam, et animas servorum tuorum horum quinquaginta.
verses.english: Again, King Ahaziah sent a third captain of fifty men, with the fifty who were with him. When this captain came, he knelt down before Elijah, and pleaded with him, and spoke: 'Man of God, please do not despise my life, nor the lives of these fifty servants of yours.'

verses.latin: Ecce enim descendit ignis de cælo, et devoravit duos principes quinquagenarios, et quinquaginta qui cum eis erant : sed nunc obsecro ut miserearis animæ meæ.
verses.english: 'For behold, fire has come down from the sky and consumed the two former captains of fifty and the fifty men who were with them. But now, I beg you, have mercy on my life.'

verses.latin: Locutusque est angelus Domini ad Eliam, dicens : Descende cum eo, ne timeas. Surrexit igitur, et descendit cum eo ad regem,
verses.english: Then the Angel of the Lord spoke to Elijah, saying, 'Go down with him; do not be afraid.' So Elijah arose and went down with the captain to the king,

verses.latin: et locutus est ad eum : Hæc dicit Dominus : Pro eo quod misisti nuntios ad consulendum Beëlzebub deum Accaron, quasi non esset Deus in Israël, cujus posses inquirere sermonem : idcirco de lectulo super quem ascendisti, non descendes, sed morte morieris.
verses.english: and he spoke to King Ahaziah: 'This is what the Lord says: 'Because you sent messengers to inquire of Baal-Zebub, the god of Ekron, as if there were no God in Israel whose word you could inquire of, therefore, from the bed upon which you have climbed, you shall not descend, but you will surely die.''

verses.latin: Mortuus est ergo juxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus est Elias, et regnavit Joram frater ejus pro eo, anno secundo Joram filii Josaphat regis Juda : non enim erat illi filius.
verses.english: So King Ahaziah died according to the word of the Lord which Elijah had spoken. And his brother Jehoram (Joram) reigned in his place in the second year of Jehoram, the son of King Jehoshaphat of Judah, because Ahaziah had no son.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Ochoziæ, quæ operatus est, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël ?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Ahaziah, all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum vellet Dominus assumere Eliam per turbinem in cælum, ibant Elias et Elissæus de Galgalis.
verses.english: Now it came to pass, when the Lord was about to take Elijah up to the sky in a whirlwind, that Elijah and Elisha were going from Gilgal.

verses.latin: Dixitque Elias ad Elissæum : Sede hic, obsecro, quia Dominus misit me usque in Bethel. Dixit illi Elissæus : Vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, non dimittam te. Cumque descendissent Bethel,
verses.english: And Elijah said to Elisha, 'Please stay here, for the Lord has sent me as far as Bethel.' Elisha replied to him, 'As the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.' And when they had gone down to Bethel,

verses.latin: egressi sunt filii prophetarum qui erant in Bethel, ad Elissæum, et dixerunt ei : Numquid nosti quia hodie Dominus tollat dominum tuum a te ? Et ille respondit : Ego novi : silte.
verses.english: the sons of the prophets who were in Bethel came out to Elisha and said to him, 'Do you know that today the Lord is taking your master from you?' And Elisha responded, 'Yes, I know; be silent about it.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Elias ad Elissæum : Elissæe, sede hic, obsecro, quia Dominus misit me usque Jericho. Et ille ait : Vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, non dimittam te. Cumque venissent Jericho,
verses.english: And Elijah said to Elisha, 'Elisha, please stay here, for the Lord has sent me as far as Jericho.' And Elisha replied, 'As the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.' And when they had come to Jericho,

verses.latin: accesserunt filii prophetarum qui erant in Jericho, ad Elissæum, et dixerunt ei : Numquid nosti quia hodie Dominus tollat dominum tuum a te ? Et ille ait : Ego novi : silte.
verses.english: the sons of the prophets who were in Jericho approached Elisha and said to him, 'Do you know that today the Lord is taking your master from you?' And Elisha replied, 'Yes, I know; be silent about it.'

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Elias : Sede hic, obsecro, quia Dominus misit me usque ad Jordanem. Qui ait : Vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, non dimittam te. Perrexerunt igitur ambo.
verses.english: And Elijah said to him, 'Please stay here, for the Lord has sent me as far as the Jordan River.' Elisha replied, 'As the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.' So both of them continued on their journey.

verses.latin: Porro quinquaginta viri de filiis prophetarum secuti sunt, qui et steterunt contra, ex adverso, procul : illi autem ambo stabant super Jordanem.
verses.english: Furthermore, fifty men from the sons of the prophets followed them; and they stood facing them, from a distance, while Elijah and Elisha both stood by the Jordan.

verses.latin: Tulitque Elias pallium suum, et involvit illud, et percussit aquas, quæ divisae sunt in utramque partem : et transierunt ambo per siccum.
verses.english: Then Elijah took his mantle, rolled it up, and struck the waters of the Jordan, which then divided to both sides. And both Elijah and Elisha crossed over on dry ground.

verses.latin: Cumque transissent, Elias dixit ad Elissæum : Postula quod vis ut faciam tibi, antequam tollar a te. Dixitque Elissæus : Obsecro ut duplex spiritus tuus fiat in me.
verses.english: When they had crossed, Elijah said to Elisha, 'Ask what you desire for me to do for you, before I am taken from you.' And Elisha said, 'I beg you, let a double portion of your spirit be upon me.'

verses.latin: Qui respondit : Rem difficilem postulasti : attamen si videris me quando tollar a te, erit tibi quod petisti : sin autem non videris, non erit.
verses.english: Elijah answered, 'You have asked a difficult thing. Nevertheless, if you see me when I am taken from you, it shall be granted to you as you have asked; but if you do not see me, it will not be granted.'

verses.latin: Cumque pergerent, et incederent pariter, ecce currus igneus, et equi ignei diviserunt utrumque : et ascendit Elias per turbinem in cælum.
verses.english: As they walked on and talked together, behold, a fiery chariot and fiery horses appeared and separated the two of them. And Elijah ascended by a whirlwind into the sky.

verses.latin: Elissæus autem videns, clamabat : Pater mi, pater mi, currus Israël, et auriga ejus. Et non vidit eum amplius : et apprehendit vestimenta sua, et scidit illa in duas partes.
verses.english: But Elisha, seeing this, cried out, 'My father, my father! The chariot of Israel and its horsemen!' And he saw Elijah no longer. Then Elisha took hold of his own clothes and tore them into two pieces.

verses.latin: Et levavit pallium Eliæ, quod ceciderat ei : reversusque stetit super ripam Jordanis.
verses.english: And Elisha picked up the mantle of Elijah that had fallen from him. Then he returned and stood by the bank of the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Et pallio Eliæ, quod ceciderat ei, percussit aquas, et non sunt divisæ. Et dixit : Ubi est Deus Eliæ nunc ? Et percussit aquas, et divisæ sunt huc et illuc : et transivit Elissæus.
verses.english: And with the mantle of Elijah, which had fallen from him, Elisha struck the waters, but they did not divide. Then he said, 'Where is the God of Elijah now?' And again he struck the waters, and they divided to one side and to the other; and Elisha crossed over.

verses.latin: Videntes autem filii prophetarum, qui erant in Jericho ex adverso, dixerunt : Requievit spiritus Eliæ super Elissæum. Et venientes in occursum ejus, adoraverunt eum proni in terram,
verses.english: Now when the sons of the prophets who were in Jericho saw him from a distance, they said, 'The spirit of Elijah rests upon Elisha.' And coming to meet him, they bowed down to the ground before him,

verses.latin: et dixerunt ei : Ecce sunt apud nos quinquaginta viri fortissimi, qui possunt ire, et quærere dominum tuum : ne forte tulerit eum Spiritus Domini, et projecerit in unum montium, aut in unam vallium. Quibus ait : Nolite mittere.
verses.english: and they said to him, 'Behold, we have fifty strong men with us who can go and search for your master. Perhaps the Spirit of the Lord has taken him up and cast him upon one of the mountains, or into one of the valleys.' But Elisha replied, 'Do not send them.'

verses.latin: Coëgeruntque eum donec acquiesceret, et dicerent : Mitte. Et miserunt quinquaginta viros, qui cum quæsisissent tribus diebus, non invenerunt.
verses.english: But they urged him until he consented, saying, 'Send them.' So they sent fifty men, who searched for three days but did not find Elijah.

verses.latin: Et reversi sunt ad eum : ille autem manebat in Jericho : et dixit eis : Numquid non dixi vobis : Nolite mittere ?
verses.english: When they returned to Elisha, who was still waiting in Jericho, he said to them, 'Did I not tell you: 'Do not send them?'

verses.latin: Dixerunt quoque viri civitatis ad Elissæum : Ecce habitatio civitatis hujus optima est, sicut tu ipse domine perspicis : aquæ vero pessimæ sunt, et terra sterilis.
verses.english: Now the men of the city of Jericho also said to Elisha, 'Behold, the dwelling place of this city is excellent, as you yourself, our lord, perceive. But the waters are very bad, and the land is barren.'

verses.latin: At ille ait : Afferte mihi vas novum, et mittite in illud sal. Cumque attulissent,
verses.english: And Elisha said, 'Bring me a new jar and put salt in it.' So when they brought it to him,

verses.latin: egressus est ad fontem aquarum, et misit in illum sal, et ait : Hæc dicit Dominus : Sanavi aquas istas, et non erit ultra in eis mors, neque sterilitas.
verses.english: he went out to the spring of the waters, and cast the salt into it, and said: 'This is what the Lord says: 'I have healed these waters, and there shall be no more death or barrenness in them from now on.''

verses.latin: Sanatæ sunt ergo aquæ usque in diem hanc, juxta verbum Eliæ, quod locutus est.
verses.english: So the waters were healed to this very day, according to the word of Elisha, which he had spoken.

verses.latin: Mortuo autem Achab, rebellavit Moab in Israel.
verses.english: But after King Ahab died, the kingdom of Moab rebelled against Israel.

verses.latin: Cecidit autem Ochozias per cancellos cenaculi sui, quod habebat in Samaria, et aegrotavit: misitque nuntios, dicens ad eos: Ite, consulite Beelzebub deum Accaron, utrum vivere queam de infirmitate mea hac.
verses.english: But King Ahaziah fell through the lattice of his upper room, which he had in Samaria, and became gravely ill. So he sent messengers, telling them, 'Go, consult Beelzebub, the pagan god of Ekron, to see if I will recover from this illness.'

verses.latin: Angelus autem Domini locutus est ad Eliam Thesbiten, dicens: Surge, et ascende in occursum nuntiorum regis Samariae, et dices ad eos: Numquid non est Deus in Israel, ut eatis ad consulendum Beelzebub deum Accaron?
verses.english: However, the Angel of the Lord spoke to Elijah the Tishbite, instructing him: 'Go now, ascend to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria, and say to them: "Is there no God in Israel, that you must go and consult Beelzebub, the pagan god of Ekron?"'

verses.latin: Quam ob rem haec dicit Dominus: De lectulo super quem ascendisti non descendes, sed morte morieris. Et abiit Elias.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord declares this: 'You shall not get up from the sickbed you are on; instead, you will certainly die.' With this message, Elijah departed.

verses.latin: Reversique sunt nuntii ad Ochoziam. Qui dixit eis: Quare reversi estis?
verses.english: When the messengers returned to King Ahaziah, he asked them, 'Why have you come back?'

verses.latin: At illi responderunt: Vir occurrit nobis, et dixit ad nos: Ite, et revertimini ad regem qui misit vos, et dicetis ei: Haec dicit Dominus: Numquid non est Deus in Israel, ut mittas consulere Beelzebub deum Accaron? Ideo de lectulo super quem ascendisti non descendes, sed morte morieris.
verses.english: They answered him, 'A man met us and told us, "Go back to the king who sent you, and tell him: 'This is what the Lord says: Is there no God in Israel, that you must send to consult Beelzebub, the pagan god of Ekron? Because of this, you will not get up from the sickbed you are on; instead, you will certainly die.'"'

verses.latin: Qui dixit eis: Qualis erat vir, qui occurrit vobis, et locutus est vobis verba haec?
verses.english: He then asked them, 'What kind of man was it who met you and spoke these words to you?'

verses.latin: At illi responderunt: Vir pilosus, et zona pellicea accinctus renibus suis. Qui ait: Elias Thesbites est.
verses.english: They replied, 'He was a man dressed in a rough, hairy garment, with a leather belt around his waist.' The king then realized, 'It is Elijah the Tishbite!'

verses.latin: Misitque ad eum quinquagenarium principem, et quinquaginta qui sub eo essent. Qui ascendit ad eum: at ille sedebat in vertice montis. Et locutus est ad eum: Homo Dei, rex praecipit: Descende.
verses.english: So the king sent to him a captain of fifty men with his fifty soldiers. The captain went up to Elijah, who was sitting on the top of a mountain, and addressed him, 'Man of God, the king commands you: "Come down!"'

verses.latin: Respondensque Elias, ait principi quinquagenario: Si ego homo Dei sum, descendat ignis de caelo, et devoret te, et quinquaginta tuos. Descendit itaque ignis de caelo, et devoravit illum, et quinquaginta qui erant cum eo.
verses.english: Elijah answered the captain of fifty, 'If I am a man of God, then let fire come down from the sky and consume both you and your fifty men.' Immediately, fire descended from the sky and consumed him and all fifty of his soldiers.

verses.latin: Rursum misit ad eum principem alterum quinquagenarium, et quinquaginta qui sub eo essent. Qui locutus est illi: Homo Dei, haec dicit rex: Festina, descende.
verses.english: Again, the king sent another captain of fifty with his fifty soldiers. This captain addressed Elijah, 'Man of God, this is what the king says: "Hurry, come down!"'

verses.latin: Et respondens Elias, ait illi: Si homo Dei ego sum, descendat ignis de caelo, et devoret te, et quinquaginta tuos. Descendit itaque ignis de caelo, et devoravit illum, et quinquaginta eius.
verses.english: Elijah answered him, 'If I am a man of God, then let fire come down from the sky and consume both you and your fifty men.' Immediately, fire descended from the sky and consumed him and his fifty soldiers.

verses.latin: Rursum misit principem tertium quinquagenarium, et quinquaginta qui sub eo erant. Qui cum venisset, curvavit genu ante Eliam, et rogavit eum, atque ait: Homo Dei, noli contemnere animam meam, et animam servorum tuorum horum quinquaginta.
verses.english: Once more, the king sent a third captain of fifty with his fifty soldiers. When this captain arrived, he humbly knelt before Elijah and pleaded with him, saying, 'Man of God, please do not disregard my life, nor the lives of these fifty servants of yours.'

verses.latin: Ecce descendit ignis de caelo, et devoravit duos principes quinquagenarios primos, et quinquaginta, qui cum eis erant: nunc ergo deprecor ut parcas animae meae.
verses.english: Behold, fire has already come down from the sky and consumed the first two captains of fifty with their fifty men. Now, I beg you, spare my life.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Angelus Domini ad Eliam, dicens: Descende cum eo, ne timeas. Surrexit ergo, et descendit cum eo ad regem.
verses.english: Then the Angel of the Lord spoke to Elijah, saying, 'Go down with him; do not be afraid.' So Elijah rose, and went down with the captain to the king.

verses.latin: Et locutus est ad eum: Haec dicit Dominus: Pro eo quod misisti nuntios ad consulendum Beelzebub deum Accaron, quasi non esset Deus in Israel, a quo posses interrogare sermonem: ideo de lectulo super quem ascendisti non descendes, sed morte morieris.
verses.english: Elijah then spoke to the king, saying, 'This is what the Lord declares: Because you sent messengers to consult Beelzebub, the pagan god of Ekron, as if there were no God in Israel from whom you could seek a prophetic word, you will not get up from the sickbed you are on; instead, you will certainly die.'

verses.latin: Mortuus est ergo juxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus est Elias, et regnavit Joram frater eius pro eo, anno secundo Joram filii Josaphat regis Juda, quia non erat illi filius.
verses.english: So King Ahaziah died according to the word of the Lord that Elijah had spoken. His brother Joram then reigned in his place, because Ahaziah had no son. This occurred in the second year of Joram, son of King Jehoshaphat of Judah.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Ochoziae, et opera eius, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: As for the rest of the acts of King Ahaziah, and all that he did, are they not indeed written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum vellet Dominus sublevare Eliam per turbinem in cælum, ivit Elias et Eliseus de Galgalis.
verses.english: Now it came about, when the Lord was about to take Elijah up into glory by means of a whirlwind, that Elijah and Elisha departed from Gilgal.

verses.latin: Dixitque Elias ad Eliseum: Sede hic, obsecro, quia Dominus misit me usque in Bethel. Dixitque Eliseus: Vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, non dimittam te. Cumque descendissent Bethel,
verses.english: And Elijah said to Elisha: 'Stay here, I beg you, because the Lord has sent me on a mission to Bethel.' And Elisha replied: 'As the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.' So they both went down to Bethel.

verses.latin: egressi sunt filii prophetarum, qui erant in Bethel, ad Eliseum, et dixerunt ei: Numquid scis quia hodie Dominus tollit dominum tuum a te? Qui respondit: Et ego novi: silete.
verses.english: Then the sons of the prophets who were in Bethel came out to Elisha and said to him: 'Do you know that today the Lord is taking your master from you?' And he answered: 'Yes, I know; be silent.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Elias ad Eliseum: Sede hic, obsecro, quia Dominus misit me usque in Jericho. Et ille ait: Vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, non dimittam te. Cumque venissent Jericho,
verses.english: And Elijah said to Elisha: 'Stay here, I beg you, because the Lord has sent me on a mission to Jericho.' But he replied: 'As the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.' So they both went to Jericho.

verses.latin: accesserunt filii prophetarum, qui erant in Jericho, ad Eliseum, et dixerunt ei: Numquid scis quia hodie Dominus tollit dominum tuum a te? Et ille ait: Et ego novi: silete.
verses.english: Then the sons of the prophets who were in Jericho approached Elisha and said to him: 'Do you know that today the Lord is taking your master from you?' And he replied: 'Yes, I know; be silent.'

verses.latin: Dixitque illi Elias: Sede hic, obsecro, quia Dominus misit me usque ad Jordanem. Et ille ait: Vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, non dimittam te. Perrexerunt igitur ambo.
verses.english: And Elijah said to him: 'Stay here, I beg you, because the Lord has sent me on a mission as far as the Jordan River.' But he replied: 'As the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you.' So they both continued on their way.

verses.latin: Et quinquaginta viri de filiis prophetarum secuti sunt, et steterunt procul contra eos, illi autem ambo stabant super Jordanem.
verses.english: And fifty men from the sons of the prophets followed them and stood at a distance, watching them. But Elijah and Elisha both stood by the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Et tulit Elias pallium suum, et involvit illud, et percussit aquas, et divisæ sunt in utramque partem, et transierunt ambo per siccum.
verses.english: Then Elijah took his cloak, rolled it up, and struck the waters of the river. And the waters divided to both sides, so that both of them crossed over on dry ground.

verses.latin: Cumque transissent, Elias dixit ad Eliseum: Postula quod vis, ut faciam tibi, antequam tollar a te. Dixitque Eliseus: Obsecro ut duplex spiritus tuus fiat in me.
verses.english: And when they had crossed over, Elijah said to Elisha: 'Ask what you wish me to do for you before I am taken from you.' And Elisha replied: 'I beg that a double portion of your spiritual power may come upon me.'

verses.latin: Qui respondit: Rem difficilem postulasti: attamen si videris me quando tollar a te, erit tibi quod petisti: sin autem non videris, non erit.
verses.english: He answered: 'You have asked a difficult thing. Nevertheless, if you see me when I am taken from you, then what you have asked will be granted to you. But if you do not see me, it will not be.'

verses.latin: Cumque pergerent, et incedentes sermonem conferrent, ecce currus igneus, et equi ignei diviserunt utrumque: et ascendit Elias per turbinem in cælum.
verses.english: And as they continued on their way, speaking together as they walked, behold, a chariot of fire and horses of fire separated the two of them. And Elijah ascended into glory by means of a whirlwind.

verses.latin: Eliseus autem videns, clamabat: Pater mi, pater mi, currus Israel, et auriga ejus. Et non vidit eum amplius: et apprehendit vestimenta sua, et scidit illa in duas partes.
verses.english: But Elisha saw it, and he cried out: 'My father, my father! The chariot of Israel and its horsemen!' And he saw him no more. Then he took hold of his own clothes and tore them into two pieces.

verses.latin: Et levavit pallium Eliæ, quod ceciderat ei: reversusque stetit super ripam Jordanis.
verses.english: And he picked up the cloak of Elijah, which had fallen from him. Then he returned and stood on the bank of the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Et pallio Eliæ, quod ceciderat ei, percussit aquas, et non sunt divisæ. Et dixit: Ubi est Deus Eliæ nunc? Et percussit aquas, et divisæ sunt in utramque partem, et transiit Eliseus.
verses.english: And with the cloak of Elijah, which had fallen from him, he struck the waters, but they did not divide. Then he said: 'Where is the God of Elijah now?' And he struck the waters again, and they divided to both sides. So Elisha crossed over.

verses.latin: Videntes autem filii prophetarum, qui erant in Jericho e contra, dixerunt: Requievit spiritus Eliæ super Eliseum. Et venientes in occursum ejus, adoraverunt eum proni in terram,
verses.english: Now when the sons of the prophets who were in Jericho saw him from across the river, they said: 'The spiritual power of Elijah rests upon Elisha.' And they came to meet him, bowing down to the ground before him.

verses.latin: et dixerunt illi: Ecce sunt apud nos quinquaginta viri fortissimi, qui possunt ire, et quærere dominum tuum: ne forte spiritus Domini tulerit eum, et projecerit in unum montium, aut in unam vallium. Qui ait: Nolite mittere.
verses.english: And they said to him: 'Behold, there are fifty strong men among your servants, who could go and search for your master. Perhaps the Spirit of the Lord has taken him up and cast him upon one of the mountains or into one of the valleys.' But he said: 'Do not send anyone.'

verses.latin: Tunc coëgerunt eum donec acquiesceret, et diceret: Mittite. Misi ergo quinquaginta viros: qui cum quæsisissent tribus diebus, non invenerunt.
verses.english: But they urged him until he consented and said: 'Send them.' So they sent fifty men, and after they had searched for three days, they did not find him.

verses.latin: Et reversi sunt ad Eliseum, sedebat enim in Jericho, et dixit eis: Nonne dixi vobis, nolite mittere?
verses.english: And when they returned to Elisha, who was sitting in Jericho, he said to them: 'Did I not tell you, 'Do not send anyone?'

verses.latin: Dixit quoque viri civitatis ad Eliseum: Ecce habitatio civitatis hujus optima est, sicut tu ipse domine perspicis: aquæ vero malæ sunt, et terra sterilis.
verses.english: Then the men of the city said to Elisha: 'Behold, the situation of this city is excellent, as you yourself, my master, can see. But the waters are bad, and the land is barren.'

verses.latin: At ille ait: Afferte mihi vas novum, et mittite in illud sal. Cumque attulissent,
verses.english: And he said: 'Bring me a new bowl and put salt in it.' And when they had brought it to him,

verses.latin: perrexit ad fontem aquarum, et misit in illum sal, et ait: Hæc dicit Dominus: Sanavi aquas istas, et non erit ultra in eis mors, neque sterilitas.
verses.english: he went to the spring of waters and cast the salt into it, and said: 'Thus says the Lord: I have healed these waters. From now on, there will be no more death or barrenness in them.'

verses.latin: Sanatæ sunt ergo aquæ usque in diem hanc, juxta verbum Elisei, quod locutus est.
verses.english: So the waters were healed to this very day, according to the word of Elisha, which he had spoken.

verses.latin: Ascendit autem inde Bethel: cumque ascenderet per viam, pueri parvi egressi sunt de civitate, et illudebant ei, dicentes: Ascende calve, ascende calve.
verses.english: And from there he went up to Bethel. And as he was going up by the way, some small boys came out of the city and mocked him, saying: 'Go up, you bald head! Go up, you bald head!'

verses.latin: Qui cum respexisset, vidit eos, et maledixit eis in nomine Domini: et egressi sunt duo ursi de saltu, et rapuerunt ex eis quadraginta duos pueros.
verses.english: When he looked back, he saw them and cursed them in the name of the Lord. And two she-bears came out of the forest and mauled forty-two of the boys.

verses.latin: Et abiit inde in montem Carmeli, et inde reversus est Samariam.
verses.english: And he went from there to Mount Carmel, and from there he returned to Samaria.

verses.latin: Cumque vellet Dominus assumere Eliam per turbinem in caelum, ibant Elias et Eliseus de Galgalis.
verses.english: When the Lord was about to take Elijah up into the heavens by means of a whirlwind, Elijah and Elisha were traveling from Gilgal.

verses.latin: Dixitque Elias ad Eliseum: Sede hic, obsecro, quia Dominus misit me usque ad Bethel. Cui ait Eliseus: Vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, non dimittam te. Cumque descendissent Bethel,
verses.english: And Elijah said to Elisha, 'Please, stay here, because the Lord has sent me as far as Bethel.' To which Elisha replied, 'As the Lord lives, and as your very self lives, I will not leave you.' So they both went down to Bethel.

verses.latin: egressi sunt filii prophetarum qui erant in Bethel ad Eliseum, et dixerunt ei: Numquid nosti quia hodie Dominus tollit dominum tuum a te? Et ille respondit: Et ego novi, silentium habete.
verses.english: Then the company of prophets who were in Bethel came out to meet Elisha, and they asked him, 'Do you know that today the Lord is taking your master from you?' And he replied, 'Yes, I know that also; be silent.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Elias ad Eliseum: Elisee, sede hic, obsecro, quia Dominus misit me usque ad Jericho. Et ille ait: Vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, non dimittam te. Cumque venissent Jericho,
verses.english: Then Elijah said to Elisha again, 'Elisha, please stay here, because the Lord has sent me as far as Jericho.' But Elisha insisted, 'As the Lord lives, and as your very self lives, I will not leave you.' So they both went on to Jericho.

verses.latin: accesserunt filii prophetarum qui erant in Jericho ad Eliseum, et dixerunt ei: Numquid nosti quia hodie Dominus tollit dominum tuum a te? Et ait: Et ego novi, silentium habete.
verses.english: And the company of prophets who were in Jericho came to Elisha and asked him, 'Do you know that today the Lord is taking your master from you?' He replied, 'Yes, I know that also; be silent.'

verses.latin: Dixitque illi Elias: Transi Jordanem, et sede hic, quia Dominus misit me usque ad Jordanem. Qui ait: Vivit Dominus, et vivit anima tua, non dimittam te. Ierunt igitur ambo.
verses.english: Then Elijah said to him, 'Please, cross the Jordan, and stay here, because the Lord has sent me as far as the Jordan River.' But Elisha affirmed again, 'As the Lord lives, and as your very self lives, I will not leave you.' So both of them continued on their way.

verses.latin: Et quinquaginta viri de filiis prophetarum secuti sunt, qui et steterunt contra, e regione procul. Illi autem ambo stabant super Jordanem.
verses.english: And fifty men from the company of prophets followed them and stood watching from a distance, directly opposite them. But Elijah and Elisha themselves stood by the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Tulitque Elias pallium suum, et involvit illud, et percussit aquas: quae divisae sunt in utramque partem, et transierunt ambo per siccum.
verses.english: Then Elijah took his mantle, rolled it up, and struck the waters of the Jordan. The waters parted to both sides, and both Elijah and Elisha crossed over on dry ground.

verses.latin: Cumque transissent, Elias dixit ad Eliseum: Postula quod vis, ut faciam tibi, antequam tollar a te. Dixitque Eliseus: Obsecro, ut fiat duplum spiritus tui in me.
verses.english: When they had crossed over, Elijah said to Elisha, 'Ask what you wish for me to do for you, before I am taken from you.' Elisha then replied, 'I beg you, let a double portion of your prophetic spirit be upon me.'

verses.latin: Et ille ait: Rem difficilem postulasti: attamen si videris me quando tollar a te, erit tibi quod petisti: sin autem non videris, non erit.
verses.english: Elijah responded, 'You have asked a difficult thing. Nevertheless, if you see me when I am taken from you, then what you have asked will be granted to you. But if you do not see me, it will not be.'

verses.latin: Cumque pergerent, et ultra loquerentur, ecce currus igneus, et equi ignei diviserunt utrumque: et ascendit Elias per turbinem in caelum.
verses.english: And as they continued on their way, still talking, behold, a chariot of fire and horses of fire appeared and separated the two of them. Then Elijah went up into the heavens by means of a whirlwind.

verses.latin: Eliseus autem videns, clamavit: Pater mi, pater mi, currus Israel, et auriga ejus. Et non vidit eum amplius: et apprehendit vestimenta sua, et scidit illa in duas partes.
verses.english: But Elisha saw it, and he cried out, 'My father, my father! The chariot of Israel and its horseman!' —a declaration of Israel's strength and Elijah's importance. And he saw Elijah no more. Then, in his grief, Elisha took hold of his own clothes and tore them into two pieces.

verses.latin: Et levavit pallium Eliae, quod ceciderat ei: et reversus stetit super ripam Jordanis.
verses.english: Then Elisha picked up Elijah’s mantle, which had fallen from him. He turned back and stood by the bank of the Jordan River.

verses.latin: Et pallio Eliae, quod ceciderat ei, percussit aquas, et non sunt divisae. Et dixit: Ubi est Dominus Deus Eliae nunc? Percussitque aquas, et divisae sunt in utramque partem: et transivit Eliseus.
verses.english: And with Elijah’s mantle, which had fallen from him, he struck the waters of the Jordan, but they did not part. So Elisha cried out, 'Where is the Lord, the God of Elijah, now?' He then struck the waters again, and they parted to both sides, and Elisha crossed over.

verses.latin: Videntes autem filii prophetarum, qui erant in Jericho e regione, dixerunt: Requievit spiritus Eliae super Eliseum. Et venientes in occursum ejus, adoraverunt eum proni in terram.
verses.english: When the company of prophets from Jericho, who had been watching from across the river, saw this, they declared, 'The spirit of Elijah rests upon Elisha!' And they came to meet him, bowing down before him with their faces to the ground.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ei: Ecce sunt apud servos tuos quinquaginta viri fortes: qui possint ire, et quaerere dominum tuum: ne forte spiritus Domini tulerit eum, et projecerit in unum montium, aut in unam vallium. Qui ait: Nolite mittere.
verses.english: And they said to him, 'Behold, your servants have fifty strong men with us who could go and search for your master. Perhaps the Spirit of the Lord has taken him up and cast him upon one of the mountains or into one of the valleys.' But Elisha said, 'Do not send them.'

verses.latin: Coegeruntque eum donec acquiesceret, et diceret: Mittite. Miserumque quinquaginta viros, qui quaesierunt tribus diebus, et non invenerunt.
verses.english: But they urged him so persistently that he finally gave in and said, 'Send them.' So they sent fifty men, who searched for three days but did not find him.

verses.latin: Et reversi sunt ad Eliseum, sedebat enim in Jericho, et dixit eis: Nonne dixi vobis, nolite mittere?
verses.english: When they returned to Elisha — for he was staying in Jericho — he said to them, 'Did I not tell you, 'Do not send them?'

verses.latin: Dixeruntque viri civitatis ad Eliseum: Ecce habitatio civitatis hujus optima est, sicut tu ipse domine perspicis: aquae vero pessimae sunt, et terra sterilis.
verses.english: Then the men of the city of Jericho said to Elisha, 'Behold, the situation of this city is excellent, as you yourself, our master, can see. But its waters are very bad, and the land is unproductive.'

verses.latin: At ille ait: Afferte mihi vas novum, et mittite in illud sal. Cumque attulissent,
verses.english: But Elisha said, 'Bring me a new jar, and put salt in it.' So they brought it to him.

verses.latin: Egressus ad fontem aquarum, misit in illum sal, et ait: Haec dicit Dominus: Sanavi aquas istas, et non erit ultra in eis mors, neque sterilitas.
verses.english: Then Elisha went out to the spring of the waters, and he cast the salt into it, declaring, 'Thus says the Lord: 'I have now healed these waters. From this moment on, there will be no more death nor barrenness from them.''

verses.latin: Sanataeque sunt aquae usque in diem hanc, juxta verbum Elisei, quod locutus est.
verses.english: And the waters have remained healed to this very day, according to the prophetic word that Elisha spoke.

verses.latin: Ascendit inde Bethel: cumque ascenderet per viam, pueri parvi egressi sunt de civitate, et illudebant ei, dicentes: Ascende calve, ascende calve.
verses.english: From there, Elisha went up towards Bethel. As he was going up by the road, some young lads came out from the city and began to mock him, shouting, 'Go up, bald head! Go up, bald head!' — a taunt challenging his authority and connection to Elijah's ascent.

verses.latin: Qui cum se respexisset, vidit eos, et maledixit eis in nomine Domini: et egressi sunt duo ursi de saltu, et rapuerunt ex eis quadraginta duos pueros.
verses.english: And when Elisha turned and looked at them, he saw them and cursed them in the name of the Lord. Immediately, two she-bears came out of the nearby forest and attacked them, tearing apart forty-two of the boys.

verses.latin: Et abiit inde in montem Carmeli, et inde reversus est Samariam.
verses.english: Then Elisha went from there to Mount Carmel, and from Mount Carmel, he returned to Samaria.

verses.latin: Moab vero rebellavit contra Israël, post mortem Achab.
verses.english: Moab, however, rebelled against Israel after Ahab's death.

verses.latin: Et regnavit Joram filius Achab super Israël in Samaria, anno duodecimo Josaphat regis Juda: regnavitque duodecim annis.
verses.english: And Joram, Ahab's son, became king over Israel in Samaria during the twelfth year of Jehoshaphat, who was king of Judah. Joram reigned for twelve years.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino, sed non quasi pater suus et mater sua: abstulit enim statuas Baal quas fecerat pater ejus.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the Lord's sight, though not to the same extent as his father Ahab or his mother Jezebel. For Joram removed the stone pillars of Baal that his father had set up.

verses.latin: Porro Mesa rex Moab nutriebat pecora multa, et solvebat regi Israël centum millia agnorum, et centum millia arietum cum velleribus suis.
verses.english: Now Mesha, the king of Moab, was a sheep breeder, and he used to pay tribute to the king of Israel: a hundred thousand lambs and a hundred thousand rams with their wool.

verses.latin: Cumque mortuus esset Achab, transgressus est Moab foedus quod habebat cum rege Israël.
verses.english: But after Ahab died, Moab broke the treaty they had with the king of Israel.

verses.latin: Egressus est ergo rex Joram in die illa de Samaria, et recensuit Israël.
verses.english: So King Joram left Samaria that day and took a census of Israel's fighting men.

verses.latin: Misitque ad Josaphat regem Juda, dicens: Rex Moab rebellavit contra me, veni mecum in Moab ad pugnandum. Qui respondit: Ascendam: ego sicut tu, populus meus sicut populus tuus, et equi mei sicut equi tui.
verses.english: He then sent a message to Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, saying, 'The king of Moab has rebelled against me. Will you come with me to fight against Moab?' Jehoshaphat replied, 'I will go up with you. My forces are like your forces, my people like your people, and my horses like your horses.'

verses.latin: Dixitque: Per quam viam ascendemus? At ille respondit: Per viam deserti Idumææ.
verses.english: Then Joram asked, 'By what route should we advance?' And Jehoshaphat answered, 'By way of the desert of Edom.'

verses.latin: Perrexerunt igitur rex Israël, et rex Juda, et rex Edom: et circuierunt per viam septem dierum, nec erat aqua exercitui et jumentis quæ sequebantur eos.
verses.english: So the king of Israel, the king of Judah, and the king of Edom set out. They marched for seven days, but there was no water for their army or for the animals that followed them.

verses.latin: Dixitque rex Israël: Heu, heu, vocavit Dominus tres reges hos ut traderet eos in manu Moab!
verses.english: Then the king of Israel cried out, 'Oh no! Has the Lord called these three kings together only to deliver them into the hand of Moab?'

verses.latin: Et ait Josaphat: Non est hic propheta Domini, ut consulamus Dominum per eum? Et respondit unus de servis regis Israël: Est Eliseus filius Saphat, qui fundebat aquam super manus Eliæ.
verses.english: But Jehoshaphat asked, 'Is there no prophet of the Lord here through whom we might consult the Lord?' One of the servants of the king of Israel replied, 'Elisha, the son of Shaphat, is here. He used to pour water on Elijah's hands'—meaning he was Elijah's personal assistant and successor.

verses.latin: Et ait Josaphat: Est sermo Domini apud eum. Descenditque rex Israël, et Josaphat, et rex Edom, ad Eliseum.
verses.english: Jehoshaphat then declared, 'The Lord's message is indeed with him.' So the king of Israel, Jehoshaphat, and the king of Edom went down to meet Elisha.

verses.latin: Dixitque Eliseus ad regem Israël: Quid mihi et tibi est? vade ad prophetas patris tui et matris tuæ. Et ait illi rex Israël: Quia vocavit Dominus tres reges hos, ut traderet eos in manu Moab.
verses.english: Elisha said to the king of Israel, 'What business do you and I have together? Go to the prophets of your father and your mother!' The king of Israel answered him, 'No, for the Lord has called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Eliseus: Vivit Dominus exercituum, in cujus conspectu sto, quod si non vultum Josaphat regis Juda erubescerem, non adtendissem quidem te, nec respexissem.
verses.english: Elisha declared, 'As the Lord of hosts lives, before whom I stand, if I did not respect the presence of Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, I would not even look at you or acknowledge you.'

verses.latin: Nunc autem adducite mihi psaltem. Cumque caneret psaltes, facta est super eum manus Domini.
verses.english: But now, bring me a harpist. And as the harpist played, the hand of the Lord came upon Elisha.

verses.latin: Et ait: Hæc dicit Dominus: Facite in torrente hoc scrobes et scrobes.
verses.english: And he said, 'Thus says the Lord: Dig many trenches in this dry streambed.'

verses.latin: Hæc enim dicit Dominus: Non videbitis ventum, neque pluviam, et torrens iste replebitur aquis, et bibet tam vos, quam familia vestra et jumenta.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord: 'You will neither see wind nor rain, yet this streambed will be filled with water, so that you, your troops, and your animals may drink.'

verses.latin: Parumque hoc est in conspectu Domini, insuper dabit etiam Moab in manibus vestris.
verses.english: And this is but a small thing in the Lord's sight. He will also deliver Moab into your hands.

verses.latin: Et percutietis omnem civitatem munitam, et omnem urbem egregiam, et universam arborem fructiferam succidetis, et universos fontes aquarum obturabitis, et omnem agrum optimum universis lapidibus comminuetis.
verses.english: You will strike every fortified city and every excellent city. You will cut down every fruit tree, stop up every spring of water, and ruin every good field with stones.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo mane, quando offerri solet sacrificium, et ecce aquæ veniebant per viam Edom, et repleta est terra aquis.
verses.english: So it happened in the morning, at the time when the sacrifice was offered, that behold, water came by way of Edom, and the land was filled with water.

verses.latin: Omnes autem Moabitae audientes quod ascendissent reges ad pugnandum adversum eos, convocaverunt omnes qui accingi poterant balteo, et steterunt in terminis.
verses.english: Now all the Moabites, hearing that the kings had come up to fight against them, gathered everyone who could put on a belt for battle and stood at their border.

verses.latin: Et primo mane consurgentes, cum sol jam refulgeret ex adverso, viderunt Moabitae procul aquas quasi sanguinem.
verses.english: When they rose early in the morning, and the sun was shining opposite them, the Moabites saw the water in the distance, appearing to them like blood.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Sanguis est: gladiis pugnaverunt reges, et cæsi sunt mutuo: nunc perge ad prædam, Moab.
verses.english: And they said, 'This is blood! The kings must have fought with their swords and killed each other. Now, Moab, to the plunder!'

verses.latin: Cumque venissent ad castra Israël, surgentes Israëlitae percusserunt Moabitas, qui fugerunt coram eis. Persecutique sunt eos, et percusserunt Moab.
verses.english: But when the Moabites came to the camp of Israel, the Israelites rose up and struck the Moabites, who fled before them. The Israelites pursued them and continued to strike Moab.

verses.latin: Et civitates destruxerunt: et omnem agrum optimum universis lapidibus repleverunt, congerentes: et universos fontes aquarum obturaverunt: et omne lignum fructiferum succiderunt, ita ut murus tantum ex lapidibus remaneret in Cirrhas: et circumdederunt ballistis locum, et percusserunt eum.
verses.english: They destroyed their cities and filled every good field with stones by throwing them. They stopped up every spring of water and cut down every fruit tree. So only the walls of stones were left in Kir-hareseth. Then the forces surrounded the city with slingers and attacked it.

verses.latin: Videns autem rex Moab quod vinceretur, assumpsit secum septingentos viros educentes gladium, ut irrumperet ad regem Edom: et non potuerunt.
verses.english: When the king of Moab saw that the battle was too fierce for him, he took with him seven hundred swordsmen to break through to the king of Edom's position, but they were unable.

verses.latin: Tollensque filium suum primogenitum, qui regnaturus erat pro eo, obtulit holocaustum super murum: et facta est indignatio magna in Israël: statimque recesserunt ab eo, et reversi sunt in terram suam.
verses.english: Then he took his eldest son, who was to succeed him as king, and offered him as a burnt offering upon the city wall. This act caused great wrath to fall upon Israel. Immediately, they withdrew from him and returned to their own land.

verses.latin: Joram filius Achab regnavit super Israël in Samaria, anno octavodecimo Josaphat regis Juda: et regnavit duodecim annis.
verses.english: Joram, the son of Ahab, began to rule over Israel in Samaria during the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah. He reigned for twelve years.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino, sed non sicut pater suus et mater: abstulit enim statuam Baal quam fecerat pater ejus.
verses.english: He did evil in the sight of the Lord, but not to the extent of his father and mother, for he removed the stone column of Baal that his father had made.

verses.latin: Verumtamen peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël, adhæsit: nec recessit ab eis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he clung to the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, who had caused Israel to sin, and he did not turn away from them.

verses.latin: Porro Mesa rex Moab nutriebat pecora multa, et solvebat regi Israël centum millia agnorum, et centum millia arietum cum velleribus suis.
verses.english: Now Mesa, the king of Moab, was a sheep breeder. He used to pay the king of Israel a tribute of one hundred thousand lambs, and one hundred thousand rams with their wool.

verses.latin: Cumque mortuus esset Achab, transgressus est rex Moab, ad regem Israël.
verses.english: But when Ahab died, the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel.

verses.latin: Egressus est ergo rex Joram in die illa de Samaria, et recensuit universum Israël.
verses.english: So King Joram left Samaria that very day and reviewed all the men of Israel.

verses.latin: Abiitque, et misit ad Josaphat regem Juda, dicens: Rex Moab recessit a me: veni mecum contra Moab ad prælium. Qui respondit: Ascendam: ego sicut tu, populus meus sicut populus tuus, et equi mei sicut equi tui.
verses.english: He went and sent a message to Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, saying: 'The king of Moab has rebelled against me. Will you come with me to fight against Moab?' Jehoshaphat replied: 'I will go up with you. My people are like your people, and my horses are like your horses.'

verses.latin: Et ait: Per quam viam ascendemus? At ille respondit: Per viam deserti Idumææ.
verses.english: Joram then asked: 'By which way should we march up?' Jehoshaphat answered: 'Through the way of the desert of Edom.'

verses.latin: Perrexerunt igitur rex Israël, et rex Juda, et rex Edom: et circuierunt per viam septem dierum, nec erat aqua exercitui et jumentis quæ sequebantur eos.
verses.english: So the king of Israel, the king of Judah, and the king of Edom went forth. They marched in a roundabout way for seven days, and there was no water for the army or for the animals that followed them.

verses.latin: Dixitque rex Israël: Heu! heu! Convocavit Dominus tres reges hos, ut traderet eos in manu Moab!
verses.english: The king of Israel cried out: 'Alas, alas! Has the Lord called these three kings together only to deliver them into the hand of Moab?'

verses.latin: Et ait Josaphat: Non est hic propheta Domini, ut consulamus Dominum per eum? Et respondit unus de servis regis Israël: Est hic Eliseus filius Saphat, qui fundebat aquam super manus Eliæ.
verses.english: Then Jehoshaphat asked: 'Is there no prophet of the Lord here, that we may inquire of the Lord through him?' One of the servants of the king of Israel answered: 'Elisha, the son of Shaphat, is here, he who poured water over the hands of Elijah.'

verses.latin: Et ait Josaphat: Est apud eum sermo Domini. Descenditque rex Israël et Josaphat et rex Edom ad eum.
verses.english: And Jehoshaphat said: 'The word of the Lord is with him.' So the king of Israel, Jehoshaphat, and the king of Edom went down to him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Eliseus ad regem Israël: Quid mihi et tibi est? vade ad prophetas patris tui et matris tuæ. Et ait illi rex Israël: Quia convocavit Dominus tres reges hos, ut traderet eos in manu Moab.
verses.english: Elisha said to the king of Israel: 'What concern have I with you? Go to the prophets of your father and your mother.' The king of Israel replied to him: 'No, because the Lord has called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab!'

verses.latin: Dixitque Eliseus: Vivit Dominus exercituum, in cujus conspectu sto, quod si non vultum Josaphat regis Juda erubescerem, non attenderem quidem te, nec aspicerem.
verses.english: Then Elisha said: 'As the Lord of hosts lives, before whom I stand, if it were not for my respect for Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, I would not even give you attention or look at you.'

verses.latin: Nunc autem adducite mihi psalten. Cumque caneret psaltes, facta est super eum manus Domini.
verses.english: Now, bring me a harpist. And when the harpist played, the hand of the Lord came upon Elisha.

verses.latin: Et ait: Hæc dicit Dominus: Facite alveum hunc fossas et fossas.
verses.english: And he said: 'Thus says the Lord: Make this valley full of ditches, dig many ditches.'

verses.latin: Hæc enim dicit Dominus: Non videbitis ventum, neque pluviam, et alveus iste replebitur aquis, et bibetis vos, et jumenta vestra, et pecora vestra.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord: 'You will not see wind, nor will you see rain, yet this valley will be filled with water, and you, your livestock, and your flocks will drink.'

verses.latin: Parumque hoc est in conspectu Domini: insuper et dabit Moab in manus vestras.
verses.english: And this is but a small thing in the sight of the Lord: He will also deliver Moab into your hands.

verses.latin: Et percutietis omnem civitatem munitam, et omnem urbem egregiam: et omnem arborem fructiferam succidetis, et universos aquarum scaturigines obturabitis: et omnem agrum optimum universis lapidibus comminuetis.
verses.english: You will strike every fortified city and every excellent city. You will cut down every fruitful tree, and you will stop up all springs of water, and you will ruin every good field with stones.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo mane, quando offerri solet sacrificium, et ecce aquæ veniebant per viam Edom, et repleta est terra aquis.
verses.english: So it came to pass in the morning, at the time when the sacrifice is usually offered, that suddenly water came by the way of Edom, and the land was filled with water.

verses.latin: Omnes autem Moabitæ audientes quod ascendissent reges, ad pugnandum adversum eos, convocaverunt omnes qui accingi poterant supra annos pubertatis, et steterunt in terminis.
verses.english: Now all the Moabites, hearing that the kings had come up to fight against them, gathered together everyone who could put on armor, from young men to old, and they stood at their borders.

verses.latin: Primoque mane surgentes, et orto jam sole ex adverso aquarum, viderunt Moabitæ procul aquas rubras quasi sanguinem.
verses.english: Rising early in the morning, as the sun rose opposite the water, the Moabites saw the water from afar, red like blood.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Sanguis est gladii. Pugnaverunt reges contra se, et cæsi sunt mutuo: nunc ergo, Moab, ad prædam!
verses.english: And they said: 'This is the blood of the sword! The kings must have fought against each other and killed one another. Now, Moab, to the plunder!'

verses.latin: Cumque venissent ad castra Israël, surgentes Israël percusserunt Moabitas, qui fugerunt coram eis. Persecutique sunt et cæderunt Moab, vastantes.
verses.english: But when they came to the camp of Israel, the Israelites rose up and struck the Moabites, who fled before them. They pursued them, striking down and devastating Moab.

verses.latin: Civitates quoque destruxerunt: et omnem agrum optimum, mittentes singuli lapides, repleverunt: et universos aquarum fontes obturaverunt: et omnem arborem fructiferam succiderunt, ita ut muri tantum remanerent civitatis Kir Haraseth: et circumdederunt fundibalarii, et percusserunt eam.
verses.english: They also destroyed the cities, and every good field they filled with stones by each man throwing a stone. They stopped up all the springs of water and cut down every fruitful tree, so that only the walls of the city of Kir Haraseth remained. The slingers surrounded it and struck it.

verses.latin: Quod cum vidisset rex Moab, vehementer sibi damnum inferri, assumptis septingentis viris educentibus gladium, irruit in regem Edom, ut pelleret eum: et non potuit.
verses.english: When the king of Moab saw that the battle was too fierce for him, he took with him seven hundred men who drew swords to break through to the king of Edom, but he could not.

verses.latin: Tulitque filium suum primogenitum, qui regnaturus erat pro eo, et obtulit holocaustum super murum: et facta est indignatio magna in Israël: statimque recesserunt ab eo, et reversi sunt in terram suam.
verses.english: Then he took his firstborn son, who was to reign in his place, and offered him as a burnt offering upon the wall. And there was great indignation in Israel. Immediately, they withdrew from him and returned to their own land.

verses.latin: Moab vero post mortem Achab recessit ab Israël.
verses.english: Moab rebelled against Israel after King Achab died.

verses.latin: Porro Joram filius Achab regnavit super Israël in Samaria anno decimo octavo Josaphat regis Juda, regnavitque duodecim annis.
verses.english: Now Joram, son of Achab, began his reign over Israel in Samaria during the eighteenth year of Josaphat's kingship in Judah, and Joram reigned for twelve years.

verses.latin: Fecitque malum coram Domino, sed non quasi pater suus et mater sua: abstulit enim statuas Baal quas fecerat pater ejus.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, yet not to the same degree as his father and mother had done, for he had removed the idols of Baal that his father had erected.

verses.latin: Mesa quoque rex Moab nutriebat pecora multa, et solvebat regi Israël centum millia agnorum, et centum millia arietum cum velleribus suis.
verses.english: Now Mesa, the king of Moab, was a wealthy sheep breeder, and he was required to pay the king of Israel a tribute of one hundred thousand lambs and one hundred thousand rams with their wool.

verses.latin: Cumque mortuus fuisset Achab, transgressus est Mesa rex Moab adversum regem Israël.
verses.english: But when King Achab had died, Mesa, the king of Moab, openly rebelled against the king of Israel.

verses.latin: Egressus est ergo rex Joram in die illa de Samaria, et recensuit universum Israël.
verses.english: So King Joram marched out from Samaria at that time and mustered all the fighting men of Israel.

verses.latin: Misitque ad Josaphat regem Juda dicens: Rex Moab rebellavit contra me, veni mecum ad Moab ad præliandum. Qui respondit: Ascendam: ego sicut tu, populus meus sicut populus tuus, equi mei sicut equi tui.
verses.english: And Joram sent a message to Josaphat, the king of Judah, saying: 'The king of Moab has rebelled against me. Will you come with me to Moab to wage war?' Josaphat replied: 'I will indeed go with you. My resources are entirely at your disposal, my people are your people, and my horses are your horses.'

verses.latin: Dixitque: Per quam viam ascendemus? At ille respondit: Per viam deserti Idumææ.
verses.english: Then Joram asked, 'By what route should our army advance?' And Josaphat replied, 'We should go through the desert route of Edom.'

verses.latin: Profectus est igitur rex Israël, et rex Juda, et rex Edom: et circuierunt per viam septem dierum, nec erat aqua exercitui, et jumentis quæ sequebantur eos.
verses.english: So the king of Israel, the king of Judah, and the king of Edom began their march. After they had traveled for seven days, there was no water left for their army or for the animals that accompanied them.

verses.latin: Et ait rex Israël: Heu! Convocavit Dominus tres reges hos, ut traderet eos in manu Moab!
verses.english: Then the king of Israel cried out, 'Oh no! Has the Lord truly brought these three kings together just to deliver us into the hand of Moab?'

verses.latin: Et ait Josaphat: Non est hic propheta Domini, ut consulamus Dominum per eum? Et respondit unus de servis regis Israël, et ait: Est hic Eliseus filius Saphat, qui fundebat aquam super manus Eliæ.
verses.english: Then Josaphat asked, 'Is there no prophet of the Lord present here, through whom we might inquire of the Lord's will?' One of the servants of the king of Israel answered, saying: 'Elisha, the son of Saphat, is here. He is the one who used to pour water on Elijah’s hands, serving him as a disciple.'

verses.latin: Et ait Josaphat: Est apud hunc sermo Domini. Descenditque rex Israël, et Josaphat, et rex Edom ad eum.
verses.english: Josaphat then declared, 'The Lord's message is truly with him.' So the king of Israel, Josaphat, and the king of Edom went down to Elisha.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Eliseus ad regem Israël: Quid mihi et tibi est? vade ad prophetas patris tui, et matris tuæ. Et ait illi rex Israël: Quia convocavit Dominus tres reges hos, ut traderet eos in manu Moab.
verses.english: Then Elisha said to the king of Israel, 'What business do I have with you? Go to the prophets of your father and your mother, the prophets of Baal!' But the king of Israel pleaded with him, 'It is because the Lord has truly called these three kings together only to deliver us into the hand of Moab!'

verses.latin: Et ait Eliseus: Vivit Dominus exercituum, in cujus conspectu sto, quod si non vultum Josaphat regis Juda erubescerem, ne attendissem quidem te, nec aspexissem.
verses.english: Then Elisha declared: 'As the Lord of hosts lives, before Whom I stand in service, if it were not for my respect for Josaphat, the king of Judah, I would not even look at you nor acknowledge your presence!'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo adducite mihi psaltem. Cumque caneret psaltes, facta est super eum manus Domini.
verses.english: Now, therefore, bring me a musician to play a stringed instrument.' And while the musician played, the power of the Lord came upon Elisha.

verses.latin: Et ait: Hæc dicit Dominus: Facite in torrente isto scrobem et scrobem.
verses.english: And Elisha declared: 'Thus says the Lord: "Dig many ditches and trenches throughout this dry valley!"'

verses.latin: Hæc enim dicit Dominus: Non videbitis ventum, neque pluviam, et torrens iste replebitur aquis, et bibetis vos, et familiæ vestræ, et jumenta vestra.
verses.english: For thus says the Lord: 'Even though you will see no wind or rain, this valley will be filled with water, so that you, your families, and your animals can drink.'

verses.latin: Parumque hoc est in conspectu Domini, insuper dabit etiam Moab in manus vestras.
verses.english: And this miracle alone is but a small thing in the sight of the Lord; He will also deliver Moab, your enemy, into your hands.

verses.latin: Et percutietis omnem civitatem munitam, et omnem urbem egregiam subvertetis: et universos arbores fructiferas succidetis, et omnes aquarum scaturigines obturabitis, et omnem agrum optimum lapidibus comminuetis.
verses.english: And you will conquer every fortified city and destroy every important town. You will cut down every fruit-bearing tree, stop up every spring of water, and ruin every fertile field by covering it with stones.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo mane, quando sacrificia offerri solent, et ecce aquæ veniebant per viam Edom, et repleta est terra aquis.
verses.english: So it came to pass the next morning, at the hour when the daily sacrifice was customarily offered, and behold, water began to flow from the direction of Edom, and the land was quickly filled with water.

verses.latin: Omnes autem Moabitae audientes quod ascendissent reges, ut pugnarent adversum eos, convocaverunt omnes qui accingi poterant balteo, et steterunt in terminis.
verses.english: Now all the Moabites, hearing that the allied kings had come up to fight against them, called together every man who was able to bear arms, from the youngest to the oldest, and they took their stand at their borders.

verses.latin: Primoque mane surrexerunt, et orto jam sole ex adverso aquarum, visa sunt Moabitis aquæ quasi sanguis.
verses.english: And they rose early in the morning, and when the sun had fully risen, shining on the water, the Moabites looked and saw the water appearing as red as blood.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque: Sanguis iste est, gladiis concisis perierunt: unusquisque occidit proximum suum: nunc igitur, Moab, ad prædam!
verses.english: And they exclaimed, 'This is blood! The allied kings must have fought fiercely and slaughtered each other with their swords! Everyone must have slain his neighbor! Now, therefore, Moab, let us go for the plunder!'

verses.latin: Cumque venissent ad castra Israël, surrexerunt Israël, et percusserunt Moab, qui fugerunt ante eos. Percussisque Moabitis, vastabant regiones.
verses.english: But when the Moabites approached the camp of Israel, the men of Israel suddenly rose up and struck down the Moabites, who then fled in panic before them. As the Israelites pursued and struck down the Moabites, they continued to lay waste to the entire region.

verses.latin: Et civitates destruxerunt, et omnem agrum optimum lapidibus oppleverunt: et universos fontes aquarum obturaverunt, et omne lignum fructiferum succiderunt, ita ut muri tantum remanerent ex lapidibus: ad hoc tantum circumdederunt civitatem muris, et fundis desuper percusserunt.
verses.english: And the allied armies continued to destroy the cities, filling every fertile field with stones. They stopped up every spring of water and cut down every fruit-bearing tree, leaving only the stone walls of the final stronghold. They surrounded this last remaining city with siege works and relentlessly attacked it with sling stones from above.

verses.latin: Videns autem rex Moab quod vicissent eum inimici, assumpsit secum septingentos viros educentes gladium, ut irrumperent ad regem Edom: et non potuerunt.
verses.english: Now when the king of Moab saw that the battle was completely lost to his enemies, he took with him seven hundred men who drew swords, hoping to break through the lines towards the king of Edom; but they were unable to succeed.

verses.latin: Tulitque filium suum primogenitum, qui regnaturus erat pro eo, et obtulit holocaustum super murum: et facta est indignatio magna in Israël: statimque recesserunt ab eo, et reversi sunt in terram suam.
verses.english: Then, in a desperate act, he took his eldest son, who was destined to succeed him as king, and offered him as a burnt offering upon the city wall. This act caused great moral indignation among the allied forces, who immediately withdrew from the city and returned to their own land.

verses.latin: Mulier quaedam de uxoribus prophetarum clamavit ad Eliseum, dicens: Servus tuus vir meus mortuus est, et tu nosti quia servus tuus fuit timens Dominum: et ecce creditor venit ut auferat duos filios meos ad serviendum sibi.
verses.english: A certain woman, one of the wives of your prophet-disciples, cried out to Elisha, saying: 'My husband, your servant, is dead. And you know that your servant was a man who truly feared the Lord—a devout man. But now, a creditor is coming to take my two sons to be his slaves, to settle their father's debt!'

verses.latin: Et ait ad eam Eliseus: Quid vis ut faciam tibi? Dic mihi quid habes in domo tua? Illa respondit: Non habeo ancillam tuam quicquam in domo mea, nisi modicum olei, quo ungar.
verses.english: Elisha then asked her: 'What do you want me to do for you, my child? Tell me, what do you have in your house?' She replied: 'Your servant has absolutely nothing left in my house, except a tiny bit of oil, just enough for personal anointing.'

verses.latin: Et ait illi: Vade, et pete mutuo ab omnibus vicinis tuis vasa vacua non pauca.
verses.english: And he said to her: 'Go now, and borrow empty vessels from all your neighbors—and make sure to get many of them, not just a few!'

verses.latin: Et ingredere, et claude ostium super te, et super filios tuos: et mitte inde in universa vasa haec, et cum plena fuerint, aufer.
verses.english: Then go inside, and close the door upon yourself and your sons. Begin to pour your existing oil into all these empty vessels. And as each vessel becomes full, set it aside.'

verses.latin: Ivit ergo mulier, et clausit ostium super se, et super filios suos: illi afferebant vasa, et illa infundebat.
verses.english: So the woman went and did as Elisha commanded. She closed the door upon herself and her sons. Her sons began bringing her the empty vessels, and she continued pouring from her small jar.

verses.latin: Cumque plena essent vasa, dixit ad filium suum: Affer mihi vas aliud. Qui respondit: Non est. Stetitque oleum.
verses.english: When all the vessels were full, she said to her son: 'Bring me another vessel.' But he responded: 'There are no more!' At that very moment, the flow of oil stopped completely.

verses.latin: Venit ergo, et indicavit homini Dei. Qui ait: Vade, vende oleum, et redde creditori tuo: tu autem, et filii tui vivite de reliquo.
verses.english: So she went and told the man of God what had happened. He said: 'Go, sell the oil, and repay your creditor. You and your sons can then live on the rest of the money.'

verses.latin: Accidit autem quadam die ut transiret Eliseus per Sunam: erat autem ibi mulier magna, quae detinebat eum ut acciperet panem. Cumque frequenter transiret per eam, divertebat ad eam ut comederet panem.
verses.english: It happened one day that Elisha was passing through Shunem. There was a prominent and wealthy woman there, who urged him to come and eat bread with her. So whenever he passed through, he would turn aside to her house to eat bread.

verses.latin: Quae dixit ad virum suum: Video quia vir Dei est iste, sanctus, qui transit per nos frequenter.
verses.english: She said to her husband: 'I perceive that this is a holy man of God who frequently passes by our house.'

verses.latin: Faciamus ergo ei coenaculum parvum, et ponamus ei in eo lectulum, et mensam, et sellam, et candelabrum, ut cum venerit ad nos, maneat ibi.
verses.english: She continued: 'Let us make a small room on the roof for him, and furnish it with a bed, a table, a chair, and a lamp. Then, whenever he comes to us, he can stay there.'

verses.latin: Factum est igitur quadam die ut veniens Eliseus diverteret ad coenaculum, et requiesceret ibi.
verses.english: So it happened one day that when Elisha came, he went to that room and rested there.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad Giezi puerum suum: Voca Sunamitidem istam. Qui cum vocasset eam, et illa stetisset coram eo,
verses.english: Then he said to Gehazi, his servant: 'Call this Shunammite woman.' When Gehazi called her, and she stood before Elisha,

verses.latin: ait ad eum: Loquere ad illam: Ecce diligenter pro nobis laborasti in omni diligentia: quid vis ut faciam tibi? Numquid vis ut loquar pro te regi, sive principi militiae? Quae respondit: In medio populi mei habito.
verses.english: Elisha said to Gehazi: 'Speak to her and tell her: “Behold, you have diligently provided for us and shown us every kindness. What do you wish that I do for you in return? Do you want me to speak on your behalf to the king, or to the commander of the army?”' She replied: 'I dwell among my own people—I lack nothing.'

verses.latin: Et dixit: Quid ergo vult sibi fieri? Dixitque Giezi: Non habet filium, et vir ejus senex est.
verses.english: And Elisha asked: 'What then can be done for her?' Gehazi replied: 'She has no son, and her husband is an old man.'

verses.latin: Jussit ergo vocari eam. Cumque vocata fuisset, et stetisset in foribus, dixit:
verses.english: So Elisha commanded that she be called again. When she was called, and stood in the doorway, he said:

verses.latin: In hoc tempore, et in hac eadem hora, vita comite, habebis filium. At illa ait: Noli, mi domine, vir Dei, noli mentiri ancillae tuae.
verses.english: 'At this very time, in this same season, in the coming year, you shall embrace a son.' But she exclaimed: 'No, my lord, man of God, do not lie to your handmaid!'
