verses.latin: Dixit autem Eliseus: Audite sermonem Domini: Haec dicit Dominus: In hac hora cras modius farinae tribus stateribus erit, et duo modii hordei quatuor stateribus in porta Samariae.
verses.english: Then Elisha said, "Hear the word of the Lord! This is what the Lord says: At this very hour tomorrow, a seah (a measure) of fine flour will be sold for three shekels (a unit of silver currency), and two seahs of barley for four shekels, right at the market gate of Samaria."

verses.latin: Respondensque satellitum unus, qui regis manibus incubabat, homini Dei, ait: Si Dominus fecerit cataractas in caelo, numquid poterit quod loqueris fieri? Et ille ait: Videbis oculis tuis, et inde non comedes.
verses.english: However, one of the king's officers, who was responsible for the king's personal safety and whose arm the king leaned upon, answered the man of God, saying, "Even if the Lord were to open the floodgates of the sky, could such a thing actually happen?" And Elisha said, "You will see it with your own eyes, but you will not eat any of it."

verses.latin: Erant ergo quatuor viri leprosi juxta introitum portae: qui ad invicem locuti sunt: Quid hic residemus, donec moriamur?
verses.english: Now there were four men who had leprosy sitting near the entrance of the city gate. They said to each other, "Why are we sitting here until we die?"

verses.latin: Si famem ingressi fuerimus civitatem, moriemur ibi: si hic manserimus, moriendum est nobis. Igitur venite, et transfugiamus ad castra Syrorum. Si pepercerint nobis, vivemus: si occiderint, moriemur.
verses.english: If we go into the city, we will die there because of the famine. If we stay here, we will surely die. So come on, let's desert to the camp of the Arameans (Syrians). If they spare our lives, we will live. If they kill us, then we will simply die.

verses.latin: Igitur surrexerunt vespere, ut venirent ad castra Syrorum. Cumque venissent ad principium castrorum Syrorum, nullum ibidem repererunt.
verses.english: So they got up in the evening to go to the camp of the Arameans. When they came to the edge of the Aramean camp, they found no one there.

verses.latin: Nam Dominus sonitum curruum et equorum et exercitus plurimi audiri fecerat de castris Syrorum: et mutuo ad se dixerunt: Ecce conduxit adversum nos rex Israel, reges Hethaeorum et Aegyptiorum, et venerunt super nos.
verses.english: For the Lord had made the Aramean army hear the sound of chariots, horses, and a very large army. So they said to one another, "Look, the king of Israel has hired the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Egypt to come and attack us!"

verses.latin: Quam ob rem surrexerunt, et fugerunt in silentio suo vespere: et dereliquerunt tentoria sua et equos et asinos in castris, et omnia, qualiter erant: et fugerunt pro vita sua.
verses.english: Because of this, they got up and fled silently in the evening, abandoning their tents, their horses, their donkeys in the camp, and everything just as it was. They simply fled for their lives.

verses.latin: Igitur cum venissent leprosi illi ad principium castrorum, ingressi sunt tabernaculum unum, et comederunt, et biberunt: tuleruntque inde argentum, et aurum, et vestes, et abierunt, et absconderunt. Et rursum reversi sunt ad aliud tabernaculum, et inde similiter tulerunt, et absconderunt.
verses.english: So when those men with leprosy came to the edge of the camp, they went into one tent and ate and drank. They took silver, gold, and clothing from there, and went and hid them. Then they returned to another tent and likewise took things from there and hid them.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad invicem: Non bene facimus: haec dies boni nuntii est. Si tacuerimus, et noluerimus nuntiare usque mane, sceleris erimus rei. Venite, et eamus, et nuntiemus in aula regis.
verses.english: Then they said to one another, "What we are doing is not right. This is a day of good news, and if we keep silent and do not report it until morning, we will be held accountable for our wickedness. Come now, let's go and report it to the king's palace."

verses.latin: Itaque cum venissent ad portam civitatis, vocem dederunt, dicentes: Venimus ad castra Syrorum, et neminem ibidem reperimus, neque vocem hominis, sed equos et asinos alligatos, et tentoria ut erant.
verses.english: So they went and called out to the gatekeepers of the city, saying, "We went to the camp of the Arameans, and we found no one there, nor any sound of a human, but only horses and donkeys tied up, and the tents just as they were left."

verses.latin: Et clauserunt se janitores, et nuntiaverunt in aula regis.
verses.english: The gatekeepers then went and announced the news inside the king's palace.

verses.latin: Surrexitque rex nocte, et ait servis suis: Expediam vobis quid mihi fecerint Syri. Famem sciunt nos pati: et idcirco egressi sunt de castris, et absconderunt se in agris, dicentes: Cum egressi fuerint de civitate, capiemus eos vivos, et tunc ingrediemur civitatem.
verses.english: The king rose up in the night and said to his servants, "I will tell you what the Arameans have done to us. They know that we are suffering from famine, and that is why they have left their camp and hidden themselves in the fields. They are thinking, 'When they come out of the city, we will capture them alive and then enter the city.'"

verses.latin: Ad quem respondens unus servorum ejus, ait: Tollamus quinque equos, qui residui sunt in civitate (quia ecce universa multitudo Israhel, quae remansit in ea, his similis est: quin potius universa multitudo Israhel consumpta est) et mittamus, et videamus.
verses.english: One of his servants answered him and said, "Let's take five of the remaining horses in the city, because the entire population of Israel remaining in it will be like those who are already dead. Indeed, the entire population of Israel is almost consumed by the famine. Let us send them out and see what is happening."

verses.latin: Tulerunt ergo bigas equorum duorum, misitque rex ad castra Syrorum, dicens: Ite, et videte.
verses.english: So they took two chariots with horses, and the king sent them to the Aramean camp, saying, "Go and see."

verses.latin: Qui abierunt post eos usque ad Jordanem. Ecce autem omnis via plena erat vestibus et vasis, quae projecerant Syri, cum turbarentur. Reversique nuntii, indicaverunt regi.
verses.english: They went after them as far as the Jordan River. And behold, the entire road was full of garments and equipment that the Arameans had thrown away in their haste when they were in a panic. The messengers returned and reported this to the king.

verses.latin: Et egressus populus diripuit castra Syrorum: factusque est modius farinae stateribus tribus, et duo modii hordei quatuor stateribus, juxta sermonem Domini.
verses.english: Then the people went out and plundered the camp of the Arameans. So a seah of fine flour was sold for three shekels, and two seahs of barley for four shekels, exactly as the Lord had spoken.

verses.latin: Porro rex commendaverat janitori illi, in cujus manu incubabat, et constituerat eum super portam: quem conculcavit turba in porta, et mortuus est, juxta quod locutus fuerat vir Dei, quando descenderat rex ad eum.
verses.english: Now the king had put that officer, on whose arm he leaned, in charge of the city gate. But the crowd trampled him in the gate, and he died, just as the man of God had prophesied when the king came down to speak with him.

verses.latin: Contigit ergo juxta sermonem viri Dei, quem loquutus fuerat regi, quando dixerat: Duo modii hordei quatuor stateribus, et modius farinae tribus stateribus erit cras in porta Samariae.
verses.english: So it happened exactly according to the word of the man of God, which he had spoken to the king when he said: "Two seahs of barley will be sold for four shekels, and a seah of fine flour for three shekels, tomorrow at the gate of Samaria."

verses.latin: Quando responderat illi satellitum unus, et dixerat: Quod si Dominus fecerit cataractas in caelo, numquid poterit istud fieri? Et dixerat illi: Videbis oculis tuis, et inde non comedes.
verses.english: And when that officer had answered him and said, "What if the Lord were to open the floodgates of the sky, could such a thing actually happen?" Elisha had said to him, "You will see it with your own eyes, but you will not eat any of it."

verses.latin: Et contigit ei sicut dictum fuerat, eo quod conculcasset eum populus in porta, et mortuus est.
verses.english: And it happened to him just as it had been said, because the people trampled him in the gate, and he died.

verses.latin: Eliseus autem locutus est ad mulierem, cujus filium reddiderat vitae, dicens: Surge, et vade tu et domus tua, et peregrinare ubicumque poteris; præcepit enim Dominus famem super terram, et veniet annis septem.
verses.english: Eliseus then spoke to the woman whose son he had restored to life, telling her: 'Get up, and go, you and your entire household, and reside as a foreigner wherever you can; for the Lord has commanded a devastating famine upon this land, and it will last for seven years.'

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque mulier, et abiit cum omni domo sua, et peregrinata est in terra Philisthim diebus septem annis.
verses.english: So the woman got up, and she left with all of her household, and they resided as foreigners in the land of the Philistines for the entire seven years.

verses.latin: Cumque finiti essent septem anni, reversa est mulier de terra Philisthim: et egressa est ut interpellaret regem super domo sua, et super agris suis.
verses.english: And when the seven years were finished, the woman returned from the land of the Philistines. And she went to appeal to the king about her house and her fields, which had likely been taken by others.

verses.latin: Rex autem loquebatur cum Giezi puero viri Dei, dicens: Narra mihi omnia magnalia, quæ fecit Eliseus.
verses.english: Now, the king was speaking with Giezi, the servant of the man of God, Eliseus. The king was saying: 'Tell me all the great things Eliseus has done.'

verses.latin: Cumque ille narraret quomodo mortuum suscitasset, apparuit mulier, cujus filium reddiderat vitae, clamans ad regem super domo sua, et super agris suis. Dixitque Giezi: Mi domine rex, hæc est mulier, et hic est filius ejus, quem suscitavit Eliseus.
verses.english: As Giezi was telling how Eliseus had raised the dead boy back to life, the very woman whose son Eliseus had restored to life appeared, crying out to the king concerning her house and her fields. Then Giezi said: 'My lord the king, this is the woman, and this is her son, whom Eliseus brought back to life.'

verses.latin: Et interrogavit rex mulierem: quæ narravit ei. Deditque ei rex eunuchum unum, dicens: Restitue ei omnia quæ sua sunt, et universos reditus agrorum, ex quo die egressa est de terra, usque in præsens.
verses.english: And the king questioned the woman, and she told him her story. Then the king gave her an official, saying: 'Restore to her all that is hers, and all the income from her fields, from the day she left the land until now.'

verses.latin: Venit quoque Eliseus Damascum, et Benadad rex Syriæ ægrotabat. Nuntiatumque est ei dicentibus: Venit vir Dei huc.
verses.english: Eliseus also went to Damascus, and Benadad, the king of Syria, was sick. And it was announced to him, with people saying: 'The man of God has come here!'

verses.latin: Dixitque rex ad Hazaël: Tolle tecum munera, et vade in occursum viri Dei, et consule per eum Dominum, dicens: Si evadere potero de infirmitate mea hac?
verses.english: And the king said to Hazaël, one of his officials: 'Take gifts with you, and go to meet the man of God, and consult the Lord through him, asking: "Will I recover from this illness?"'

verses.latin: Ivit igitur Hazaël in occursum ejus, habens secum munera, et omnia bona Damasci, onera quadraginta camelorum. Cumque venisset, stetit coram eo, et ait: Filius tuus Benadad rex Syriæ misit me ad te, dicens: Si evadere potero de infirmitate mea hac?
verses.english: So Hazaël went to meet him, bringing gifts with him—all the good things of Damascus, a load for forty camels. And when he arrived, he stood before Eliseus and said: 'Your son Benadad, the king of Syria, has sent me to you, asking: "Will I recover from this illness?"'

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Eliseus: Vade, dic ei: Certe sanaberis: porro ostendit mihi Dominus, quia morte morietur.
verses.english: And Eliseus said to him: 'Go, tell him: "You will surely recover"— but the Lord has shown me that he will certainly die.'

verses.latin: Stetitque cum eo, et conturbatus est, et confusus, et flevit vir Dei.
verses.english: And Eliseus stood with him, staring intently. Hazaël became troubled and embarrassed, and then the man of God, Eliseus, wept.

verses.latin: Cui Hazaël ait: Quare flet dominus meus? Qui respondit: Quia scio quæ mala facturus sis filiis Israël: civitates eorum munitas igne succendes, et juvenes eorum interficies gladio, et parvulos eorum elides, et prægnantes eorum dissecabis.
verses.english: To him, Hazaël said: 'Why is my lord weeping?' Eliseus answered: 'Because I know what evils you will inflict upon the children of Israel: you will set their fortified cities on fire, you will kill their young men with the sword, you will dash their little ones to pieces, and you will rip open their pregnant women.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Hazaël: Quid enim sum servus tuus canis, ut faciam hoc grande malum? Et ait Eliseus: Ostendit mihi Dominus te regem fore Syriæ.
verses.english: And Hazaël said: 'What is your servant, a mere dog, that I should do such a great evil?' And Eliseus said: 'The Lord has shown me that you will be king over Syria.'

verses.latin: Cumque abisset ab Eliseo, venit ad dominum suum. Qui ait ei: Quid tibi dixit Eliseus? Et ille respondit: Ait mihi: Certe sanaberis.
verses.english: And when he had departed from Eliseus, he came to his master. Who said to him: 'What did Eliseus say to you?' And he answered: 'He told me: "You will surely recover."

verses.latin: Altera autem die, tulit cilicium, et infudit aquam, et expandit super faciem ejus: quo mortuo, regnavit Hazaël pro eo.
verses.english: But the very next day, Hazaël took a thick cloth, soaked it in water, and spread it over Benadad’s face, smothering him. And when he was dead, Hazaël reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno quinto Joram filii Achab regis Israël, et Josaphat regis Juda regnante, ingessus est Joram filius Josaphat regis Juda.
verses.english: In the fifth year of Joram, son of Achab, king of Israel, while Josaphat was king of Juda, Joram, son of Josaphat, king of Juda, began to reign.

verses.latin: Triginta duorum annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et octo annis regnavit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was thirty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for eight years in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Ambulavitque in viis regum Israël, sicut ambulaverat domus Achab: filia quippe Achab erat uxor ejus: et fecit malum coram Domino.
verses.english: And he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, just as the house of Achab had walked, because a daughter of Achab was his wife. And he did evil in the sight of the Lord.

verses.latin: Noluit autem Dominus disperdere Judam propter David servum suum, sicut promiserat ei loquens, et dans illi lucernam, et filiis ejus cunctis diebus.
verses.english: However, the Lord would not destroy Juda, for the sake of David, His servant, just as He had promised him by speaking, and by giving him a lamp—a continuous line of descendants—and to his sons for all days.

verses.latin: In diebus ejus recessit Edom, ne esset sub Juda, et constituit sibi regem.
verses.english: In his days, Edom revolted so that it would no longer be under the rule of Juda, and it appointed a king for itself.

verses.latin: Venitque Joram Seira, et omnis currus cum eo: et surrexit nocte, et percussit Idumeos, qui eum circumdederant, et præfectos curruum: fugeruntque populi in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: So Joram went to Seira, and all the chariots with him. And he rose up in the night and attacked the Idumeans who had surrounded him, along with the commanders of their chariots; but the people fled to their tents.

verses.latin: Recessit ergo Edom ne esset sub Juda usque in præsentem diem. Tunc Libna recessit in tempore illo.
verses.english: Therefore Edom revolted from being under Juda, and it remains so to this present day. At that same time, Libna also revolted.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joram, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Joram, and all that he did, are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Juda?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joram cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David: regnavitque Ochozias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: And Joram slept with his fathers, and he was buried with them in the City of David. And Ochozias, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno duodecimo Joram filii Achab regis Israël, regnavit Ochozias filius Joram regis Juda.
verses.english: In the twelfth year of Joram, son of Achab, king of Israel, Ochozias, son of Joram, king of Juda, began to reign.

verses.latin: Viginti duorum annorum erat Ochozias cum regnare cœpisset, et uno anno regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Athalia filia Amri regis Israël.
verses.english: Ochozias was twenty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for one year in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Athalia, daughter of Amri, king of Israel.

verses.latin: Ambulavitque in viis domus Achab, et fecit malum coram Domino, sicut domus Achab: gener enim Achab erat.
verses.english: And he walked in the ways of the house of Achab, and he did evil in the sight of the Lord, just like the house of Achab, for he was a son-in-law of Achab.

verses.latin: Abiit quoque cum Joram filio Achab in bellum contra Hazaël regem Syriæ in Ramoth Galaad: et vulneraverunt Syri Joram.
verses.english: He also went with Joram, son of Achab, to war against Hazaël, king of Syria, in Ramoth Galaad; and the Syrians wounded Joram.

verses.latin: Qui reversus est ut curaretur in Jezraël, propter vulnera quæ fecerant ei Syri in Ramoth, quando pugnabat contra Hazaël regem Syriæ. Ochozias autem filius Joram rex Juda descendit visitare Joram filium Achab in Jezraël ægrotantem.
verses.english: So Joram returned to be healed in Jezraël because of the wounds that the Syrians had inflicted on him in Ramoth, when he fought against Hazaël, the king of Syria. And Ochozias, son of Joram, king of Juda, went down to visit Joram, son of Achab, who was sick in Jezraël.

verses.latin: Eliseus autem locutus est ad mulierem, cujus filium reddiderat vitae, dicens: Surge, et vade tu et domus tua, et peregrinare ubicumque fueris; quoniam vocavit Dominus famem super terram, et veniet annis septem.
verses.english: But Elisha spoke to the woman whose son he had restored to life, saying, "Rise up, you and your household, and go live as a foreigner wherever you can; for the Lord has called a famine upon the land, and it will last for seven years."

verses.latin: Quae surrexit, et abiit cum omni domo sua, et peregrinata est in terra Philisthinorum septem annis.
verses.english: So she rose up and went with all her household, and lived as a foreigner in the land of the Philistines for seven years.

verses.latin: Cumque finiti essent septem anni, reversa est mulier de terra Philisthinorum, et egressa est ut interpellaret regem super domo sua, et super agris suis.
verses.english: When the seven years were finished, the woman returned from the land of the Philistines, and she went out to appeal to the king concerning her house and her fields.

verses.latin: Rex autem loquebatur ad Giezi puerum viri Dei, dicens: Narra mihi omnia magna opera, quae fecit Eliseus.
verses.english: Now the king was speaking with Gehazi, the servant of the man of God, saying, "Tell me all the great works that Elisha has done."

verses.latin: Cumque ille narraret regi quomodo mortuum suscitasset, apparuit mulier, cujus Eliseus filium reddiderat vitae, clamans ad regem super domo sua, et super agris suis. Dixitque Giezi: Mi rex domine, haec est mulier, et hic filius ejus, quem suscitavit Eliseus.
verses.english: As Gehazi was telling the king how Elisha had raised the dead, the very woman whose son Elisha had restored to life appeared, crying out to the king concerning her house and her fields. And Gehazi said, "My lord king, this is the woman, and this is her son whom Elisha raised from the dead!"

verses.latin: Et interrogavit rex mulierem, quae narravit illi. Deditque ei rex eunuchum unum, dicens: Restitue omnia quae illius fuerunt, et universos reditus agrorum, ex eo die quo reliquit terram, usque in praesens.
verses.english: The king then questioned the woman, and she told him her story. So the king gave her an official, saying, "Restore to her all that belonged to her, and all the income from her fields, from the day she left the land until now."

verses.latin: Venit quoque Eliseus Damascum: et Benadad rex Syriae aegrotabat. Nuntiaveruntque ei, dicentes: Venit vir Dei huc.
verses.english: Now Elisha came to Damascus, and Ben-hadad king of Syria was sick. They reported to him, saying, "The man of God has come here!"

verses.latin: Et ait rex ad Hazael: Tolle tecum munera, et vade in occursum viri Dei, et consule Dominum per illum, dicens: Si evadere potero de infirmitate mea hac?
verses.english: And the king said to Hazael, "Take gifts with you, and go meet the man of God, and inquire of the Lord through him, saying, 'Will I recover from this sickness?'"

verses.latin: Ivit ergo Hazael in occursum ejus, habens secum munera, et omnia bona Damasci, onera quadraginta camelorum. Cumque venisset, stetit coram eo, et ait: Filius tuus Benadad rex Syriae misit me ad te, dicens: Si evadere potero de infirmitate mea hac?
verses.english: So Hazael went to meet Elisha, carrying gifts with him, all the good things of Damascus, a load for forty camels. When he came, he stood before him and said, "Your son Ben-hadad, king of Syria, has sent me to you, saying, 'Will I recover from this sickness?'"

verses.latin: Dixitque illi Eliseus: Vade, dic ei: Certe sanaberis: porro ostendit mihi Dominus quia morte morietur.
verses.english: And Elisha said to him, "Go, tell him, 'You will certainly recover.' However, the Lord has shown me that he will surely die a different death."

verses.latin: Stetitque vultu rigido, et conturbatus est usque ad confusionem: et flevit vir Dei.
verses.english: Then Elisha stared fixedly until Hazael was confused and ashamed; and the man of God wept.

verses.latin: Et dixit Hazael: Quare fleret dominus meus? Qui ait: Quia scio quae facturus sis filiis Israël mala: civitates eorum munitas igne succendes, et juvenes eorum interficies gladio, et parvulos eorum elides, et praegnantes confringes.
verses.english: And Hazael said, "Why does my lord weep?" He answered, "Because I know the evil that you will do to the children of Israel: you will burn their fortified cities with fire, and you will kill their young men with the sword, and you will dash their little ones to pieces, and rip open their pregnant women."

verses.latin: Cui ait Hazael: Quis est servus tuus, dominus meus, nisi canis, ut faciat hoc grande facinus? Et dixit Eliseus: Ostendit mihi Dominus te regem fore Syriae.
verses.english: To which Hazael said, "Who is your servant, my lord, but a dog, that I should do this great evil?" And Elisha said, "The Lord has shown me that you will be king of Syria."

verses.latin: Cumque recessisset ab Eliseo, venit ad dominum suum. Qui ait illi: Quid tibi dixit Eliseus? Et ille respondit: Ait mihi: Recipies sanitatem.
verses.english: So he departed from Elisha and came to his master. And Ben-hadad said to him, "What did Elisha say to you?" And Hazael answered, "He told me, 'You will recover your health.'"

verses.latin: Altera autem die, sumpsit stragulum, et tinxit aqua, et expandit super faciem ejus: quo mortuo, regnavit Hazael pro eo.
verses.english: But the next day, Hazael took a thick blanket, soaked it in water, and spread it over Ben-hadad's face, so he suffocated. When Ben-hadad was dead, Hazael reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno quinto Joram filii Achab regis Israël, et Josaphat regis Juda, regnavit Joram filius Josaphat rex Juda.
verses.english: In the fifth year of Joram, son of Ahab, king of Israel—while Jehoshaphat was still king of Judah—Jehoram, son of Jehoshaphat, began to reign as king of Judah.

verses.latin: Triginta duorum annorum erat cum regnare coepisset, et octo annis regnavit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was thirty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for eight years in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Ambulavitque in viis regum Israël, sicut ambulaverat domus Achab: filia quippe Achab erat uxor ejus: et fecit malum coram Domino.
verses.english: And he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, just as the house of Ahab had walked, for the daughter of Ahab was his wife; and he did evil in the sight of the Lord.

verses.latin: Noluit autem Dominus disperdere Judam propter David servum suum, sicut promiserat ei ut daret illi lucernam, et filiis ejus cunctis diebus.
verses.english: However, the Lord was unwilling to destroy Judah for the sake of David His servant, just as He had promised him that He would give him a lamp, a line of descendants, for all days.

verses.latin: In diebus illius recessit Edom, ne esset sub Juda, et constituit sibi regem.
verses.english: In his days, Edom revolted from being under the rule of Judah and appointed a king for themselves.

verses.latin: Venitque Joram in Saïra, et omnis currus cum eo: et surrexit nocte, et percussit Idumeos qui eum circumdederant, et duces curruum: fugeruntque populi in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: So Jehoram went to Zair, and all his chariots with him; and he rose up by night and struck the Edomites who had surrounded him and the captains of the chariots. Then the people fled to their tents.

verses.latin: Recessit autem Edom, ne esset sub Juda usque in praesentem diem. Tunc recessit et Lobna in tempore illo.
verses.english: Thus Edom revolted from being under Judah to this present day. At that time, Libnah also revolted.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joram, et universa quae fecit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoram, and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Et dormivit Joram cum patribus suis, sepultusque est cum eis in civitate David: et regnavit Ochozias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: And Jehoram rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David; and Ahaziah, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno duodecimo Joram filii Achab regis Israël, regnavit Ochozias filius Joram regis Juda.
verses.english: In the twelfth year of Joram, son of Ahab, king of Israel, Ahaziah, son of Jehoram, king of Judah, began to reign.

verses.latin: Viginti duorum annorum erat Ochozias cum regnare coepisset, et uno anno regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Athalia filia Amri regis Israël.
verses.english: Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for one year in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Athaliah, the daughter of Omri, king of Israel.

verses.latin: Ambulavitque in viis domus Achab, et fecit malum coram Domino sicut domus Achab: gener quippe Achab erat.
verses.english: And he walked in the ways of the house of Ahab, and did evil in the sight of the Lord, just like the house of Ahab, for he was a son-in-law of Ahab's house.

verses.latin: Abiit quoque cum Joram filio Achab ad praeliandum contra Hazael regem Syriae in Ramoth Galaad: vulneraveruntque Syri Joram.
verses.english: He also went with Joram, son of Ahab, to fight against Hazael, king of Syria, in Ramoth-gilead; and the Syrians wounded Joram.

verses.latin: Qui reversus est ut curaretur in Jezrahel propter vulnera, quibus eum percusserant Syri in Ramoth, quando pugnabat contra Hazael regem Syriae. Ochozias autem filius Joram regis Juda descendit invisere Joram filium Achab in Jezrahel, quia ægrotabat.
verses.english: So Joram returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds with which the Syrians had struck him at Ramoth, when he fought against Hazael, king of Syria. And Ahaziah, son of Jehoram, king of Judah, went down to visit Joram, son of Ahab, in Jezreel, because he was sick.

verses.latin: Eliseus autem locutus fuerat ad mulierem cujus filium reddiderat vitae dicens: Surge et vade tu et domus tua, et peregrinare ubicumque et poteris: quoniam vocavit Dominus famem super terram, et veniet annis septem.
verses.english: Elisha had spoken to the woman whose son he had brought back to life, saying: "Get up and leave, you and your household, and find a place to live as a foreigner wherever you can, because the Lord has called for a famine to come upon the land, and it will last for seven years."

verses.latin: Quae surrexit et abiit cum omni domo sua, et peregrinata est in terra Philisthinorum septem annis.
verses.english: So she got up and left with all her household, and lived as a foreigner in the land of the Philistines for seven years.

verses.latin: Et cum expleti essent septem anni, reversa est mulier de terra Philisthinorum: et egressa est ut interpellaret regem super domo sua, et super agris suis.
verses.english: And when the seven years were completed, the woman returned from the land of the Philistines. She went out to appeal to the king concerning her house and her fields, seeking their restoration.

verses.latin: Rex autem loquebatur cum Giezi puero viri Dei, dicens: Narra mihi omnia magnalia quae fecit Eliseus.
verses.english: Meanwhile, the king was speaking with Gehazi, the servant of the man of God, saying: "Tell me all the great and powerful things that Elisha has done."

verses.latin: Et cum narrasset quomodo mortuum suscitasset, apparuit mulier, cujus filium Eliseus reddiderat vitae, clamans ad regem super domo sua, et super agris suis. Dixitque Giezi: Mi domine rex, haec est mulier, et hic filius ejus, quem suscitavit Eliseus.
verses.english: And just as Gehazi was telling how Elisha had brought a dead person back to life, the very woman appeared, whose son Elisha had restored to life, crying out to the king about her house and her fields. Gehazi then said: "My lord king, this is the woman, and this is her son whom Elisha restored to life."

verses.latin: Et interrogavit rex mulierem, quae narravit ei. Deditque ei rex eunuchum unum, dicens: Restitue ei omnia quae sua sunt, et universos agros a die qua reliquit terram usque in praesens.
verses.english: And the king questioned the woman, and she told him her story. So the king gave her an official, saying: "Restore to her all that belongs to her, and all her fields from the day she left the land until now."

verses.latin: Venit quoque Eliseus Damascum, cum Benadad rex Syriae aegrotaret: et nuntiaverunt ei dicentes: Venit vir Dei huc.
verses.english: Elisha also came to Damascus, when Ben-Hadad, the king of Syria, was sick. And they announced to the king, saying: "The man of God has come here."

verses.latin: Dixitque rex ad Hazaël: Tolle tecum munera, et vade in occursum viri Dei, et consule per eum Dominum, dicens: Si evadere potero de infirmitate mea hac?
verses.english: And the king said to Hazael: "Take gifts with you, and go to meet the man of God. Consult the Lord through him, saying: 'Will I be able to recover from this illness?'"

verses.latin: Abiit ergo Hazaël in occursum ejus, habens secum munera, et omnia bona Damasci, onera quadraginta camelorum. Et cum stetisset coram eo, ait: Filius tuus Benadad rex Syriae misit me ad te dicens: Si evadere potero de infirmitate mea hac?
verses.english: So Hazael went to meet Elisha, carrying gifts with him, and all the good things of Damascus, a load for forty camels. And when he stood before him, he said: "Your son Ben-Hadad, the king of Syria, has sent me to you, saying: 'Will I be able to recover from this illness?'"

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Eliseus: Vade et dic ei: Certe sanaberis: porro ostendit mihi Dominus quia morte morietur.
verses.english: And Elisha said to him: "Go and tell him: 'You will certainly recover.' However, the Lord has shown me that he will nevertheless surely die by other means."

verses.latin: Stetitque et conturbatus est vir Dei, et flevit.
verses.english: And the man of God stood there, troubled, and then wept.

verses.latin: Cui ait Hazaël: Quare dominus meus flet? Et ille dixit: Quia scio quae mala facturus sis filiis Israel: munitiones eorum igne succendes, et juvenes eorum interficies gladio, et parvulos eorum elides, et praegnantes eorum scindes.
verses.english: Hazael said to him: "Why does my lord weep?" And Elisha said: "Because I know the evils you will inflict upon the children of Israel: you will burn their strongholds with fire, you will kill their young men with the sword, you will dash their little ones to pieces, and you will rip open their pregnant women."

verses.latin: Dixitque Hazaël: Quid enim sum servus tuus canis, ut faciam hoc grande opus? Et ait Eliseus: Ostendit mihi Dominus te regem fore Syriae.
verses.english: And Hazael said: "But what am I, your servant, a mere dog, that I should do such a great deed?" And Elisha said: "The Lord has shown me that you will be king of Syria."

verses.latin: Cumque abiisset ab Eliseo, venit ad dominum suum, qui ait illi: Quid tibi dixit Eliseus? Et ille respondit: Ait mihi: Certe sanaberis.
verses.english: And when he had departed from Elisha, he came to his master, who asked him: "What did Elisha say to you?" And Hazael responded: "He told me: 'You will certainly recover.'"

verses.latin: Altera autem die, tulit stragulum, et infudit aqua, et expandit super faciem ejus, mortuusque est: et regnavit Hazaël pro eo.
verses.english: However, the next day, Hazael took a thick cloth, soaked it in water, and spread it over Ben-Hadad's face, so that he suffocated and died. And Hazael reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno quinto Joram filii Achab regis Israel, et Josaphat regis Juda, regnavit Joram filius Josaphat rex Juda.
verses.english: In the fifth year of Joram, son of Ahab, king of Israel, and while Jehoshaphat was king of Judah, Joram, son of Jehoshaphat, became king of Judah.

verses.latin: Triginta duorum annorum erat cum regnare coepisset, et octo annis regnavit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was thirty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for eight years in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Ambulavitque in viis regum Israel, sicut ambulaverat domus Achab: filia quippe Achab erat uxor ejus: et fecit malum coram Domino.
verses.english: And he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, just as the house of Ahab had walked, for the daughter of Ahab was his wife. And he did evil in the sight of the Lord.

verses.latin: Noluit autem Dominus disperdere Judam, propter David servum suum: sicut promiserat ei, ut daret illi lucernam, et filiis ejus cunctis diebus.
verses.english: Yet the Lord was unwilling to destroy Judah, for the sake of His servant David, just as He had promised him that He would always give him and his sons a lamp, meaning a perpetual lineage on the throne.

verses.latin: In diebus illis recessit Edom, ne esset sub Juda, et constituit sibi regem.
verses.english: In those days, Edom revolted and separated from the control of Judah, and set up a king for themselves.

verses.latin: Venitque Joram Seira, et omnis currus cum eo: et surrexit nocte, et percussit Idumeos qui eum circumdederant: populus autem fugerat in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: So Joram went to Zair, and all his chariots with him. And he rose up by night and struck the Edomites who had surrounded him; but the rest of the Edomite people had already fled to their tents.

verses.latin: Et recessit Edom ne esset sub Juda usque in praesentem diem. Tunc Libna recessit in tempore illo.
verses.english: And Edom remained separate from the control of Judah until this present day. At that time, Libnah also revolted.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joram, et universa quae fecit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: The rest of the acts of Joram, and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joram cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David: et regnavit Ochozias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: And Joram rested with his ancestors and was buried with them in the City of David. Then Ahaziah, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno duodecimo Joram filii Achab regis Israel, regnavit Ochozias filius Joram regis Juda.
verses.english: In the twelfth year of Joram, son of Ahab, king of Israel, Ahaziah, son of Joram, king of Judah, began to reign.

verses.latin: Viginti duorum annorum erat Ochozias cum regnare coepisset, et uno anno regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Athalia filia Amri regis Israel.
verses.english: Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for one year in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Athaliah, daughter of Omri, king of Israel.

verses.latin: Et ambulavit in viis domus Achab, et fecit malum coram Domino sicut domus Achab: genitus enim erat socer Achab.
verses.english: And he walked in the ways of the house of Ahab, and did evil in the sight of the Lord, just as the house of Ahab did; for he was allied by marriage to the house of Ahab.

verses.latin: Abiit quoque cum Joram filio Achab ad praeliandum contra Hazaël regem Syriae in Ramoth Galaad: vulneraveruntque Syri Joram.
verses.english: He also went with Joram, son of Ahab, to fight against Hazael, king of Syria, in Ramoth-Gilead. And the Syrians wounded Joram.

verses.latin: Qui reversus est ut curaretur in Jezrahel: quia vulneraverant eum Syri in Rama, quando pugnabat contra Hazaël regem Syriae. Ochozias quoque filius Joram regis Juda descendit invisere Joram filium Achab in Jezrahel, quia aegrotabat.
verses.english: Joram then returned to Jezreel to recover, because the Syrians had wounded him in Ramah when he fought against Hazael, king of Syria. Ahaziah also, son of Joram, king of Judah, went down to Jezreel to visit Joram, son of Ahab, because he was sick.

verses.latin: Eliseus autem propheta vocavit unum de filiis prophetarum, et ait illi: Accinge lumbos tuos, et tolle lenticulam olei hujus in manu tua, et vade in Ramoth Galaad.
verses.english: Elisha the prophet called one of the disciples of the prophets and said to him, 'Prepare yourself for travel, and take this small jar of oil with you in your hand, then go to Ramoth Gilead.'

verses.latin: Et ingressus illuc, quaere Jehu filium Josaphat filii Nemesi: et ingrediens, extrahe eum de medio fratrum suorum, et introduc in cubiculum absconditum.
verses.english: When you arrive there, find Jehu, the son of Jehoshaphat, who is the son of Nimshi. When you find him, take him away from his companions and lead him into a hidden private chamber.

verses.latin: Et tollens lenticulam olei, effunde super caput ejus, et dic: Haec dicit Dominus: Unxi te regem super Israël. Aperique ostium, et fuge, et noli cunctari.
verses.english: Then, take the jar of oil and pour it over his head, saying: 'This is what the Lord says: I have anointed you to be king over Israel.' After you have done this, open the door, flee immediately, and do not delay.

verses.latin: Abiit ergo adolescens puer propheta in Ramoth Galaad.
verses.english: So the young man, the prophet's disciple, went to Ramoth Gilead.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est: ecce enim principes exercitus sedebant: et ait: Verbum mihi est ad te princeps.
verses.english: When he arrived, behold, the commanders of the army were sitting together. He said, 'I have a message for you, commander.'

verses.latin: Et ait Jehu: Ad quem ex omnibus nobis?
verses.english: Jehu asked, 'Which of us are you speaking to?'

verses.latin: At ille respondit: Ad te princeps.
verses.english: He replied, 'To you, commander.'

verses.latin: Et surrexit Jehu, et ingressus est in cubiculum: et fudit oleum super caput ejus, et ait illi: Haec dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Unxi te regem super populum Domini Israël.
verses.english: So Jehu got up and went into the private chamber. The young man poured the oil over his head and said to him, 'This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: I have anointed you king over the Lord's people, Israel.'

verses.latin: Et percuties domum Achab domini tui, ut ultus sim sanguinem servorum meorum prophetarum, et sanguinem omnium servorum Domini, de manu Jezabel.
verses.english: 'You are to strike down the household of Ahab your master, so that I may avenge the blood of My servants, the prophets, and the blood of all the Lord's servants, at the hand of Jezebel.'

verses.latin: Et disperdam domum Achab: et interficiam de Achab mingentem ad parietem, et clausum, et novissimum in Israël.
verses.english: 'I will destroy the house of Ahab. I will cut off from Ahab every male, both slave and free, in Israel.'

verses.latin: Et dabo domum Achab sicut domum Jeroboam filii Nabat, et sicut domum Baasa filii Ahia.
verses.english: 'I will make the house of Ahab like the house of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha, the son of Ahijah.'

verses.latin: Jezabel quoque comedent canes in agro Jezrahel, nec erit qui sepeliat.
verses.english: 'As for Jezebel, dogs will devour her body in the field of Jezreel, and no one will bury her.'

verses.latin: Aperuitque ostium, et fugit.
verses.english: Then he opened the door and fled, just as Elisha commanded.

verses.latin: Jehu autem egressus ad servos domini sui, dixerunt ei: Rectene sunt omnia? quid sibi voluit insanus iste ad te?
verses.english: When Jehu came out to the servants of his master, they asked him, 'Is everything all right? What did that madman want with you?'

verses.latin: Qui respondit eis: Nostis hominem, et quid locutus sit.
verses.english: He answered them, 'You know the man and what he said.'

verses.latin: At illi dixerunt: Nequaquam: sed magis dic nobis.
verses.english: But they insisted, 'That's not true! Tell us what he said!'

verses.latin: At ille ait eis: Haec et haec locutus est mihi, dicens: Haec dicit Dominus: Unxi te regem super Israël.
verses.english: He then told them, 'He said such and such to me, saying: 'This is what the Lord says: I have anointed you king over Israel.''

verses.latin: Festinaverunt itaque, et tollentes unumquemque pallium suum, posuerunt sub pedibus ejus in similitudinem tribunalis, et cecinerunt tuba, atque dixerunt: Regnavit Jehu.
verses.english: They quickly took off their cloaks, and each man spread his own under Jehu's feet, forming an impromptu royal carpet. Then they sounded the trumpet and shouted, 'Jehu is king!'

verses.latin: Conjuravit ergo Jehu super Joram: Joram autem obsederat Ramoth Galaad, ipse et omnis Israël contra Hazaël regem Syriae.
verses.english: So Jehu plotted against Joram. Now Joram, along with all of Israel, was guarding Ramoth Gilead against Hazael, the king of Syria.

verses.latin: Reversusque fuerat rex Joram ut curaretur in Jezrahel propter vulnera, quibus sauciaverant eum Syri, cum pugnaret contra Hazaël regem Syriae.
verses.english: King Joram had returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds the Arameans had inflicted upon him when he fought against Hazael, the king of Syria.

verses.latin: Dixitque Jehu: Si placet vobis, nemo effugiat de civitate, ne vadat, et nuntiet in Jezrahel.
verses.english: Jehu then said, 'If you are with me, let no one escape from the city to go and report this news in Jezreel.'

verses.latin: Et ascendit Jehu, et ivit in Jezrahel: Joram quippe jacebat ibi, et Achazias rex Juda descenderat ut inviseret Joram.
verses.english: So Jehu mounted his chariot and rode to Jezreel, for Joram was lying there wounded. Ahaziah, the king of Judah, had also come down to visit Joram.

verses.latin: Igitur speculator stabat super turrem Jezrahel, viditque Jehu venientem, et multitudinem quae erat cum eo, et ait: Quadrigam cernam.
verses.english: Now the watchman was standing on the tower in Jezreel. He saw Jehu approaching with his company and exclaimed, 'I see a chariot approaching!'

verses.latin: Et dixit Joram: Adhuc jungite.
verses.english: Joram said, 'Harness my chariot!'

verses.latin: Et junxit quadrigam suam, et egressus est Joram rex Israël, et Achazias rex Juda, singuli in curribus suis, egressique sunt obviam Jehu, et invenerunt eum in agro Naboth Jezrahelitae.
verses.english: So they harnessed his chariot, and King Joram of Israel, along with King Ahaziah of Judah, each in their own chariots, went out to meet Jehu. They encountered him in the field of Naboth the Jezreelite.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Joram Jehu, ait: Pax est Jehu?
verses.english: When Joram saw Jehu, he asked, 'Is it peace, Jehu?'

verses.latin: Qui respondit: Quae pax? adhuc fornicationes Jezabel matris tuae, et veneficia ejus multa vigent.
verses.english: Jehu replied, 'What peace can there be? The harlotries of your mother Jezebel and her many sorceries are still flourishing!'

verses.latin: Igitur Joram convertit manum suam, et fugiens ait ad Achaziam: Insidiae, Achazia!
verses.english: Then Joram turned his chariot around to flee, crying out to Ahaziah, 'Treachery, Ahaziah!'

verses.latin: Jehu autem tetendit arcum manu sua, et percussit Joram inter brachia: et egressa est sagitta de corde ejus, statimque corruit in curru suo.
verses.english: But Jehu drew his bow with his own hand and shot Joram between his shoulders. The arrow pierced his heart, and he immediately collapsed in his chariot.

verses.latin: Et ait Jehu ad Badacer ducem suum: Tolle, et projice eum in agrum Naboth Jezrahelitae: coge enim, quomodo ego et tu sedentes in curru, sequebamur Achab patrem hujus, et Dominus onus hoc imposuit super eum, dicens:
verses.english: Jehu then said to Bidkar, his captain, 'Pick him up and throw him into the field of Naboth the Jezreelite. Remember how, when you and I were riding in chariots behind Ahab his father, the Lord pronounced this sentence against him, saying:'

verses.latin: Si non sanguinem Naboth, et sanguinem filiorum ejus, quem effudi heri, ait Dominus, reddam tibi in agro isto, dicit Dominus: nunc ergo tolle, et projice eum in agrum juxta verbum Domini.
verses.english: 'Surely I saw the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons yesterday,' says the Lord, 'and I will repay you in this very field,' says the Lord. 'So now, take him and throw him into the field, according to the word of the Lord.'

verses.latin: Achazias autem rex Juda videns hoc, fugit per viam domus horti: persecutusque est eum Jehu, et ait: Etiam hunc percutite in curru suo.
verses.english: When Ahaziah, the king of Judah, saw this, he fled by the road of the garden house. Jehu pursued him and said, 'Strike him down too, in his chariot!'

verses.latin: Et percusserunt eum in ascensu Gaver, quae est juxta Jeblaam. Qui fugit in Mageddo, et mortuus est ibi.
verses.english: They struck him down at the ascent of Gur, which is by Ibleam. He fled to Megiddo and died there.

verses.latin: Et imposuerunt eum servi sui super currum suum, et tulerunt in Jerusalem: sepelieruntque eum in sepulchro suo cum patribus suis in civitate David.
verses.english: His servants carried him in his chariot to Jerusalem and buried him in his tomb with his ancestors in the City of David.

verses.latin: Anno undecimo Joram filii Achab, regnavit Achazias super Judam.
verses.english: In the eleventh year of Joram, son of Ahab, Ahaziah began to reign over Judah.

verses.latin: Venit ergo Jehu in Jezrahel. Porro Jezabel introitu ejus audito, depinxit oculos suos stibio, et ornavit caput suum, et prospiciebat per fenestram.
verses.english: So Jehu came to Jezreel. When Jezebel heard about his arrival, she painted her eyes with dark makeup, arranged her hair, and looked out a window.

verses.latin: Ingredientibus Jehu per portam, dixit: Numquid pax esse potest Zambri, qui interfecit dominum suum?
verses.english: As Jehu entered the city gate, she called out, 'Is it peace, you Zimri, murderer of your master?'

verses.latin: Et levavit Jehu faciem suam ad fenestram, et ait: Quis est mecum?
verses.english: Jehu looked up to the window and called out, 'Who is on my side? Who?'

verses.latin: Et aspexerunt eum duo vel tres eunuchi.
verses.english: Two or three eunuchs looked out to him.

verses.latin: Qui ait eis: Praecipitate illam deorsum. Et praecipitaverunt eam, et aspersus est sanguis ejus super parietem, et super equos, et conculcata est.
verses.english: He said to them, 'Throw her down!' So they threw her down. Her blood splattered on the wall and on the horses, and she was trampled underfoot.

verses.latin: Cumque ingressus esset, et comedisset, et bibisset, ait: Ite, et videte maledictam illam, et sepelite eam: quia filia regis est.
verses.english: After Jehu went in, and had eaten and drunk, he said, 'Go and look after that cursed woman and bury her, for she was a king's daughter.'

verses.latin: Cumque issent ut sepelirent eam, non invenerunt nisi calvariam, et pedes, et summas manus.
verses.english: But when they went to bury her, they found nothing but her skull, her feet, and the palms of her hands.

verses.latin: Reversique nuntiaverunt ei. Et ait Jehu: Sermo Domini est, quem locutus est per servum suum Eliam Thesbiten, dicens: In agro Jezrahel comedent canes carnes Jezabel.
verses.english: When they returned and reported this to him, Jehu said, 'This is the word of the Lord, which He spoke through His servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying: 'In the field of Jezreel, dogs will devour the flesh of Jezebel.''

verses.latin: Et erit cadaver Jezabel quasi stercus super faciem terrae in agro Jezrahel, ut non possit agnosci: Hujuscemodi est Jezabel.
verses.english: 'The corpse of Jezebel will be like dung on the surface of the ground in the field of Jezreel, so that no one will be able to say: 'This is Jezebel.'' This is her fate.

verses.latin: Eliseus autem propheta vocavit unum de filiis prophetarum, et ait illi: Accinge lumbos tuos, et tolle lancem olei hujus in manu tua, et vade in Ramoth Galaad.
verses.english: Now, Elisha the prophet called one of the young men from the school of the prophets, and said to him, 'Prepare yourself for a journey and take this flask of anointing oil in your hand, and go to Ramoth-Gilead.

verses.latin: Cumque veneris illuc, vide ubi sit Jehu filius Josaphat filii Namsi: et ingressus percute ostium, et ingredere, et suscitans eum de medio fratrum suorum, introduc in cubiculum absconditum.
verses.english: When you get there, find Jehu, the son of Jehoshaphat, the son of Nimshi. Go inside, call to him, and then bring him away from his companions, leading him into an inner room where you can speak with him privately.

verses.latin: Et auferens lancem olei, funde super caput ejus, et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus: Unxi te regem super Israel. Aperique ostium, et fuge, et ne moreris ibi.
verses.english: Then take the flask of oil and pour it over his head, saying, 'This is what the Lord declares: I have anointed you king over Israel.' After you have done this, open the door, flee quickly, and do not stay there.

verses.latin: Abiit ergo puer propheta in Ramoth Galaad.
verses.english: So the young prophet departed for Ramoth-Gilead.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est, et ecce principes exercitus sedebant: et ait: Verbum mihi est ad te princeps. Dixitque Jehu: Ad quem ex omnibus nobis? At ille ait: Ad te princeps.
verses.english: When he arrived, behold, the commanders of the army were sitting together. The prophet said, 'I have a message for you, commander.' Jehu asked, 'For which of us, among all of us here?' And he answered, 'For you, commander.'

verses.latin: Et surrexit, et ingressus est cubiculum. At ille fudit oleum super caput ejus, et ait: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Unxi te regem super populum Domini Israel.
verses.english: So Jehu got up and went into the inner room. The prophet then poured the oil over his head and declared, 'This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: I have anointed you king over the people of the Lord, over Israel.

verses.latin: Et percuties domum Achab domini tui, et ulciscar sanguinem servorum meorum prophetarum, et sanguinem omnium servorum Domini, de manu Jezabel.
verses.english: You are to strike down the house of Ahab, your master. I will avenge the blood of my servants, the prophets, and the blood of all the Lord’s servants who were murdered by Jezebel.'

verses.latin: Et perdam omnem domum Achab: et interficiam de Achab mingentem ad parietem, et clausum, et novissimum in Israel.
verses.english: Indeed, I will destroy the entire house of Ahab. I will cut off from Ahab every male descendant, both slave and free, in Israel.

verses.latin: Et dabo domum Achab sicut domum Jeroboam filii Nabat, et sicut domum Baasa filii Ahia.
verses.english: I will make the house of Ahab like the house of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha, the son of Ahijah.

verses.latin: Jezabel quoque comedent canes in agro Jezrahel, nec erit qui sepeliat.
verses.english: And as for Jezebel, dogs will devour her in the territory of Jezreel, and no one will bury her body.

verses.latin: Aperuitque ostium, et fugit.
verses.english: Then the young prophet opened the door and fled, just as Elisha had commanded him.

verses.latin: Jehu autem egressus est ad servos domini sui, qui dixerunt ei: Rectene sunt omnia? quare venit iste insanus ad te? Qui ait eis: Nostis hominem, et quid locutus sit.
verses.english: When Jehu came out to his master’s servants, they asked him, 'Is everything well? Why did this madman come to you?' He replied to them, 'You know the man and what he might say.'

verses.latin: At illi dixerunt: Falsum est, sed magis dic nobis. Qui ait illis: Hæc et hæc locutus est mihi, dicens: Hæc dicit Dominus: Unxi te regem super Israel.
verses.english: But they insisted, 'No, that is not true; tell us instead!' So he told them, 'He said to me exactly this: 'This is what the Lord declares: I have anointed you king over Israel.''

verses.latin: Festinaverunt itaque, et unusquisque tollens pallium suum posuerunt subter pedes ejus in similitudinem tribunalis, et cecinerunt tuba, atque dixerunt: Regnavit Jehu.
verses.english: Immediately, each of them quickly took off his cloak and spread it under Jehu’s feet, as if making a royal throne. Then they blew the trumpet and proclaimed, 'Jehu is now king!'

verses.latin: Conjuravit ergo Jehu filius Josaphat filii Namsi contra Joram. Joram autem tenebat Ramoth Galaad, ipse et omnis Israel contra Hazaël regem Syriæ.
verses.english: So Jehu, the son of Jehoshaphat, the son of Nimshi, conspired against Joram. Now Joram had been defending Ramoth-Gilead, along with all of Israel, against Hazael, the king of Syria.

verses.latin: Et reversus fuerat rex Joram ut curaretur in Jezrahel propter vulnera, quæ acceperat a Syris, cum pugnaret contra Hazaël regem Syriæ. Dixitque Jehu: Si placet vobis, nemo egrediatur profugus de civitate, ne vadat, et nuntiet in Jezrahel.
verses.english: King Joram had returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds he received from the Syrians while fighting against Hazael, the king of Syria. Jehu then commanded, 'If it is agreeable to you, let no one escape from the city to go and report this news in Jezreel.'

verses.latin: Jehu autem ascendit currum, et abiit in Jezrahel: Joram enim ægrotavit ibi, et Ochozias rex Juda descenderat ad visitandum eum.
verses.english: So Jehu mounted his chariot and headed for Jezreel, because Joram was convalescing there, and Ahaziah, the king of Judah, had come down to visit him.

verses.latin: Speculator itaque stabat super turrem Jezrahel, viditque carpentem Jehu venientem, et ait: Currus video. Dixitque Joram: Tolle currum, et mitte in occursum eorum, et interroga, utrum pax sit.
verses.english: Now, the watchman was standing on the tower in Jezreel, and he saw Jehu’s company approaching in their chariots. He called out, 'I see chariots coming!' Joram said, 'Send a horseman to meet them and ask if they come in peace.'

verses.latin: Egressus est ergo eques in occursum ejus, et ait: Hæc dicit rex: Pacificane venis? Dixitque Jehu: Quid tibi et paci? Transi, et sequere me. Nuntiavitque speculator, dicens: Venit nuntius ad eos, et non revertitur.
verses.english: So a horseman went out to meet him and asked, 'The king asks, 'Do you come in peace?'' Jehu replied, 'What concern is peace to you? Turn around and follow me!' The watchman reported, 'The messenger reached them, but he is not returning.'

verses.latin: Misit etiam equitem secundum: qui veniens ad eos, ait: Hæc dicit rex: Pacificane venis? Et respondit Jehu: Quid tibi et paci? Transi, et sequere me.
verses.english: Then Joram sent a second horseman, who came to them and asked, 'The king asks, 'Do you come in peace?'' And Jehu answered, 'What concern is peace to you? Turn around and follow me!'

verses.latin: Nuntiavit autem speculator, dicens: Venit usque ad eos, et non revertitur: et incessus quasi incessus Jehu filii Namsi, præceps enim graditur.
verses.english: The watchman reported again, saying, 'He reached them, but he is not returning. The way the chariot is being driven is like the furious driving of Jehu, the son of Nimshi, for he drives with great speed.'

verses.latin: Et ait Joram: Junge currum. Et junxerunt currum ejus. Egressusque est Joram rex Israel, et Ochozias rex Juda, singuli in curribus suis, et perrexerunt obviam Jehu, et invenerunt eum in agro Naboth Jezrahelitæ.
verses.english: Then Joram exclaimed, 'Prepare my chariot!' So they prepared his chariot. King Joram of Israel and King Ahaziah of Judah each went out in their own chariots, and they rode to meet Jehu. They encountered him in the field of Naboth the Jezreelite.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Joram Jehu, ait: Pacificane venis Jehu? At ille respondit: Quæ pax? adhuc fornicationes Jezabel matris tuæ et veneficia ejus multa vigent.
verses.english: When Joram saw Jehu, he asked, 'Do you come in peace, Jehu?' He replied, 'How can there be peace, as long as the many immoral acts and sorceries of your mother Jezebel are still thriving?'

verses.latin: Joram autem convertit manum, et fugiens ait ad Ochoziam: Proditionis insidiæ, Ochozia!
verses.english: Joram then quickly turned his chariot to flee and shouted to Ahaziah, 'Treachery, Ahaziah! It’s an ambush!'

verses.latin: Porro Jehu tetendit arcum manu sua, et percussit Joram inter scapulas: egressaque est sagitta per cor ejus, statimque corruit in curru suo.
verses.english: But Jehu drew his bow with his full strength and shot Joram between his shoulders. The arrow pierced through his heart, and he immediately collapsed in his chariot.

verses.latin: Dixitque Jehu ad Bidcar ducem suum: Tolle, et projice eum in agrum Naboth Jezrahelitæ. Memini enim quando ego et tu sedentes in curru post Achab patrem tuum, Dominus hoc onus imposuit super eum, dicens:
verses.english: Jehu then said to Bidkar, his aide, 'Pick him up and throw him into the field of Naboth the Jezreelite. Remember when you and I were riding together in a chariot behind Ahab, your father? The Lord then laid this prophecy as a burden upon him, saying:'

verses.latin: Si non sanguinem Naboth, et sanguinem filiorum ejus vidi heri, ait Dominus, et reddam tibi in agro isto, ait Dominus. Nunc igitur tolle, et projice eum in agrum juxta verbum Domini.
verses.english: 'Surely I saw the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons yesterday, says the Lord, and I will repay you in this very field, says the Lord.' Now therefore, pick him up and throw him into the field, fulfilling the word of the Lord.

verses.latin: Ochozias autem rex Juda videns hoc, fugit per viam domus horti: persecutusque est eum Jehu, et ait: Percutite etiam et hunc in curru suo. Eumque percusserunt in ascensu Gaver, qui est juxta Jeblaam, qui fugit in Mageddo, et mortuus est ibi.
verses.english: When Ahaziah, the king of Judah, saw this, he fled by way of the garden house. Jehu pursued him and commanded, 'Strike this one down too!' And they struck him down in his chariot on the ascent of Gur, which is by Ibleam. He then escaped to Megiddo and died there.

verses.latin: Imposueruntque eum servi sui super currum ejus, et pertulerunt in Jerusalem, et sepelierunt eum in sepulchro suo cum patribus suis in civitate David.
verses.english: His servants took his body in a chariot and brought him to Jerusalem, where they buried him in his tomb with his ancestors in the City of David.

verses.latin: Jehu ergo venit Jezrahel. Porro Jezabel introitu ejus audito, depinxit oculos suos stibio, et ornavit caput suum, et prospiciebat per fenestram.
verses.english: Jehu then arrived in Jezreel. When Jezebel heard of his arrival, she painted her eyes with kohl, adorned her head, and looked out from a window.

verses.latin: Cum intrasset Jehu portam, ait: Numquid pacificus est Zambri, qui interfecit dominum suum?
verses.english: As Jehu entered the city gate, Jezebel called out, 'Is it peace, you Zimri, murderer of your master?' —comparing him to a previous king who assassinated his lord.

verses.latin: Levavitque Jehu faciem suam ad fenestram, et ait: Quis est mecum? Quis est mecum? Et aspexerunt eum duo vel tres eunuchi.
verses.english: Jehu looked up to the window and called out, 'Who is on my side? Who?' And two or three eunuchs looked down at him.

verses.latin: At ille ait eis: Præcipitate eam deorsum. Et præcipitaverunt eam, et aspersus est sanguis ejus in parietem, et in equos, et conculcata est.
verses.english: He said to them, 'Throw her down!' So they threw her down. Her blood splattered on the wall and on the horses, and her body was trampled underfoot.

verses.latin: Cumque intrasset, et comedisset, et bibisset, ait: Ite, et videte maledictam illam, et sepelite eam: quia filia regis est.
verses.english: Then Jehu went inside, ate, and drank. Afterward, he commanded, 'Go now and see to that cursed woman, and bury her, for after all, she was a king’s daughter.'

verses.latin: Et cum issent ut sepelirent eam, non invenerunt nisi calvariam, et pedes, et summas manus.
verses.english: But when they went to bury her, they found nothing but her skull, her feet, and the palms of her hands.

verses.latin: Reversique nuntiaverunt ei. Et ait Jehu: Sermo Domini est, quem locutus est per servum suum Eliam Thesbiten, dicens: In agro Jezrahel comedent canes carnes Jezabel.
verses.english: So they returned and reported this to him. Jehu then declared, 'This is the word of the Lord, which He spoke through His servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying: 'In the territory of Jezreel, dogs will devour the flesh of Jezebel.'

verses.latin: Et erit cadaver Jezabel quasi stercus super faciem terræ in agro Jezrahel, ita ut non possit agnosci, utrum hæc sit Jezabel.
verses.english: And the corpse of Jezebel will be like dung on the surface of the ground in the territory of Jezreel, so that no one will be able to identify her and say, 'This was Jezebel.'
