verses.english: Now, Elisha the prophet called one of the sons of the prophets and told him: "Prepare yourself for a journey, take this small flask of oil in your hand, and go to Ramoth-Gilead."

verses.latin: Cumque illuc veneris, videbis Jehu filium Josaphat filii Namsi: ingredere, et suscita eum de medio fratrum suorum, et introduc in interius cubiculum.
verses.english: When you arrive there, you will see Jehu, the son of Jehoshaphat, the son of Nimshi. Go inside, call him away from his companions, and bring him into an inner room.

verses.latin: Tollensque lenticulam olei, effunde super caput ejus, et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus: Unxi te regem super Israël. Aperique ostium, et fuge, et noli cunctari.
verses.english: Then, take the flask of oil, pour it over his head, and say: "This is what the Lord says: 'I have anointed you king over Israel.'" Then, open the door, flee immediately, and do not delay.

verses.latin: Abiit ergo puer, propheta in Ramoth Galaad.
verses.english: So the young prophet went to Ramoth-Gilead.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est ad principes exercitus: porro ipse sedebat in medio eorum. Et ait: Verbum mihi est ad te princeps. Dixitque Jehu: Ad quem ex omnibus nobis? At ille ait: Ad te princeps.
verses.english: He arrived and went in to the commanders of the army, and Jehu was sitting among them. The prophet said, "I have a message for you, commander." Jehu asked, "For which one of us?" The prophet replied, "For you, commander."

verses.latin: Et surrexit Jehu, et ingressus est in cubiculum: at ille fudit oleum super caput ejus, et ait: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Unxi te regem super populum Domini Israël.
verses.english: So Jehu stood up and went into the inner room. The prophet then poured the oil over his head and declared: "This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: 'I have anointed you king over the Lord's people, Israel.'"

verses.latin: Et percuties domum Achab domini tui, ut ultus sim sanguinem servorum meorum prophetarum, et sanguinem omnium servorum Domini, de manu Jezabel.
verses.english: "And you will strike down the house of Ahab, your master, so that I may avenge the blood of My servants, the prophets, and the blood of all the Lord’s servants, from the hand of Jezebel."

verses.latin: Et perdam omnem domum Achab: et interficiam de Achab mingentem ad parietem, et clausum, et novissimum in Israël.
verses.english: "I will utterly destroy the entire house of Ahab. I will cut off from Ahab every male, both slave and free, the last person remaining in Israel."

verses.latin: Et dabo domum Achab sicut domum Jeroboam filii Nabat, et sicut domum Baasa filii Ahia.
verses.english: "And I will make the house of Ahab like the house of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha, the son of Ahijah."

verses.latin: Jezabel quoque comedent canes in agro Jezrahel, nec est qui sepeliat. Aperuitque ostium, et fugit.
verses.english: "As for Jezebel, dogs will eat her flesh in the field of Jezreel, and no one will bury her." Then the prophet opened the door and fled.

verses.latin: Jehu autem egressus est ad servos domini sui: qui dixerunt ei: Rectene sunt omnia? quare venit iste furiosus ad te? Qui ait eis: Nostis hominem, et quid locutus sit.
verses.english: Jehu then went out to the servants of his master. They asked him, "Is everything alright? Why did that madman come to you?" He replied to them, "You know the man and what he said."

verses.latin: At illi responderunt: Mendacium est: sed magis dic nobis. Qui ait illis: Hæc et hæc locutus est mihi, et ait: Hæc dicit Dominus: Unxi te regem super Israël.
verses.english: But they insisted, "That's not true! Tell us what he really said!" So he told them, "He said to me such and such, and then he declared, 'This is what the Lord says: I have anointed you king over Israel.'"

verses.latin: Festinaverunt itaque, et unusquisque tollens pallium suum, posuerunt sub pedibus ejus in similitudinem tribunalis, et cecinerunt tuba, atque dixerunt: Regnavit Jehu.
verses.english: So they immediately rushed, and each man took his cloak, spread it under Jehu's feet like a royal carpet, and sounded the trumpet, proclaiming, "Jehu is king!"

verses.latin: Conjuravit ergo Jehu filius Josaphat filii Namsi contra Joram. Porro Joram obsederat Ramoth Galaad, ipse et omnis Israël, contra Hazaël regem Syriæ.
verses.english: Thus, Jehu, the son of Jehoshaphat, the son of Nimshi, conspired against Joram. (Now, Joram had been defending Ramoth-Gilead, along with all of Israel, against Hazael, the king of Syria.)

verses.latin: Et reversus fuerat rex Joram ut curaretur in Jezrahel propter vulnera quæ acceperat a Syris, cum pugnaret contra Hazaël regem Syriæ. Dixitque Jehu: Si placet vobis, nemo egrediatur profugus de civitate, ne vadat, et nuntiet in Jezrahel.
verses.english: King Joram had returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds he had received from the Syrians while fighting against Hazael, the king of Syria. Jehu then said, "If you agree with my plan, let no one escape from the city to go and report this news in Jezreel."

verses.latin: Et ascendit Jehu, et perrexit in Jezrahel: Joram enim ægrotabat ibi, et Ohozias rex Juda descenderat, ut inviseret Joram.
verses.english: Jehu then mounted his chariot and went to Jezreel, for Joram was recovering there, and Ahaziah, the king of Judah, had come down to visit Joram.

verses.latin: Speculator ergo qui stabat super turrem Jezrahel, vidit currum Jehu venientem, et ait: Currum perspicio. Dixitque Joram: Adhuc longe est, mitte nuntium obvius ei, et dicat: Pacatane sunt omnia?
verses.english: The lookout who was standing on the watchtower in Jezreel saw Jehu's chariot approaching and reported, "I see a chariot coming!" Joram said, "It's still far off. Send a messenger to meet him and ask: 'Is all well?'"

verses.latin: Abiit igitur nuntius obvius ei, et ait: Hæc dicit rex: Pacatane sunt omnia? Dixitque Jehu: Quid tibi et paci? transi, et sequere me. Nuntiavit quoque speculator, dicens: Venit nuntius ad eos, et non revertitur.
verses.english: So the messenger went to meet him and said, "The king asks: 'Is all well?'" Jehu replied, "What concern is peace to you? Turn around and follow me!" The lookout reported again, saying, "The messenger reached them, but he is not returning."

verses.latin: Misit etiam currum secundum equorum, et venit ad eos, et ait: Hæc dicit rex: Pacatane sunt omnia? Et ait Jehu: Quid tibi et paci? transi, et sequere me.
verses.english: Joram then sent a second chariot with horses, and this messenger also reached them and asked, "The king asks: 'Is all well?'" Jehu again replied, "What concern is peace to you? Turn around and follow me!"

verses.latin: Nuntiavitque speculator, dicens: Venit usque ad eos, et non revertitur: est autem incessus quasi incessus Jehu filii Namsi, præceps enim graditur.
verses.english: The lookout reported again, saying, "He reached them and is not returning. The driving is like the driving of Jehu, the son of Nimshi, for he drives furiously."

verses.latin: Et ait Joram: Junge currum. Junxeruntque currum ejus, et egressus est Joram rex Israël, et Ohozias rex Juda, singuli in curribus suis, et perrexerunt obvius Jehu, et invenerunt eum in agro Naboth Jezrahelitæ.
verses.english: Joram said, "Harness my chariot!" So they harnessed his chariot, and King Joram of Israel and King Ahaziah of Judah each went out in their own chariots. They rode to meet Jehu and found him in the field of Naboth the Jezreelite.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Joram Jehu, ait: Pacatane sunt, Jehu? At ille respondit: Quæ pax? adhuc fornicationes Jezabel matris tuæ, et veneficia ejus multa vigent.
verses.english: When Joram saw Jehu, he asked, "Is all well, Jehu?" But Jehu responded, "How can there be peace, as long as the many idolatries and sorceries of your mother Jezebel continue to thrive?"

verses.latin: Avertit igitur Joram manum suam, et fugit, dicens ad Ochoziam: Insidiæ, Ochozia.
verses.english: Joram immediately turned his chariot around and fled, shouting to Ahaziah, "Treason, Ahaziah!"

verses.latin: Porro Jehu tetendit arcum manu sua, et percussit Joram inter scapulas: egressaque est sagitta de corde ejus, et statim corruit in curru suo.
verses.english: Then Jehu drew his bow with his full strength and shot Joram between his shoulders. The arrow pierced his heart, and he immediately collapsed in his chariot.

verses.latin: Dixitque Jehu ad Badecær ducem suum: Tolle, et projice eum in agrum Naboth Jezrahelitæ. Memento enim quando ego et tu simul sedentes in curru sequebamur Achab patrem hujus, quod Dominus onus hoc imposuerit super eum, dicens:
verses.english: Jehu then said to Bidkar, his officer, "Pick him up and throw him into the field of Naboth the Jezreelite. Remember when you and I were riding together in a chariot behind Ahab, this man's father, that the Lord laid this burden upon him, saying:"

verses.latin: Si non sanguinem Naboth, et sanguinem filiorum ejus, quem effudisti heri, reddidi tibi, dicit Dominus. Nunc igitur tolle, et projice eum in agrum juxta verbum Domini.
verses.english: "'Surely I saw the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons yesterday, says the Lord, and I will repay you in this very field.' Therefore, pick him up now and throw him into the field, according to the word of the Lord."

verses.latin: Ochozias autem rex Juda videns hoc, fugit per viam domus horti. Persecutusque est eum Jehu, et ait: Etiam hunc percutite in curru suo. Et percuterunt eum in ascensu Gaver, qui est juxta Jeblaam: qui fugit in Mageddo, et mortuus est ibi.
verses.english: King Ahaziah of Judah, seeing this, fled by way of the garden house. But Jehu pursued him and commanded, "Strike him down also in his chariot!" So they struck him down on the ascent of Gur, which is by Ibleam. He managed to flee to Megiddo, but he died there.

verses.latin: Et imposuerunt eum servi sui super currum suum, et tulerunt in Jerusalem, et sepelierunt eum in sepulchro suo cum patribus suis in civitate David.
verses.english: His servants then placed him in his own chariot and brought him to Jerusalem, where they buried him in his tomb with his fathers in the City of David.

verses.latin: Anno undecimo Joram filii Achab, regnavit Ochozias super Judam.
verses.english: In the eleventh year of Joram, son of Ahab, Ahaziah began his reign over Judah.

verses.latin: Et venit Jehu in Jezrahel. Porro Jezabel introitu ejus audito, depinxit oculos suos stibio, et ornavit caput suum, et prospiciebat per fenestram.
verses.english: Jehu then arrived in Jezreel. When Jezebel heard of his coming, she put on her eye makeup, adorned her head, and looked out of the window.

verses.latin: Ingressumque Jehu per portam, dixit: Numquid pax potuit esse Zambri, qui interfecit dominum suum?
verses.english: As Jehu entered through the gate, she called out, "Is it peace, you Zimri, who murdered his master?"

verses.latin: Et levavit Jehu faciem suam ad fenestram, et ait: Quis est mecum? Quis? Et respexerunt eum duo vel tres eunuchi.
verses.english: Jehu then looked up toward the window and asked, "Who is on my side? Who?" Two or three eunuchs looked out at him.

verses.latin: At ille ait eis: Præcipitate eam deorsum. Et præcipitaverunt eam, et aspersus est sanguis ejus super parietem, et super equos, et conculcata est.
verses.english: He commanded them, "Throw her down!" So they threw her down. Her blood splattered on the wall and on the horses, and she was trampled underfoot.

verses.latin: Cumque ingressus esset, ut comederet biberetque, ait: Visitate, et videte cadaver maledictæ illius, et sepelite eam: quia filia regis est.
verses.english: Jehu then went inside to eat and drink. Afterward, he said, "Go, inspect the body of that cursed woman and bury her, because after all, she was a king's daughter."

verses.latin: Et cum perrexissent ut sepelirent eam, non invenerunt nisi calvariam, et pedes, et palmas manuum.
verses.english: But when they went to bury her, they found nothing but her skull, her feet, and the palms of her hands.

verses.latin: Reversique nuntiaverunt ei. Et ait Jehu: Sermo Domini est, quem locutus est per servum suum Eliam Thesbitem, dicens: In agro Jezrahel comedent canes carnes Jezabel,
verses.english: They returned and reported this to him. Jehu said, "This is the word of the Lord, which He spoke through His servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying: 'In the field of Jezreel, dogs will eat the flesh of Jezebel.'"

verses.latin: Et erit cadaver Jezabel quasi stercus super faciem terræ in agro Jezrahel: ita ut hi qui transeunt, dicant: Hæccine est illa Jezabel?
verses.english: "And the corpse of Jezebel will be like dung on the surface of the ground in the field of Jezreel, so that those who pass by will say, 'Is this really that Jezebel?'"

verses.latin: Eliseus autem propheta vocavit unum de filiis prophetarum, et ait illi: Accinge lumbos tuos, et tolle conum olei hujus in manu tua, et vade in Ramoth Galaad.
verses.english: Elisha the prophet called one of the prophets' disciples and said to him, 'Prepare yourself for travel, take this flask of anointing oil in your hand, and go to Ramoth-Gilead.'

verses.latin: Cumque veneris illuc, vide ubi sit Jehu filius Josaphat filii Namsi: et ingrediens claude ostium cubiculi, et tolle eum de medio fratrum suorum, et introduc in interius cubiculum.
verses.english: When you arrive there, look for Jehu, the son of Jehoshaphat, the grandson of Nimshi. Go in, close the door of the room securely, take him aside from his companions, and lead him into a private, inner room.

verses.latin: Et tollens conum olei, funde super caput ejus, et dices: Hæc dicit Dominus: Unxi te regem super Israël. Aperiesque ostium, et fugies, et non expectabis.
verses.english: Then take the flask of anointing oil and pour it over his head, saying, 'The Lord declares this: I have anointed you as king over Israel.' After you have done this, open the door, flee immediately, and do not wait there for anything.

verses.latin: Abiit ergo adolescens puer prophetæ in Ramoth Galaad.
verses.english: So the young man, the prophet's servant, went to Ramoth-Gilead.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est cubiculum principum exercitus: porro ille sedebat in medio fratrum suorum. Et ait: Verbum mihi est ad te, princeps.
verses.english: He entered the room where the army commanders were gathered. Jehu was sitting among his fellow officers. The young man said, 'I have a message for you, commander.'

verses.latin: Et ait Jehu: Ad quem ex omnibus nobis? Qui respondit: Ad te, princeps.
verses.english: Jehu asked, 'For which one of us?' The young man replied, 'For you, commander.'

verses.latin: Et surrexit, et ingressus est cubiculum: at ille fudit oleum super caput ejus, et ait: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Unxi te regem super populum Domini, super Israël.
verses.english: Jehu stood up and went into the private room. There, the young prophet poured the oil over his head and declared, 'This is what the Lord God of Israel says: I have anointed you as king over the Lord's people, over Israel.'

verses.latin: Et percuties domum Achab domini tui: et ulciscar sanguinem servorum meorum prophetarum, et sanguinem omnium servorum Domini, de manu Jezabel.
verses.english: You must strike down the household of Ahab your master. Through your hand, I will avenge the blood of My servants, the prophets, and the blood of all the Lord's servants, against Jezebel.

verses.latin: Et disperdam omnem domum Achab: et interficiam de Achab mingentem ad parietem, et clausum, et novissimum in Israël.
verses.english: I will utterly destroy the entire household of Ahab. I will cut off from Ahab every male, both slave and free, in Israel.

verses.latin: Et dabo domum Achab sicut domum Jeroboam filii Nabat, et sicut domum Baasa filii Ahia.
verses.english: I will make the household of Ahab like the household of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, and like the household of Baasha, the son of Ahijah.

verses.latin: Jezabel quoque comedent canes in agro Jezrahel, nec erit qui sepeliat. Aperuitque ostium, et fugit.
verses.english: And as for Jezebel, dogs will devour her in the field of Jezreel, and there will be no one to bury her.' After saying this, the young prophet opened the door and fled.

verses.latin: Jehu autem egressus est ad servos domini sui, qui dixerunt ei: Rectene sunt omnia? propter quid venit insanus iste ad te?
verses.english: When Jehu returned to his master's officers, they asked him, 'Is everything alright? Why did that madman come to you?'

verses.latin: Qui ait eis: Nostis hominem, et quid locutus sit.
verses.english: He replied to them, 'You know the man, and you know what he said.'

verses.latin: At illi dixerunt: Noli mendax esse: sed magis dic nobis. Qui ait: Hæc et hæc locutus est mihi, dicens: Hæc dicit Dominus: Unxi te regem super Israël.
verses.english: But they said, 'Don't lie to us; tell us honestly.' So he told them, 'He said such and such to me, saying: "The Lord declares this: I have anointed you as king over Israel."'

verses.latin: Festinaverunt itaque, et uniuscujusque tollentes pallium posuerunt sub pedibus ejus in similitudinem tribunalis, et cecinerunt tuba, atque dixerunt: Regnavit Jehu!
verses.english: They quickly took each man's cloak and laid it beneath Jehu, like a royal carpet on a raised platform. Then they blew the trumpet and proclaimed, 'Jehu is king!'

verses.latin: Conjuravit ergo Jehu super Joram filium Achab in Jezrahel: Joram autem obsederat Ramoth Galaad, ipse et omnis Israël.
verses.english: So Jehu plotted against Joram, Ahab's son, who was in Jezreel. Joram, along with all Israel, had been defending Ramoth-Gilead.

verses.latin: Et reversus fuerat Joram, ut curaretur in Jezrahel pro vulneribus, quia percusserant eum Syri, præliantem contra Hazaël regem Syriæ. Dixitque Jehu: Si placet vobis, nemo egrediatur profugus de civitate, ne vadat, et nuntiet in Jezrahel.
verses.english: Joram had returned to Jezreel to recover from wounds inflicted by the Arameans when he fought against Hazael, the king of Aram. Jehu declared, 'If you are in agreement with me, let no one escape from the city to go and report this news in Jezreel.'

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo Jehu, et ivit in Jezrahel: Joram quoque rex infirmabatur ibi, et Ochozias rex Juda descenderat, ut inviseret Joram.
verses.english: Then Jehu mounted his chariot and rode to Jezreel, where King Joram was recuperating. Ahaziah, king of Judah, had also come down to visit Joram.

verses.latin: Speculator autem stabat super turrem Jezrahel, viditque venientem Jehu, et multitudinem quæ erat cum eo, et ait: Quadriga video venientem. Dixitque Joram: Tolle currum, et mitte in occursum eorum, et roga: Pacatane sunt omnia?
verses.english: A watchman standing on the tower in Jezreel saw Jehu approaching with his company of men and exclaimed, 'I see a chariot approaching!' Joram said, 'Send a rider on horseback to meet them and ask, "Is it peace?"'

verses.latin: Egressus est igitur eques in occursum ejus, et ait: Hæc dicit rex: Pacatane sunt omnia? Dixitque Jehu: Quid tibi et paci? Transi, et sequere me. Nuntiavit quoque speculator, dicens: Venit nuntius ad eos, et non revertitur.
verses.english: So a horseman rode out to meet him and asked, 'The king asks, "Is it peace?"' Jehu replied, 'What concern is peace to you? Turn around and follow me!' The watchman reported again, saying, 'The messenger reached them, but he is not returning.'

verses.latin: Misit ergo secun dum currum equitem: qui cum venisset ad eos, ait: Hæc dicit rex: Pacatane sunt omnia? Responditque Jehu: Quid tibi et paci? Transi, et sequere me.
verses.english: So Joram sent out a second horseman. When he reached them, he asked, 'The king asks, "Is it peace?"' Jehu replied, 'What concern is peace to you? Turn around and follow me!'

verses.latin: Nuntiavit autem speculator, dicens: Venit usque ad illos, et non revertitur: est autem incessus quasi incessus Jehu filii Namsi, præceps enim graditur.
verses.english: The watchman reported, 'He reached them as well, but he is not returning. And the driving is like the driving of Jehu, son of Nimshi—he drives like a madman.'

verses.latin: Et ait Joram: Junge currum. Junxeruntque currum ejus, et egressus est Joram rex Israël, et Ochozias rex Juda, singuli in curribus suis, egressique sunt in occursum Jehu, et invenerunt eum in agro Naboth Jezrahelitæ.
verses.english: Joram then commanded, 'Harness my chariot!' So they harnessed his chariot. King Joram of Israel and King Ahaziah of Judah each went out in their own chariots, riding to meet Jehu. They encountered him in the field that belonged to Naboth of Jezreel.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Joram Jehu, ait: Pacatane sunt, Jehu? At ille respondit: Quæ pax? adhuc fornicationes Jezabel matris tuæ, et veneficia illius plurima vigent.
verses.english: When Joram saw Jehu, he asked, 'Is it peace, Jehu?' Jehu replied, 'What peace can there be, as long as the harlotries of your mother Jezebel and her many sorceries are still flourishing?'

verses.latin: Porro Joram convertit manum, et fugiens ait ad Ochoziam: Proditiones, Ochozia!
verses.english: Joram immediately turned his chariot to flee and cried out to Ahaziah, 'Treachery, Ahaziah!'

verses.latin: Jehu autem tetendit arcum manu sua, et percussit Joram inter scapulas: et egressa est sagitta de corde ejus, statimque corruit in curru suo.
verses.english: But Jehu drew his bow with his full strength and struck Joram between his shoulders. The arrow pierced through his heart, and he collapsed instantly in his chariot.

verses.latin: Dixitque Jehu ad Bada cerum ducem suum: Tolle, et projice eum in agrum Naboth Jezrahelitæ: memento enim quando ego et tu sedentes in curribus prosequebamur Achab patrem hujus, et Dominus onus hoc imposuit super eum, dicens:
verses.english: Then Jehu ordered Bidkar, his officer, 'Pick him up and throw him into the field of Naboth the Jezreelite. Remember when you and I were riding in chariots behind Ahab, this man's father, how the Lord laid this burden upon him, saying:'

verses.latin: Si non sanguinem Naboth, et sanguinem filiorum ejus, quem fudit heri, inquiram in agro isto, ait Dominus, et reddam tibi in agro isto, dicit Dominus. Nunc ergo tolle, et projice eum in agrum juxta verbum Domini.
verses.english: '"Surely I have seen the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons, which was shed yesterday," declares the Lord. "And I will repay you in this very field," declares the Lord. Now, therefore, pick him up and throw him into the field, according to the word of the Lord.'

verses.latin: Ochozias autem rex Juda videns hoc, fugit per viam domus horti: et insecutus est eum Jehu, et ait: Percutite etiam hunc in curru suo. Atque percusserunt eum in ascensu Gaver, quæ est juxta Jeblaam: qui fugit in Mageddo, et mortuus est ibi.
verses.english: King Ahaziah of Judah saw what happened and fled by way of the garden house. Jehu pursued him and commanded, 'Strike him down in his chariot too!' So they struck him at the ascent of Gur, which is by Ibleam. He managed to escape to Megiddo, but he died there.

verses.latin: Et imposuerunt eum servi sui super currum in Jerusalem, et sepelierunt eum in sepulchro suo cum patribus suis in civitate David.
verses.english: His servants carried him in a chariot to Jerusalem and buried him in his tomb with his ancestors in the City of David.

verses.latin: Jehu ergo venit Jezrahel. Porro Jezabel introitu ejus audito, depinxit oculos suos stibio, et ornavit caput suum, et prospiciebat per fenestram.
verses.english: When Jehu arrived in Jezreel, Jezebel heard about his coming. She painted her eyelids with kohl, adorned her head with jewels, and looked out from a window.

verses.latin: Veniente Jehu per portam, ait: Numquid pax esse potest Zamri, qui interfecit dominum suum?
verses.english: As Jehu entered the gate, she called out, 'Is it peace, you Zimri, murderer of your master?'

verses.latin: Et levavit Jehu faciem suam ad fenestram, et ait: Quis est mecum? Quis? Et aspexerunt eum duo vel tres eunuchi.
verses.english: Jehu looked up toward the window and asked, 'Who is on my side? Who?' Two or three eunuchs looked out at him.

verses.latin: At ille ait eis: Præcipitate eam. Et præcipitaverunt eam, et aspersus est sanguine paries, et equorum ungulæ: et conculcata est.
verses.english: He commanded them, 'Throw her down!' So they threw her down. Some of her blood splattered on the wall and on the horses' hooves, and Jehu's chariot trampled over her.

verses.latin: Cumque intrasset, et comederet, bibissetque, ait: Visitate, et videte cadaver maledictæ illius, et sepelite eam: quia filia regis est.
verses.english: Then Jehu went inside, ate and drank. Afterward, he said, 'Go and see to that accursed woman's corpse and bury her, for she was a king's daughter.'

verses.latin: Et cum issent ut sepelirent eam, non invenerunt nisi calvariam, et pedes, et summas manus.
verses.english: But when they went to bury her, they found nothing but her skull, her feet, and the palms of her hands.

verses.latin: Reversique nuntiaverunt ei. Et ait Jehu: Sermo Domini est, quem locutus est per servum suum Eliam Thesbitem, dicens: In agro Jezrahel comedent canes carnes Jezabel.
verses.english: When they returned and reported this to Jehu, he said, 'This is the word of the Lord, which He spoke through His servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying: "In the field of Jezreel, dogs will devour Jezebel's flesh."

verses.latin: Et erit cadaver Jezabel quasi stercus super faciem terræ in agro Jezrahel, ita ut prætereuntes dicant: Hæccine est illa Jezabel?
verses.english: And the corpse of Jezebel will be like dung on the surface of the ground in the field of Jezreel, so that those passing by will say: "Is this truly that Jezebel?"'

verses.latin: Non enim in terra nec erit in loco Jezabel ubi sepeliatur, sed effundetur in campo Jezrahel sicut stercus super faciem terræ usque ad unum pedum non poterunt agnoscere.
verses.english: For Jezebel will not be in the earth, nor will there be a place where she can be buried. Instead, her remains will be scattered in the plain of Jezreel like dung on the surface of the ground, so completely that no one will be able to recognize her remains.

verses.latin: Et erit cadaver Jezabel quasi stercus super faciem terræ in agro Jezrahel ita ut prætereuntes dicant hæccine est illa Jezabel non enim in terra nec erit in loco Jezabel ubi sepeliatur sed effundetur in campo Jezrahel sicut stercus super faciem terræ usque ad unum pedum non poterunt agnoscere.
verses.english: Thus, the corpse of Jezebel will be like dung on the surface of the ground in the field of Jezreel, so that those passing by will say: 'Is this truly that Jezebel?' For she will not be in the earth, nor will there be a place where Jezebel can be buried. Instead, her remains will be scattered in the plain of Jezreel like dung on the surface of the ground, so completely that no one will be able to recognize her remains.

verses.latin: Erat autem Achab septuaginta filios in Samaria: scripsit ergo Jehu litteras, et misit in Samariam ad optimates civitatis, et ad majores natu, et ad nutrices Achab, dicens:
verses.english: Now King Ahab had seventy sons living in Samaria. So Jehu wrote letters and dispatched them to Samaria, addressing them to the city's officials, its elders, and those who were responsible for raising Ahab's sons, with this message:

verses.latin: Si filii domini vestri apud vos sunt, et currus et equi, et civitas muni, et arma,
verses.english: "Since your lord's sons are with you, and you have chariots, horses, a fortified city, and weapons,

verses.latin: eligite meliorem et aptiorem de filiis domini vestri, et ponite super solium patris sui, et pugnate pro domo domini vestri.
verses.english: choose the best and most capable among your lord's sons, and place him on his father's throne. Then, fight for the family and household of your lord."

verses.latin: Et timuerunt vehementer, et dixerunt: Ecce duo reges non potuerunt stare coram eo, et nos quomodo poterimus resistere?
verses.english: But the officials were terrified, and they said: "Look, two kings—King Joram and King Ahaziah—could not stand against him. How then can we possibly resist him?"

verses.latin: Misit ergo præpositus domus et præfectus civitatis, et majores natu, et nutrices ad Jehu, dicentes: Servi tui sumus, quæcumque jusseris faciemus: non faciemus regem: quodcumque tibi placet, fac.
verses.english: So the royal steward, the city governor, the elders, and the guardians of the sons sent a message back to Jehu, saying: "We are your servants, and we will do whatever you command us. We will not make anyone king. Do whatever you deem best."

verses.latin: Scripsit autem eis litteras secundo, dicens: Si mei estis, et obedits mihi, tollite capita filiorum domini vestri, et venite ad me in Jezrahel cras hora hac. Porro regis filii septuaginta viri erant apud optimates civitatis, qui eos nutriebant.
verses.english: Then Jehu wrote to them a second time, saying: "If you are truly on my side and will obey me, then cut off the heads of your lord's sons, and come to meet me in Jezreel by this time tomorrow." Now, the king's seventy sons were living with the city's leading men, who were raising them.

verses.latin: Cumque venissent litteræ ad eos, tulerunt filios regis, et occiderunt septuaginta viros, et posuerunt capita eorum in cophinis, et miserunt ad eum in Jezrahel.
verses.english: When the letters reached them, they seized the king's sons and killed all seventy men. Then they placed their heads in baskets and sent them to Jehu in Jezreel.

verses.latin: Venit autem nuntius, et indicavit ei, dicens: Attulerunt capita filiorum regis. Qui respondit: Ponite ea duos acervos juxta introitum portæ usque mane.
verses.english: Then a messenger arrived and reported to Jehu, saying: "They have brought the heads of the king's sons." Jehu responded: "Arrange them in two piles at the entrance of the city gate, and leave them there until morning."

verses.latin: Cumque mane egressus esset, stetit, et ait omni populo: Justi estis: ecce ego conjuravi adversus dominum meum, et interfeci eum: quis jugulavit omnes hos?
verses.english: When Jehu went out the next morning, he stood before the people and declared: "You are innocent in this matter. Indeed, I conspired against my lord and killed him; that is my responsibility. But who is responsible for slaying all these seventy men?"

verses.latin: Scitote ergo quia non cecidit de sermonibus Domini in terram, quos locutus est Dominus super domum Achab, et Dominus fecit quod locutus est in manu servi sui Heliæ.
verses.english: Know therefore that not a single word spoken by the Lord against the house of Ahab has failed to come true. The Lord has accomplished what He declared through His servant Elijah."

verses.latin: Percussit ergo Jehu omnes, qui residui fuerant de domo Achab in Jezrahel, universosque optimates ejus, et cognatos, et sacerdotes, donec non remanerent ex eo reliquiæ.
verses.english: So Jehu struck down all who remained of Ahab's family and household in Jezreel, including all his leading men, his relatives, and his priests, until there was not a single person left from Ahab's line.

verses.latin: Et surrexit, et abiit, et venit in Samariam: cumque venisset ad Domum Pastorum in via,
verses.english: Then Jehu rose up and departed, traveling to Samaria. As he came to the Shepherds' House on the way,

verses.latin: invenit fratres Ohoziæ regis Juda, dicens ad eos: Qui estis vos? Qui responderunt: Fratres Ohoziæ sumus, et descendimus ut salutaremus filios regis, et filios reginæ.
verses.english: he encountered the relatives of King Ahaziah of Judah and asked them: "Who are you?" They replied: "We are relatives of Ahaziah, and we have come down to greet the sons of the king and the sons of the queen."

verses.latin: Quos apprehendit, et jugulavit juxta foveam, juxta Domum Pastorum, quadraginta duos viros, et non reliquit ex eis quemquam.
verses.english: Jehu seized them and slaughtered forty-two men by the pit near the Shepherds' House, leaving not a single one alive.

verses.latin: Cumque egressus inde, invenisset Jonadab filium Rechab in occursum sibi, et benedixisset ei, et dicisset ad eum: Numquid est cor tuum rectum sicut et cor meum cum corde tuo? Et ait Jonadab: Est. Si est, inquit, da manum tuam. Dedit ille manum suam: et levavit eum ad se in curru.
verses.english: When Jehu departed from there, he met Jehonadab son of Rechab. After greeting him, Jehu asked: "Is your heart as loyal to me as my heart is loyal to you and God's purpose?" Jehonadab answered: "It is." Then Jehu said: "If so, give me your hand." Jehonadab extended his hand, and Jehu pulled him up into his chariot.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eum: Veni mecum, et vide zelum meum pro Domino. Et imposuit eum in curru suo.
verses.english: Jehu then said to him: "Come with me, and witness my zeal for the Lord." So Jehu brought him into his chariot.

verses.latin: Et ingressus Samariam, percussit omnes, qui reliqui fuerant de Achab in Samaria, donec deleret eum juxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus est ad Eliam.
verses.english: Upon entering Samaria, Jehu struck down all who remained of Ahab's family and household in that city, utterly destroying them, in fulfillment of the Lord's word spoken to Elijah.

verses.latin: Congregavit ergo Jehu omnem populum, et dixit ad eos: Achab coluit Baal parum, ego autem colam eum amplius.
verses.english: Then Jehu gathered all the people and declared to them: "Ahab served Baal only a little, but I will serve him much more diligently."

verses.latin: Nunc igitur omnes prophetas Baal, et universos servos ejus, et omnes sacerdotes illius, vocate ad me: nullus sit qui non veniat: quoniam victima magna est mihi Baali. Quicumque defuerit, non vivet. Jehu autem hoc faciebat insidiose, ut disperderet cultores Baal.
verses.english: Therefore, summon all the prophets of Baal, all his servants, and all his priests to me now. Let no one fail to come, for I am offering a great sacrifice to Baal. Whoever is absent will not live." Jehu was doing this with cunning intent, aiming to utterly destroy the worshippers of Baal.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Sanctificate diem solemnem Baali. Et prædicavit.
verses.english: And Jehu commanded: "Proclaim a solemn assembly for Baal!" So it was proclaimed throughout the land.

verses.latin: Misit quoque Jehu in universum Israël, et venerunt omnes servi Baal: non fuit residuus, nec unus quidem qui non veniret. Et ingressi sunt templum Baal, et impletum est templum Baal a summo usque ad summum.
verses.english: Jehu also sent messengers throughout all Israel, and all the servants of Baal came. Not a single one remained who did not come. They entered the temple of Baal, and the temple of Baal was filled from one end to the other.

verses.latin: Et ait his, qui erant super vestes, proferte vestimenta universis servis Baal. Et protulerunt eis vestimenta.
verses.english: Then Jehu said to the one in charge of the vestments: "Bring out the robes for all the servants of Baal." So the official brought out the robes for them.

verses.latin: Ingressusque Jehu et Jonadab filius Rechab templum Baal, ait cultoribus Baal: Scrutamini, et videte ne quis forte sit vobiscum de servis Domini, sed ut sint servi Baal tantum.
verses.english: When Jehu and Jehonadab son of Rechab entered the temple of Baal, Jehu said to the Baal worshippers: "Look carefully and make sure there is no servant of the Lord among you, but only servants of Baal."

verses.latin: Ingressique sunt ut facerent victimas et holocausta. Jehu autem præparavit sibi foris octoginta viros, et dixit eis: Quicumque fugerit de viris, quos ego adduxero ad vos, anima ejus pro anima illius erit.
verses.english: Then the Baal worshippers proceeded to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. Meanwhile, Jehu had stationed eighty men outside, warning them: "If any of the men whom I bring into your hands should escape, then your own life will be taken in exchange for his life."

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum conplessem holocaustum, præcepit Jehu cursoribus et ducibus suis: Ingredimini, et percutite illos: nullus evadat. Percusseruntque cursores et duces ore gladii: et projecerunt, et abierunt in civitatem templi Baal.
verses.english: As soon as Jehu had finished offering the burnt offering, he commanded his guards and officers: "Go in and strike them down! Let no one escape!" So the guards and officers struck them with the edge of the sword. Then they cast out the bodies and proceeded to the inner sanctuary of the temple of Baal.

verses.latin: Et protulerunt statuam de templo Baal, et combusserunt eam.
verses.english: They brought out the sacred pillar of Baal from the temple of Baal and burned it.

verses.latin: Frægerunt quoque statuam Baal, et idem templum Baal subverterunt, feceruntque latrinas usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: They also broke down the sacred pillar of Baal and completely tore down the temple of Baal. They turned it into a public latrine, and it remains so to this very day.

verses.latin: Delevit ergo Jehu Baal de Israël.
verses.english: Thus Jehu utterly eradicated Baal worship from Israel.

verses.latin: Verumtamen a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël, non recessit Jehu, neque a vitulis aureis qui erant in Bethel et Dan.
verses.english: However, Jehu did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, who had caused Israel to sin, specifically from worshipping the golden calves that were in Bethel and Dan.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Dominus ad Jehu: Quia studiose fecisti quod rectum erat, et quod placitum est in oculis meis, et omnia quæ erant in corde meo, fecisti contra domum Achab, filii tui usque ad quartam generationem sedebunt super thronum Israël.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord said to Jehu: "Because you have diligently carried out what was right and pleasing in My sight, and you have done everything I intended against the house of Ahab, your sons will sit on the throne of Israel for four generations."

verses.latin: Porro Jehu non custodivit, ut ambularet in lege Domini Dei Israël in toto corde suo: a peccatis enim Jeroboam non recessit, qui peccare fecerat Israël.
verses.english: Yet Jehu himself was not careful to walk in the Law of the Lord, the God of Israel, with his whole heart; for he did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, who had caused Israel to sin.

verses.latin: In diebus illis cœpit Dominus horrere super Israël: percussitque eos Hazaël in universis finibus Israël,
verses.english: In those days, the Lord began to diminish Israel. King Hazael of Aram struck them throughout all the territories of Israel,

verses.latin: trans Jordanem quidem omnem terram Galaad, et Gad, et Ruben, et Manasse, ab Aroer, quæ est super torrentem Arnon, et Galaad, et Basan.
verses.english: including all the land beyond the Jordan River—Gilead, Gad, Reuben, and Manasseh—from Aroer, which is by the Arnon Valley, including Gilead and Bashan.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jehu, et omnium quæ fecit, et fortitudinis ejus, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Jehu, all that he accomplished, and all his might, are these not recorded in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Et dormivit Jehu cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in Samaria: regnavitque Joachaz filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Then Jehu rested with his ancestors, and they buried him in Samaria. His son Jehoahaz succeeded him as king.

verses.latin: Dies autem quos regnavit Jehu super Israël in Samaria, viginti et octo anni sunt.
verses.english: The length of Jehu's reign over Israel in Samaria was twenty-eight years.

verses.english: [Verse not found in Clementine Vulgate for 2 Kings 10]

verses.latin: Fuerunt ergo septuaginta filii Achab in Samaria: scripsit autem Jehu litteras, et misit in Samariam ad optimates civitatis, et ad majores natu, et ad nutrices Achab, dicens:
verses.english: Now, Ahab had seventy sons living in Samaria. So Jehu wrote letters and sent them into Samaria, to the city's most important officials, to its elders, and to those who had cared for Ahab's children since their youth, saying this:

verses.latin: statim ut acceperitis litteras has, qui habetis filios domini vestri, et currus, et equos, et civitates, et arma:
verses.english: “As soon as you receive this letter—you who are responsible for your lord's sons, who have chariots and horses, who control fortified cities and weapons—

verses.latin: eligite meliorem, et aptissimum de filiis domini vestri, et ponite eum super solium patris sui, et pugnate pro domo domini vestri.
verses.english: choose the best and most capable among your lord's sons. Then put him on his father's throne and fight for the dynasty of your lord.”

verses.latin: Illi timuerunt vehementer, et dixerunt: Ecce duo reges non steterunt contra eum, et quomodo possumus nos resistere?
verses.english: But they were terrified and said, “Look, two kings couldn't stand against him—referring to Jehu—so how can we possibly resist Jehu ourselves?”

verses.latin: Miserunt ergo præpositi domus, et principes civitatis, et majores natu, et nutrices ad Jehu, dicentes: Servi tui sumus: quicquid jusseris, faciemus: non faciemus regem: tu quod tibi placet fac.
verses.english: So the official in charge of the palace, along with the city's chief officials, the elders, and the guardians of Ahab's sons, sent this message back to Jehu: “We are your servants. Whatever you command, we will do. We will not set up anyone as king. You may do whatever you think is right.”

verses.latin: Rescripsit autem eis litteras secundo, dicens: Si mei estis, et obeditis mihi, tollite capita filiorum domini vestri, et venite ad me in Jezrahel cras hac hora. Porro filii regis septuaginta viri erant apud optimates civitatis, qui eos nutriebant.
verses.english: Jehu then wrote a second letter to them, saying: “If you truly are loyal to me and are ready to obey me, then take the heads of your lord's sons and come to me in Jezreel by this time tomorrow.” Now, the king's seventy sons were living with the most important officials of the city, who were raising them.

verses.latin: Cumque acceptæ essent litteræ, comprehendentes filios regis septuaginta viros, interfecerunt, et posuerunt capita eorum in cophinis, et miserunt ad eum in Jezrahel.
verses.english: When the officials received Jehu's letter, they seized the king's seventy sons and slaughtered every one of them. Then they put their heads in baskets and sent them to Jehu in Jezreel.

verses.latin: Venit autem nuntius, et indicavit ei, dicens: Attulerunt capita filiorum regis. Qui respondit: Ponite ea duos acervos juxta introitum portæ usque mane.
verses.english: When a messenger came and reported to Jehu, saying, “They have brought the heads of the king's sons,” Jehu replied, “Pile them in two heaps by the entrance of the city gate, and leave them there until morning.”

verses.latin: Cumque egressus esset mane, et stans loqueretur ad omnem populum: Scitote, inquit, quoniam nihil inveteratum est de universis sermonibus Domini, quos locutus est super domum Achab: et Dominus fecit quod locutus est in manu servi sui Eliæ.
verses.english: In the morning, Jehu went out, stood before all the people, and declared: “Understand this now: None of you are guilty of this conspiracy to kill Joram, the son of Ahab; however, know that nothing of all the Lord's words spoken against the dynasty of Ahab has failed to come to pass. The Lord has truly done what he promised through his servant Elijah.”

verses.latin: Igitur percussit Jehu omnes, qui reliqui fuerant de domo Achab in Jezrahel, universosque optimates ejus, et cognatos, et sacerdotes, donec non remanerent ex eo reliquiæ.
verses.english: So then Jehu struck down all those who remained of Ahab's dynasty in Jezreel, along with all of Ahab's chief officials, his close associates, and his priests, until not a single person remained from his family line.

verses.latin: Et surrexit, et venit in Samariam: cumque venisset ad casam pastoris in via,
verses.english: Then Jehu got up and traveled to Samaria. On the way, when he reached a shepherd's hut,

verses.latin: invenit fratres Ohoziæ regis Juda. Et ait illis: Qui estis vos? Qui responderunt: Fratres Ohoziæ sumus, et descendimus ad salutandos filios regis, et filios reginæ.
verses.english: he found the relatives of Ahaziah, king of Judah. He asked them, “Who are you?” They answered, “We are the relatives of King Ahaziah, and we are on our way to greet the sons of the king and the sons of the queen.”

verses.latin: Qui ait: Comprehendite eos vivos. Quos cum comprehendissent vivos, jugulaverunt eos juxta cisternam viæ, quadraginta duos viros, et non reliquerunt ex eis quemquam.
verses.english: Jehu ordered, “Seize them alive!” And when they had seized them alive, he had them slaughtered by the roadside well—all forty-two men. He did not leave a single one of them alive.

verses.latin: Cumque abiisset inde, invenit Jonadab filium Rechab in occursum sibi: et benedixit ei, et ait ad eum: Rectum est cor tuum, sicut et cor meum cum corde tuo? Et ait Jonadab: Est, est. Et ait: Si est, da manum tuam. Dedit ille manum suam: et levavit eum ad se in curru.
verses.english: When Jehu left that place, he met Jehonadab son of Rechab, who was coming to meet him. Jehu greeted him and said, “Is your heart as true to me as my heart is to yours?” Jehonadab answered, “It is.” Jehu then said, “If it is, give me your hand.” So Jehonadab gave him his hand, and Jehu pulled him up into his chariot with him.

verses.latin: Et ait illi: Veni mecum, et vide studium meum pro Domino. Et imposuit eum in curru suo.
verses.english: Then Jehu said to him, “Come with me and see my zeal for the Lord.” And he took Jehonadab into his chariot.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset Samariam, percussit omnes qui reliqui fuerant de Achab in Samaria usque ad internecionem, juxta verbum Domini quod locutus est ad Eliam.
verses.english: When Jehu arrived in Samaria, he struck down everyone who remained from Ahab's dynasty in Samaria, until he had completely annihilated them. This was in accordance with the word of the Lord that he had spoken to Elijah.

verses.latin: Congregavit ergo Jehu omnem populum, et dixit ad eos: Achab coluit Baal parum, ego autem colam eum amplius.
verses.english: Then Jehu gathered all the people and said to them, “Ahab served Baal a little, but I will serve him much more.”

verses.latin: Nunc ergo omnes prophetas Baal, et universos servos ejus, et cunctos sacerdotes illius, vocate ad me: nullus sit qui non veniat, quia victima magna mihi est Baali. Quicumque defuerit, non vivet. Jehu autem hoc faciébat insidiose, ut disperderet cultores Baal.
verses.english: “Therefore, summon all the prophets of Baal, all his servants, and all his priests to me now. Let no one fail to come, for I am offering a great sacrifice to Baal. Anyone who is absent will not live.” Jehu was doing this with a cunning plan in mind, intending to utterly destroy the worshippers of Baal.

verses.latin: Et dixit Jehu: Sanctificate diem solemnem Baal. Et prædicavit.
verses.english: And Jehu said, “Consecrate a solemn assembly for Baal!” So they proclaimed it.

verses.latin: Misitque Jehu in universum Israël: et venerunt omnes servi Baal, non fuit residuus, ne unus quidem, qui non veniret. Et ingressi sunt templum Baal: et impletum est templum Baal a summo usque ad summum.
verses.english: Jehu sent messengers throughout all Israel, and all the servants of Baal came; not one remained who did not come. They entered the temple of Baal, and the temple of Baal was filled from one end to the other.

verses.latin: Et ait his qui erant super vestimenta: Proferte vestimenta universis cultoribus Baal. Et protulerunt eis vestimenta.
verses.english: Then Jehu said to the attendant who was in charge of the robes, “Bring out vestments for all the worshippers of Baal.” So he brought out vestments for them.

verses.latin: Ingressusque Jehu, et Jonadab filius Rechab, templum Baal, ait cultoribus Baal: Scrutamini, et videte ne quis forte vobiscum sit de servis Domini, sed ut sint soli cultores Baal.
verses.english: Jehu, along with Jehonadab son of Rechab, entered the temple of Baal. Jehu said to the worshippers of Baal, “Search carefully and make sure there is no servant of the Lord among you, but only worshippers of Baal.”

verses.latin: Ingressique sunt ut facerent victimas et holocausta. Porro Jehu statuerat sibi foris octoginta viros, et dixerat eis: Quicumque fugerit de viris his, quos ego adduxero in manus vestras, anima ejus erit pro anima illius.
verses.english: Then they proceeded to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. Now, Jehu had stationed eighty men outside, saying to them, “If any of these men whom I bring into your hands escape, then the life of that guard will pay for the life of the one who escaped.”

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum conpletum esset holocaustum, præcepit Jehu militibus et ducibus suis: Ingredimini, et percutite illos: nullus evadat. Percusseruntque eos milites et duces in ore gladii: et projecerunt, jactantes, et abierunt in civitatem templi Baal.
verses.english: As soon as the burnt offering was completed, Jehu commanded his guards and officers, “Go in and strike them down! Let no one escape!” So the guards and officers struck them down with the edge of the sword. They threw their bodies out and went into the inner sanctuary of the temple of Baal.

verses.latin: Et protulerunt statuam de templo Baal, et combusserunt eam.
verses.english: They brought out the sacred pillar, or idol, from the temple of Baal and burned it.

verses.latin: Frangeruntque statuam Baal, et everterunt templum Baal, feceruntque illud latrinam usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: They then broke down the sacred pillar of Baal and tore down the temple of Baal itself. They turned it into a latrine, which it remains to this very day.

verses.latin: Delevit itaque Jehu Baal de Israël.
verses.english: Thus, Jehu eradicated Baal worship from Israel.

verses.latin: Verumtamen a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël, non recessit Jehu, neque a vitulis aureis, qui erant in Bethel, et Dan.
verses.english: Nevertheless, Jehu did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, who caused Israel to sin—namely, the worship of the golden calves that were in Bethel and Dan.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Dominus ad Jehu: Quia studiose fecisti quod rectum erat, et complesti quod in corde meo erat, in omnia quæ erant in domo Achab: filii tui usque ad quartam generationem sedebunt super thronum Israël.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord said to Jehu, “Because you have zealously carried out what was right in my sight, and have accomplished all that was in my heart concerning the dynasty of Ahab, your sons will sit on the throne of Israel for four generations.”

verses.latin: Porro Jehu non custodivit, ut ambularet in lege Domini Dei Israël in toto corde suo: non enim recessit a peccatis Jeroboam, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: However, Jehu himself did not carefully walk in the Law of the Lord, the God of Israel, with all his heart. For he did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, who caused Israel to sin.

verses.latin: In illis diebus cœpit Dominus horrere super Israël: percussitque eos Hazahel in omni terminio Israël,
verses.english: In those days, the Lord began to cut off parts of Israel. King Hazael of Aram struck them throughout all the territory of Israel,

verses.latin: a Jordane contra orientalem plagam, omnem terram Galaad, et Gad, et Ruben, et Manasse, ab Aroer, quæ est super torrente Arnon, et Galaad, et Basan.
verses.english: starting from the Jordan River eastward, encompassing all the land of Gilead—the territories of Gad, Reuben, and Manasseh—from Aroer, which is by the Arnon Valley, including Gilead and Bashan.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jehu, et universa quæ fecit, et fortitudo ejus, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Jehu, all that he did, and all his might, are they not written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Jehu cum patribus suis: et sepelierunt eum in Samaria: regnavitque Joachaz filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Jehu rested with his ancestors, and they buried him in Samaria. Then his son Jehoahaz became king in his place.

verses.latin: Dies autem quos regnavit Jehu super Israël, viginti et octo anni sunt in Samaria.
verses.english: Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria for twenty-eight years.

verses.latin: Et reliqua sermonum Joachaz, et universa quæ fecit, et fortitudo ejus, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: As for the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and all that he did, and his might, are they not written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joachaz cum patribus suis: sepelieruntque eum in Samaria. Regnavitque Joas filius ejus pro eo in decimo septimo anno Joas regis Juda.
verses.english: Jehoahaz rested with his ancestors, and they buried him in Samaria. Then his son Joash became king in his place, during the seventeenth year of the reign of King Joash of Judah.

verses.latin: Quinquaginta et quinque annorum erat Amasias cum regnare cœpisset, et viginti novem annis regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Joadan de Jerusalem.
verses.english: Amasias was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Jehoaddin, from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque rectum in conspectu Domini: verumtamen non sicut David pater ejus. Omnia juxta quæ fecerat Joas pater ejus, fecit.
verses.english: He did what was right in the sight of the Lord, though not with the complete devotion of his ancestor David. He followed the example of all that his father Joash had done.

verses.latin: Excelsa vero non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et adolebat incensum in excelsis. In diebus autem istis, misit Amasias nuntios ad Joas filium Joachaz, filii Jehu regis Israël, dicens: Veni, et videamus nos mutuo.
verses.english: However, he did not remove the high places—the pagan altars—so the people still offered sacrifices and burned incense there. In those days, Amaziah sent messengers to King Joash son of Jehoahaz, son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, “Come, let us meet face to face in battle.”

verses.latin: Erant autem septuaginta filii Achab in Samaria: scripsit ergo Jehu epistolas, et misit in Samariam ad optimates civitatis, et ad majores natu, et ad nutrices Achab, dicens:
verses.english: Now, Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria. So Jehu wrote letters and sent them into Samaria to the chief men of the city, to the elders, and to those who had been responsible for raising Ahab’s children. This is what he said:

verses.latin: Statim ut acceperitis litteras has, qui habetis filios domini vestri, et currus, et equos, et civitates, et arma, eligite meliorem, et eum qui vobis placuerit de filiis domini vestri, et ponite super thronum patris sui, et pugnate pro domo domini vestri.
verses.english: "As soon as you receive these letters—you who have the sons of your lord, and chariots, and horses, and cities, and weapons—choose the best and most pleasing of your lord’s sons. Then put him on his father’s throne and fight for your lord’s family."

verses.latin: Illi timuerunt vehementer, et dixerunt: Ecce duo reges non potuerunt stare contra eum: et nos quomodo poterimus resistere?
verses.english: But they were terrified, and they said: "Look, two kings were not able to stand against him, so how can we resist?"

verses.latin: Misi ergo qui regerent domum, et filios Achab; qui occidit omnes optimates, et universos majores natu, et nutrices eorum in Samaria.
verses.english: Therefore, Jehu had already sent people to take charge of the household and the sons of Ahab. Indeed, Jehu himself had already killed all the chief men, all the elders, and those who had been responsible for raising Ahab’s children in Samaria.

verses.latin: Misit autem epistolas secundas ad eos, dicens: Si mei estis, et obediscitis mihi, tollite capita filiorum Achab, et venite ad me cras hac hora in Jezrahel. Filii autem regis septuaginta viri erant apud optimates civitatis, qui eos nutriebant.
verses.english: But then Jehu sent a second set of letters to them, saying: "If you are with me and obey me, then take the heads of Ahab’s sons and come to me tomorrow at this time in Jezreel." (The king’s seventy sons were living with the chief men of the city, who were raising them.)

verses.latin: Cumque venissent litterae ad eos, tulerunt filios regis, et occiderunt septuaginta viros: et posuerunt capita eorum in cophinis, et miserunt ad eum in Jezrahel.
verses.english: When these letters reached them, they seized the king’s sons and killed all seventy men. Then they put their heads in baskets and sent them to Jehu in Jezreel.

verses.latin: Venit autem nuntius, et indicavit ei, dicens: Attulerunt capita filiorum regis. Qui respondit: Ponite ea duos acervos juxta introitum portae usque mane.
verses.english: A messenger came and reported to Jehu, saying: "They have brought the heads of the king’s sons." Jehu replied: "Make them into two piles at the entrance of the city gate, and leave them there until morning."

verses.latin: Cumque venisset mane, et egressus Jehu staret super gradum juxta portam, dixit ad omnem populum: Vos justi estis: ecce ego conjuravi contra dominum meum, et interfeci eum: quis jugulavit omnes hos?
verses.english: When morning came, Jehu went out and stood on the steps near the city gate. He said to all the people there: "You yourselves are innocent in this matter. Look, I conspired against my lord and killed him. But who then murdered all of these men?"

verses.latin: Videte ergo nunc quia non cecidit de sermonibus Domini in terram, quos locutus est Dominus super domum Achab, et Dominus fecit quod locutus est in manu servi sui Eliae.
verses.english: "Understand now that not one word spoken by the Lord against Ahab’s house has fallen to the ground without being fulfilled. The Lord has done what He spoke through His servant Elijah."

verses.latin: Occidit ergo Jehu omnes, qui residui fuerant de domo Achab in Jezrahel, et universos optimates ejus, et notos, et sacerdotes, donec relinqueret ex eo ne unum quidem.
verses.english: So Jehu then killed all those who remained of Ahab’s family in Jezreel—all of his chief men, his close acquaintances, and his priests—until he left not a single one alive.

verses.latin: Et surrexit, et abiit in Samariam: cumque venisset ad casam pastoris in via,
verses.english: And Jehu rose up and left, going toward Samaria. When he came to the shepherd’s house on the road,

verses.latin: invenit ibi fratres Ochoziae regis Juda, et dixit eis: Qui estis vos? Qui responderunt: Fratres Ochoziae sumus, et descendimus ad salutandos filios regis, et filios reginae.
verses.english: He found the relatives of Ahaziah, the king of Judah, there and asked them: "Who are you?" They replied: "We are Ahaziah’s relatives, and we have come down to greet the sons of the king and the sons of the queen."

verses.latin: Dixitque: Apprehendite eos vivos. Quos cum comprehendissent vivos, jugulaverunt illos juxta puteum juxta casam, quadraginta duos viros: et non reliquit ex eis quemquam.
verses.english: Jehu said: "Capture them alive!" So, when they had captured them alive, they slaughtered them—forty-two men—by the well near the house. Not a single one of them was left alive.

verses.latin: Cumque abiisset inde, invenit Jonadab filium Rechab in occursum sibi, et benedixit ei, et ait ad eum: Rectumne est cor tuum, sicut cor meum est cum corde tuo? Et ait Jonadab: Rectum est, et si est, da manum tuam. Dedit ille manum suam: et sublevavit eum in curru suo.
verses.english: When Jehu had gone from there, he met Jehonadab, the son of Rechab, who was coming to meet him. Jehu greeted him and said to him: "Is your heart as true to mine as my heart is to yours?" Jehonadab replied: "It is true, indeed! If it is, then give me your hand." So Jehu gave him his hand, and Jehu lifted him up into his chariot.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eum: Veni mecum, et vide zelum meum pro Domino. Et imposuit eum in curru suo.
verses.english: And Jehu said to him: "Come with me, and see my zeal for the Lord." So he had Jehonadab sit in his chariot with him.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset in Samariam, occidit omnes qui residui fuerant de Achab in Samaria usque ad unum juxta sermonem Domini quem locutus est ad Eliam.
verses.english: When Jehu arrived in Samaria, he killed all who remained of Ahab’s family in Samaria, until not one was left. This was according to the word of the Lord which He had spoken to Elijah.

verses.latin: Tulit autem Jehu sacerdotem Baal, et dixit eis: Voca mihi omnes servos Baal, universos sacerdotes ejus, et prophetas ejus: nullus sit qui non veniat: quia victima magna mihi est Baal. Quicumque defuerit, non vivet. Jehu vero faciebat hoc insidiose, ut disperderet cultores Baal.
verses.english: Then Jehu took a priest of Baal and said to them: "Summon all the servants of Baal for me—all of his priests and all of his prophets. No one is to be absent, for I am offering a great sacrifice to Baal. Whoever fails to come will not live." Jehu was doing this cunningly, intending to destroy the worshippers of Baal.

verses.latin: Et nuntiavit Jehu in omnem Samariam.
verses.english: And Jehu announced this throughout all Samaria.

verses.latin: Et nuntiavit Jehu in omnem Israhel: dicens: Sanctificate diem solemnem Baal. Et praedicavit, et congregati sunt universi servi Baal, et non remansit ex eis vel unus, qui non veniret.
verses.english: And Jehu announced throughout all Israel, saying: "Consecrate a solemn day for Baal!" He proclaimed it, and all the servants of Baal gathered together. Not a single one remained who did not come.

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt templum Baal, et plenum fuit templum Baal, a summo usque ad summum.
verses.english: And they entered the temple of Baal, and the temple of Baal was filled from one end to the other.

verses.latin: Et dixit his qui erant super vestes: Proferte vestimenta universis servis Baal. Et protulerunt eis vestes.
verses.english: And Jehu said to those who were in charge of the vestments: "Bring out robes for all the servants of Baal." So they brought out the robes for them.

verses.latin: Ingressusque Jehu cum Jonadab filio Rechab templum Baal, ait cultoribus Baal: Scrutamini, et videte ne quis forte sit vobiscum de servis Domini, sed ut sint servi Baal tantum.
verses.english: Then Jehu, along with Jehonadab, the son of Rechab, entered the temple of Baal. He said to the worshippers of Baal: "Search carefully and make sure that none of the Lord’s servants are among you, but only the servants of Baal."

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt ut facerent hostias et holocausta. Jehu autem praeparaverat sibi extra centum viros, dicens: Quicumque fugerit de viris quos ego tradidero in manus vestras, anima ejus erit pro anima illius.
verses.english: And they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. But Jehu had placed one hundred men outside, telling them: "Whoever allows any of the men whom I deliver into your hands to escape, his life will pay for that man’s life."

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum conpleta esset holocausti oblatio, praecepit Jehu militibus, et ducibus suis: Ingredimini, et percutite illos, nullus evadat. Percusseruntque eos in ore gladii, et projecerunt, et abierunt in civitatem templi Baal.
verses.english: And it came to pass that when the offering of the burnt offering was completed, Jehu commanded his guards and his commanders: "Go in and strike them down! Let no one escape!" So they struck them down with the edge of the sword, threw out their bodies, and then went into the inner city of the temple of Baal.

verses.latin: Et protulerunt statuam de templo Baal, et combusserunt.
verses.english: And they brought out the statue from the temple of Baal and burned it.

verses.latin: Et comminuerunt statuam Baal, et destruxerunt templum ejus in latrinas usque in praesentem diem.
verses.english: And they smashed the statue of Baal into pieces and utterly destroyed its temple, turning it into latrines, right up to the present day.

verses.latin: Delevit ergo Jehu Baal de Israhel.
verses.english: So Jehu completely eradicated Baal worship from Israel.

verses.latin: Verumtamen a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israhel, non recessit Jehu, neque a vitulis aureis qui erant in Bethel et Dan.
verses.english: Nevertheless, Jehu did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who had caused Israel to sin. He did not abandon the golden calves that were in Bethel and Dan.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Dominus ad Jehu: Quia studiose fecisti quod rectum erat, et complacuit in oculis meis, et omnia quae erant in corde meo fecisti contra domum Achab: filii tui usque ad quartam generationem sedebunt super thronum Israhel.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Jehu: "Because you have diligently done what was right and pleasing in My eyes, and have carried out everything that was in My heart against the house of Ahab, your sons will sit upon the throne of Israel for four generations."

verses.latin: Porro Jehu non custodivit, ut ambularet in lege Domini Dei Israhel in toto corde suo: non enim recessit a peccatis Jeroboam, qui peccare fecerat Israhel.
verses.english: However, Jehu did not carefully observe walking in the law of the Lord God of Israel with all his heart. For he did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, who had caused Israel to sin.

verses.latin: In diebus illis coepit Dominus taedere super Israhel: percussitque eos Hazahel in omnibus finibus Israhel,
verses.english: In those days, the Lord began to be disgusted with Israel. He allowed Hazael to strike them in all the territories of Israel,

verses.latin: a Jordane contra orientem, omnem terram Galaad, et Gad, et Ruben, et Manasse, a Aroer, quae est super torrentem Arnon, et Galaad, et Basan.
verses.english: From the Jordan River eastward, he struck all the land of Gilead, and Gad, and Reuben, and Manasseh—from Aroer, which is by the torrent of Arnon, including Gilead, and Bashan.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jehu, et universa quae fecit, et fortitudo ejus, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israhel?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Jehu, and all that he did, and his mighty deeds—are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivit igitur Jehu cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in Samaria: et regnavit Joachaz filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Jehu rested with his forefathers, and they buried him in Samaria. And his son Jehoahaz reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Dies autem quos regnavit Jehu super Israhel, viginti et octo anni sunt in Samaria.
verses.english: Now, the days that Jehu reigned over Israel were twenty-eight years in Samaria.

verses.latin: Dormivitque Jehu cum patribus suis: et sepelierunt eum in Samaria: et regnavit Joachaz filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: And Jehu rested with his forefathers, and they buried him in Samaria. And his son Jehoahaz reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Athalia vero mater Ochoziae videns quod mortuus esset filius suus, surrexit et interfecit omnem stirpem regiam.
verses.english: Athalia, the mother of Ochozias, saw that her son was dead. She then rose up and ordered the killing of all the royal offspring.

verses.latin: Iosaba autem filia regis Ioram soror Ochoziae, tollens Ioas filium Ochoziae, furata est eum de medio filiorum regis, qui interficiebantur, et dedit eum nutrici suae in cubiculum thesauro: et absconderunt eum a facie Athaliae ne occideretur.
verses.english: However, Iosaba, daughter of King Ioram and sister of Ochozias, took Ioas, the son of Ochozias. She secretly removed him from among the king’s sons who were being slaughtered. She gave him to his nurse in the treasury chamber, and they hid him from Athalia to prevent his murder.

verses.latin: Fuitque cum ea in domo Domini sex annis, abscondita, Athalia autem regnavit super terram.
verses.english: Ioas was hidden with her in the Temple of the Lord for six years. During this time, Athalia reigned over the land.

verses.latin: Anno autem septimo misit Ioiada, et assumens centuriones et milites, introduxit ad se in templum Domini, pepigitque cum eis foedus imponens eis iusiurandum in domo Domini: et ostendit eis filium regis.
verses.english: In the seventh year, Ioiada sent for the centurions and soldiers, bringing them to him in the Temple of the Lord. He made a solemn covenant with them, imposing an oath on them in the Temple of the Lord, and then revealed the king’s son to them.

verses.latin: Et praecepit eis dicens: Hoc est verbum quod facere debetis: Tertia pars vestrum intret sabbato, et custodiat excubitum domus regis.
verses.english: He commanded them, saying: “This is the instruction you must follow: A third of you are to enter on the Sabbath and guard the royal palace.”

verses.latin: Et tertia pars in porta Sur: et tertia pars in porta quae est ultra currus armigerorum: et custodietis excubitum domus, et interfectionem.
verses.english: “A third of you will stand guard at the Sur Gate. And a third of you will be at the gate beyond the armor-bearers’ chariots. You are to maintain watch over the palace and prevent any attack.”

verses.latin: Duae vero partes e vobis, omnes exeuntes sabbato, custodite excubitum domus Domini circa regem.
verses.english: “The other two parts of your company, all those whose Sabbath shift is ending, are to guard the Temple of the Lord around the king.”

verses.latin: Et circumdabitis eum habentes arma in manibus vestris: si quis autem ingressus fuerit septa, interficiatur: eritisque cum rege intrante, et egrediente.
verses.english: “You are to surround him, with your weapons in your hands. If anyone enters the Temple precincts without permission, they are to be killed. You will be with the king both when he enters and when he leaves.”

verses.latin: Feceruntque centuriones juxta omnia quae praeceperat eis Ioiada sacerdos: et assumens unusquisque viros suos qui ingrediebantur sabbato, et qui exibant sabbato, venerunt ad Ioiada sacerdotem.
verses.english: The centurions carried out all that Ioiada the priest had commanded them. Each one gathered his men—those whose Sabbath shift was beginning and those whose shift was ending—and they came to Ioiada the priest.

verses.latin: Deditque eis sacerdos arma et scuta regis David, quae erant in domo Domini.
verses.english: The priest then gave them the weapons and shields of King David, which had been stored in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et steterunt singuli habentes arma in manibus suis a parte dextra templi usque ad partem sinistram altaris, et templi, circa regem.
verses.english: Each man stood with his weapons in hand, forming a line from the right side of the Temple to the left side of the altar and the Temple itself, surrounding the king.

verses.latin: Produxitque filium regis, et posuit super eum diadema, et testimonium: feceruntque eum regem, et unxerunt: et plaudentes manu dixerunt: Vivat rex.
verses.english: Ioiada brought out the king’s son and placed the royal crown upon him, along with a copy of the Law to signify his covenant with God. They made him king and anointed him. Then, clapping their hands, they shouted: “Long live the king!”

verses.latin: Audivit autem Athalia vocem populi currentis et laudantis principem: et ingressa ad populum in templum Domini.
verses.english: Athalia, meanwhile, heard the sound of the people running and praising the new king. She went to the people in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Vidit regem stantem super tribunal juxta morem, et cantores, et tubas prope eum, et omnem populum terrae gaudentem, et clangentem tubis: et scidit vestimenta sua, et clamavit: Conjuratio, Conjuratio.
verses.english: She saw the king standing on the royal platform, as was customary, with the singers and trumpeters near him, and all the people of the land rejoicing and blowing trumpets. She tore her garments and cried out: “Conspiracy! Conspiracy!”

verses.latin: Praecepit autem Ioiada sacerdos centurionibus, et his qui erant super exercitum, et dixit eis: Educite illam extra septa templi, et qui sequetur eam interficiatur gladio. Dixerat enim sacerdos: Non interficiatur in domo Domini.
verses.english: But Ioiada the priest commanded the centurions and those in charge of the army, saying: “Lead her outside the Temple precincts. Anyone who follows her is to be killed by the sword.” The priest had given this order because he said: “She must not be killed in the Temple of the Lord.”

verses.latin: Imposueruntque ei manus: et cum venisset per viam introitus equorum juxta palatium regis, interfecerunt eam ibi.
verses.english: So they seized her, and when she reached the path of the Horse Gate, near the royal palace, they killed her there.

verses.latin: Pepigit ergo Ioiada foedus inter Dominum et regem et populum, ut esset populus Domini, et inter regem et populum.
verses.english: Ioiada then made a covenant between the Lord and the king and the people, establishing that they would be the Lord’s people. He also made a covenant between the king and the people, defining their mutual obligations.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est omnis populus terrae in templum Baal, et destruxerunt illud: et altaria ejus, et simulacra confregerunt vehementer: Mathan quoque sacerdotem Baal interfecerunt coram altaribus. Et posuit sacerdos custodes in domo Domini.
verses.english: All the people of the land went to the temple of Baal and destroyed it. They utterly shattered its altars and idols. They also killed Mathan, the priest of Baal, in front of the altars. Then the priest stationed guards in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Tulitque centuriones, et Carios, et cursores, et universum populum terrae: et adduxerunt regem de domo Domini, et ingressi sunt per viam portae Scutarum in palatium, et sedit super thronum regum.
verses.english: He then took the centurions, the Carians, the royal guards, and all the people of the land. They led the king from the Temple of the Lord and entered the palace through the Gate of the Guards. Ioas then took his seat on the royal throne.

verses.latin: Laetatusque est omnis populus terrae, et civitas conquievit: Athalia autem occisa est gladio in domo regis.
verses.english: All the people of the land rejoiced, and the city became peaceful. Athalia had been killed by the sword at the royal palace.

verses.latin: Septem annorum erat Ioas cum regnare cœpisset.
verses.english: Ioas was seven years old when he began to reign.

verses.latin: Anno septimo Iehu regnavit Ioas: et quadraginta annis regnavit in Ierusalem. Nomen matris eius Sebia de Bersabee.
verses.english: In the seventh year of Iehu’s reign, Ioas began to reign. He reigned for forty years in Ierusalem. His mother’s name was Sebia, from Bersabee.

verses.latin: Fecitque Ioas rectum coram Domino cunctis diebus quibus docuit eum Ioiada sacerdos.
verses.english: Ioas did what was right in the eyes of the Lord all the days that Ioiada the priest guided him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et adolebat in excelsis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he did not remove the high places of worship. The people still continued to sacrifice and burn incense there.

verses.latin: Dixitque Ioas ad sacerdotes: Omnem pecuniam sanctificationum, quae infertur ad templum Domini a praetereuntibus, quae offertur pro pretio animae, et quam sponte et arbitrio cordis sui inferunt homines in templum Domini,
verses.english: Ioas said to the priests: “All the consecrated money that is brought to the Temple of the Lord by passersby—including money offered as atonement for a soul or dedicated by a personal vow, and whatever money people freely and willingly bring to the Temple of the Lord—

verses.latin: accipiant singuli sacerdotes a propinquis suis, et instaurent sartatecta domus, si quid ruptum vel hians invenerint.
verses.english: let each priest receive it from his designated collectors, and with it, let them repair the deterioration of the Temple whenever they find anything broken or in disrepair.”

verses.latin: Usque ad vigesimum tertium annum regis Ioas non instauraverunt sacerdotes sartatecta templi.
verses.english: But by the twenty-third year of King Ioas, the priests still had not repaired the deterioration of the Temple.

verses.latin: Vocavitque rex Ioas Ioiadam pontificem, et sacerdotes, dicens eis: Quare sartatecta non instauratis templi? Nunc ergo nolite accipere pecuniam juxta propinquos vestros, sed date eam ad instaurationem templi.
verses.english: So King Ioas summoned Ioiada the high priest and the other priests, saying to them: “Why have you not repaired the deterioration of the Temple? From now on, you are not to receive money from your collectors, but instead, you must hand it over directly for the Temple’s restoration.”

verses.latin: Prohibitique sunt sacerdotes ultra accipere pecuniam a populo, et instaurare sartatecta domus.
verses.english: Thus, the priests were forbidden from then on to receive money from the people and from overseeing the repair of the Temple’s deterioration themselves.

verses.latin: Et tulit Ioiada pontifex thecam unam, et aperuit foramen desuper, et posuit illam juxta altare, a dextro intrantium domum Domini: mittebantque in eam sacerdotes, qui custodiebant ostia, omnem pecuniam quae afferebatur ad templum Domini.
verses.english: Ioiada the high priest took a single chest, cut a hole in its lid, and placed it beside the altar, on the right side of those entering the Temple of the Lord. The priests who guarded the doors would put all the money brought to the Temple of the Lord into it.

verses.latin: Cumque viderent plenam esse thecam, ascendebat scriba regis et pontifex, et effundebant, et numerabant pecuniam quae inveniebatur in templo Domini.
verses.english: Whenever they saw that the chest was full, the king’s scribe and the high priest would go up. They would empty it and count the money that had been collected in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dabant eam juxta numerum et mensuram in manu eorum, qui praeerant operibus, et fabris, et structoribus, et caementariis, qui instaurarent sarteacta templi.
verses.english: They would then give the money, according to its counted sum and measure, into the hands of those overseeing the work, and to the carpenters, builders, and stonemasons who were to repair the Temple’s deterioration.

verses.latin: Et his qui emebant ligna, et lapides de sectis, ut instaurarent detrimenta domus Domini, et omnia impensum, quae indigent operae instaurationis templi.
verses.english: It was also given to those who bought wood and cut stones to repair the damage to the Temple of the Lord, and for all other expenses required for the work of restoring the Temple.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non fiebant in templo Domini crateres argentei, et hydriae, et scyphi, et tubae, et omne vas aureum et argenteum, de pecunia quae inferebatur in templum Domini.
verses.english: Nevertheless, silver bowls, pitchers, cups, trumpets, or any gold and silver vessels were not made in the Temple of the Lord from the money that was brought in.

verses.latin: Sed his qui faciebant opus, dabatur, ut instaurarent ex ea sartatecta templi.
verses.english: Instead, the money was given solely to those performing the work, so that they could use it to repair the deterioration of the Temple.
