verses.latin: Rationem autem non poscebant ab his viris, quibus dabatur pecunia, ut effunderent eam operariis, et fabris: sed in fide faciebant.
verses.english: No accounting was required from the men who were given the money to distribute to the workmen and carpenters, because they acted with complete trustworthiness.

verses.latin: Pecuniam vero pro delicto, et pecuniam pro peccatis, non inferebatur in templum Domini, sed erat sacerdotum.
verses.english: However, the money from the trespass offerings and the money from the sin offerings was not put into the Temple treasury; it belonged to the priests.

verses.latin: Tunc ascendit Azahel rex Syriae, et pugnavit contra Geth, et cepit eam: direxitque faciem suam ut ascenderet in Ierusalem.
verses.english: At that time, Azahel, the king of Syria, advanced and fought against Geth, capturing it. He then turned his attention towards Ierusalem, intending to attack it.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem tulit Ioas rex Iuda omnia sanctificata, quae consecraverant Iosaphat, et Ioram, et Ochozias patres eius reges Iuda, et quae ipse obtulerat: et universum argentum, quod inveniri potuit in thesauro templi Domini, et in thesauro regis: misitque regi Syriae Azahel, et avertit ab Ierusalem.
verses.english: For this reason, Ioas, king of Iuda, took all the consecrated items that Iosaphat, Ioram, and Ochozias—his ancestors and kings of Iuda—had dedicated, along with his own offerings. He also took all the silver that could be found in the treasury of the Temple of the Lord and in the royal treasury. He sent all this to King Azahel of Syria, who then turned away from Ierusalem.

verses.latin: Reliqa autem sermonum Ioas, et universa quae fecit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Iuda?
verses.english: The rest of the acts of Ioas, and all that he did, are they not indeed written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Iuda?

verses.latin: Athalia autem mater Ochoziae, videns filium suum mortuum, surrexit, et interfecit omne semen regium.
verses.english: When Athalia, the mother of Ochozias, saw that her son was dead, she rose up and killed all the royal offspring.

verses.latin: Porro Iosaba, filia regis Ioram, soror Ochoziae, tulit Ioas filium Ochoziae, et furata est eum de medio filiorum regis, qui interficiebantur, absconditque eum et nutriceam eius in cubiculo lectulorum a facie Athaliae, et non est interfectus.
verses.english: However, Josaba—daughter of King Joram and sister of Ochozias—took Joas, the son of Ochozias, and secretly rescued him from among the other royal children who were being murdered. She hid him and his nurse in the bedroom, away from Athalia, and so he was not killed.

verses.latin: Fuit ergo cum ea in domo Domini absconditus sex annis: Athalia autem regnavit super terram.
verses.english: So Joas was hidden with her in the Lord's Temple for six years, while Athalia reigned over the land.

verses.latin: Anno autem septimo misit Ioiada, et assumens centuriones et milites, introduxit ad se in templum Domini, et pepigit cum eis foedus, et adiurans eos in domo Domini, ostendit eis filium regis.
verses.english: But in the seventh year, Joiada sent for the centurions and soldiers and brought them to him in the Lord's Temple. There he made a covenant with them, and after administering an oath in the Lord's Temple, he showed them the king's son.

verses.latin: Et praecepit eis, dicens: Hoc est verbum quod facietis: tertia pars vestrum intret sabbato, et custodiat excubitum domus regis.
verses.english: And he commanded them, saying, 'This is what you shall do: a third of you will come on the Sabbath and guard the king's palace.'

verses.latin: Et tertia pars sit ad portam Sur: et tertia pars ad portam quae est intra, iuxta cursum scutarum: et custodietis excubitum domus Templi vicissim.
verses.english: Another third will guard the Sur Gate. And the final third will guard the inner gate, where the shield-bearers usually run their course. You will take turns guarding the Temple complex.

verses.latin: Duae vero partes e vobis, omnes egredientes sabbato, custodiant excubitum domus Domini circa regem.
verses.english: And two other groups of you, all who typically go off duty on the Sabbath, are to guard the Lord's Temple around the king.

verses.latin: Et circumdate regem habentes arma singuli in manibus suis: et qui ingredietur saepta, interficiatur: eritisque cum rege introeunte et exeunte.
verses.english: Surround the king, with each man having his weapons in hand. Anyone who tries to break through your ranks is to be killed. You are to stay with the king both when he enters and when he exits.

verses.latin: Fecerunt ergo centuriones iuxta omnia quae praeceperat eis Ioiada pontifex: et assumens unumquemque viros suos, qui ingrediebantur sabbato, et qui exibant sabbato, venerunt ad Ioiada pontificem.
verses.english: So the centurions did everything that Joiada the high priest had commanded them. Each centurion gathered his men, both those whose shift was beginning on the Sabbath and those whose shift was ending, and they came to Joiada the high priest.

verses.latin: Deditque eis pontifex lanceas et arma regis David, quae erant in domo Domini.
verses.english: Then the high priest gave them the spears and the weapons of King David that were stored in the Lord's Temple.

verses.latin: Steteruntque singuli habentes arma in manibus suis, a parte templi dextra, usque ad partem sinistram altaris et templi, circa regem.
verses.english: Then each man, with weapons in hand, took his position around the king, from the right side of the Temple all the way to the left side, encompassing both the altar and the Temple itself.

verses.latin: Produxitque filium regis, et posuit super eum diadema, et testimonium: feceruntque eum regem, et unxerunt: et plaudentes manu, dixerunt: Vivat rex.
verses.english: Then Joiada brought out the king's son and placed the royal crown upon him, along with the Testimony (the law of the covenant). They proclaimed him king and anointed him. Then, clapping their hands, they all shouted, 'Long live the King!'

verses.latin: Audivit autem Athalia vocem populi currentis, et ingressa ad populum in templum Domini.
verses.english: When Athalia heard the shouts of the people running about, she came to the people in the Lord's Temple.

verses.latin: Viditque regem stantem super tribunal iuxta morem, et cantores, et tubas iuxta regem: et omnem populum terrae laetantem, et clangentem tubis: et scidit vestimenta sua, et clamavit: Conjuratio, Conjuratio.
verses.english: She saw the new king standing on the platform according to custom, with the singers and trumpeters beside him. All the people of the land were rejoicing and blowing trumpets. So she tore her clothes and cried out, 'Treason! Treason!'

verses.latin: Praecepit autem Ioiada centurionibus qui erant super exercitum, et dixit eis: Educite illam extra saepta templi, et quicumque eam secutus fuerit, interficiatur gladio. Dixerat enim sacerdos: Non occidatur in templo Domini.
verses.english: Joiada then commanded the centurions who were in charge of the army, saying, 'Bring her out beyond the Temple precincts, and anyone who follows her is to be killed with the sword.' For the high priest had declared, 'Let her not be killed in the Lord's Temple.'

verses.latin: Et iniunxerunt ei manus, et duxerunt eam per viam introitus equorum iuxta palatium, et interfecta est ibi.
verses.english: So they seized her and led her out through the entrance for horses, next to the palace, and there she was put to death.

verses.latin: Pepigit ergo Ioiada foedus inter Dominum et regem et populum, ut esset populus Domini, et inter regem et populum.
verses.english: Then Joiada made a covenant between the Lord, the king, and the people, establishing them as the Lord's own people. He also made a covenant between the king and the people.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est omnis populus terrae templum Baal, et destruxerunt illud, et altaria eius, et imagines contriverunt vehementer: Mathan quoque sacerdotem Baal interfecerunt coram altaribus.
verses.english: Then all the people of the land went to the temple of Baal and utterly demolished it. They smashed its altars and images into tiny pieces. They also killed Mathan, the priest of Baal, right in front of the altars.

verses.latin: Constituitque Ioiada praepositos super templum Domini, et sub manibus sacerdotum, et levitarum, per singulos ordinem suum, ad ministerium domus Domini, holocausti et pacifica, iuxta praeceptum David, sicut scriptum est in libro Moysi: et in gaudio, et in cantu.
verses.english: Joiada then appointed officers over the Lord's Temple, placing them under the authority of the priests and Levites, each performing his service in his assigned role within the Lord's house. This was to oversee the burnt offerings and peace offerings, according to the commandment of David, as it is written in the Book of Moses, and to perform these duties with joy and singing.

verses.latin: Et assumptis centurionibus, et fortibus, et principibus populi, et omni populo terrae, deduxit regem de templo Domini, et ingressi sunt per viam portae equitum in palatium, et sedit super thronum regium.
verses.english: Then Joiada, accompanied by the centurions, the mighty men, the leaders of the people, and all the common people of the land, led the new king from the Lord's Temple. They entered the palace through the Horse Gate, and the king took his seat upon the royal throne.

verses.latin: Laetatusque est omnis populus terrae, et civitas conquievit: Athalia autem occisa est gladio in domo regis.
verses.english: All the people of the land rejoiced, and the city finally found peace. Athalia had been killed by the sword at the king's palace.

verses.latin: Athalia vero mater Ochoziae videns quod mortuus esset filius suus, surrexit, et interfecit omne semen regium.
verses.english: Athaliah, who was the mother of Ahaziah, saw that her son was dead. So she rose up and killed all the royal offspring.

verses.latin: Porro Josaba filia regis Joram soror Ochoziae, tollens Joas filium Ochoziae furata est eum de medio filiorum regis, qui interficiebantur, et dedit eum nutriculae suae in cubiculum absconditum a facie Athaliae, ut non interficeretur.
verses.english: But Jehosheba, who was King Jehoram's daughter and Ahaziah's sister, took Ahaziah's son, Joash. She secretly took him from among the king's children who were being killed. She gave him to his nurse in a hidden bedroom, so that he would not be killed by Athaliah.

verses.latin: Fuitque cum ea in domo Domini sex annis celatus, et Athalia regnavit super terram.
verses.english: He remained hidden with her in the house of the Lord for six years. During this time, Athaliah reigned over the land as queen.

verses.latin: Anno autem septimo misit Joïada, et assumens centuriones et milites, introduxit ad se in templum Domini: pepigitque cum eis foedus, et adjurans eos in domo Domini ostendit eis filium regis.
verses.english: In the seventh year, Jehoiada sent for the centurions and the soldiers. He brought them to him in the Temple of the Lord. He made a covenant with them there and swore them to an oath in the Temple of the Lord. Then he showed them the king's son, Joash.

verses.latin: Præcepitque eis, dicens: Hoc est verbum quod facietis: tertia pars vestrum ingredietur sabbato, et custodiet excubitum domus regis.
verses.english: He commanded them, saying, "This is what you are to do: One-third of you, those who are entering on duty for the Sabbath, shall guard the royal palace."

verses.latin: Et tertia pars est ad portam Sur: et tertia pars ad portam, quæ est post ædificium scutariorum: et custodietis excubitum domus ædificii.
verses.english: "Another third of you shall be at the Sur Gate. And the final third shall be at the gate behind the guardhouse. You will all keep watch over the palace building."

verses.latin: Duæ vero partes e vestris, omnes egredientes sabbato, custodiant excubitum domus Domini circa regem.
verses.english: "The other two divisions of you, all who are going off duty on the Sabbath, shall guard the Temple of the Lord around the king."

verses.latin: Et circumdabitis regem habentes arma singuli in manibus suis: si quis autem ingressus fuerit septa, interficietur: eritisque cum rege introëunte et egrediente.
verses.english: "You shall surround the king, with each man having his weapons in his hands. If anyone tries to enter the inner courts, he shall be killed. You are to remain with the king as he enters and leaves."

verses.latin: Feceruntque centuriones juxta omnia quæ præceperat eis Joïada sacerdos: et assumentes singuli viros suos, qui ingrediebantur sabbato, cum his qui egressi fuerant de sabbato, venerunt ad Joïadam sacerdotem.
verses.english: So the centurions did everything that Jehoiada the priest had commanded them. Each one took his men, those who were entering duty on the Sabbath, along with those who were going off duty from the Sabbath, and they came to Jehoiada the priest.

verses.latin: Deditque eis sacerdos lanceas, et arma regis David, quæ erant in domo Domini.
verses.english: The priest then gave them spears and the weapons of King David, which were kept in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et steterunt viri habentes singuli arma in manibus suis a parte templi dextra, usque ad partem templi sinistram, per altare, et templum, et circa regem.
verses.english: The men stood, each with his weapons in his hands. They formed a line from the right side of the Temple to the left side, by the altar, the Temple itself, and all around the king.

verses.latin: Produxitque filium regis, et posuit super eum diadema, et testimonium: feceruntque eum regem, et unxerunt: et plaudentes manu dixerunt: Vivat rex.
verses.english: Then Jehoiada brought out the king's son. He placed the royal crown on him and presented him with the testimony, which was the covenant scroll. They made him king and anointed him with oil. They clapped their hands and shouted, "Long live the king!"

verses.latin: Audiens autem Athalia vocem populi currentis, et laudantis regem, ingressa est ad populum in templum Domini.
verses.english: When Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and praising the king, she entered the Temple of the Lord where the people were.

verses.latin: Viditque regem stantem super tribunal juxta morem, et cantores, et tubas prope eum, et omnem populum terræ lætantem, et clangentem tubis: et scidit vestimenta sua, et clamavit: Conjuratio, conjuratio.
verses.english: She saw the king standing by the pillar, as was the custom, with the singers and trumpeters near him. All the people of the land were rejoicing and blowing trumpets. So she tore her clothes and cried out, "Treason! Treason!"

verses.latin: Præcepitque Joïada centurionibus, qui erant super exercitum, et ait eis: Educite illam extra septa templi, et quicumque eam secutus fuerit, interficiatur gladio. Dixerat enim sacerdos: Non interficiatur in domo Domini.
verses.english: Jehoiada commanded the centurions who were in charge of the army. He told them, "Bring her out beyond the Temple courts. And whoever follows her, let him be killed by the sword." For the priest had said, "She must not be killed in the Temple of the Lord."

verses.latin: Et immiserunt ei manus: et egressa est per viam introitus equorum juxta palatium, interfectaque est ibi.
verses.english: So they seized her. She went out through the Horse Gate, which was near the royal palace, and she was killed there.

verses.latin: Pepigit ergo Joïada fœdus inter Dominum, et inter regem, et inter populum, ut esset populus Domini: et inter regem, et populum.
verses.english: Then Jehoiada made a covenant between the Lord, the king, and the people, so that they would be the Lord's people. He also established a covenant between the king and the people.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est omnis populus terræ in templum Baal, et destruxerunt illud: et altaria ejus, et simulacra confregerunt vehementer: Mathan quoque sacerdotem Baal interfecerunt coram altari. Et posuit sacerdos custodias in domo Domini.
verses.english: All the people of the land went to the temple of Baal and destroyed it. They smashed its altars and its idols into pieces, completely destroying them. They also killed Mattan, the priest of Baal, in front of his altar. Then the priest Jehoiada appointed guards over the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Tulitque centuriones, et Carios, et scutarios, et universum populum terræ, et deduxerunt regem de domo Domini: et introierunt per viam portæ scutariorum in palatium: et sedit super thronum regum.
verses.english: Jehoiada took the centurions, the Carites (a foreign mercenary guard), the royal guards, and all the people of the land. They brought the king down from the Temple of the Lord. They entered the palace by way of the royal guard's gate, and he sat on the throne of the kings.

verses.latin: Lætatusque est omnis populus terræ, et civitas conquievit: Athalia autem occisa est gladio in domo regis.
verses.english: All the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet and at peace. Athaliah, however, had been killed by the sword in the royal palace.

verses.latin: Septem annorum erat Joas cum regnare cœpisset.
verses.english: Joash was seven years old when he began to reign.

verses.latin: Anno septimo Jehu regnavit Joas, et quadraginta annis regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Sebia de Bersabee.
verses.english: In the seventh year of Jehu's reign, Joash became king. He reigned for forty years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Zibiah, from Beersheba.

verses.latin: Fecitque Joas rectum coram Domino cunctis diebus quibus docuit eum Joïada sacerdos.
verses.english: Joash did what was right in the sight of the Lord all the days that Jehoiada the priest instructed him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat, et adolebat incensum in excelsis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he did not remove the high places—these were the local places of worship outside Jerusalem. The people still sacrificed and burned incense on these high places.

verses.latin: Dixitque Joas ad sacerdotes: Omnem pecuniam sanctificationum, quæ illata est in templum Domini a prætereuntibus, quæ offertur pro pretio animæ, et quam sponte et arbitrio cordis sui inferunt in templum Domini.
verses.english: Joash said to the priests, "All the money that is brought into the Temple of the Lord for sacred purposes by those who pass through—the money paid for a person's life, and any money that people freely and willingly bring to the Temple of the Lord—"

verses.latin: Accipiant sacerdotes juxta ordinem suum, et instaurent sartatecta domus, si quid ruptum vel hians invenerint.
verses.english: "Let the priests receive it, each from his own district, and let them repair the damages of the Temple building wherever they find a breach or a gap."

verses.latin: Usque ad vicesimum tertium annum regis Joas non instauraverunt sacerdotes sartatecta templi.
verses.english: However, by the twenty-third year of King Joash's reign, the priests had still not repaired the damages of the Temple.

verses.latin: Vocavitque rex Joas Joïadam pontificem et sacerdotes, dicens eis: Quare non sarcitis rupturas templi? Nunc igitur nolite accipere pecuniam, sed ad instaurationem reddite.
verses.english: So King Joash called for Jehoiada the chief priest and the other priests. He asked them, "Why are you not repairing the damages of the Temple? From now on, you shall not receive money from the people for yourselves. Instead, you must hand it over directly for the Temple repairs."

verses.latin: Prohibitique sunt sacerdotes ultra accipere pecuniam a populo, et instaurare rupturas domus.
verses.english: The priests were then forbidden to receive money from the people for their own use and were tasked only with repairing the breaches of the Temple.

verses.latin: Et tulit Joïada pontifex arcam unam, aperuitque foramen desuper, et posuit illam juxta altare ad dexteram ingredientium domum Domini: mittebantque in eam sacerdotes, qui custodiebant ostia, omnem pecuniam, quæ deferebatur ad templum Domini.
verses.english: Jehoiada the chief priest took one chest and bored a hole in its lid. He placed it beside the altar, on the right side as one entered the Temple of the Lord. The priests who guarded the entrance would put into it all the money that was brought to the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Cumque viderent nimiam pecuniam esse in arca, ascendebat scriba regis et pontifex, et effundebant, et numerabant pecuniam quæ inveniebatur in domo Domini.
verses.english: When they saw that there was a large amount of money in the chest, the king's secretary and the chief priest would go up. They would empty it and count the money that was found in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dabant juxta numerum in manu eorum qui præerant fabris murariis, et structoribus, et cæmentariis, qui instaurabant domum Domini.
verses.english: They would then give the counted money to the supervisors of the masons, the builders, and the stonecutters, who were restoring the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et his qui cædebant saxa, et latomis, et ut emerent ligna et lapides de sectis, ut instaurarentur rupturæ domus Domini in universum, quæ expendebantur ad instaurandum templum.
verses.english: They gave it to those who cut stones and to the quarrymen. It was also used to buy wood and cut stones, so that the entire Temple of the Lord could be restored wherever there were damages. This money was spent specifically for the restoration of the Temple.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non fiebant in templo Domini crateres argentei, et hydriæ, et phialæ, et tubæ, et omne vas aureum et argenteum, de pecunia quæ inferebatur in templum Domini.
verses.english: However, no silver basins, snuffers, bowls, trumpets, or any other vessels of gold or silver were made for the Temple of the Lord from the money brought into the Temple.

verses.latin: Sed his dabatur, qui faciebant opus, ut instaurarent ex ea templum Domini.
verses.english: Instead, that money was given to those who performed the work, so that they could use it to restore the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et non fiebat ratio his hominibus, qui accipiebant pecuniam ut distribuerent fabris et his, qui operabantur: sed in fide habebantur.
verses.english: No accounting was required from the men who received the money to distribute to the workmen and the laborers, because they were considered trustworthy.

verses.latin: Pecunia vero pro delicto, et pecunia pro peccatis non inferebatur in templum Domini, quia sacerdotum erat.
verses.english: The money from trespass offerings and sin offerings was not brought into the Temple of the Lord, because that money belonged to the priests.

verses.latin: Tunc ascendit Hazaël rex Syriæ, et pugnabat adversum Geth, et cepit eam: direxitque faciem suam ut ascenderet in Jerusalem.
verses.english: At that time, Hazael, the king of Syria, came up and fought against Gath and captured it. Then he set his sights on marching against Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem tulit Joas rex Juda omnia sanctificata, quæ consecraverant Josaphat, et Joram, et Ochozias patres ejus reges Juda, et quæ ipse obtulerat: et universum argentum, quod inveniri potuit in thesauris templi Domini, et in thesauros regis: misitque regi Syriæ Hazaël, et avertit ab Jerusalem.
verses.english: Because of this threat, King Joash of Judah took all the sacred gifts that his fathers—Jehoshaphat, Jehoram, and Ahaziah, the kings of Judah—had consecrated. He also took his own consecrated gifts, and all the silver that could be found in the treasuries of the Temple of the Lord and in the royal palace treasury. He sent all these to King Hazael of Syria. In exchange for these treasures, Hazael turned his army away from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now, as for the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Athalia vero mater Ochoziae videns quod mortuus esset filius suus, surrexit et interfecit omne semen regium.
verses.english: Athalia, the mother of Ahaziah, heard that her son was dead. She then rose up and ordered the killing of all who were of the royal lineage, to eliminate all potential heirs to the throne.

verses.latin: Porro Josaba filia regis Joram, soror Ochoziae, tollens Joas filium Ochoziae, furata est eum de medio filiorum regis, qui interficiebantur, et dedit eum nutrici suae in cubiculum absconditum a facie Athaliae, et non est interfectus.
verses.english: But Jehosheba, the daughter of King Joram and sister of Ahaziah, rescued Ahaziah's son, Joash, by secretly taking him from among the other royal children who were being murdered. She gave him to his nurse in a hidden room away from Athalia, and so he was not killed.

verses.latin: Eratque cum ea in domo Domini clam sex annis, Athalia regnante super terram.
verses.english: Joash remained hidden with her in the house of the Lord, the Temple, for six years, all while Athalia was ruling over the land.

verses.latin: Anno autem septimo misit Joïada et assumens centuriones et milites adduxit ad se in templum Domini, et pepigit cum eis foedus, et adjurans eos in domo Domini ostendit eis filium regis.
verses.english: Then, in the seventh year of Athalia's reign, Jehoiada the high priest sent for the captains of hundreds and the soldiers. He brought them to himself in the Temple of the Lord, made a solemn covenant with them, and after making them swear an oath in the Temple, he showed them the king’s son, Joash.

verses.latin: Præcepitque eis, dicens: Hoc est verbum quod facere debetis: tertia pars vestrum intret sabbato, et custodiat excubitum domus regis.
verses.english: Jehoiada then commanded them, saying: “These are your instructions: a third of your men, those who are coming on duty for the Sabbath, shall go into the palace and guard the king’s residence.

verses.latin: Et tertia pars sit ad portam Sur, et tertia pars ad portam, quæ est post habitaculum scutariorum: et custodietis excubitum domus, ut non expugnetur.
verses.english: Another third of you will stand guard at the Sur Gate, and the final third will be at the gate behind the guards' barracks. You must keep watch over the Temple to ensure it is not breached.”

verses.latin: Duæ vero partes ex vobis, omnes egredientes sabbato, custodiant excubitum domus Domini circa regem.
verses.english: “As for the other two parts of your men, all who are going off duty on the Sabbath, they shall guard the Lord's Temple and surround the king.

verses.latin: Et circumdabitis regem habentes arma in manibus vestris: si quis autem ingressus fuerit septa, interficiatur: eritisque cum rege introëunte et exeunte.
verses.english: You shall form a protective circle around the king, with your weapons ready in your hands. If anyone attempts to enter your lines, they are to be killed. You are to remain with the king, protecting him whenever he enters or leaves.”

verses.latin: Feceruntque centuriones juxta omnia quæ præceperat eis Joïada sacerdos: et assumpto unoquoque viro de sociis suis, qui intraverant sabbato, et ex his qui egrediebantur sabbato, venerunt ad Joïadam sacerdotem.
verses.english: The captains of hundreds carried out all the orders given to them by Jehoiada the priest. Each officer took command of his incoming men, those who were starting their Sabbath duty, and his outgoing men, those who were finishing their Sabbath duty, and they all assembled before Jehoiada the priest.

verses.latin: Deditque eis sacerdos Joïada hastas, et arma regis David, quæ erant in domo Domini.
verses.english: Then Jehoiada the priest equipped them, giving them spears and the weapons of King David that had been kept in the Lord's Temple treasury.

verses.latin: Et steterunt singuli habentes arma in manibus suis, a parte templi dextra usque ad partem sinistram altaris et templi, circa regem.
verses.english: Each man took his position with weapons in hand, forming a perimeter from the right side of the Temple all the way to the left side of the altar and the main Temple building, surrounding the king.

verses.latin: Produxitque filium regis, et posuit super eum diadema et testimonium: feceruntque eum regem, et unxerunt: et plaudentes manu, dixerunt: Vivat rex.
verses.english: Then Jehoiada brought out the king's son, Joash, and placed the royal crown upon him. He also presented him with a copy of God’s Law, symbolizing his covenant with God and his duty to rule justly. They then proclaimed him king and anointed him with oil. The people clapped their hands and shouted, “Long live the king!”

verses.latin: Audivit autem Athalia vocem populi currentis et laudantis regem: et ingressa ad populum in templum Domini,
verses.english: Athalia heard the noise of the people running and praising the new king. She went to where the people were, entering into the Lord's Temple.

verses.latin: vidit regem stantem super tribunal juxta morem, et cantores, et tubas prope eum, et omnem populum terræ lætantem, et clangentem tubis: et scidit vestimenta sua, et clamavit: Conjuratio, conjuratio.
verses.english: There she saw the young king standing on the royal platform, as was the custom. The Temple singers were there, with trumpeters nearby, and all the people of the land were rejoicing and sounding their trumpets. Athalia tore her royal robes in distress and cried out, “Conspiracy! Treason!”

verses.latin: Præcepitque Joïada sacerdos centurionibus, qui erant super exercitum: Educite illam extra septa templi, et quicumque eam fuerit secutus, interficiatur gladio. Dixerat enim sacerdos: Non interficiatur in domo Domini.
verses.english: Jehoiada the priest then gave orders to the captains of the army: “Lead her out from the Temple grounds, and anyone who follows her is to be killed by the sword.” The priest had given this instruction because he did not want her to be put to death in the sacred house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et immiserunt ei manus, et ejecerunt eam per viam introitus equorum juxta palatium, et interfecta est ibi.
verses.english: So they seized her and led her out through the Horse Gate, which led to the royal palace, and there she was executed.

verses.latin: Pepigit ergo Joïada fœdus inter Dominum, et inter regem, et inter populum, ut esset populus Domini.
verses.english: So Jehoiada formally established a covenant between the Lord, the new king, and the people, confirming that the nation would again wholeheartedly belong to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est omnis populus terræ in templum Baal, et destruxerunt illud, et altaria ejus, et imagines contriverunt vehementer: Mathan quoque sacerdotem Baal interfecerunt coram altaribus. Et posuit sacerdos custodias in domo Domini.
verses.english: Then all the people of the land went to the temple of Baal and utterly destroyed it, along with its altars and idols, which they thoroughly smashed. They also killed Mattan, the priest of Baal, right in front of his altars. Jehoiada the priest then placed guards over the Lord's Temple.

verses.latin: Tulitque centuriones, et Caritas, et pedites, et omnem populum terræ, et adduxerunt regem de domo Domini, et ingressi sunt per viam portæ scutariorum in palatium, et sedit super thronum regum.
verses.english: Jehoiada then led the captains, the Carite guards, the royal footmen, and all the people of the land, bringing the king from the Temple of the Lord. They entered the palace through the main guard gate, and Joash then sat upon the royal throne, taking his rightful place as king.

verses.latin: Lætatusque est omnis populus terræ, et civitas conquievit: Athalia autem interfecta est gladio in domo regis.
verses.english: All the people of the land rejoiced, and the city finally found peace and quiet. Athalia had been put to death by the sword near the king's palace, ending her reign of terror.

verses.latin: Septem annorum erat Joas cum regnare cœpisset.
verses.english: Joash was seven years old when he began his reign as king.

verses.latin: Anno septimo Jehu, regnavit Joas: et quadraginta annis regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Sebia de Bersabee.
verses.english: In the seventh year of Jehu's reign, Joas began to reign as king. He reigned for forty years in Jerusalem, the capital city. His mother's name was Sebia, and she was from the city of Bersabee.

verses.latin: Fecitque Joas rectum coram Domino cunctis diebus quibus docuit eum Jojada sacerdos.
verses.english: And Joas did what was right in the sight of the Lord during all the days that Jojada the high priest instructed and guided him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et adolebat in excelsis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, King Joas did not tear down the high places of worship outside of Jerusalem, so the people continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense in these unauthorized shrines.

verses.latin: Dixitque Joas ad sacerdotes: Omnem pecuniam sanctorum, quae infertur ad templum Domini, a peregrino, vel a ponente pretium animae suae, et quam sponte et arbitrio cordis sui inferunt in templum Domini,
verses.english: King Joas then said to the priests: "Collect all the money from the holy offerings that is brought into the Lord's Temple. This includes money from visitors, from those who pay the redemption tax for their lives, and whatever people willingly and freely bring to the Lord's Temple from their hearts."

verses.latin: accipiant sacerdotes per ordinem suum, et instaurent sartatecta domus, si quid reparandum esse viderint.
verses.english: "The priests are to receive this money, each from his own assigned collection point. Then they are to use it to repair any damage they find in the Temple structure, wherever they see a need for restoration."

verses.latin: Usque ad vigesimum tertium annum regis Joas, non instauraverunt sacerdotes sartatecta templi.
verses.english: However, up to the twenty-third year of King Joas's reign, the priests still had not completed the repairs on the Temple structure.

verses.latin: Vocavitque rex Joas Jojadam pontificem et sacerdotes, dicens eis: Quare sartatecta templi non instauratis? Nolite ergo accipere ultra pecuniam, sed reddite eam ad instaurationem templi.
verses.english: So King Joas called for Jojada the high priest and the other priests and demanded of them: "Why have you not repaired the damages of the Temple? From now on, you are not to keep this money for yourselves. Instead, you must give it directly for the repairs of the Temple."

verses.latin: Prohibitique sunt sacerdotes ne acciperent ultra pecuniam a populo, et ne instaurarent sartatecta domus.
verses.english: Therefore, the priests were forbidden from accepting money from the people for their own use, and they were also no longer solely responsible for directing the repairs of the Temple.

verses.latin: Et tulit Jojada pontifex thecam unam, ac foramen unum in operculo ejus aperuit: posuitque juxta altare, a dextro intrantium templum Domini, et mittebant illic sacerdotes qui custodiebant ostia, omnem pecuniam quae afferebatur ad templum Domini.
verses.english: Then Jojada the high priest took a single chest and drilled a hole in its lid. He placed it beside the altar, to the right of those entering the Lord's Temple. And the priests who guarded the entrance deposited all the money that was brought to the Lord's Temple directly into this chest.

verses.latin: Cumque viderent nimiam pecuniam esse in theca, ascendebat scriba regis et pontifex, et effundebant ac numerabant pecuniam quae inveniebatur in templo Domini:
verses.english: Whenever the Temple officials saw that a large amount of money had accumulated in the chest, the king's secretary and the high priest would go up. They would empty the chest and count the money that had been collected for the Lord's Temple.

verses.latin: et dabant ipsam ad manus eorum qui praeerant operi, et fabris, et caementariis quos conductos habebant, instaurantes templum.
verses.english: They then gave the counted money directly into the hands of those who supervised the work, and to the carpenters and the masons they had hired, who were responsible for repairing the Temple.

verses.latin: Et tignariis, ac structoribus, in emendis lapidibus et lignis, et de ceteris quæ ad sartatecta templi instauranda pertinebant.
verses.english: They also paid the timber merchants and stonecutters for purchasing stone and timber, and for all other expenses related to restoring the damages of the Temple.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non fiebant in templo Domini craters argentei, nec tridentes, et phialæ, neque tubæ, nec omne vas aureum et argenteum, de pecunia quæ inferebatur in templum Domini,
verses.english: Nevertheless, out of the money brought into the Lord's Temple, no silver basins, tongs, bowls, trumpets, or any other vessels of gold or silver were made for use in the Temple rituals.

verses.latin: sed his dabatur qui faciebant opus, ut instaurarent ex ea sartatecta templi.
verses.english: Instead, the money was given only to those who were doing the work, so that they could use it to repair the damages of the Temple.

verses.latin: Rationem quoque non quærebant a viris qui accipiebant pecuniam ut illam darent operariis: sed in fide faciebant.
verses.english: They did not require an accounting from the men who received the money to pay the workers, because they entrusted it to them in good faith.

verses.latin: Pecunia vero pro peccato, et pecunia pro delictis, non inferebatur in templum Domini: sed sacerdotum erat.
verses.english: However, the money from sin offerings and guilt offerings was not brought into the Lord's Temple chest, because that money belonged to the priests for their sustenance.

verses.latin: Tunc ascendit Hazael rex Syriæ, et pugnabat adversum Geth, et cepit eam: direxitque faciem suam ut ascenderet in Jerusalem.
verses.english: At that time, Hazael, the king of Syria, marched up and fought against the city of Geth and captured it. Then he set his sights on marching up against Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem tulit Joas rex Juda omnia sanctificata, quæ consecraverant Josaphat, et Joram, et Ochozias patres ejus reges Juda, et quæ ipse obtulerat: et universum aurum quod inveniri potuit in thesauris templi Domini, et in palatio regis: misitque Hazaeli regi Syriæ, et avertit ab Jerusalem.
verses.english: Because of this threat, Joas, the king of Judah, took all the sacred gifts that his fathers, the kings of Judah—Josaphat, Joram, and Ochozias—had dedicated to the Lord, along with his own offerings, and all the gold that could be found in the treasuries of the Lord's Temple and in the king's palace. He sent all of this as a tribute to Hazael, the king of Syria, and Hazael then turned away from attacking Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Are not the rest of the deeds of Joas, and all that he accomplished, recorded in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Surrexerunt autem servi ejus, et conjuraverunt inter se, percusseruntque Joas in domo Mello, quæ descendit in Sella.
verses.english: However, his own servants rose up and conspired against him. They struck down Joas in the house of Mello, which is on the road that goes down to Sella.

verses.latin: Josachar namque filius Semaath, et Jozabad filius Somer servi ejus percusserunt eum, et mortuus est: et sepelierunt eum cum patribus suis in civitate David. Regnavitque Amasias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Josachar, the son of Semaath, and Jozabad, the son of Somer, his own servants, struck him down, and he died. They buried him with his ancestors in the City of David. His son Amasias then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno septimo Iehu, regnavit Ioas, et quadraginta annis regnavit in Ierusalem. Nomen matris eius Sebia de Bersabee.
verses.english: In the seventh year of Jehu's reign, Joash became king. He reigned for forty years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Zibiah, from Beersheba.

verses.latin: Fecitque Ioas rectum coram Domino cunctis diebus quibus docuit eum Ioiada sacerdos.
verses.english: Joash did what was right in the sight of the Lord throughout all the days that Jehoiada the priest instructed him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit, adhuc populus immolabat et adurebat in excelsis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he did not remove the high places. The people continued to sacrifice and burn incense there.

verses.latin: Dixitque Ioas ad sacerdotes: Omnem pecuniam sanctificationum, quae infertur ad templum Domini a praetereuntibus, quae datur ex voto, et quam sponte offert quispiam, et infertur in templum Domini:
verses.english: Joash said to the priests: "All the money that is brought into the temple of the Lord from those who pass through—money consecrated to God, that is given as a vow, or that anyone willingly offers—and brought into the temple of the Lord:"

verses.latin: accipiant illam sacerdotes iuxta ordinem suum, et instaurent sartatecta templi, ubi a quocumque loco scierint quicquam esse ruptum.
verses.english: "Let the priests receive it according to their assigned duty, and let them repair the damages of the temple, wherever they find anything broken."

verses.latin: Usque ad vigesimum tertium annum regis Ioas, non instauraverunt sacerdotes sartatecta templi.
verses.english: But up until the twenty-third year of King Joash, the priests had not repaired the damages of the temple.

verses.latin: Vocavitque rex Ioas Ioiada pontificem et sacerdotes, dicens eis: Quare sartatecta non instaurastis templi? Nolite ergo accipere ultra pecuniam iuxta ordinem vestrum, sed date eam pro sartatectis templi.
verses.english: So King Joash called Jehoiada the high priest and the other priests, saying to them: "Why have you not repaired the damages of the temple? Therefore, do not receive any more money according to your assigned duty, but give it for the repair of the temple."

verses.latin: Prohibitique sunt sacerdotes ultra accipere pecuniam a populo, et instaurare sartatecta templi.
verses.english: And the priests were forbidden from receiving any more money from the people or repairing the damages of the temple themselves.

verses.latin: Et tulit Ioiada pontifex arcam unam, ac foramen unum in operculo eius aperuit, posuitque iuxta altare a dextris ingredientium domus Domini, et mittebant illuc sacerdotes, qui custodiebant ostia, omnem pecuniam quae deferebatur ad templum Domini.
verses.english: Then Jehoiada the high priest took a single chest and drilled a hole in its lid. He placed it beside the altar, on the right side of those entering the House of the Lord. And the priests who guarded the entrances deposited all the money that was brought to the temple of the Lord into it.

verses.latin: Cumque viderent nimiam pecuniam esse in arca, ascendebat scriba regis et pontifex, effundebantque et numerabant pecuniam quae inveniebatur in templo Domini:
verses.english: Whenever they saw that there was a large amount of money in the chest, the king's secretary and the high priest would go up to it, empty it out, and count the money that was found in the temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: et dabant iuxta numerum atque mensuram in manu eorum qui praeerant fabris domus Domini: ipsi autem expendebant eam in caementariis et in structoribus, qui operabantur in templo Domini,
verses.english: Then they would give it, carefully counted and measured, into the hands of those who supervised the builders of the House of the Lord. These supervisors, in turn, spent it on the masons and the carpenters who worked on the temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: et in his qui instaurabant rimulas, et in coemptione lapidum et lignorum, ut instauraretur sartatectum templi Domini in universum, quaecumque indigebant reparatione.
verses.english: They also spent it on those who repaired the cracks, and on purchasing stones and timbers to fully restore the damages of the temple of the Lord, whatever needed repair.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non fiebant ex eadem pecunia hydriae argenteae, et matulae, et phialae, et tubae, et omne vas aureum et argenteum de pecunia quae inferebatur in templum Domini:
verses.english: However, no silver basins, snuffers, bowls, trumpets, or any gold or silver vessels were made from that particular money that was brought into the temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: sed iis dabatur, qui faciebant opus, ut instaurarent ex ea sartatecta templi Domini.
verses.english: Instead, that money was given to those who performed the work, so that they could repair the damages of the temple of the Lord with it.

verses.latin: Et non fiebat ratio his viris, qui accipiebant pecuniam, ut distribuerent eam fabris, sed in fide faciebant.
verses.english: And no accounting was required from the men who received the money to distribute it to the builders, because they acted with integrity.

verses.latin: Pecuniam vero pro delicto et pro peccato, non inferebatur in templum Domini, sed erat sacerdotum.
verses.english: However, money from trespass offerings and sin offerings was not brought into the temple of the Lord, but belonged to the priests.

verses.latin: Tunc ascendit Azael rex Syriae, et pugnabat contra Geth, et cepit eam: direxitque faciem suam ut ascenderet in Ierusalem.
verses.english: At that time, Hazael, the king of Syria, came up and fought against Gath and captured it. Then he set his sights on marching up against Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem tulit Ioas rex Iudae omnia sanctificata, quae consecraverant Iosaphat, et Ioram, et Ochozias patres eius reges Iudae, et quae ipse obtulerat: et universum argentum quod inveniri potuit in thesauris templi Domini, et in thesauros regis, misitque Azaeli regi Syriae, et avertit ab Ierusalem.
verses.english: For this reason, Joash, the king of Judah, took all the sacred gifts that his fathers, King Jehoshaphat, Jehoram, and Ahaziah, had consecrated, along with what he himself had offered. He also took all the silver that could be found in the treasuries of the temple of the Lord and in the king's treasuries, and he sent it to Hazael, the king of Syria. As a result, Hazael withdrew from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Ioas, et universa quae fecit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Iuda?
verses.english: As for the rest of the deeds of Joash, and all that he did, are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Coniuraverunt autem adversus eum servi sui, et percusserunt eum in domo Mello, in descensu Sella.
verses.english: But his servants conspired against him and struck him down in the House of Millo, on the road down to Silla.

verses.latin: Iozachar namque filius Semaath, et Iozabad filius Somer servi eius percusserunt eum, et mortuus est: et sepelierunt eum cum patribus suis in civitate David: et regnavit Amasias filius eius pro eo.
verses.english: Indeed, Jozachar, the son of Shimeath, and Jozabad, the son of Shomer, his servants, struck him, and he died. They buried him with his fathers in the City of David, and his son Amaziah reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno septimo Jehu, regnavit Joas: et quadraginta annis regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Sebia de Bersabee.
verses.english: In the seventh year of Jehu's reign, Joash became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for forty years. His mother's name was Zibiah, and she was from Beersheba.

verses.latin: Fecitque Joas rectum coram Domino cunctis diebus quibus docuit eum Jojada sacerdos.
verses.english: King Joash did what was right in the eyes of the Lord all the days that Jehoiada the High Priest guided and taught him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et adolebat incensum in excelsis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, the king did not remove the high places of worship. The people continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense in these high places.

verses.latin: Dixitque Joas ad sacerdotes: Omnem pecuniam sanctificationum, quae infertur in templum Domini a praetereuntibus, quae offertur pro pretio animae, et quam sponte et arbitrio cordis sui inferunt in templum Domini homines:
verses.english: King Joash then spoke to the priests: "All the consecrated funds that are brought into the Temple of the Lord by those who pass through, and the money offered as a redemption for a soul, and whatever people willingly and freely bring into the Temple of the Lord, out of their own free will—"

verses.latin: accipiant sacerdotes juxta ordinem suum, et instaurent sartatecta domus, si quid ruptum vel hians invenerint.
verses.english: "...—the priests are to receive these funds according to their assigned duties, and they must use them to repair the structural damage of the Temple, specifically anything they find that is broken or dilapidated."

verses.latin: Igitur usque ad vigesimum tertium annum regis Joas, non instauraverunt sacerdotes sartatecta templi.
verses.english: However, up until the twenty-third year of King Joash's reign, the priests had not yet repaired the structural damage of the Temple.

verses.latin: Vocavitque rex Joas Jojadam pontificem et sacerdotes, dicens eis: Quare non sarcitis ruinas templi? Nunc igitur nolite accipere pecuniam, sed reddite eam pro reparandis atque instaurandis templi ruinis.
verses.english: So King Joash called for Jehoiada the High Priest and the other priests, asking them: "Why are you not repairing the damage to the Temple? From now on, you are not to personally receive the money, but instead, you must hand it over specifically for the purpose of repairing and restoring the Temple's damage."

verses.latin: Prohibitique sunt sacerdotes ultra accipere pecuniam a populo, et instaurare ruinas domus.
verses.english: Therefore, the priests were forbidden from then on to collect money directly from the people for themselves, or to manage the repairs of the Temple on their own.

verses.latin: Et tulit Jojada pontifex arcam unam, aperuitque foramen desuper, et posuit eam juxta altare ad dexteram ingredientium domum Domini, mittebantque in eam sacerdotes qui custodiebant vestibulum, omnem pecuniam quae afferebatur in templum Domini.
verses.english: So Jehoiada the High Priest took one chest, drilled a hole in its lid, and placed it beside the altar, on the right side as one enters the House of the Lord. The priests who guarded the entrance then put all the money that was brought into the Temple of the Lord into this chest.

verses.latin: Cumque viderent multam pecuniam esse in arca, ascendebat scriba regis et pontifex, effundebantque et numerabant pecuniam quae inveniebatur in domo Domini.
verses.english: When they saw that a large amount of money had accumulated in the chest, the king's scribe and the High Priest would go up, empty out the chest, and count the money that was found in the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et dabant eam juxta numerum et mensuram in manu eorum qui praeerant fabris, et artificibus, et structoribus domus Domini, qui reparabant sarcinata templi:
verses.english: They would then give the counted money to those who were in charge of the craftsmen, the skilled laborers, and the builders of the House of the Lord. These were the ones responsible for repairing the structural work of the Temple.

verses.latin: tignariis quoque et caementariis, et his qui caedebant lapides, et ut emerent ligna et lapides de sectis, ad instauranda sarcinata domus Domini, et omnia quae in reparatione domus indigebant.
verses.english: This money was given to the carpenters, the masons, and those who quarried stones. It was also used to purchase wood and cut stones from the quarries for repairing the structural work of the House of the Lord, and for all other materials needed for the Temple's restoration.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non fiebant in templo Domini crateres argentei, et hydriae, et phialae, et tubae, et omne vas aureum et argenteum de pecunia quae inferebatur in templum:
verses.english: However, from the money that was brought into the Temple, no silver basins, tongs, bowls, trumpets, or any other golden or silver vessels were made for the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: sed operariis dabatur, ut instaurarent ex ea templum Domini.
verses.english: Instead, the money was given to the workers so that they could use it to repair the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et non fiebat ratio his hominibus, qui accipiebant pecuniam, ut distribuerent eam fabris atque artificibus: sed in fide faciebant.
verses.english: And no accounting was required from the men who received the money to distribute it to the craftsmen and skilled laborers, for they acted with faithfulness and integrity.

verses.latin: Pecunia vero pro delicto, et pecunia pro peccatis, non inferabatur in templum Domini, quia sacerdotum erat.
verses.english: However, money from trespass offerings and money from sin offerings was not brought into the Temple of the Lord, because these specific funds belonged to the priests as their rightful portion.

verses.latin: Tunc ascendit Hazael rex Syriae, et pugnavit contra Geth, cepitque eam: et paravit faciem suam ut ascenderet in Jerusalem.
verses.english: At that time, Hazael, the king of Syria, attacked and fought against Gath, capturing it. He then set his sights on Jerusalem, preparing to conquer it next.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem tulit Joas rex Juda omnia sanctificata, quae consecraverant Josaphat, et Joram, et Ochozias patres ejus reges Juda, et quae ipse obtulerat: et universum argentum quod inveniri potuit in thesauris domus Domini, et in thesauro regis: misitque regi Syriae Hazael, et avertit ab Jerusalem.
verses.english: Because of this threat, King Joash of Judah took all the sacred gifts that his fathers—Kings Jehoshaphat, Jehoram, and Ahaziah of Judah—had dedicated, along with his own offerings. He also took all the silver that could be found in the treasuries of the House of the Lord and in the king's treasury. He sent all of this to King Hazael of Syria, and by doing so, he diverted the attack away from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, et universa quae fecit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now, concerning the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he accomplished, are these not indeed written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Surrexerunt autem servi ejus, et conjuraverunt inter se, percusseruntque Joas in domo Mello, in descensu Sella.
verses.english: However, his own servants rose up and conspired against him, striking down King Joash at Beth Millo, on the road descending to Silla.

verses.latin: Josachar namque filius Semaath, et Jozabad filius Somer servi ejus, percusserunt eum, et mortuus est: et sepelierunt eum cum patribus suis in civitate David. Regnavitque Amasias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Indeed, his servants Jozachar, son of Shimeath, and Jehozabad, son of Shomer, were the ones who struck him, and he died. They buried him with his ancestors in the City of David. Then his son Amaziah became king in his place.

verses.latin: Anno septimo Jehu regnavit Joas: et quadraginta annis regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Sebia de Bersabee.
verses.english: In the seventh year of Jehu's reign, Joash became king. He reigned for forty years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Zibiah, and she was from Beersheba.

verses.latin: Fecitque Joas rectum coram Domino cunctis diebus quibus docuit eum Jojada sacerdos.
verses.english: Joash did what was right in the sight of the Lord all the days that Jehoiada the priest instructed him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et succendebat in excelsis.
verses.english: However, he did not remove the high places of pagan worship. The people still continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense in these high places.

verses.latin: Dixitque Joas ad sacerdotes: Omnem pecuniam sanctificationum quae infertur in templum Domini a transeuntibus, et a singulis viris, juxta aestimationem animae suae, et omnem pecuniam quae sponte et ex propria voluntate defertur in templum Domini,
verses.english: Joash then said to the priests: 'All the money offered as sacred gifts that is brought into the Temple of the Lord by those passing through, and from individual men, according to the assessed value of their souls, and all the money that is voluntarily and willingly brought into the Temple of the Lord—'

verses.latin: accipiant sacerdotes juxta ordinem suum, et instaurent sartatecta templi, ubi a quocumque loco fuerit inventa ruinam.
verses.english: '—let the priests receive it according to their regular practice, and use it to repair the Temple's damage, wherever ruin is found.'

verses.latin: Igitur usque ad vigesimum tertium annum regis Joas non instauraverunt sacerdotes sartatecta templi.
verses.english: However, up to the twenty-third year of King Joash's reign, the priests had not yet repaired the Temple's damage.

verses.latin: Vocavitque rex Joas Jojadam pontificem et sacerdotes, dicens eis: Quare sartatecta templi non instauratis? Nolite ergo accipere ultra pecuniam juxta ordinem vestrum, sed ad instaurationem templi reddite eam.
verses.english: So King Joash called for Jehoiada the high priest and the other priests, saying to them: 'Why have you not repaired the Temple's damage? From now on, you are not to receive money according to your regular portion, but you must give it for the restoration of the Temple.'

verses.latin: Prohibitique sunt sacerdotes ultra accipere pecuniam a populo, et instaurare sartatecta domus.
verses.english: Consequently, the priests were forbidden from receiving any more money from the people for their own use, and they were instead charged with repairing the Temple.

verses.latin: Et tulit Jojada pontifex arcam unam, aperuitque foramen desuper, et posuit illam juxta altare ad dexteram ingredientium domum Domini, mittebantque in eam sacerdotes qui custodiebant ostia, omnem pecuniam quae deferebatur in templum Domini.
verses.english: Then Jehoiada the high priest took a single chest, cut a hole in its lid, and placed it beside the altar, to the right of those entering the Lord's house. The priests who guarded the doors would place all the money that was brought into the Lord's Temple into this chest.

verses.latin: Cumque viderent plures argenti esse in arca, ascendebat scriba regis, et pontifex, effundebantque et numerabant pecuniam quae inveniebatur in templo Domini:
verses.english: Whenever they saw that there was a large amount of silver in the chest, the king's scribe and the high priest would go up, empty it, and count the money that was found in the Lord's Temple.

verses.latin: et dabant juxta numerum, in manu eorum qui praeerant operi, et fabris lignariis et caementariis, qui instaurabant domum Domini,
verses.english: They would then give the counted money to those who were in charge of the work, and to the carpenters and masons who were repairing the Lord's house,

verses.latin: et iis qui caedebant saxa, et complentibus, et ut emerent ligna et lapides de sectis, et ad instauranda universa quae indigebant reparari in templo Domini.
verses.english: and to those who cut stones, and to those who carried materials. This was also for buying timber and cut stones, and for performing all other repairs needed for the Lord's Temple.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non fiebant ex auro, et argento, in templo Domini, ornanenta, vel trullae, vel phialae, vel tubae, vel omnis vas aureum et argenteum de pecunia quae inferebatur in templum:
verses.english: However, no golden or silver ornaments, no bowls, no basins, no trumpets, nor any golden or silver vessels were made for the Lord's Temple from the money that was brought in.

verses.latin: sed operariis dabatur, ut instauraretur ex ea templum Domini.
verses.english: Instead, the money was given to the workmen so that the Lord's Temple could be repaired with it.

verses.latin: Et rationem non ponebant viris qui accipiebant pecuniam, ut illam distribuerent operariis: sed in fide faciebant.
verses.english: The men who received the money to distribute to the workmen were not required to give an account for it, because they acted with integrity and trustworthiness.

verses.latin: Pecunia vero pro delicto, et pecunia pro peccatis, non inferebatur in templum Domini, quia sacerdotum erat.
verses.english: But the money for guilt offerings and the money for sin offerings was not brought into the Lord's Temple, because that money belonged to the priests as their portion.

verses.latin: Tunc ascendit Hazael rex Syriae, et pugnabat adversum Geth, et cepit eam: direxitque faciem suam ut ascenderet in Jerusalem.
verses.english: At that time, Hazael, the king of Syria, went up and fought against Gath and captured it. He then set his sights on marching against Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem tulit Joas rex Juda omnia sanctificata, quae consecraverant Josaphat, et Joram, et Ochozias patres ejus reges Juda, et quae ipse obtulerat: et universum argentum, quod inveniri potuit in thesauris templi Domini, et in palatio regis: misitque Hazael regi Syriae, et avertit ab Jerusalem.
verses.english: Because of this threat, Joash, the king of Judah, took all the sacred gifts that his fathers, King Jehoshaphat, King Jehoram, and King Ahaziah, had consecrated, along with his own offerings, and all the silver that could be found in the treasuries of the Lord's Temple and in the king's palace. He sent all of this to Hazael, the king of Syria, and Hazael then turned away from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, et universa quae fecit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: As for the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, are these not written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Surrexerunt autem servi ejus, et conjuraverunt inter se, percusseruntque Joas in domo Mello, quae descendit Sesella.
verses.english: However, his own servants rose up and formed a conspiracy among themselves. They struck down Joash in the house of Millo, which is on the way down to Silla.

verses.latin: Josachar namque filius Semaath, et Jozabad filius Somer servi ejus, percusserunt eum: et mortuus est. Sepelieruntque eum cum patribus suis in civitate David: et regnavit Amasias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Jozachar, the son of Shimeath, and Jehozabad, the son of Shomer, his own servants, struck him dead. He was buried with his forefathers in the city of David, and his son Amaziah became king in his place.

verses.latin: Nullum est versum 22 in Libro Quarto Regum, Capitulo 12, juxta Vulgatam Clementinam.
verses.english: There is no verse 22 in the Fourth Book of Kings, Chapter 12, according to the Clementine Vulgate. This chapter concludes with verse 21.

verses.latin: Anno vigesimo tertio Joas filii Ochoziae regis Juda, regnavit Joachaz filius Jehu super Israel in Samaria, sedecim annis.
verses.english: In the twenty-third year of Joash, the son of Ahaziah, who was king of Judah, Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu, began to reign over Israel in Samaria. He reigned for sixteen years.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino: secutusque est peccata Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israel, non recessit ab eis.
verses.english: And he did evil in the sight of the Lord. He followed the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who had caused Israel to sin, and he did not turn away from those sins.

verses.latin: Iratusque est Dominus contra Israel, et tradidit eos in manu Hazaël regis Syriae, et in manu Benadad filii Hazaël, cunctis diebus.
verses.english: So the Lord was angry with Israel and delivered them into the power of Hazael, the king of Syria, and into the power of Ben-Hadad, the son of Hazael, for all those days.

verses.latin: Deprecatus est autem Joachaz faciem Domini: et audivit eum Dominus: vidit enim angustiam Israel, quia adflixerat eos rex Syriae.
verses.english: But Jehoahaz pleaded with the Lord, and the Lord heard him, for He saw the suffering of Israel because the king of Syria had greatly oppressed them.

verses.latin: Et dedit Dominus Israeli salvatorem, et liberavit eos de manu Syriae: et habitaverunt filii Israel in tabernaculis suis sicut heri et nudiustertius.
verses.english: And the Lord gave Israel a deliverer, and he freed them from the power of Syria, so the children of Israel lived in their own homes as they had before—in peace and security.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non recesserunt a peccatis domus Jeroboam, qui peccare fecit Israel, sed in ipsis ambulaverunt: insuper et lucus permansit in Samaria.
verses.english: Nevertheless, they did not turn away from the sins of the house of Jeroboam, who had caused Israel to sin, but they persisted in those sins. Moreover, the Asherah pole also remained standing in Samaria.

verses.latin: Et non reliquerat Dominus Joachaz de populo, nisi quinquaginta equites, et decem currus, et decem millia peditum: interfecerat enim eos rex Syriae, et redegerat quasi pulverem in tritura.
verses.english: And the Lord had left to Jehoahaz no more of the people than fifty horsemen, ten chariots, and ten thousand foot soldiers, for the king of Syria had destroyed them and made them like dust when threshing grain.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joachaz, et universa quae fecit, et fortitudo ejus, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and all that he did, and his strength, are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joachaz cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in Samaria: et regnavit Joas filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Jehoahaz slept with his fathers, and they buried him in Samaria. And Joash, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo septimo Joas regis Juda, regnavit Joas filius Joachaz super Israel in Samaria, sedecim annis.
verses.english: In the thirty-seventh year of Joash, the king of Judah, Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and he reigned for sixteen years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum est coram Domino: non recessit ab omnibus peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israel, sed in ipsis ambulavit.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from all the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who had caused Israel to sin, but he persisted in them.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, et universa quae fecit, et fortitudo ejus, quomodo pugnavit contra Amasiam regem Juda, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, and his strength, and how he fought against Amaziah, the king of Judah, are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joas cum patribus suis: et Jeroboam sedit super solium ejus. Porro Joas sepultus est in Samaria juxta reges Israel.
verses.english: So Joash slept with his fathers, and Jeroboam sat on his throne. And Joash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Eliseus autem aegrotabat infirmitate sua, qua et mortuus est. Descenditque ad eum Joas rex Israel, et flebat coram eo, dicens: Pater mi, pater mi, currus Israel et auriga ejus.
verses.english: Now Elisha was suffering from the illness of which he was to die. And Joash, the king of Israel, went down to him and wept before him, saying, 'My father, my father! You are the very strength and defense of Israel!'

verses.latin: Et ait illi Eliseus: Affer arcum et sagittas. Cum attulisset ad eum arcum et sagittas,
verses.english: And Elisha said to him, 'Bring a bow and arrows.' So he brought a bow and arrows to him.

verses.latin: dixit ad regem Israel: Pone manum tuam super arcum. Et cum posuisset ille manum suam, superposuit Eliseus manum suam super manus regis.
verses.english: He then said to the king of Israel, 'Put your hand on the bow.' And when the king had put his hand on it, Elisha put his own hands over the king's hands.

verses.latin: Et ait: Aperite fenestram orientalem. Cumque aperuisset, ait Eliseus: Jacere sagittam. Et jecit. Et ait Eliseus: Sagitta salutis Domini, et sagitta salutis contra Syriam: percutiesque Syriam in Aphec donec consumas eam.
verses.english: And Elisha said, 'Open the eastern window.' And when he had opened it, Elisha said, 'Shoot the arrow!' And he shot it. Then Elisha said, 'This is the arrow of the Lord’s deliverance, the arrow of deliverance against Syria! You will strike down Syria at Aphek until you have utterly destroyed them!'

verses.latin: Et rursum ait: Tolle sagittas. Et cum tulisset, ait ad regem Israel: Percute cum hastili terram. Et percussit tribus vicibus, et stetit.
verses.english: And again Elisha said, 'Take the arrows.' And when he had taken them, he said to the king of Israel, 'Strike the ground with the arrows.' And he struck the ground three times, and then he stopped.

verses.latin: Et iratus est contra eum vir Dei, et ait: Si percussisses quinquies, aut sexies, aut septies, percussisses Syriam usque ad consumptionem: nunc autem tribus vicibus percuties Syriam.
verses.english: And the man of God was angry with him and said, 'If you had struck the ground five or six or seven times, you would have struck down Syria until its complete destruction. But now you will strike Syria only three times!'

verses.latin: Mortuus est ergo Eliseus, et sepelierunt eum. Venerant autem latrunculi de Moab in terra in anno ipso.
verses.english: So Elisha died, and they buried him. Now, bands of Moabite raiders would invade the land in the spring of that year.

verses.latin: Quidam autem sepelientes hominem, viderunt latrunculos, et projecerunt cadaver in sepulchro Elisei. Qui cum tetigisset ossa Elisei, revixit, et stetit super pedes suos.
verses.english: And as some men were burying a man, they saw the raiders and quickly threw the corpse into Elisha’s tomb. And when the corpse touched the bones of Elisha, the man was revived and stood up on his feet.

verses.latin: Humiliaverat autem Hazaël rex Syriae Israel cunctis diebus Joachaz.
verses.english: Now Hazael, the king of Syria, had oppressed Israel throughout all the days of Jehoahaz.

verses.latin: Et misertus est Dominus eorum, et reversus est ad eos propter pactum suum, quod pepigerat cum Abraham, Isaac et Jacob: et noluit disperdere eos, neque projicere penitus a facie sua usque in praesens tempus.
verses.english: But the Lord was merciful to them and turned to them because of His covenant which He had made with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. He was unwilling to destroy them or utterly cast them from His presence, even to this present time.

verses.latin: Mortuus est Hazaël rex Syriae: et regnavit Benadad filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Hazael, the king of Syria, died, and Ben-Hadad, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Porro Joas filius Joachaz tulit urbes de manu Benadad filii Hazaël, quas tulerat de manu Joachaz patris sui in pugna: tribus vicibus percussit eum Joas, et reddidit civitates Israeli.
verses.english: And Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, took back from the power of Ben-Hadad, the son of Hazael, the cities which Hazael had taken from the power of Jehoahaz, his father, in battle. Joash defeated him three times and restored the cities to Israel.

verses.latin: Anno vigesimo tertio Joas filii Ochoziae regis Juda, regnavit Joachaz filius Jehu super Israel in Samaria, decem et septem annis.
verses.english: In the twenty-third year of the reign of Joash, son of Ahaziah, king of Judah, Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu, began his seventeen-year reign over Israel in Samaria.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino, et secutus est peccata Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israel: non recessit ab eis.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He continued to commit the sins of Jeroboam, son of Nebat, who caused Israel to sin. He did not turn away from those sins.

verses.latin: Iratusque est furor Domini contra Israel, et tradidit eos in manu Hazael regis Syriae, et in manu Benadad filii Hazael, cunctis diebus.
verses.english: The Lord's anger burned hot against Israel. He handed them over to the power of Hazael, the king of Syria, and later to Ben-Hadad, Hazael’s son, for the entire reign of these kings.

verses.latin: Deprecatus est autem Joachaz faciem Domini, et audivit Dominus illum: videbat enim angustiam Israel, quia afflixerat eos rex Syriae.
verses.english: Jehoahaz then pleaded before the Lord, and the Lord heard him, for the Lord saw the oppression of Israel, because the king of Syria was crushing them.

verses.latin: Et dedit Dominus Israeli salvatorem, et liberati sunt de manu regis Syriae: habitaveruntque filii Israel in tabernaculis suis sicut heri et nudiustertius.
verses.english: And the Lord gave Israel a deliverer, and they were rescued from the power of the king of Syria. The Israelites then lived in their homes in peace, as they had in previous times.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non recesserunt a peccatis domus Jeroboam, qui peccare fecit Israel, sed in ipsis ambulaverunt: quin et lucus permansit in Samaria.
verses.english: However, they did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam's family line, who caused Israel to sin. Instead, they continued to practice those very sins. Moreover, the Asherah pole—a false idol—remained standing in Samaria.

verses.latin: Et non sunt derelicti Joachaz de populo, nisi quinquaginta equites, et decem currus, et decem millia peditum: interfecerat enim eos rex Syriae, et redegerat quasi pulverem in tritura.
verses.english: Jehoahaz had almost no fighting force left from his army, except for fifty cavalrymen, ten chariots, and ten thousand infantrymen. This was because the king of Syria had decimated them, he had ground them down like dust on the threshing floor.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joachaz, et universa quae fecit, et fortitudo ejus: nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and all that he did, and his strength—are these not recorded in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joachaz cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in Samaria: regnavitque Joas filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Jehoahaz rested in death with his ancestors, and they buried him in Samaria. His son Joash began to reign in his place.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo septimo Joas regis Juda, regnavit Joas filius Joachaz super Israel in Samaria, sedecim annis.
verses.english: In the thirty-seventh year of Joash's reign over Judah, Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, began his sixteen-year reign over Israel in Samaria.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum in conspectu Domini: non recessit ab omnibus peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israel, sed in ipsis ambulavit.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from any of the sins of Jeroboam, son of Nebat, who had caused Israel to sin, but he continued to practice those very sins.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, et universa quae fecit, et fortitudo ejus, qualiter pugnaverit contra Amasiam regem Juda: nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, and his strength, including how he fought against Amaziah, the king of Judah—are these not recorded in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joas cum patribus suis: et Jeroboam sedit super thronum ejus. Porro Joas sepultus est in Samaria cum regibus Israel.
verses.english: Joash rested in death with his ancestors, and Jeroboam then took his place on the throne. Moreover, Joash was buried in Samaria, among the kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Elisæus autem ægrotabat infirmitate sua, qua et mortuus est: descenditque ad eum Joas rex Israel, et flebat coram eo, dicens: Pater mi, pater mi, currus Israel et auriga ejus.
verses.english: Now Elisha was suffering from the illness that would ultimately cause his death. King Joash of Israel went to visit him and wept before him, crying out: "My father, my father! You are the very strength of Israel, its chariots and horsemen!"

verses.latin: Et ait illi Elisæus: Affer arcum et sagittas. Cumque attulisset ad eum arcum et sagittas,
verses.english: Elisha said to him, "Bring a bow and arrows." And when the king had brought him a bow and arrows,

verses.latin: dixit ad regem Israel: Pone manum tuam super arcum. Et cum posuisset ille manum suam, superposuit Elisæus manus suas super manus regis,
verses.english: Elisha said to the king of Israel, "Place your hand on the bow." And when the king had placed his hand on the bow, Elisha placed his own hands over the king's hands.

verses.latin: et ait: Aperiam fenestram orientalem. Aperuitque. Et ait Elisæus: Jacere. Et jaculatus est. Dixitque Elisæus: Sagitta salutis Domini, et sagitta salutis contra Syriam: percutiesque Syriam in Aphec, donec consumas eam.
verses.english: Then Elisha said, "Open the window facing east." And the king opened it. Elisha told him, "Shoot." And he shot the arrow. Elisha declared: "This is the Lord's arrow of salvation, an arrow of victory against Syria! You will strike down Syria at Aphek until they are utterly defeated."

verses.latin: Et ait: Tolle sagittas. Cumque tulisset, rursum dixit ad eum: Percute terram. Et percussit tribus vicibus, et stetit.
verses.english: Then Elisha said, "Now pick up the arrows." And the king picked them up. Again, Elisha told him, "Strike the ground with them." So the king struck the ground three times, and then he stopped.

verses.latin: Et iratus est contra eum vir Dei, et ait: Si percussisses quinque aut sexies, percussisses Syriam usque ad consummationem: nunc autem tribus vicibus percuties Syriam.
verses.english: And the man of God became angry with him and said, "If you had struck the ground five or six times, you would have completely defeated Syria. But now, you will defeat Syria only three times."

verses.latin: Mortuus est ergo Elisæus, et sepelierunt eum. Venerunt autem latrunculi Moabitarum in terra, in anno.
verses.english: So Elisha died, and he was buried. Now, every year, Moabite raiding parties would invade the land.

verses.latin: Quidam autem sepelientes hominem, viderunt latrunculos, et projecerunt cadaver in sepulchro Elisæi. Quod cum tetigisset ossa Elisæi, revixit homo, et stetit super pedes suos.
verses.english: Once, as some men were burying a dead man, they suddenly saw a raiding party approaching and quickly threw the dead body into Elisha's tomb. As soon as the body touched Elisha's bones, the man was restored to life and stood up on his feet.

verses.latin: Cunctis autem diebus Joachaz afflixerat Hazael rex Syriae Israel.
verses.english: Throughout the entire reign of Jehoahaz, Hazael, the king of Syria, had oppressed Israel.

verses.latin: Et misertus est Dominus eorum, et reversus est ad eos propter pactum suum, quod habebat cum Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob: et noluit disperdere eos, neque projicere penitus a facie sua usque in praesens.
verses.english: But the Lord had compassion on them and He turned back to them because of His covenant, which He had established with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. He was unwilling to destroy them or to utterly cast them away from His presence, right up to the present day.

verses.latin: Mortuusque est Hazael rex Syriae, et regnavit Benadad filius ejus pro eo.
