verses.english: Then Hazael, the king of Syria, died, and his son Ben-Hadad began to reign in his place.

verses.latin: Reddita sunt autem Joas filio Joachaz verba, quae tulerat de manu patris sui Joachaz, per manum Benadad filii Hazael: tribus vicibus percussit eum Joas, et restituit civitates Israel.
verses.english: Now Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, recaptured the cities that Ben-Hadad, son of Hazael, had taken from his father, Jehoahaz. Joash defeated Ben-Hadad three times and restored the cities of Israel to its control.

verses.latin: Anno vigesimo tertio Joas filii Ochoziae regis Juda, regnavit Joachaz filius Jehu super Israël in Samaria, sedecim annis.
verses.english: In the twenty-third year of Joas, son of Ochozia, the king of Judah, Joachaz, son of Jehu, began to reign over Israel in Samaria. He reigned for sixteen years.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino : secutus est peccata Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël, et non recessit ab eis.
verses.english: He did evil in the Lord's presence. He continued the sins of Jeroboam, son of Nabat, who had led Israel into sin, and he never turned away from them.

verses.latin: Iratusque est furor Domini contra Israël, et tradidit eos in manu Hazael regis Syriae, et in manu Benadad filii Hazael, cunctis diebus.
verses.english: The Lord's wrath burned against Israel, and He handed them over to Hazael, king of Syria, and to Hazael's son, Benadad, for many days.

verses.latin: Deprecatus est autem Joachaz faciem Domini : et audivit eum Dominus : vidit enim angustiam Israël, quia afflixerat eos rex Syriae.
verses.english: However, Joachaz implored the Lord for help, and the Lord heard him, because He had seen the distress of Israel and how the king of Syria had afflicted them.

verses.latin: Et dedit Dominus Israël salvatorem, et liberavit eos de manu regis Syriae : egressique sunt filii Israël de sub manu Syriae, et habitaverunt in tabernaculis suis sicut heri et nudiustertius.
verses.english: So the Lord provided Israel with a deliverer, and He freed them from the hand of the king of Syria. The people of Israel were released from Syrian control and were able to live in their homes peacefully again, just as they had before the war.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non recesserunt a peccatis domus Jeroboam, qui peccare fecit Israël, sed ambulaverunt in eis : siquidem et lucus permansit in Samaria.
verses.english: Nevertheless, they did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam's house—the ones who had led Israel into sin. Instead, they continued in them. Even the Asherah pole, dedicated to false gods, remained standing in Samaria.

verses.latin: Et non fuerat relicta Joachaz de populo, nisi quinquaginta equites, et decem currus, et decem millia peditum : interfecerat enim rex Syriae omnes, et redegerat quasi pulverem in tritura.
verses.english: For Joachaz, there were only fifty horsemen, ten chariots, and ten thousand foot soldiers left in his army. The king of Syria had destroyed all the rest, crushing them like dust under the threshing sledge.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joachaz, et universa quae fecit, et fortiter operatus est, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël ?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the history of Joachaz—all that he did, and how bravely he acted—is it not all written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joachaz cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in Samaria : regnavitque Joas filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Joachaz died and was buried in Samaria. Then his son, Joas, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo septimo Joas regis Juda, regnavit Joas filius Joachaz super Israël in Samaria, sedecim annis.
verses.english: In the thirty-seventh year of Joas, the king of Judah, Joas, son of Joachaz, began to reign over Israel in Samaria. He reigned for sixteen years.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum in conspectu Domini : non recessit ab omnibus peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël, sed in ipsis ambulavit.
verses.english: He also did evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from any of the sins of Jeroboam, son of Nabat, who had led Israel into sin, but he continued to practice them.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, et universa quae fecit, et fortitudo ejus qua pugnavit contra Amasiam regem Juda, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël ?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the history of Joas—all that he did, and his might in fighting against Amasias, the king of Judah—is it not all written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joas cum patribus suis : et Jeroboam sedit super thronum ejus. Porro Joas sepultus est in Samaria cum regibus Israël.
verses.english: Joas died, and Jeroboam, his son, sat on his throne. Joas was buried in Samaria, among the kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Eliseus autem aegrotabat infirmitate sua, qua et mortuus est. Descenditque ad eum Joas rex Israël, et flebat coram eo, dicens : Pater mi, pater mi, currus Israël, et auriga ejus.
verses.english: Now Eliseus became sick with the illness from which he would die. Joas, the king of Israel, went down to visit him and wept before him, saying, 'My father, my father! You are like the chariot and horsemen of Israel!'

verses.latin: Et ait illi Eliseus : Affer arcum et sagittas. Cum attulisset ad eum arcum et sagittas,
verses.english: Eliseus said to him, 'Bring a bow and arrows.' So the king brought him a bow and arrows.

verses.latin: dixit ad regem Israël : Pone manum tuam super arcum. Et cum posuisset ille manum suam, superposuit Eliseus manum suam super manus regis,
verses.english: Then Eliseus said to the king of Israel, 'Put your hand on the bow.' The king did so, and Eliseus placed his own hands over the king's hands.

verses.latin: et ait : Aperire fenestram orientalem. Cumque aperuisset, dixit Eliseus : Jacere sagittam. Et jaculavit. Et ait Eliseus : Sagitta salutis Domini, et sagitta salutis contra Syriam : percutesque Syriam in Aphec, donec consumas eam.
verses.english: Eliseus said, 'Open the window to the east.' When the king opened it, Eliseus commanded, 'Shoot the arrow!' The king shot the arrow. Then Eliseus declared, 'This is the Lord's arrow of salvation and deliverance against Syria! You will strike Syria at Aphec until you completely destroy them!'

verses.latin: Et ait : Accipe sagittas. Qui cum tulisset, rursum dixit ei : Percute terram. Et percussit tribus vicibus, et stetit.
verses.english: Then Eliseus said, 'Take the arrows.' When the king had taken them, Eliseus said to him again, 'Strike the ground!' The king struck the ground three times and then stopped.

verses.latin: Et iratus est contra eum vir Dei, et ait : Si percussisses quinquies, aut sexies, sive septies, percussisses Syriam usque ad consumptionem : nunc vero tribus vicibus percuties Syriam.
verses.english: The man of God was angry with him and said, 'If you had struck five, six, or even seven times, you would have utterly destroyed Syria! But now, you will strike Syria only three times.'

verses.latin: Mortuus est ergo Eliseus, et sepelierunt eum. Venerunt autem latrunculi Moabitarum in terra, in ipso anno.
verses.english: So Eliseus died, and they buried him. In that same year, Moabite raiding parties invaded the land.

verses.latin: Quidam autem sepelientes hominem, viderunt latrunculos, et projecerunt cadaver in sepulchro Elisei. Quod cum tetigisset ossa Elisei, revixit homo, et stetit super pedes suos.
verses.english: As some men were burying a dead body, they suddenly saw the Moabite raiding parties approaching. So, they quickly threw the corpse into Eliseus's tomb. When the body touched Eliseus's bones, the man came back to life and stood on his feet!

verses.latin: Cunctis autem diebus Joachaz afflixerat Hazael rex Syriae Israël :
verses.english: Throughout the entire reign of Joachaz, Hazael, the king of Syria, had oppressed Israel.

verses.latin: et misertus est Dominus eorum, et reversus est ad eos propter pactum suum, quod habebat cum Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob : et noluit disperdere eos, neque projicere penitus a facie sua usque in praesens.
verses.english: However, the Lord had compassion on them. He turned to them because of His covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. He did not wish to destroy them or utterly cast them out from His presence, even to this very day.

verses.latin: Mortuus est Hazael rex Syriae, et regnavit Benadad filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Then Hazael, the king of Syria, died, and his son Benadad reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Porro Joas filius Joachaz tulit urbes de manu Benadad filii Hazael, quas tulerat de manu Joachaz patris sui jure praelii : tribus vicibus percussit eum Joas, et reddidit civitates Israël.
verses.english: Furthermore, Joas, son of Joachaz, recaptured the cities from Benadad, son of Hazael—the very cities Benadad's father had seized from Joachaz, his own father, in battle. Joas defeated Benadad three times, thus restoring those cities to Israel.

verses.latin: Anno vigesimo tertio Joas filii Ochoziae regis Juda, regnavit Joachaz filius Jehu super Israel in Samaria, decem et septem annis.
verses.english: In the twenty-third year of the reign of Joash, the son of Ahaziah, king of Judah, Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu, began his reign over Israel in Samaria, and he ruled for seventeen years.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino: et secutus est peccata Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israel, nec recessit ab eis.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He followed the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who had made Israel commit sin; Jehoahaz did not turn away from those sins.

verses.latin: Iratusque est Dominus contra Israel: et tradidit eos in manu Hazael regis Syriae, et in manu Benadad filii Hazael, cunctis diebus.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord was angry with Israel. He handed them over to the power of Hazael, the king of Syria, and into the power of Ben-Hadad, Hazael's son, throughout those days.

verses.latin: Deprecatus est autem Joachaz faciem Domini: et audivit eum Dominus: videbat enim angustiam Israel, quia adtriverat eos rex Syriae.
verses.english: But Jehoahaz pleaded before the Lord. And the Lord heard him, because He saw the distress of Israel; for the king of Syria had oppressed them.

verses.latin: Et dedit Dominus Israeli salvatorem: et liberati sunt de manu regis Syriae: habitaveruntque filii Israel in tabernaculis suis sicut heri et nudiustertius.
verses.english: So the Lord gave Israel a deliverer, and they were freed from the power of the king of Syria. Then the children of Israel were able to live in their homes, as they had in times past.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non recesserunt a peccatis domus Jeroboam, qui peccare fecerat Israel, sed ambulaverunt in eis: siquidem et lucus permansit in Samaria.
verses.english: Nevertheless, they did not turn away from the sins of the house of Jeroboam, who had made Israel commit sin; instead, they continued in them. Indeed, the Asherah pole remained standing in Samaria.

verses.latin: Et non fuerat derelictus Joachaz de populo, nisi quinquaginta equites, et decem currus, et decem milia peditum: interfecerat enim rex Syriae omnes, et redegerat quasi pulverem in tritura.
verses.english: For Jehoahaz, there remained no more of the army than fifty horsemen, ten chariots, and ten thousand foot soldiers. This was because the king of Syria had destroyed everyone else, crushing them like dust under the threshing sledges.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joachaz, et universa quae fecit, et fortiter gessit, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now, as for the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and everything he did, and his valiant deeds—are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joachaz cum patribus suis: et sepelierunt eum in Samaria. Regnavitque Joas filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Jehoahaz rested with his fathers, and they buried him in Samaria. Then his son Jehoash became king in his place.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo septimo Joas regis Juda, regnavit Joas filius Joachaz super Israel in Samaria, sedecim annis.
verses.english: In the thirty-seventh year of Joash, king of Judah, Jehoash, the son of Jehoahaz, began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and he ruled for sixteen years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum est in conspectu Domini: non declinavit ab omnibus peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israel, sed in ipsis ambulavit.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from any of the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who had made Israel commit sin, but walked in them.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, et universa quae fecit, et fortitudo ejus qua pugnavit contra Amasiam regem Juda, nonne haec scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israel?
verses.english: Now, as for the rest of the acts of Jehoash, and everything he did, and his might in how he fought against Amaziah, king of Judah—are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Et dormivit Joas cum patribus suis: seditque Jeroboam super solium ejus. Sepultus est autem Joas in Samaria cum regibus Israel.
verses.english: So Jehoash rested with his fathers, and Jeroboam sat on his throne. Jehoash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Eliseus autem aegrotabat infirmitate sua, qua et mortuus est. Descenditque ad eum Joas rex Israel: et flebat coram eo, dicens: Pater mi, pater mi, currus Israel et auriga ejus.
verses.english: Now Elisha became sick with the illness by which he eventually died. Then Jehoash, the king of Israel, went down to him and wept over him, saying: 'My father, my father! The chariots of Israel and its horsemen!'

verses.latin: Et ait illi Eliseus: Affer arcum et sagittas. Cumque attulisset ad eum arcum et sagittas,
verses.english: Elisha then said to him, 'Bring a bow and arrows.' When Jehoash had brought him a bow and arrows,

verses.latin: dixit ad regem Israel: Pone manum tuam super arcum. Et posuit ille manum suam, et superimposuit Eliseus manus suas super manus regis,
verses.english: Elisha said to the king of Israel, 'Place your hand upon the bow.' And Jehoash placed his hand upon it, and Elisha placed his hands over the king's hands.

verses.latin: et ait: Aperito fenestram orientalem. Cumque aperuisset, ait Eliseus: Jacere sagittam. Et jaculatus est. Et dixit Eliseus: Sagitta salutis Domini, et sagitta salutis contra Syriam: percutesque Syriam in Aphec, donec consumas eam.
verses.english: And Elisha said, 'Open the window toward the east.' When Jehoash had opened it, Elisha said, 'Shoot the arrow!' And he shot it. Then Elisha declared, 'This is the arrow of the Lord's deliverance! It is the arrow of deliverance against Syria! For you will strike Syria in Aphek until you completely destroy them.'

verses.latin: Et ait: Tolle sagittas. Cumque tulisset, rursum dixit ad eum: Percute terra. Et percussit tribus vicibus, et stetit.
verses.english: And Elisha said, 'Take the arrows.' When Jehoash had taken them, Elisha again said to him, 'Strike the ground.' And he struck it three times, and then he stopped.

verses.latin: Et iratus est contra eum vir Dei, et ait: Si percussisses quinque aut sexies, percussisses Syriam usque ad consummationem: nunc autem tribus vicibus percuties Syriam.
verses.english: Then the man of God was angry with him and said, 'If you had struck five or six times, you would have struck Syria until their complete destruction. But now, you will strike Syria only three times.'

verses.latin: Mortuus est ergo Eliseus, et sepelierunt eum. Veniuntque latrunculi de Moab in terra in ipso anno.
verses.english: So Elisha died, and they buried him. And raiding parties from Moab invaded the land in that very year.

verses.latin: Quidam autem sepelientes hominem, viderunt latrunculos, et projecerunt cadaver in sepulchro Elisei. Quo cum attigisset ossa Elisei mortuus, revixit, et stetit super pedes suos.
verses.english: Now it happened that some men were burying a dead person when they saw the raiding parties. So they threw the corpse into Elisha's tomb. When the dead man touched Elisha's bones, he revived and stood up on his feet.

verses.latin: Cunctis autem diebus Joachaz regis, adflixerat Hazael rex Syriae Israel.
verses.english: Indeed, throughout all the days of King Jehoahaz, Hazael, the king of Syria, had oppressed Israel.

verses.latin: Et misertus est Dominus eorum, et reversus est ad eos propter pactum suum, quod habebat cum Abraham, Isaac, et Jacob: et noluit disperdere eos, neque projicere penitus a facie sua usque in praesens.
verses.english: But the Lord had mercy on them and turned back to them because of His covenant which He had made with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. He did not wish to destroy them, nor to cast them utterly away from His sight, even until the present day.

verses.latin: Mortuusque est Hazael rex Syriae: et regnavit Benadad filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Then Hazael, the king of Syria, died, and his son Ben-Hadad reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Porro Joas filius Joachaz, tunc recepit urbes de manu Benadad filii Hazael, quas tulerat de manu Joachaz patris sui jure belli, cunctis diebus: tribus vicibus percussit eum Joas, et restituit civitates Israel.
verses.english: Moreover, Jehoash, the son of Jehoahaz, then recovered the cities from the hand of Ben-Hadad, the son of Hazael. These were the cities that Ben-Hadad had taken from the hand of Jehoahaz, Jehoash's father, by right of war, throughout all those days. Jehoash struck him three times, and so restored the cities to Israel.

verses.latin: Anno secundo Joas filii Joachaz regis Israël, regnavit Amasias filius Joas regis Juda.
verses.english: In the second year of Joas, the son of Joachaz and King of Israel, Amasias, the son of Joas and King of Judah, began his reign.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, viginti novem annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Joadan de Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Joadan, who was from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque rectum in conspectu Domini: verumtamen non sicut David pater ejus: omnia quæ fecerat Joas pater ejus, fecit.
verses.english: Amasias did what was right in the sight of the Lord, however, he did not do it with the same wholeheartedness as David, his father. He followed all the ways that Joas, his father, had done before him.

verses.latin: Tantum excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et adolebat incensum in excelsis.
verses.english: Yet the high places of idolatry were not removed; the people still offered sacrifices and burned incense on those high places dedicated to false gods.

verses.latin: Cumque obfirmasset regnum in manu sua, percussit servos suos, qui interfecerant regem patrem suum:
verses.english: After he had established his royal authority and secured the kingdom in his own hands, Amasias struck down his servants who had assassinated Joas, his royal father.

verses.latin: filios autem eorum, qui interfecerant, non occidit, juxta id quod scriptum est in libro legis Moysi, sicut præcepit Dominus, dicens: Non occidentur patres pro filiis, neque filii pro patribus: sed unusquisque in peccato suo morietur.
verses.english: But the sons of those assassins he did not put to death. He acted according to what is written in the book of the Law of Moses, as the Lord commanded, saying: 'Fathers shall not be put to death for their sons, nor shall sons be put to death for their fathers; rather, each person shall die for their own sin alone.'

verses.latin: Ipse percussit Edom in Valle Salinarum decem millia, et apprehendit petram in prælio, vocavitque nomen ejus Jecthel, usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: Amasias himself struck down Edom in the Valley of Salt, killing ten thousand men. He captured the city of Sela in battle, and he called its name Jecthel, which remains its name to this very day.

verses.latin: Tunc misit Amasias nuntios ad Joas filium Joachaz, filii Jehu regis Israël, dicens: Veni, et videamus nos mutuo.
verses.english: Then Amasias sent messengers to Joas, the son of Joachaz and grandson of Jehu, who was King of Israel. Amasias' message was: 'Come, let us look each other in the face,' meaning, 'Let us meet in battle.'

verses.latin: Remisitque Joas rex Israël, ad Amasiam regem Juda, dicens: Lilium agri misit ad cedrum Libani, dicens: Da filiam tuam filio meo uxorem. Et transierunt bestiæ agri, et conculcaverunt lilium.
verses.english: Joas, the King of Israel, sent this reply to Amasias, the King of Judah: 'The thistle in the field sent a message to the cedar in Lebanon, saying, "Give your daughter to my son to be his wife." But a wild beast passed by and trampled the thistle underfoot.'

verses.latin: Percussisti et vicisti Edom, et sublevavit te cor tuum: gaude, et sede in domo tua: quare provocas malum, ut cadas tu, et Juda tecum?
verses.english: Joas continued, 'You have indeed struck down and conquered Edom, and your heart has been lifted up in pride because of it. Rejoice in your victory, but stay in your own house and enjoy your triumph. Why do you provoke evil, so that you fall, and Judah with you?'

verses.latin: Et non acquievit Amasias. Ascenditque Joas rex Israël, et ipse et Amasias rex Juda, videruntque se mutuo in Bethsames oppido Judæ.
verses.english: But Amasias did not listen to this warning. So Joas, the King of Israel, went up with his army. And he, along with Amasias, the King of Judah, met each other in battle at Beth Shemesh, a town in Judah.

verses.latin: Perquecussus est Juda a faciei Israël, et fugerunt singuli in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: Judah was defeated by Israel, and every man of Judah fled back to his own tent, abandoning the battle.

verses.latin: Porro Amasiam regem Juda, filium Joas, filii Ochoziæ, cepit Joas rex Israël in Bethsames, et adduxit eum in Jerusalem: et diruit murum Jerusalem a porta Ephraim usque ad portam Anguli, quadringentis cubitis.
verses.english: Joas, the King of Israel, captured Amasias, the King of Judah — the son of Joas, and grandson of Ochozias — at Beth Shemesh. Joas then brought Amasias as his prisoner to Jerusalem. There, Joas broke down the wall of Jerusalem, from the Gate of Ephraim to the Corner Gate, a distance of four hundred cubits — a significant humiliation and weakening of Judah's defenses.

verses.latin: Tulitque omne aurum et argentum, et universa vasa quæ invenit in domo Domini, et in thesauris regis, et obsides, et reversus est Samariam.
verses.english: Joas took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels he found in the house of the Lord and in the king's treasuries. He also took hostages, and then he returned to Samaria, the capital of Israel.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, quæ fecit, et fortitudo ejus, quomodo pugnavit contra Amasiam regem Juda, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Joas, and his military strength, and how he fought against Amasias, the King of Judah — are these not all written in the book of the chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joas cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Samaria cum regibus Israël: et regnavit Jeroboam filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Joas then slept with his fathers — meaning he died — and was buried in Samaria with the other Kings of Israel. And his son, Jeroboam, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Amasias filius Joas rex Juda, postquam mortuus est Joas filius Joachaz regis Israël, quindecim annis.
verses.english: Amasias, the son of Joas and King of Judah, lived for fifteen years after Joas, the son of Joachaz and King of Israel, had died.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Amasiæ, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Amasias — are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Factaque est conjuratio contra eum in Jerusalem: qui fugiens in Lachis, interfectus est ibi.
verses.english: A conspiracy was made against Amasias in Jerusalem. He fled to Lachish to escape, but he was killed there.

verses.latin: Et asportaverunt corpus ejus in equis, sepultusque est in Jerusalem cum patribus suis in civitate David.
verses.english: His body was then brought back on horses, and he was buried in Jerusalem with his fathers, in the City of David.

verses.latin: Tulit autem universus populus Judæ Azariam annorum sedecim, et constituit eum regem pro patre suo Amasia.
verses.english: Then all the people of Judah took Azarias, who was sixteen years old, and they appointed him king in place of his father Amasias.

verses.latin: Ipse ædificavit Ailath, et restituit eam Judæ, postquam dormivit rex cum patribus suis.
verses.english: It was Azarias who rebuilt Ailath and restored it to Judah, after the king — his father — had died.

verses.latin: Anno quintodecimo Amasiæ filii Joas regis Juda, regnavit Jeroboam filius Joas regis Israël in Samaria, quadraginta et uno anno.
verses.english: In the fifteenth year of Amasias, the son of Joas and King of Judah, Jeroboam, the son of Joas and King of Israel, began to reign in Samaria, and he reigned for forty-one years.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod malum erat coram Domino: non recessit ab omnibus peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: Jeroboam did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from any of the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, who had caused Israel to sin and worship idols.

verses.latin: Ipse restituit terminos Israël ab introitu Emath usque ad mare Solitudinis, juxta sermonem Domini Dei Israël, quem locutus est per servum suum Jonam filium Amathi prophetam, qui erat de Geth, quæ est in Opher.
verses.english: It was Jeroboam who restored the borders of Israel, from the entrance of Hamath to the Sea of the Arabah, according to the word of the Lord, the God of Israel. This word was spoken through His servant Jonas, the son of Amathi, the prophet, who was from Gath-hepher.

verses.latin: Vidit enim Dominus afflictionem Israël amaram valde, et quod consumpti essent, et clausi usque ad eos, qui remanserant, et non superesset auxiliator Israël.
verses.english: For the Lord saw that the affliction of Israel was exceedingly bitter. He saw that they were utterly consumed and trapped, even those who remained, and there was no helper left for Israel.

verses.latin: Nec locutus est Dominus ut deleret nomen Israël sub cœlo: sed salvavit eos in manu Jeroboam filii Joas.
verses.english: The Lord had not yet declared that He would blot out the name of Israel from under the sky — meaning from existence. Instead, He saved them through the hand of Jeroboam, the son of Joas.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jeroboam, et universa quæ fecit, et fortitudo ejus, quomodo præliatus est, et quomodo restituit Damascum et Emath Judæ in Israël, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and everything he did, including his military strength, and how he fought, and how he recovered Damascus and Hamath for Judah within Israel — are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Jeroboam cum patribus suis, regibus Israël: et regnavit Zacharias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Jeroboam then slept with his fathers — meaning he died — with the other Kings of Israel. And his son, Zacharias, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno vicesimo septimo Jeroboam regis Israël regnavit Azarias filius Amasiæ regis Juda.
verses.english: In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam, the King of Israel, Azarias, the son of Amasias and King of Judah, began his reign.

verses.latin: Sedecim annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et quinquaginta duobus annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Jechelia de Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was sixteen years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for fifty-two years in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Jechelia, who was from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod placitum erat coram Domino juxta omnia quæ fecerat pater ejus Amasias.
verses.english: Azarias did what was pleasing in the sight of the Lord, following all the ways that his father Amasias had done.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et adolebat incensum in excelsis.
verses.english: Yet, he did not remove the high places of idolatry; the people still offered sacrifices and burned incense on those high places dedicated to false gods.

verses.latin: Dominus autem percussit regem, et fuit leprosus usque in diem mortis suæ, et habitabat in domo separata: Joatham vero filius regis regebat palatium, et judicabat populum terræ.
verses.english: But the Lord struck the king, and he became a leper until the day of his death. He lived in a separate house, isolated because of his illness. Joatham, the king's son, managed the palace and governed the people of the land in his father's stead.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Azariæ, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Azarias, and everything he did — are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Azarias cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum cum patribus suis in civitate David: et regnavit Joatham filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Azarias then slept with his fathers — meaning he died — and they buried him with his fathers in the City of David. And his son, Joatham, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno secundo Phacee filii Romeliæ regis Israël, regnavit Joatham filius Oziæ regis Juda.
verses.english: In the second year of Pekah, the son of Remaliah and King of Israel, Joatham, the son of Ozias and King of Judah, began his reign.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et sedecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Jerusa filia Sadoc.
verses.english: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for sixteen years in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Jerusa, the daughter of Sadoc.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod placitum erat coram Domino juxta omnia quæ fecerat Ozias pater ejus.
verses.english: Joatham did what was pleasing in the sight of the Lord, following all the ways that his father Ozias had done.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et adolebat incensum in excelsis: ipse ædificavit portam domus Domini excelsam.
verses.english: Yet, he did not remove the high places of idolatry; the people still offered sacrifices and burned incense on those high places dedicated to false gods. However, he himself built the upper gate of the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Anno secundo Joas filii Joachaz regis Israël, regnavit Amasias filius Joas regis Juda.
verses.english: In the second year of the reign of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, who was king of Israel, Amaziah, the son of Joash, king of Judah, began his reign.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et viginti novem annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Joadan de Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Jehoaddan, from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et fecit rectum coram Domino: verumtamen non sicut David pater ejus. Juxta omnia quæ fecit Joas pater ejus, ita fecit.
verses.english: He did what was right in the sight of the Lord God. However, he did not do so perfectly, like his ancestor David. Instead, he did everything just as Joash, his father, had done.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et adolebat incensum in excelsis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, Amaziah did not remove the high places, which were unauthorized altars for worship. The people continued to sacrifice and burn incense in these high places.

verses.latin: Cumque obtinuisset regnum, percussit servos suos qui interfecerant regem patrem suum.
verses.english: After he had secured his royal power, he executed his own servants who had assassinated King Joash, his father.

verses.latin: Filios autem eorum non interfecit juxta quod scriptum est in libro legis Moysi, sicut præcepit Dominus dicens: Non occidentur patres pro filiis, neque filii occidentur pro patribus, sed unusquisque in peccato suo morietur.
verses.english: But he did not put their children to death. He acted according to what is written in the book of the Law of Moses, as the Lord God had commanded, saying: "Fathers shall not be put to death for the sins of their children, nor shall children be put to death for the sins of their fathers. Rather, each person shall die for their own sin."

verses.latin: Ipse percussit Edom in valle Salinarum decem millia, et apprehendit Petram in prælio, vocavitque nomen ejus Jectehel, usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: It was Amaziah himself who struck down ten thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt. He also captured the city of Sela in battle, and he named it Joktheel, a name it bears even to this present day.

verses.latin: Tunc misit Amasias nuntios ad Joas filium Joachaz, filii Jehu regis Israël, dicens: Veni, et videamus nos mutuo.
verses.english: Then Amaziah sent messengers to Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, who was the son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying: "Come, let us confront each other in battle."

verses.latin: Misitque Joas rex Israël ad Amasiam regem Juda dicens: Carduus Libani misit ad cedrum Libani, dicens: Da filiam tuam filio meo uxorem: et transierunt bestiæ campi, et conculcaverunt carduum.
verses.english: King Joash of Israel sent back a message to King Amaziah of Judah, saying: "The insignificant thistle of Lebanon sent a message to the mighty cedar of Lebanon, saying: 'Give your daughter as a wife to my son.' But then, wild beasts of the field came by and trampled the thistle. This is a warning that you are beneath me."

verses.latin: Percussisti et interfecisti Edom, et sublevavit te cor tuum. Contentus esto gloriæ, et sede in domo tua: quare provocas malum, ut cadas tu, et tecum Juda?
verses.english: You have indeed struck down Edom and gained a victory, and your heart has become proud because of it. Be content with this glory, and stay in your own house. Why provoke such a disaster, that you should fall, and Judah with you?

verses.latin: Et noluit audire Amasias. Ascenditque Joas rex Israël, et ipse, et Amasias rex Juda, viderunt se mutuo in Bethsames civitate Juda.
verses.english: But Amaziah would not listen to this warning. So King Joash of Israel went up against him. Both he and King Amaziah of Judah confronted each other at Beth Shemesh, a city in Judah.

verses.latin: Percussusque est Juda coram Israël, et fugerunt unusquisque in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: And Judah was defeated before Israel. Every man then fled to his own tent, abandoning the battle.

verses.latin: Amasiam vero regem Juda filium Joas, filii Ochoziæ, apprehendit Joas rex Israël in Bethsames: et adduxit eum in Jerusalem, et destruxit murum Jerusalem a porta Ephraim usque ad portam Anguli, quadringentis cubitis.
verses.english: King Joash of Israel captured King Amaziah of Judah, the son of Joash, who was the son of Ahaziah, at Beth Shemesh. Joash then brought Amaziah back to Jerusalem and tore down the wall of Jerusalem, from the Gate of Ephraim to the Corner Gate, a distance of four hundred cubits.

verses.latin: Omne quoque aurum et argentum, et universa vasa quæ inventa sunt in templo Domini, et in thesauris regis, et obsides, reduxit in Samariam.
verses.english: He also took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels that were found in the Temple of the Lord God, as well as in the king's treasuries. He also took hostages, and then returned to Samaria, the capital of his kingdom.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, quæ fecit, et fortitudo ejus, qua præliatus est contra Amasiam regem Juda, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Joash, and his military might, and how he fought against Amaziah, king of Judah—are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joas cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Samaria cum regibus Israël: et regnavit Jeroboam filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Joash passed away and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel. And Jeroboam, his son, began to reign in his place.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Amasias filius Joas regis Juda, postquam mortuus est Joas filius Joachaz regis Israël, quindecim annis.
verses.english: Amaziah, the son of Joash, king of Judah, lived for fifteen years after the death of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, king of Israel.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Amasiæ, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Amaziah—are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Accusatoque conjurationis in Jerusalem, fugit in Lachis. Miseruntque post eum in Lachis, et interfecerunt eum ibi.
verses.english: After a conspiracy was formed against him in Jerusalem, Amaziah fled to Lachish. But they sent men after him to Lachish and killed him there.

verses.latin: Et asportaverunt eum in equis, sepultusque est in Jerusalem cum patribus suis in civitate David.
verses.english: They brought his body back on horses, and he was buried in Jerusalem with his fathers, in the City of David.

verses.latin: Tulit ergo omnis populus Juda Azariam annos sedecim natum, et constituit eum regem pro patre suo Amasia.
verses.english: Then all the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah. (He is also known as Uzziah.)

verses.latin: Ipse ædificavit Ailath, et restituit eam Juda, postquam dormivit rex cum patribus suis.
verses.english: It was Azariah who rebuilt Elath and restored it to Judah, after King Amaziah passed away and was buried with his ancestors.

verses.latin: Anno quintodecimo Amasiæ filii Joas regis Juda, regnavit Jeroboam filius Joas regis Israël in Samaria, quadraginta et uno anno.
verses.english: In the fifteenth year of Amaziah, the son of Joash, who was king of Judah, Jeroboam, the son of Joash, king of Israel, began his reign in Samaria. He reigned for forty-one years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat coram Domino: non recessit ab omnibus peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord God. He did not turn away from any of the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin by establishing idol worship.

verses.latin: Ipse restituit terminos Israël ab introitu Emath usque ad mare Solitudinis, juxta verbum Domini Dei Israël, quod locutus est per servum suum Jonam filium Amathi prophetam, qui erat de Geth, quæ est in Opher.
verses.english: It was Jeroboam who restored the borders of Israel, from the entrance of Hamath to the Sea of the Arabah (which is the Dead Sea). He did this according to the word of the Lord God of Israel, which He had spoken through His servant Jonah, the prophet, the son of Amittai, who was from Gath Hepher.

verses.latin: Vidit enim Dominus afflictionem Israël amaram valde, et quod consumpti essent usque ad clausum, et usque ad apertum, et non esset qui auxiliaretur Israël.
verses.english: For the Lord God saw the very bitter affliction of Israel. There was no one left, whether enslaved or free, and no one to help Israel.

verses.latin: Nec est locutus Dominus ut deleret nomen Israël sub cælo, sed salvavit eos in manu Jeroboam filii Joas.
verses.english: And the Lord God had not said that He would blot out the name of Israel from under heaven. So He saved them by the hand of Jeroboam, the son of Joash.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jeroboam, et universa quæ fecit, et fortitudo ejus, quomodo præliatus est, et quomodo restituit Damascum et Emath Judæ, in Israël, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and all that he did, and his military might, and how he fought, and how he restored Damascus and Hamath to Judah within Israel—are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Jeroboam cum patribus suis, regibus Israël: et regnavit Zacharias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Jeroboam passed away and was buried with the kings of Israel. And Zechariah, his son, began to reign in his place.

verses.latin: Anno vicesimo septimo Jeroboam regis Israël regnavit Azarias filius Amasiæ regis Juda.
verses.english: In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam, king of Israel, Azariah, the son of Amaziah, king of Judah, began his reign.

verses.latin: Sexdecim annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et quinquaginta duobus annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Jechelia de Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was sixteen years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for fifty-two years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Jecoliah, from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod placitum erat coram Domino juxta omnia quæ fecerat pater ejus Amasias.
verses.english: And he did what was pleasing in the sight of the Lord God, just as his father Amaziah had done in every way.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc enim populus sacrificabat et adolebat in excelsis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he did not remove the high places, which were unauthorized altars for worship. The people still continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense there.

verses.latin: Percussit autem Dominus regem, et leprosus fuit usque ad diem mortis suæ, et habitabat in domo separata: Joatham vero filius regis regebat domum, et judicabat populum terræ.
verses.english: But the Lord God struck the king, and he remained a leper until the day of his death. Because of his leprosy, he had to live in a separate house, isolated from the people. And Jotham, the king's son, was in charge of the royal household and governed the people of the land.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Azariæ, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Azariah, and all that he did—are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Azarias cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum cum patribus suis in civitate David: et regnavit Joatham filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Azariah passed away and was buried with his fathers in the City of David. And Jotham, his son, began to reign in his place.

verses.latin: Anno tricesimo octavo Azariæ regis Juda regnavit Zacharias filius Jeroboam super Israël in Samaria sex mensibus.
verses.english: In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah, king of Judah, Zechariah, the son of Jeroboam, reigned over Israel in Samaria for six months.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat coram Domino sicut fecerunt patres ejus: non recessit a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord God, just as his fathers had done. He did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin.

verses.latin: Conjuravitque contra eum Sellum filius Jabes: et percussit eum in publico, interfecitque, et regnavit pro eo.
verses.english: And Shallum, the son of Jabesh, conspired against him. Shallum struck him down in public, killed him, and then began to reign in his place.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Zachariæ scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël.
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Zechariah—are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Anno secundo Joas filii Joachaz regis Israël, regnavit Amasias filius Joas regis Juda.
verses.english: In the second year of Joas, who was the son of Joachaz and king of Israel, Amasias, the son of Joas, began his reign as king over Judah.

verses.latin: Vicesimum quintum annum habebat quando regnare cœpit: et viginti et novem annis regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Joadan de Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Joadan, and she was from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et fecit rectum coram Domino: verumtamen non sicut David pater ejus. Juxta omnia quæ fecit Joas pater suus, ita fecit.
verses.english: He did what was right in the sight of the Lord, yet not like David, his great ancestor. He did everything just as his father Joas had done.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et adurebat incensum in excelsis.
verses.english: However, he did not remove the high places of worship. The people still continued to sacrifice and burn incense there.

verses.latin: Cumque obtinuisset regnum, percussit servos suos qui interfecerant regem patrem suum:
verses.english: When he had taken firm control of his kingdom, he executed the servants who had murdered Joas, his royal father.

verses.latin: Filios vero parricidarum non occidit, juxta quod scriptum est in libro legis Moysi, sicut præcepit Dominus dicens: Non morientur patres pro filiis, neque filii morientur pro patribus, sed unusquisque in peccato suo morietur.
verses.english: But he did not put the children of those murderers to death, according to what is written in the book of the law of Moses—for the Lord had commanded this, saying: "Fathers shall not die for their children, nor shall children die for their fathers, but each one shall die for his own sin."

verses.latin: Ipse percussit Edom in Valle Salinarum decem millia: et apprehendit Petram in prælio, vocavitque nomen ejus Jectehel, usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: He himself struck down Edom in the Valley of Salt, ten thousand men; and he captured the city of Sela in battle, and he called its name Jectehel, which it is still called to this very day.

verses.latin: Tunc misit Amasias nuntios ad Joas filium Joachaz, filii Jehu regis Israël, dicens: Veni, et videamus nos.
verses.english: Then Amasias sent messengers to Joas, the son of Joachaz and grandson of Jehu, king of Israel, saying: "Come, let us look each other in the face"—meaning, "Let us fight in battle."

verses.latin: Remisitque Joas rex Israël ad Amasiam regem Juda, dicens: Lilium agri misit ad cedrum Libani, dicens: Da filiam tuam filio meo uxorem. Et transierunt bestiæ campi, et conculcaverunt lilium.
verses.english: Joas, the king of Israel, sent back a reply to Amasias, king of Judah, saying: "The thistles of the field sent word to the cedars of Lebanon, saying: 'Give your daughter to my son as a wife.' But then, wild beasts of the field came by and trampled down the thistles."

verses.latin: Percussisti, et invaluisti super Edom: et sublevavit te cor tuum. Gloriare, et sede in domo tua: quare provocas malum tuum, ut cadas tu, et Juda tecum?
verses.english: "You have indeed struck down Edom and you have grown arrogant because of it. Be content with your victory and remain in your own house. Why provoke such evil against yourself, that both you and Judah should fall with you?"

verses.latin: Et noluit Amasias acquiescere. Ascenditque Joas rex Israël, et ipse et Amasias rex Juda, et viderunt se in Bethsames oppido Judæ.
verses.english: But Amasias would not listen to the warning. So Joas, the king of Israel, went up against him, and Amasias, the king of Judah, also went forth; and they faced each other in Bethsames, a town in Judah.

verses.latin: Percussusque est Juda a commisso Israël: et fugerunt unusquisque in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: Judah was defeated by Israel in the battle, and every man of Judah fled back to his own tent.

verses.latin: Amasiam vero regem Juda, filium Joas, filii Ochoziæ, cepit Joas rex Israël in Bethsames, et adduxit Jerusalem: et destruxit murum Jerusalem a porta Ephraim usque ad portam Anguli, quadringentis cubitis.
verses.english: Joas, the king of Israel, captured Amasias, the king of Judah (who was the son of Joas, and grandson of Ochozias), at Bethsames, and brought him to Jerusalem. Then Joas tore down the wall of Jerusalem, from the Gate of Ephraim to the Corner Gate, a length of four hundred cubits—which is about 600 feet.

verses.latin: Omne quoque aurum et argentum, et universa vasa quæ invenit in domo Domini, et in thesauris regis, et obsides, reduxit in Samariam.
verses.english: He also took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels that he found in the house of the Lord and in the king's treasuries, and he brought the hostages back with him to Samaria.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joas, quæ fecit, et fortitudo ejus, et quomodo pugnavit contra Amasiam regem Juda, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Joas, and his strength, and how he fought against Amasias, the king of Judah—are these not written in the book of the words of the days of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joas cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Samaria cum regibus Israël: et regnavit Jeroboam filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Joas slept with his fathers, and he was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel; and Jeroboam, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Amasias filius Joas rex Juda postquam mortuus est Joas filius Joachaz rex Israël quindecim annis.
verses.english: Amasias, the son of Joas, king of Judah, lived fifteen years after the death of Joas, the son of Joachaz, king of Israel.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Amasiæ, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Amasias—are these not written in the book of the words of the days of the kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Factaque est contra eum conjuratio in Jerusalem: et fugam iniit in Lachis. Miseruntque post eum in Lachis, et interfecerunt eum ibi.
verses.english: And a conspiracy was formed against him in Jerusalem, so he fled to Lachis. But they sent men after him to Lachis, and they put him to death there.

verses.latin: Et asportaverunt eum in equis, et sepultus est in Jerusalem cum patribus suis in civitate David.
verses.english: And they brought his body back on horses, and he was buried in Jerusalem with his fathers, in the City of David.

verses.latin: Tulit ergo omnis populus Judæ Azariam annorum sedecim, et constituerunt eum regem pro patre suo Amasia.
verses.english: Then all the people of Judah took Azarias, who was sixteen years old, and they made him king in place of his father Amasias.

verses.latin: Ipse ædificavit Ailath, et restituit eam Judæ postquam dormivit rex cum patribus suis.
verses.english: It was he who built Ailath and restored it to Judah, after the king—his father—had slept with his fathers.

verses.latin: Anno quintodecimo Amasiæ filii Joas regis Juda, regnavit Jeroboam filius Joas regis Israël in Samaria, quadraginta et uno anno.
verses.english: In the fifteenth year of Amasias, the son of Joas and king of Judah, Jeroboam, the son of Joas, began to reign as king over Israel in Samaria, and he reigned for forty-one years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat coram Domino: non recessit ab omnibus peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from any of the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, who had made Israel to sin.

verses.latin: Ipse restituit terminos Israël ab introitu Emath usque ad mare Solitudinis juxta verbum Domini Dei Israël, quod locutus est per servum suum Jonam filium Amathi prophetam, qui erat de Geth, quæ est in Opher.
verses.english: It was he who restored the borders of Israel, from the entrance of Emath as far as the Sea of the Desert, according to the word of the Lord, the God of Israel, which He spoke through His servant Jonas, the son of Amathi, the prophet, who was from Geth-opher.

verses.latin: Vidit enim Dominus afflictionem Israël amaram nimis, et quod consumpti essent, et clausi, et non esset auxiliator Israël.
verses.english: For the Lord saw that the affliction of Israel was exceedingly bitter, and that they were utterly consumed and shut in, and there was no helper for Israel.

verses.latin: Nec est locutus Dominus ut deleret nomen Israël sub cælo, sed salvavit eos in manu Jeroboam filii Joas.
verses.english: And the Lord had not said that He would blot out the name of Israel from under the heavens; rather, He saved them by the hand of Jeroboam, the son of Joas.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jeroboam, et universa quæ fecit, et fortitudo ejus, quo modo pugnavit, et quo modo restituit Damascum et Emath Judæ in Israël, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and all that he did, and his strength, how he fought, and how he restored Damascus and Emath to Judah in Israel—are these not written in the book of the words of the days of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Jeroboam cum patribus suis Israël, et regnavit Zacharias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Jeroboam slept with his fathers, the kings of Israel, and Zacharias, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno secundo Joas filii Joachaz regis Israël, regnavit Amasias filius Joas regis Juda.
verses.english: In the second year that Joas, the son of Joachaz, was king of Israel, Amasias, the son of Joas, began his reign as king of Judah.

verses.latin: Vicesimum quintum annum habebat quando regnare cœpit: et viginti et novem annis regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomen matris ejus Joadan de Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Joadan, and she was from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque rectum coram Domino: verumtamen non sicut David pater ejus. Omnia peragenda fecit sicut Joas pater suus.
verses.english: He did what was right in the sight of the Lord; however, not in the same manner as his ancestor David. Amasias did everything that was to be done according to the ways of Joas his father.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et adurebat in excelsis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he did not remove the high places of worship. The people continued to sacrifice and burn incense there.

verses.latin: Cumque obtinuisset regnum, percussit servos suos, qui interfecerant regem patrem suum.
verses.english: As soon as he had firmly established his kingship, he executed the servants who had murdered his father, the king.

verses.latin: Filios autem eorum, qui occiderant, non occidit, juxta quod scriptum est in libro legis Moysi, sicut præcepit Dominus dicens: Non occidentur patres pro filiis, neque filii occidentur pro patribus: sed unusquisque in peccato suo morietur.
verses.english: However, he did not put to death the children of the murderers. He acted according to what is written in the Book of the Law of Moses, for the Lord had commanded, saying: 'Fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor shall children be put to death for their fathers; rather, each person shall die for their own sin.'

verses.latin: Ipse percussit Edom in valle Salinarum decem millia: et apprehendit Petram in prælio, vocavitque nomen ejus Jecetheel, usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: Amasias himself struck down ten thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt, and he captured Petra—the city then called Sela—in battle. He then renamed it Jectheel, which it is still called to this very day.

verses.latin: Tunc misit Amasias nuncios ad Joas filium Joachaz, filii Jehu regis Israël, dicens: Veni, et videamus nos mutuo.
verses.english: Then Amasias sent messengers to Joas, the son of Joachaz, the son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying: 'Come, let us meet face-to-face in battle!'

verses.latin: Remisitque Joas rex Israël ad Amasiam regem Juda, dicens: Lilium agri misit ad cedrum Libani, dicens: Da filiam tuam filio meo uxorem: et transierunt bestiæ agri, et conculcaverunt lilium.
verses.english: Joas, king of Israel, sent back this reply to Amasias, king of Judah: 'A lowly lily of the field once sent a message to the mighty cedar of Lebanon, saying: "Give your daughter to my son as a wife." But then, wild beasts of the field came by and trampled the lily underfoot.'

verses.latin: Tu percussisti Edom, et elevaverunt te cor tuum: contentus esto gloria tua, et sede in domo tua: quare provocas malum, ut cadas tu, et Juda tecum?
verses.english: You have struck down Edom, and your heart has become arrogant because of it. Be content with your glory, and remain in your own palace! Why do you provoke this evil that will cause both you and Judah to fall with you?'

verses.latin: Et non acquievit Amasias. Ascenditque Joas rex Israël, et ipse, et viderunt se mutuo, ipse et Amasias rex Juda in Bethsames Juda.
verses.english: But Amasias would not yield. So Joas, king of Israel, went up with his forces, and he and Amasias, king of Judah, met face-to-face in Beth-shemesh of Judah for battle.

verses.latin: Percussusque est Juda coram Israël, et fugerunt unusquisque in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: Judah was defeated by Israel, and every man fled home to his own dwelling.

verses.latin: Amasiam vero regem Juda filium Joas filii Ochoziæ, cepit Joas rex Israël in Bethsames: et adduxit eum in Jerusalem, et destruxit murum Jerusalem, a porta Ephraim usque ad portam Anguli, quadringentis cubitis.
verses.english: Joas, king of Israel, captured Amasias, king of Judah—the son of Joas and grandson of Ochozias—in Beth-shemesh. He then brought Amasias to Jerusalem and demolished a section of Jerusalem's city wall, from the Gate of Ephraim to the Corner Gate, a distance of four hundred cubits.

verses.latin: Omnemque aurum et argentum, et omnia vasa quæ inventa fuerant in domo Domini, et in thesauris regis, et obsides, reduxit in Samariam.
verses.english: Joas took all the gold and silver, along with all the vessels he found in the Temple of the Lord and in the royal treasuries. He also took hostages, and then he returned with all of it to Samaria.

verses.latin: Reliqva autem sermonum Joas, quæ fecit, et fortitudo ejus, quomodo pugnavit contra Amasiam regem Juda, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: As for the rest of the deeds of Joas, and all his might, and how he fought against Amasias, king of Judah—are these not all written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joas cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in Samaria cum regibus Israël: et regnavit Jeroboam filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Joas died and was buried in Samaria alongside the other kings of Israel. His son, Jeroboam, then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Amasias filius Joas regis Juda, postquam mortuus est Joas filius Joachaz regis Israël, quindecim annis.
verses.english: Amasias, the son of Joas, king of Judah, lived for fifteen years after the death of Joas, the son of Joachaz, king of Israel.

verses.latin: Reliqva autem sermonum Amasiæ, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: As for the rest of the deeds of Amasias, are these not all written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Cumque facta esset conjuratio contra eum in Jerusalem, fugit in Lachis. Miseruntque post eum in Lachis, et interfecerunt eum ibi.
verses.english: When a conspiracy was formed against him in Jerusalem, Amasias fled to Lachish. But his enemies sent men after him to Lachish and murdered him there.

verses.latin: Et asportaverunt eum in equis, et sepultus est in Jerusalem cum patribus suis in civitate David.
verses.english: His body was brought back on horses, and he was buried in Jerusalem with his ancestors in the City of David.

verses.latin: Omnis autem populus Juda sumpsit Azariam annos sedecim natum, et constituit eum regem pro patre suo Amasia.
verses.english: Then all the people of Judah took Azarias, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amasias.

verses.latin: Ipse ædificavit Ailath, et restituit eam Juda, postquam dormivit rex cum patribus suis.
verses.english: It was Azarias who rebuilt Ailath and restored it to Judah, after his father, the king, had died.

verses.latin: Anno quintodecimo Amasiæ filii Joas regis Juda, regnavit Jeroboam filius Joas regis Israël in Samaria, quadraginta et uno anno.
verses.english: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Amasias, the son of Joas, king of Judah, Jeroboam, the son of Joas, began his reign as king of Israel in Samaria, and he reigned for forty-one years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat coram Domino: non recessit ab omnibus peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from any of the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, who had caused Israel to sin.

verses.latin: Ipse restituit terminos Israël ab introitu Emath usque ad mare Solitudinis, juxta verbum Domini Dei Israël, quod locutus est per servum suum Jonam filium Amathi prophetam, qui erat de Geth, quæ est in Opher.
verses.english: It was Jeroboam who restored the borders of Israel, from the entrance of Hamath all the way to the Sea of the Arabah—the Dead Sea—just as the Lord, the God of Israel, had declared. This was spoken through His servant Jonas, the prophet, the son of Amathi, who was from Gath-hepher.

verses.latin: Vidit enim Dominus afflictionem Israël amaram valde, et quod consumpti essent, et non superesset clusus, neque apertus, neque auxiliator Israël.
verses.english: For the Lord had seen how very bitter was the affliction of Israel. They were utterly consumed, and there was no one left to help, neither bond nor free; no one to come to Israel's aid.

verses.latin: Nec locutus est Dominus ut deleret nomen Israël sub cælo, sed salvavit eos in manu Jeroboam filii Joas.
verses.english: The Lord had not yet declared that He would blot out the name of Israel from the face of the earth. So, He saved them by the hand of Jeroboam, the son of Joas.

verses.latin: Reliqva autem sermonum Jeroboam, et omnium quæ fecit, et fortitudo ejus, quomodo præliavit, et quomodo restituit Damascum et Emath Juda in Israël, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: As for the rest of the deeds of Jeroboam, and all that he did, and his might—how he fought his battles, and how he restored Damascus and Hamath, previously held by Judah, back to Israel—are these not all written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Jeroboam cum patribus suis regibus Israël, et sepultus est in Samaria: et regnavit Zacharias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Jeroboam died and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel. Then his son Zacharias reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno vicesimo septimo Jeroboam regis Israël, regnavit Azarias filius Amasiæ regis Juda.
verses.english: In the twenty-seventh year of King Jeroboam's reign in Israel, Azariah, the son of King Amaziah of Judah, began his reign.

verses.latin: Sedecim annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et quinquaginta duobus annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Jechelia de Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned for fifty-two years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Jechelia, who was from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod erat rectum coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerat Amasias pater ejus.
verses.english: He did what was right in the sight of the Lord, just as his father Amaziah had done in all things.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et succendebat in excelsis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he did not remove the high places of worship. The people still continued to sacrifice and burn incense on these high places.

verses.latin: Percussit ergo Dominus regem, et fuit leprosus usque ad diem mortis suæ, et habitabat in domo privata separatim. Joatham vero filius regis gubernabat domum, et judicabat populum terræ.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord struck the king with leprosy, and he remained a leper until the day of his death. He lived in a private house, set apart from others. Jotham, the king's son, managed the royal household and governed the people of the land.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Azariæ, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: All the other deeds of Azariah, and everything he accomplished, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Et dormivit Azarias cum patribus suis: et sepelierunt eum cum patribus suis in civitate David: regnavitque Joatham filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Azariah died and was buried with his ancestors in the City of David. His son Jotham then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo octavo Azariæ regis Juda, regnavit Zacharias filius Jeroboam super Israël in Samaria sex mensibus.
verses.english: In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah's reign in Judah, Zechariah, the son of Jeroboam, reigned over Israel in Samaria for six months.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat coram Domino, sicut fecerant patres ejus: non recessit a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, just as his ancestors had done. He did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin.

verses.latin: Conjuravit autem contra eum Sellum filius Jabes: percussitque eum publice, et interfecit, regnavitque pro eo.
verses.english: Shallum, son of Jabesh, conspired against him. He struck Zechariah down in public, killing him, and then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Zachariæ, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: All the other deeds of Zechariah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Ipse est sermo Domini, quem locutus est ad Jehu, dicens: Filii usque ad quartam generationem sedebunt tibi super thronum Israël. Factumque est ita.
verses.english: This fulfilled the word of the Lord which He had spoken to Jehu, saying, "Your sons shall sit on the throne of Israel for four generations." And so it came to pass.

verses.latin: Sellum filius Jabes regnavit anno trigesimo nono Oziæ regis Juda, et regnavit uno mense in Samaria.
verses.english: Shallum, son of Jabesh, began to reign in the thirty-ninth year of Uzziah, king of Judah. He reigned for only one month in Samaria.

verses.latin: Et ascendit Manahem filius Gadi de Thersa in Samariam, et percussit Sellum filium Jabes in Samaria, et interfecit eum, regnavitque pro eo.
verses.english: Then Menahem, son of Gadi, went up from Tirzah to Samaria. He struck down Shallum, son of Jabesh, in Samaria and killed him, then he reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Sellum, et conjuratio ejus, quam fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: All the other deeds of Shallum, and the conspiracy he carried out, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Tunc percussit Manahem Thapsam, et omnes qui erant in ea, et terminos ejus, de Thersa, eo quod non aperuissent ei: et interfecit omnes prægnantes ejus, sciditque eas.
verses.english: At that time, Menahem struck down Tappuah and everyone in it, and all its territory, starting from Tirzah, because they had not opened their gates to him. He killed all the pregnant women there and ripped them open.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo nono Azariæ regis Juda, regnavit Manahem filius Gadi super Israël decem annis in Samaria.
verses.english: In the thirty-ninth year of Azariah's reign in Judah, Menahem, son of Gadi, began his ten-year reign over Israel in Samaria.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat coram Domino: non recessit a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël, cunctis diebus ejus.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He never departed from the sins of Jeroboam, son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin, throughout all his days.

verses.latin: Venit Phul rex Assyriorum in terram: deditque Manahem Phul mille talenta argenti, ut esset ei in auxilium, et firmaret regnum ejus.
verses.english: Pul, the king of the Assyrians, came to the land. Menahem gave Pul a thousand talents of silver so that Pul would help him and strengthen his reign.

verses.latin: Et exegit Manahem pecuniam a populo Israël, ab omnibus potentibus divitiis, singulos quinquagenos siclos argenti, ut daret regi Assyriorum: reversusque est rex Assyriorum, et non est moratus in terra.
verses.english: Menahem exacted the money from the people of Israel, from all the powerful and wealthy men, demanding fifty shekels of silver from each, to give to the king of the Assyrians. So the king of Assyria turned back and did not remain in the land.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Manahem, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: All the other deeds of Menahem, and everything he accomplished, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Et dormivit Manahem cum patribus suis: et regnavit Phaceia filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Menahem died and was buried with his ancestors. His son Pekahiah then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno quinquagesimo Azariæ regis Juda, regnavit Phaceia filius Manahem super Israël in Samaria duobus annis.
verses.english: In the fiftieth year of Azariah's reign in Judah, Pekahiah, son of Menahem, reigned over Israel in Samaria for two years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat coram Domino: non recessit a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin.

verses.latin: Conjuravit autem contra eum Phacee filius Romeliæ, dux ejus, et habebat secum quinquaginta viros de filiis Galaaditarum: percussitque eum in Samaria, in turre domus regiæ juxta Argob, et juxta Areie: et interfecit eum, regnavitque pro eo.
verses.english: However, Pekah, son of Remaliah, his captain, conspired against him. He had fifty men from the sons of the Gileadites with him. He struck Pekahiah down in Samaria, in the citadel of the royal palace, near Argob and Arieh. He killed him and then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Phacei, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: All the other deeds of Pekahiah, and everything he accomplished, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Anno quinquagesimo secundo Azariæ regis Juda, regnavit Phacee filius Romeliæ super Israël in Samaria viginti annis.
verses.english: In the fifty-second year of Azariah's reign in Judah, Pekah, son of Remaliah, reigned over Israel in Samaria for twenty years.

verses.latin: Et fecit quod malum erat coram Domino: non recessit a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin.

verses.latin: In diebus Phacee regis Israël, venit Theglathphalasar rex Assyriorum, et cepit Ajjon, et Abel domum Maacha, et Janoe, et Cedes, et Asor, et Galaad, et Galilæam, et universam terram Nephtali: et transtulit eos in Assyriam.
verses.english: In the days of Pekah, king of Israel, Tiglath-Pileser, king of the Assyrians, came and captured Ijon, Abel-Beth-Maachah, Janoah, Kedesh, Hazor, Gilead, Galilee, and all the land of Naphtali. He deported the inhabitants of these places to Assyria.

verses.latin: Conjuravit autem et Osee filius Ela, et percussit Phacee filium Romeliæ, et interfecit eum: regnavitque pro eo, vicesimo anno Joatham filii Oziæ.
verses.english: Then Hoshea, son of Elah, conspired against Pekah, son of Remaliah, striking him down and killing him. He then reigned in his place, in the twentieth year of Jotham, son of Uzziah.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Phacee, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: All the other deeds of Pekah, and everything he accomplished, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Anno secundo Phacee filii Romeliæ regis Israël, regnavit Joatham filius Oziæ regis Juda.
verses.english: In the second year of Pekah's reign, son of Remaliah, king of Israel, Jotham, son of Uzziah, king of Judah, began his reign.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et sedecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Jerusa filia Sadoc.
verses.english: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned for sixteen years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Jerusha, daughter of Zadok.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod rectum erat coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerat Ozias pater ejus.
verses.english: He did what was right in the sight of the Lord, just as his father Uzziah had done in all things.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc populus immolabat et succendebat incensum in excelsis: ipse ædificavit portam domus Domini excelsam.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he did not remove the high places of worship. The people still continued to sacrifice and burn incense on these high places. He himself built the upper gate of the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joatham, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: All the other deeds of Jotham, and everything he accomplished, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.latin: In diebus illis cœpit Dominus mittere in Juda Rasin regem Syriæ, et Phacee filium Romeliæ.
verses.english: In those days, the Lord began to send Rezin, king of Syria, and Pekah, son of Remaliah, against Judah.

verses.latin: Et dormivit Joatham cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David patris sui: regnavitque Achaz filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Jotham died and was buried with his ancestors in the City of David, his father's city. His son Ahaz then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno vigesimo septimo Jeroboam regis Israël regnavit Azarias filius Amasiae regis Juda.
verses.english: In the twenty-seventh year of King Jeroboam's reign over Israel, Azariah, the son of King Amaziah of Judah, began to reign as king of Judah. —This Jeroboam was Jeroboam II, the son of Joash.

verses.latin: Quindecim annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et quinquaginta duobus annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Jechelia de Jerusalem.
verses.english: He was fifteen years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for fifty-two years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Jechelia, from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod rectum est coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerat Amasias pater ejus.
verses.english: And he did what was right in the sight of the Lord, just as his father Amaziah had done in all things.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc enim populus immolabat et adolebat in excelsis.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he did not remove the high places; for the people still offered sacrifices and burned incense there. —These 'high places' were unauthorized sites of worship outside of the Temple in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Percussit autem Dominus regem, et fuit leprosus usque ad diem mortis suæ, et habitabat in domo privata: Joatham vero filius regis gubernabat domum, et judicabat populum terræ.
verses.english: But the Lord struck the king with leprosy, and he remained a leper until the day of his death. He lived in a separate house, while Jotham, the king's son, governed the royal household and judged the people of the land.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Azariæ, et omnia quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Azariah, and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Azarias cum patribus suis: et sepelierunt eum cum patribus suis in civitate David: regnavitque Joatham filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Azariah slept with his fathers, and they buried him with his fathers in the City of David. His son Jotham then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo octavo Azariæ regis Juda regnavit Zacharias filius Jeroboam super Israël sex mensibus.
verses.english: In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah's reign over Judah, Zachariah, the son of Jeroboam (Jeroboam II), began to reign over Israel for six months.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod malum est coram Domino, sicut fecerant patres ejus: non recessit a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, just as his royal ancestors had done. He did not turn away from the sins introduced by Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, who had led Israel into idolatry and false worship. —The 'sins of Jeroboam' refer to the worship of golden calves at Dan and Bethel.

verses.latin: Conjuravit autem contra eum Sellum filius Jabes, et percussit eum palam, interfecitque, ac regnavit pro eo.
verses.english: But Shallum, the son of Jabesh, conspired against him. He struck him down openly, killing him, and then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Zachariæ, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Zachariah, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Hoc est verbum Domini quod locutus est ad Jehu, dicens: Filii tui usque ad quartam generationem sedebunt super thronum Israël. Et factum est ita.
verses.english: This fulfilled the word of the Lord which He had spoken to Jehu, saying: 'Your sons shall sit on the throne of Israel until the fourth generation.' And so it came to pass. —This prophecy was fulfilled with Zachariah, the fourth descendant of Jehu.

verses.latin: Sellum filius Jabes regnavit trigesimo nono anno Azariæ regis Juda: et regnavit uno mense in Samaria.
verses.english: Shallum, the son of Jabesh, began to reign in the thirty-ninth year of King Azariah of Judah. He reigned for only one month in Samaria.

verses.latin: Et ascendit Manahem filius Gadi de Thersa in Samariam, et percussit Sellum filium Jabes in Samaria, et interfecit eum, regnavitque pro eo.
verses.english: Then Menahem, the son of Gadi, went up from Tirzah to Samaria. He struck down Shallum, the son of Jabesh, in Samaria, killed him, and then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Sellum, et conjuratio ejus, qua conjuravit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
