verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Shallum, and the conspiracy by which he conspired, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Tunc percussit Manahem Thapsam, et omnes qui erant in ea, et terminos ejus de Thersa, eo quod non aperuissent ei: et interfecit omnes prægnantes ejus, sciditque eas.
verses.english: Then Menahem struck down Tiphsah, and all who were in it, and its territories from Tirzah, because they had not opened their gates to him. He killed all the pregnant women, ripping them open.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo nono Azariæ regis Juda regnavit Manahem filius Gadi super Israël decem annis in Samaria.
verses.english: In the thirty-ninth year of Azariah's reign over Judah, Menahem, the son of Gadi, began to reign over Israel for ten years in Samaria.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod malum est coram Domino: non recessit a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël, cunctis diebus ejus.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from the sins introduced by Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, who had caused Israel to sin, throughout all his days.

verses.latin: Venit Phul rex Assyriorum in terram, et dedit Manahem Phul mille talenta argenti, ut esset ei in auxilio, et firmaret regnum ejus.
verses.english: Pul, the king of the Assyrians, came into the land of Israel. Menahem, in an act of submission, gave Pul a thousand talents of silver so that Pul would offer him military aid and strengthen his hold on the kingdom. —Pul is also known as Tiglath-Pileser III, a powerful Assyrian king.

verses.latin: Et præcepit Manahem universis divitibus Israël, ut darent pecuniam Phul, singuli quingentos siclos argenti, ad impetrandum auxilium regis Assyriorum: reversusque est rex Assyriorum, et non est moratus in terra.
verses.english: Menahem then commanded all the wealthy men of Israel to give money to Pul, each man contributing five hundred shekels of silver, to secure the help of the king of Assyria. So the king of Assyria returned to his own land and did not remain in Israel.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Manahem, et omnia quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Menahem, and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Manahem cum patribus suis: regnavitque Phaceia filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Menahem slept with his fathers. His son Pekahiah then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno quinquagesimo Azariæ regis Juda regnavit Phaceia filius Manahem super Israël in Samaria duobus annis.
verses.english: In the fiftieth year of Azariah's reign over Judah, Pekahiah, the son of Menahem, began to reign over Israel in Samaria for two years.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod malum est coram Domino: non recessit a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from the sins introduced by Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, who had caused Israel to sin.

verses.latin: Conjuravit autem contra eum Phacee filius Romeliæ, dux ejus, et percussit eum in Samaria, in turre domus regalis, juxta Argob et juxta Arie, et cum eo quinquaginta viros de filiis Galaaditarum: et interfecit eum, regnavitque pro eo.
verses.english: But Pekah, the son of Remaliah, his own captain, conspired against him. Pekah struck him down in Samaria, in the citadel of the royal palace, in the presence of Argob and Arie, along with fifty men from the Gileadites. Pekah killed him and then reigned in his place. —The 'citadel of the royal palace' refers to a fortified inner part of the king's residence.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Phaceia, et omnia quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Pekahiah, and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Anno quinquagesimo secundo Azariæ regis Juda regnavit Phacee filius Romeliæ super Israël in Samaria viginti annis.
verses.english: In the fifty-second year of Azariah's reign over Judah, Pekah, the son of Remaliah, began to reign over Israel in Samaria for twenty years.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod malum est coram Domino: non recessit a peccatis Jeroboam filii Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël.
verses.english: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not turn away from the sins introduced by Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, who had caused Israel to sin.

verses.latin: In diebus Phacee regis Israël venit Theglathphalasar rex Assyriorum, et cepit Ajjon, et Abel domum Maacha, et Janoe, et Cedes, et Asor, et Galaad, et Galilæam, et universam terram Nepthali: et transtulit eos in Assyrios.
verses.english: In the days of Pekah, king of Israel, Tiglath-Pileser, the king of Assyria, came and captured Ijon, Abel-Beth-Maachah, Janoah, Kedesh, Hazor, Gilead, Galilee, and all the land of Naphtali. He then deported their inhabitants to Assyria. —This Tiglath-Pileser is the same King Pul mentioned earlier, and this deportation was a common Assyrian tactic to suppress rebellion.

verses.latin: Fecitque conjurationem Osee filius Ela contra Phacee filium Romeliæ, et percussit eum, et interfecit: regnavitque pro eo vigesimo anno Joatham filii Azariæ.
verses.english: Then Hoshea, the son of Elah, conspired against Pekah, the son of Remaliah. He struck him down and killed him, and then reigned in his place in the twentieth year of Jotham, the son of Azariah.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Phacee, et omnia quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Israël?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Pekah, and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?

verses.latin: Anno secundo Phacee filii Romeliæ regis Israël regnavit Joatham filius Azariæ regis Juda.
verses.english: In the second year of Pekah's reign over Israel (Pekah, the son of Remaliah), Jotham, the son of King Azariah of Judah, began to reign as king of Judah.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et sedecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Jerusa filia Sadoc.
verses.english: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for sixteen years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Jerusha, the daughter of Zadok.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod rectum est coram Domino: juxta omnia quæ fecerat Azarias pater ejus, fecit.
verses.english: And he did what was right in the sight of the Lord, just as his father Azariah had done in all things.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit: adhuc enim populus immolabat et adolebat in excelsis. Ipse ædificavit portam domus Domini excelsam.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he did not remove the high places; for the people still offered sacrifices and burned incense there. It was he who built the Upper Gate of the House of the Lord. —The 'high places' were unauthorized sites of worship outside of the Temple in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joatham, et universa quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: In diebus illis cœpit Dominus mittere in Juda Rasin regem Syriæ, et Phacee filium Romeliæ.
verses.english: In those days, the Lord began to send against Judah King Rezin of Syria, and Pekah, the son of Remaliah. —Pekah was the reigning king of Israel at this time.

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joatham cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David patris sui: et regnavit Achaz filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Jotham slept with his fathers, and he was buried with them in the City of David, his father. His son Ahaz then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno decimo septimo Phacee filii Romeliae regnavit Achaz filius Joatham regis Juda.
verses.english: In the seventeenth year of the reign of Pekah, son of Remaliah, Ahaz, son of Jotham, who was the King of Judah, began his reign.

verses.latin: Viginti annorum erat Achaz cum regnare cœpisset, et sedecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: et non fecit quod placitum erat in conspectu Domini Dei sui, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for sixteen years in Jerusalem. He did not do what was pleasing in the sight of the Lord his God, unlike his father David.

verses.latin: Sed ambulavit in via regum Israël: insuper et filium suum traduxit per ignem juxta idolorum nationum, quas interfecit Dominus a facie filiorum Israël.
verses.english: Instead, he walked in the way of the kings of Israel. Furthermore, he even made his son pass through fire, following the abominable customs of the nations whom the Lord had driven out before the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Immolaverat quoque et suffumigaverat in excelsis, et super colles, et sub omni ligno frondoso.
verses.english: He also sacrificed and burned incense in the high places, and upon the hills, and under every leafy tree, engaging in idolatry.

verses.latin: Tunc ascendit Rasin rex Syriae, et Phacee filius Romeliae rex Israël in Jerusalem, ad præliandum: cumque obsidissent Achaz, non potuerunt eum capere.
verses.english: Then Rezin, the king of Syria, and Pekah, son of Remaliah, the king of Israel, came up to Jerusalem to wage war. Although they besieged Ahaz, they could not capture him.

verses.latin: In tempore illo restituit Rasin rex Syriae Ailath Syriae, et ejecit Judæos de Ailath: et Idumæi venerunt in Ailath, et habitaverunt ibi usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: At that time, Rezin, the king of Syria, restored Elath to Syria, driving the Judeans out of Elath. And the Edomites came into Elath and settled there, where they remain even to this very day.

verses.latin: Misit autem Achaz nuntios ad Theglathphalasar regem Assyriorum, dicens: Servus tuus, et filius tuus ego sum: ascende, et salva me de manu regis Syriae, et de manu regis Israël, qui consurrexerunt adversum me.
verses.english: Then Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglath-Pileser, the king of the Assyrians, saying: "I am your servant and your son. Come up and rescue me from the hand of the king of Syria and from the hand of the king of Israel, who have risen up against me."

verses.latin: Et tulit Achaz argentum et aurum quod inveniri potuit in domo Domini, et in thesauris regis: et misit regi Assyriorum munera.
verses.english: Ahaz then took the silver and gold that could be found in the house of the Lord and in the royal treasuries, and he sent these as gifts to the king of the Assyrians.

verses.latin: Qui et acquievit ei: ascendit enim rex Assyriorum in Damascum, et vastavit eam, et transtulit habitatores ejus in Cyrenen: et Rasin interfecit.
verses.english: The Assyrian king agreed to his request, for the king of the Assyrians went up to Damascus, devastated it, and deported its inhabitants to Cyrene. He also killed Rezin.

verses.latin: Et abiit rex Achaz in occursum Theglathphalasar regis Assyriorum in Damascum, cumque vidisset altare Damasci, misit rex Achaz ad Uriam sacerdotem exemplar ejus, et similitudinem omnis operis ejus.
verses.english: And King Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath-Pileser, the king of the Assyrians. When King Ahaz saw the altar in Damascus, he sent its detailed plan and the exact likeness of all its workmanship to Urijah, the priest.

verses.latin: Et ædificavit Uria sacerdos altare juxta omnia quæ mandaverat rex Achaz de Damasco: sic fecit Uria sacerdos, donec veniret rex Achaz de Damasco.
verses.english: And Urijah, the priest, built an altar exactly according to all the instructions King Ahaz had sent from Damascus. Urijah the priest did this, completing it before King Ahaz returned from Damascus.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset rex de Damasco, vidit altare, et vota inchoavit super illud.
verses.english: When the king returned from Damascus, he saw the altar, and he began to offer sacrifices and vows upon it.

verses.latin: Et adolevit holocaustum, et sacrificium suum, et libavit libamina, et fudit sanguinem pacificorum quæ obtulerat super altare.
verses.english: He burned his burnt offering and his sacrifice, poured out his libations, and sprinkled the blood of his peace offerings upon the altar.

verses.latin: Porro altare æneum quod erat coram Domino, transtulit de facie templi, et de loco altaris, et de loco templis Domini posuit illud ex latere altaris.
verses.english: Furthermore, the bronze altar that stood before the Lord, he moved it away from the front of the Temple, from its place between the altar and the Lord's Temple, and placed it on the side of this new, foreign altar.

verses.latin: Præcepit quoque rex Achaz Uriæ sacerdoti, dicens: Super altare majus offer holocaustum matutinum, et sacrificium vespertinum, et holocaustum regis, et sacrificium ejus, et holocaustum universi populi terræ, et sacrificia eorum, et libamina eorum: et omnem sanguinem holocausti, et universi sacrificii super illud effundes: altare vero æneum erit paratum ad voluntatem meam.
verses.english: King Ahaz also commanded Urijah the priest, saying: "Upon the larger, new altar, offer the morning burnt offering, the evening sacrifice, the king's burnt offering, and his sacrifice, along with the burnt offering of all the people of the land, their sacrifices, and their libations. You shall pour all the blood of the burnt offerings and all the sacrifices upon it. As for the bronze altar, it shall be available for my personal discretion and use."

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Uria sacerdos juxta omnia quæ præceperat rex Achaz.
verses.english: So Urijah, the priest, did according to all that King Ahaz had commanded.

verses.latin: Abscidit autem rex Achaz oras bases, et lavacrum amovit ab ipsis: et mare posuit super bases boveas duodecim, quæ erant subter illud, et abstulit illud de basibus suis, et posuit super pavimentum stratum lapide.
verses.english: King Ahaz also cut off the panels of the stands and removed the basins from them. He also took the great bronze Sea off the twelve oxen-shaped bases that were beneath it, removing it from its stands, and placed it upon a stone pavement.

verses.latin: Musach quoque sabbati quod ædificaverat in templo, et ingressum regis exterius, mutavit de templo Domini, propter regem Assyriorum.
verses.english: The covered passageway for the Sabbath, which he had built in the Temple, and the outer entrance for the king, he removed these from the Temple of the Lord, doing so out of deference to the king of the Assyrians.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Achaz, quæcunque fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the deeds of Ahaz, all that he did, are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Achaz cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David: et regnavit Ezechias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Ahaz slept with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David. And Hezekiah, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno decimo septimo Phacee filii Romeliae regnavit Achaz filius Joatham regis Juda.
verses.english: In the seventeenth year of Pekah, the son of Remaliah, King Ahaz, the son of Jotham, began to reign over Judah.

verses.latin: Viginti annorum erat Achaz cum regnare cœpisset, et sedecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem : et non fecit quod placitum erat in conspectu Domini Dei sui, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king. He reigned for sixteen years in Jerusalem. He did not do what was right in the sight of the Lord his God, unlike his father David, who served God faithfully.

verses.latin: Sed ambulavit in via regum Israel, insuper et filium suum traduxit per ignem juxta idola gentium, quæ disperdidit Dominus a facie filiorum Israel.
verses.english: Instead, he followed the ways of the kings of Israel (who were unfaithful to God). He even sacrificed his own son by fire, according to the abominable practices of the pagan nations that the Lord had previously driven out from before the Israelites.

verses.latin: Immolabat quoque et accendebat thymiama in excelsis, et in collibus, et sub omni ligno frondoso.
verses.english: He also offered sacrifices and burned incense on the high places (illicit altars), on the hills, and under every flourishing tree, worshipping pagan deities in these places.

verses.latin: Tunc ascendit Rasin rex Syriæ, et Phacee filius Romeliae rex Israel in Jerusalem ad præliandum : cumque obsiderent Achaz, non potuerunt superare eum.
verses.english: At that time, King Rezin of Syria and Pekah, the son of Remaliah, King of Israel, marched up to Jerusalem to wage war. Although they besieged Ahaz, they were not able to overcome him.

verses.latin: In tempore illo restituit Rasin rex Syriæ Ailam Syriæ, et ejecit Judæos de Ailath : et Idumæi venerunt in Ailam, et habitaverunt ibi usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: At that same time, King Rezin of Syria restored Elath (also known as Eilat or Ailath) to Syria, driving the Jews out of Elath. The Edomites then came into Elath and settled there, where they remained even until the present day.

verses.latin: Misitque Achaz nuntios ad Theglathphalasar regem Assyriorum, dicens : Servus tuus, et filius tuus ego sum : ascende, et salva me de manu regis Syriæ, et de manu regis Israel, qui consurrexerunt adversum me.
verses.english: King Ahaz then sent messengers to King Tiglath-Pileser of Assyria, declaring: "I am your servant and your son (meaning, I pledge loyalty and vassalage to you). Come up and rescue me from the power of the King of Syria and from the power of the King of Israel, who have risen up against me."

verses.latin: Et tulit Achaz argentum et aurum quod inveniri potuit in domo Domini, et in thesauris regis : et misit regi Assyriorum munera.
verses.english: Ahaz then took all the silver and gold that could be found in the Temple of the Lord and in the royal treasuries, and he sent these valuables as tribute (or gifts) to the King of Assyria.

verses.latin: Qui et acquievit ei : ascenditque rex Assyriorum in Damascum, et vastavit eam, et transtulit habitatores ejus in Cyrenen : regem vero Rasin interfecit.
verses.english: The King of Assyria agreed to Ahaz's request. He marched up to Damascus, conquered and devastated it, and deported its inhabitants to Kir (or Cyrene). He also put King Rezin to death.

verses.latin: Perrexitque Achaz rex in Damascum in occursum Theglathphalasar regis Assyriorum, cumque vidisset altare Damasci, misit Achaz rex ad Uriam sacerdotem exemplar ejus, et similitudinem omnis operis ejus.
verses.english: King Ahaz then traveled to Damascus to meet King Tiglath-Pileser of Assyria. While there, Ahaz saw the altar in Damascus (which was likely a pagan, Assyrian-style altar). King Ahaz then sent a detailed sketch of this altar, including its full design and every aspect of its construction, to Uriah the priest in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Ædificavitque Urias sacerdos altare juxta omnia quæ præceperat rex Achaz de Damasco : et ita fecit Urias sacerdos donec rediret rex Achaz de Damasco.
verses.english: So Uriah the priest diligently built an altar exactly according to all the specifications and instructions that King Ahaz had sent him from Damascus. Uriah the priest completed this task before King Ahaz even returned from Damascus.

verses.latin: Cumque redisset rex de Damasco, vidit altare, et veneratus est illud : et ascendit, et immolavit super illud.
verses.english: When the king returned from Damascus, he saw the new altar. He approached it and venerated it (showing reverence to this foreign, pagan-inspired structure). He then went up to it and offered sacrifices upon it.

verses.latin: Et adolevit holocaustum, et sacrificium suum, et libavit libamina : et effudit sanguinem pacificorum super altare.
verses.english: He burned his burnt offerings and his other sacrifices on it, and poured out his drink offerings. He also sprinkled the blood of his peace offerings upon this altar.

verses.latin: Porro altare æneum quod erat coram Domino, et ante faciem templi, id est inter altare et templum Domini, transtulit de loco suo, de facie templi Domini, et posuit illud ex latere altaris.
verses.english: Furthermore, Ahaz removed the bronze altar that stood before the Lord (the sacred altar originally built by Solomon), which was in front of the Temple, specifically between the new altar and the Temple of the Lord. He moved it from its proper place in front of the Lord’s Temple and positioned it to the side of the new altar.

verses.latin: Præcepit quoque Achaz rex Uriae sacerdoti, dicens : Super altare majus offer holocaustum matutinum, et sacrificium vespertinum, et holocaustum regis, et sacrificium ejus, et holocaustum universi populi terræ, et sacrificia eorum, et libamina eorum : et omnem sanguinem holocausti, et universum sanguinem victimæ super illud effundes : altare vero æneum erit paratum ad voluntatem meam.
verses.english: King Ahaz then commanded Uriah the priest, saying: "On this larger, new altar (the one copied from Damascus), you are to offer the morning burnt offering and the evening sacrifice. Also offer the king's burnt offering and his sacrifice, along with the burnt offerings of all the people of the land, their sacrifices, and their drink offerings. All the blood from the burnt offerings and all the blood from the sacrifices you shall pour out upon it. The bronze altar (the old, sacred one) will now be reserved for my personal consultation and discretion."

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Urias sacerdos juxta omnia quæ præceperat rex Achaz.
verses.english: So Uriah the priest carried out all these instructions, exactly as King Ahaz had commanded him.

verses.latin: Abstulit quoque rex Achaz bases æneas, et luterem qui super eas erat : et mare de bubus æneis, quæ subter illud erant, posuit super pavimentum stratum lapide.
verses.english: King Ahaz also removed the bronze stands and the basins that rested upon them. He took down the "Sea" (the large bronze basin for ritual washing) from the bronze oxen that supported it, and he placed the "Sea" upon a paved stone platform instead.

verses.latin: Musach etiam sabbati, quod ædificaverat in templo, et ingressum regis exterius flexit in templum Domini, propter regem Assyriorum.
verses.english: He also removed the covered way for the Sabbath (or "Sabbath structure") that had been built in the Temple. Furthermore, he rerouted the king's outer entrance to the Temple of the Lord, making these changes specifically to appease the King of Assyria and avoid any offense or suspicion.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Achaz, quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Ahaz, all that he did, are these not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Achaz cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David : et regnavit Hiscias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Ahaz rested with his ancestors and was buried with them in the City of David. His son Hezekiah then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno duodecimo Achaz regis Juda, regnavit Osee filius Ela in Samaria super Israel novem annis.
verses.english: In the twelfth year of King Ahaz of Judah, Hoshea, son of Elah, began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and he reigned for nine years.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino: non sicut reges Israel qui fuerant ante eum.
verses.english: But he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, though not as evil as the kings of Israel who had reigned before him.

verses.latin: Contra hunc ascendit Salmanasar rex Assyriorum, et factus est ei Osee servus, reddebatque illi tributa.
verses.english: Shalmaneser, the king of the Assyrians, marched against King Hoshea, and Hoshea became his servant and paid tribute to him.

verses.latin: Cumque deprehendisset rex Assyriorum Osee, quod nollet ei ultra tributa reddere, et misisset nuncios ad regem Ægypti contra regem Assyriorum, obsedit eum, et vinctum misit in carcerem.
verses.english: But the king of Assyria discovered that Hoshea was conspiring against him. Hoshea had sent messengers to the king of Egypt and had stopped paying his yearly tribute to Assyria. So the king of Assyria arrested Hoshea, chained him, and imprisoned him.

verses.latin: Et depopulatus est omnem terram ascendens, et venit Samariam: et obsedit eam tribus annis.
verses.english: Then the king of Assyria invaded all of the land of Israel. He marched to Samaria and besieged it for three years.

verses.latin: Anno igitur nono Osee cepit rex Assyriorum Samariam, et transtulit Israel in Assyrios: posuitque eos in Hala et in Habor, juxta fluvium Gozan, in civitatibus Medorum.
verses.english: In the ninth year of Hoshea’s reign, the king of Assyria captured Samaria and carried the people of Israel into exile to Assyria. He settled them in Halah, and on the Habor River in Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.

verses.latin: Factum est enim hoc, quoniam peccaverunt filii Israel Domino Deo suo, qui eduxerat eos de terra Ægypti de manu Pharaonis regis Ægypti: et coluerunt deos alienos.
verses.english: This disaster happened because the people of Israel had sinned against the Lord their God, who had brought them up out of the land of Egypt and freed them from the power of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. Yet they worshipped other gods.

verses.latin: Et ambulaverunt juxta ritus gentium quas consumpserat Dominus in conspectu filiorum Israel: et regum Israel, quia fecerant similiter.
verses.english: They followed the practices of the pagan nations that the Lord had driven out before them. They also imitated the practices of the kings of Israel, which were just as evil.

verses.latin: Et operuerunt filii Israel verbis non rectis Dominum Deum suum: et ædificaverunt sibi excelsa per cunctas urbes suas, a turre custodum usque ad civitatem munitam.
verses.english: The people of Israel secretly did things against the Lord their God that were not right. They built high places for idol worship in all their cities, from watchtowers to fortified cities.

verses.latin: Et statuerunt sibi statuas, et lucos in omni colle sublimi, et subter omne lignum nemorosum:
verses.english: They set up sacred stones and Asherah poles—idolatrous symbols—on every high hill and under every green tree.

verses.latin: et adolebant ibi incensum super aras in more gentium, quas transtulerat Dominus a facie eorum: et fecerunt verba pessima irritantes Dominum.
verses.english: On all these high places, they burned incense, just like the pagan nations that the Lord had driven out before them. They did wicked things that provoked the Lord’s anger.

verses.latin: Et coluerunt immunditias, de quibus præceperat Dominus ne facerent hæc.
verses.english: They worshipped idols, even though the Lord had told them, “You must not do such a thing.”

verses.latin: Et testificatus est Dominus in Israel et in Juda per manum omnium prophetarum et videntium, dicens: Convertimini a viis vestris pessimis, et custodite præcepta mea, et cæremonias meas juxta omnem legem, quam præcepi patribus vestris, et sicut misi ad vos in manu servorum meorum prophetarum.
verses.english: The Lord had warned both Israel and Judah through all his prophets and seers, saying, “Turn from your evil ways. Keep My commandments and My ceremonies according to all the Law that I commanded your fathers and that I sent to you through My servants, the prophets.”

verses.latin: Qui non audierunt, sed induraverunt cervicem suam juxta cervicem patrum suorum, qui noluerunt obedire Domino Deo suo.
verses.english: But they would not listen. They became stubborn, just like their fathers, who had refused to obey the Lord their God.

verses.latin: Et abjecerunt statuta ejus, et pactum quod pepigerat cum patribus eorum, et testificationes ejus, quibus contestatus est eos: et secuti sunt vanitates, et vane egerunt: et imitati sunt gentes quæ erant in circuitu eorum, super quibus præceperat Dominus ut non facerent sicut et illi.
verses.english: They rejected His decrees and the covenant He had made with their fathers, as well as the warnings He had given them. They pursued worthless idols and themselves became worthless. They imitated the pagan nations around them, even though the Lord had commanded them not to do as those nations did.

verses.latin: Et dimiserunt omnia præcepta Domini Dei sui: feceruntque sibi conflatiles duos vitulos, et lucos, et adoraverunt universam militiam cæli: et servierunt Baal.
verses.english: They abandoned all the commandments of the Lord their God. They made for themselves two calves of cast metal, and Asherah poles. They worshipped all the host of the universe—the stars and planets—and they served Baal.

verses.latin: Et transire fecerunt filios suos et filias suas per ignem: et divinationibus inservierunt, et auguriis: et tradiderunt se ut facerent malum coram Domino, et irritarent eum.
verses.english: They sacrificed their sons and daughters in fire as offerings to idols. They practiced divination and omens, and they surrendered themselves to doing evil in the sight of the Lord, provoking His anger.

verses.latin: Iratus est igitur Dominus vehementer Israeli, et abstulit eos de conspectu suo: et non remansit nisi tribus Juda tantummodo.
verses.english: So the Lord was very angry with Israel and removed them from His sight. Only the tribe of Judah was left.

verses.latin: Sed nec ipse Juda custodivit mandata Domini Dei sui: verum et ipsi ambulaverunt in erroribus Israel, quos fecerat.
verses.english: Even Judah did not keep the commandments of the Lord their God; instead, they followed the sinful practices that Israel had introduced.

verses.latin: Projicivitque Dominus omnem stirpem Israel, et afflixit eos, et tradidit in manu diripientium, donec projiceret eos a facie sua.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord rejected all the people of Israel. He afflicted them and delivered them into the hands of plunderers until He finally cast them out from His presence.

verses.latin: Quoniam scissus est Israel a domo David, et constituerunt sibi regem Jeroboam filium Nabat: Jeroboam segregavit Israel ab Domino, et peccare eos fecit peccatum grande.
verses.english: For Israel had been torn away from the house of David, and they made Jeroboam, son of Nebat, their king. Jeroboam then led Israel away from the Lord and caused them to commit a great sin.

verses.latin: Et ambulaverunt filii Israel in cunctis peccatis Jeroboam quæ fecerat: nec recesserunt ab eis,
verses.english: The people of Israel continued in all the sins that Jeroboam had committed, and they did not turn away from them.

verses.latin: donec auferret Dominus Israel a facie sua, sicut locutus fuerat in manu omnium servorum suorum prophetarum: translatusque est Israel de terra sua in Assyriam, usque in diem hanc.
verses.english: So the Lord removed Israel from His presence, just as He had spoken through all His servants, the prophets. Thus, Israel was carried away from their own land into Assyria, where they remain to this very day.

verses.latin: Adduxit autem rex Assyriorum de Babylone, et de Cutha, et de Ava, et de Emath, et de Sepharvaim: et collocavit eos in civitatibus Samariæ pro filiis Israel: qui possederunt Samariam, et habitaverunt in urbibus ejus.
verses.english: Then the king of Assyria brought people from Babylon, Cuthah, Avva, Hamath, and Sepharvaim, and settled them in the cities of Samaria in place of the people of Israel. These new inhabitants took possession of Samaria and lived in its cities.

verses.latin: Cumque initio habitationis suæ non timerent Dominum, immisit in eos Dominus leones, qui interficiebant eos.
verses.english: When these new inhabitants first began to live there, they did not worship the Lord, so the Lord sent lions among them, which killed some of them.

verses.latin: Nuntiatumque est regi Assyriorum, dicentibus: Gentes quas transtulisti, et habitare fecisti in civitatibus Samariæ, ignorant jus Dei terræ: et immisit in eos Dominus leones, et ecce interficiunt eos, eo quod ignorent ritum Dei terræ.
verses.english: So the king of Assyria was informed, “The nations whom you have deported and settled in the cities of Samaria do not know the customs of the God of that land. Therefore, the Lord has sent lions among them, and they are killing them because they do not know the proper way to worship the God of that land.”

verses.latin: Præcepit autem rex Assyriorum, dicens: Ducite illuc unum de sacerdotibus quos inde captivos adduxistis: et vadat, et habitet cum eis: et doceat eos cæremonias Dei terræ.
verses.english: Then the king of Assyria gave this command: “Send back one of the priests whom you captured from there. Let him go and live among them and teach them the customs of the God of that land.”

verses.latin: Venit ergo unus de sacerdotibus his, qui fuerant capti de Samaria, et habitavit in Bethel, et docebat eos quomodo colerent Dominum.
verses.english: So one of the priests who had been carried away captive from Samaria came and lived in Bethel, and he taught them how they should worship the Lord.

verses.latin: Et factum est: gentes singulæ faciebant deos suos, posueruntque eos in fanis excelsis, quæ fecerant Samaritani, gens et gens in civitatibus suis in quibus habitabant.
verses.english: Nevertheless, each of these foreign nations made their own gods and placed them in the shrines on the high places that the Samaritans had built. Each nation did this in the cities where they lived.

verses.latin: Viri enim Babylonis fecerunt Soccoth Benoth: viri autem Cuthi fecerunt Nergel: et viri Emath fecerunt Asima.
verses.english: The people from Babylon made Succoth-Benoth; the people from Cuthah made Nergal; and the people from Hamath made Ashima.

verses.latin: Porro Hevæi fecerunt Nebahaz et Tharthac. Et hi de Sepharvaim comburebant filios suos igni, Adramelech et Amelech diis Sepharvaim.
verses.english: The Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak. And the people from Sepharvaim burned their children in fire as offerings to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

verses.latin: Coluerunt autem et Dominum: et fecerunt sibi de novissimis suis sacerdotes excelsorum, et ponebant eos in fanis excelsis.
verses.english: They did worship the Lord, but they also appointed priests from among themselves for the high places, and these priests offered sacrifices in the shrines of the high places.

verses.latin: Et Dominum quidem colebant, et deos suos juxta consuetudinem gentium de quibus translati fuerant, serviebant.
verses.english: So they worshipped the Lord, but they also served their own gods according to the customs of the nations from which they had been brought.

verses.latin: Usque in præsentem diem juxta pristinum ritum faciunt: non timent Dominum, neque custodiunt cæremonias ejus, et judicia, et legem, et mandatum, quod præceperat Dominus filiis Jacob, cui imposuit nomen Israël:
verses.english: Even to this present day, they continue to practice their former customs. They do not truly fear the Lord, nor do they observe His ceremonies, His judgments, His Law, or the commandment that the Lord gave to the children of Jacob, to whom He gave the name Israel.

verses.latin: et percusserat cum eis pactum, et præceperat eis, dicens: Nolite timere deos alienos, et non adoretis eos, neque colatis, neque immolatis eis.
verses.english: When the Lord had made a covenant with them, He commanded them, saying, “You must not fear other gods, nor worship them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them.

verses.latin: Sed Dominum Deum vestrum, qui eduxit vos de terra Ægypti in fortitudine magna, et in brachio extento, ipsum timete, et illum adorate, et ipsi immolate.
verses.english: But you must fear the Lord your God, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt with great power and an outstretched arm. Him alone you must fear, Him alone you must worship, and to Him alone you must sacrifice.

verses.latin: Et cæremonias, et judicia, et legem, et mandata, quæ scripsit vobis, custodite ut faciatis cunctis diebus: et non timeatis deos alienos.
verses.english: You must always be careful to observe the ceremonies, the judgments, the Law, and the commandments that He wrote for you. You must not fear other gods.

verses.latin: Et pactum quod pepigi vobiscum, nolite oblivisci: nec colatis deos alienos:
verses.english: And the covenant that I made with you, you must not forget. You must not worship other gods.

verses.latin: sed Dominum Deum vestrum timete, et ipse eruet vos de manu omnium inimicorum vestrorum.
verses.english: Instead, fear the Lord your God, and He Himself will deliver you from the power of all your enemies.”

verses.latin: Illi vero non audierunt, sed juxta consuetudinem suam pristinam faciebant.
verses.english: However, they did not listen, but continued to do according to their former customs.

verses.latin: Anno duodecimo Achaz regis Juda regnavit Osee filius Ela in Samaria super Israel novem annis.
verses.english: In the twelfth year of King Achaz of Judah, Osee, the son of Ela, began his reign over Israel in Samaria, and he ruled for nine years.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino, non secundum reges Israël qui fuerant ante eum.
verses.english: And Osee committed evil acts in the presence of the Lord, though not to the same degree as the previous kings of Israel before him.

verses.latin: Contra hunc ascendit Salmanasar rex Assyriorum, et factus est Osee servus ejus, reddebatque illi tributa.
verses.english: Salmanasar, the king of the Assyrians, marched against Osee, and Osee became Salmanasar's vassal and paid him annual tribute.

verses.latin: Cumque deprehendisset rex Assyriorum Osee, quod niteretur ad eum, et mittet nuntios ad ad regem Aegypti, ad Sua regem, et non redderet tributa sicut per singulos annos consueverat: obsedit eum, et vinxit in domo carceris.
verses.english: But the king of the Assyrians discovered that Osee was secretly conspiring against him, sending messengers to King Sua of Egypt. Osee also stopped paying the tribute he used to send every year. So the king of Assyria besieged Osee and imprisoned him.

verses.latin: Et assscendit rex Assyriorum per omnem terram: et cum venisset in Samariam, obsedit eam tribus annis.
verses.english: The king of Assyria then marched throughout all the land of Israel, and when he reached Samaria, he besieged it for three years.

verses.latin: Anno nono Osee cepit rex Assyriorum Samariam, et transtulit Israël in Assyrios: posuitque eos in Hala et in Habor juxta fluvium Gozan, in civitatibus Medorum.
verses.english: In the ninth year of Osee's reign, the king of Assyria captured Samaria and carried the people of Israel away as exiles to Assyria. He settled them in Hala and in Habor, near the Gozan River, and in the cities of the Medes.

verses.latin: Hoc enim factum est, quia peccaverunt filii Israël Domino Deo suo, qui eduxerat eos de terra Aegypti de manu Pharaonis regis Aegypti: et coluerunt deos alienos.
verses.english: This happened because the children of Israel had sinned against the Lord their God, the One who had brought them out of the land of Egypt and delivered them from the power of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. Yet they worshipped other gods.

verses.latin: Et ambulaverunt juxta ritus gentium quas subverterat Dominus in conspectu filiorum Israël, et regum Israël: quia ipsi fecerant.
verses.english: They also followed the customs of the pagan nations whom the Lord had driven out before the children of Israel, and the customs that the kings of Israel had themselves established.

verses.latin: Et offendeunt filii Israël sermone non recto Dominum Deum suum: et ædificaverunt sibi excelsa in omnibus urbibus suis, a turre custodum usque ad civitatem munitam.
verses.english: The children of Israel secretly committed acts against the Lord their God that were not right. They built high places for themselves in all their cities, from the watchman's tower to the fortified city.

verses.latin: Et statuerunt sibi statuas et lucos in omni colle sublimi, et sub omni ligno frondoso.
verses.english: They set up sacred pillars and wooden idols for themselves on every high hill and under every green tree.

verses.latin: Et adolebant ibi incensum super aras in more gentium quas transtulerat Dominus a facie eorum: et fecerunt verba pessima irritantes Dominum.
verses.english: There, on those altars, they burned incense in the manner of the pagan nations whom the Lord had removed from before them. They committed very wicked deeds, provoking the Lord to anger.

verses.latin: Et coluerunt immunditias, de quibus præceperat Dominus ne facerent sermonem istum.
verses.english: They worshipped filthy idols, concerning which the Lord had explicitly commanded them not to engage in such practices.

verses.latin: Et testificatus est Dominus in Israël et in Juda per manum omnium prophetarum et videntium, dicens: Convertimini a viis vestris pessimis, et custodite præcepta mea, et cæremonias meas juxta omnem legem quam præcepi patribus vestris, et sicut misi ad vos in manu servorum meorum prophetarum.
verses.english: The Lord had warned Israel and Judah through all His prophets and seers, saying: "Turn away from your wicked ways, and keep My commandments and My ceremonies, according to all the Law that I commanded your fathers, and as I sent to you through the hand of My servants, the prophets."

verses.latin: Qui non audierunt, sed induraverunt cervicem suam juxta cervicem patrum suorum, qui noluerunt obedire Domino Deo suo.
verses.english: But they would not listen; instead, they stiffened their necks, just like their fathers had, who refused to obey the Lord their God.

verses.latin: Et abjecerunt legitima ejus, et pactum quod pepigerat cum patribus eorum, et testificationes illius quas testificatus est eis: et secuti sunt vanitates, et inanes ipsi facti sunt, et secuti sunt gentes quæ erant per circuitum eorum, super quibus præceperat Dominus eis, ut non facerent sicut et illi.
verses.english: They rejected His statutes, and the covenant He had made with their fathers, and the warnings He had given them. They followed worthless idols and themselves became worthless. They imitated the pagan nations around them, concerning whom the Lord had commanded them not to act like them.

verses.latin: Et dereliquerunt universa præcepta Domini Dei sui: feceruntque sibi conflatiles duos vitulos, et fecerunt lucos, et adoraverunt omnem militiam cæli, et coluerunt Baal.
verses.english: They abandoned all the commandments of the Lord their God. They cast for themselves two calves out of metal, and made wooden idols, and worshipped all the heavenly bodies—the entire host of the universe—and served Baal.

verses.latin: Et transire fecerunt filios suos et filias suas per ignem: et dederunt se divinationibus, et auguriis: et fecerunt malum in conspectu Domini, ut irritarent eum.
verses.english: They sacrificed their sons and daughters in fire, and devoted themselves to divination and omens. They committed much evil in the sight of the Lord, provoking Him to anger.

verses.latin: Iratusque est Dominus vehementer Israeli, et abstulit eos a facie sua: nec remansit nisi tribus Juda tantum.
verses.english: The Lord became intensely angry with Israel and removed them from His sight. Only the tribe of Judah remained.

verses.latin: Sed et ipse Juda non custodivit mandata Domini Dei sui: verum in superstitionibus Israël ambulaverunt quas fecerat.
verses.english: Yet even Judah did not keep the commandments of the Lord their God. Instead, they followed the superstitious practices that Israel had established.

verses.latin: Projecitque Dominus omnem stirpem Israël, et afflixit eos, et tradidit in manu diripientium, donec projiceret eos a facie sua.
verses.english: So the Lord rejected all the descendants of Israel, and afflicted them, and gave them into the hand of plunderers until He finally cast them out from His presence.

verses.latin: Ex eo tempore quo scissus est Israël a domo David, et constituerunt sibi regem Jeroboam filium Nabat: separavit Jeroboam Israël a Domino, et peccare eos fecit peccatum magnum.
verses.english: From the time that Israel split from the house of David and appointed Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, as their king, Jeroboam led Israel away from the Lord and caused them to commit a great sin.

verses.latin: Et ambulaverunt filii Israël in cunctis peccatis Jeroboam quæ fecerat: nec recesserunt ab eis.
verses.english: The children of Israel continued in all the sins that Jeroboam had committed, and they did not turn away from them.

verses.latin: Donec auferret Dominus Israël a facie sua, sicut locutus fuerat in manu omnium servorum suorum prophetarum: et transtulit Israël de terra sua in Assyrios, usque in diem hanc.
verses.english: Until the Lord finally removed Israel from His sight, just as He had spoken through all His servants, the prophets. Thus, Israel was carried away from their own land into Assyria, where they remain to this very day.

verses.latin: Adduxit autem rex Assyriorum de Babylone, et de Cutha, et de Avah, et de Emath, et de Sepharvaim: et collocavit eos in civitatibus Samariæ pro filiis Israël: qui possederunt Samariam, et habitaverunt in urbibus ejus.
verses.english: The king of Assyria brought people from Babylon, Cutha, Avah, Emath, and Sepharvaim and settled them in the cities of Samaria in place of the children of Israel. These new inhabitants took possession of Samaria and lived in its cities.

verses.latin: Cumque initio habitationis eorum non timerent Dominum, immisit Dominus in eos leones, qui interficiebant eos.
verses.english: When they first settled there, these people did not fear the Lord. So the Lord sent lions among them, which killed some of them.

verses.latin: Nuntiatumque est regi Assyriorum, dicentibus: Gentes quas transtulisti, et habitare fecisti in civitatibus Samariæ, ignorant legitima Dei terræ: et immisit in eos Dominus leones, et ecce interficiunt eos, eo quod ignorent ritum Dei terræ.
verses.english: Then it was reported to the king of Assyria, saying: "The nations whom you have relocated and settled in the cities of Samaria do not know the laws of the God of that land. Therefore, the Lord has sent lions among them, and indeed, they are killing them, because these people do not know the proper way to worship the God of that land."

verses.latin: Præcepit itaque rex Assyriorum, dicens: Ducite illuc unum de sacerdotibus quos inde captivos adduxistis, et vadat, et habitet cum eis: et doceat eos legitima Dei terræ.
verses.english: So the king of Assyria commanded, saying: "Send back one of the priests whom you brought as captives from there. Let him go and live among them and teach them the laws of the God of the land."

verses.latin: Venit ergo unus de sacerdotibus his qui fuerant capti in Samaria, et habitavit in Bethel, et docebat eos quomodo colerent Dominum.
verses.english: So one of the priests who had been carried away captive from Samaria came and settled in Bethel. He taught them how they should worship the Lord, the true God.

verses.latin: Et unaquæque gens fecit deum suum, posueruntque eos in delubris excelsorum quæ fecerant Samaritani, gens et gens in civitatibus suis in quibus habitabant.
verses.english: Yet, each of the new nations made their own gods. They placed these gods in the shrines of the high places which the Samaritans had originally built, each nation in the cities where they lived.

verses.latin: Viri enim Babylonii fecerunt Soccoth Benoth: et viri Cuthæi fecerunt Nergal: et viri de Emath fecerunt Asima.
verses.english: For the men from Babylon made Succoth-benoth. The men from Cutha made Nergal. The men from Hamath made Ashima.

verses.latin: Porro Evei fecerunt Nebahaz et Tharthac. Illi vero qui erant de Sepharvaim, comburebant filios suos igni, Adramelech et Amelech diis Sepharvaim.
verses.english: The Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak. And the people from Sepharvaim burned their children as offerings in fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

verses.latin: Et nihilominus colentes Dominum, fecerunt sibi de novissimis sacerdotes excelsorum, et ponebant eos in fanis excelsorum.
verses.english: Even though they were worshipping the Lord, they also appointed priests for their high places from among themselves—these were not true priests of God—and these false priests served in the shrines of the high places.

verses.latin: Et cum Dominum colerent, diis quoque suis serviebant juxta consuetudinem gentium de quibus translati fuerant in Samariam.
verses.english: While they worshipped the Lord, they also served their own gods, according to the custom of the nations from which they had been brought to Samaria.

verses.latin: Usque in præsentem diem juxta pristinam consuetudinem faciunt: non timent Dominum, neque custodiunt cæremonias ejus, judiciaque, et legem, et mandatum quod præceperat Dominus filiis Jacob, cui imposuit nomen Israël:
verses.english: To this very day, they continue to practice their former customs. They do not truly fear the Lord, nor do they keep His ceremonies, His judgments, His law, or the commandment which the Lord had given to the children of Jacob, whom He had named Israel.

verses.latin: Et pepigerat cum eis pactum, et præceperat illis, dicens: Non timebitis deos alienos, nec adorabitis eos, neque coletis, neque immolabitis eis.
verses.english: The Lord had made a covenant with them and commanded them, saying: "You shall not fear other gods, nor worship them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them."

verses.latin: Sed Dominum, qui eduxit vos de terra Ægypti in fortitudine magna, et brachio extento, ipsum timebitis, et illum adorabitis, et ipsi immolabitis.
verses.english: But the Lord, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt with great power and an outstretched arm, Him you shall fear, Him you shall worship, and to Him alone you shall sacrifice.

verses.latin: Et cæremonias, et judicia, et legem, et mandata quæ scripsit vobis, custodite ut faciatis cunctis diebus: et non timeatis deos alienos.
verses.english: And the ceremonies, the judgments, the law, and the commandments which He wrote for you, you shall diligently keep and perform forever. And you shall not fear other gods.

verses.latin: Et pactum quod pepigi vobiscum, nolite oblivisci: neque coletis deos alienos,
verses.english: And the covenant that I made with you, do not forget it. You shall not worship other gods.

verses.latin: Sed Dominum Deum vestrum timebite, et ipse eruet vos de manu omnium inimicorum vestrorum.
verses.english: But you shall fear the Lord your God, and He Himself will deliver you from the hand of all your enemies.

verses.latin: Illi vero non audierunt, sed juxta consuetudinem suam pristinam faciebant.
verses.english: Yet these people did not listen to the Lord's commands. Instead, they continued to act according to their former, unholy customs.

verses.latin: Anno duodecimo Achaz regis Juda, regnavit Osee filius Ela in Samaria super Israel novem annis.
verses.english: In the twelfth year that Achaz was king of Judah, Osee, the son of Ela, began to reign over Israel in Samaria. He ruled for nine years.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino: non secundum reges Israel qui fuerant ante eum.
verses.english: And Osee did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. His wickedness was not like the kings of Israel who had been before him, but still evil.

verses.latin: Contra hunc ascendit Salmanasar rex Assyriorum, et factus est ei Osee servus, reddebatque ei tributum.
verses.english: Salmanasar, the king of the Assyrians, marched against Osee. Osee became his servant and had to pay tribute to him.

verses.latin: Cumque deprehendisset rex Assyriorum Osee, quod niteretur ad adiutorium, mittens nuntios ad Aegyptum ad Sua regem, et non redderet tributa sicut per singulos annos consueverat: obsedit eum, et vinxit in domo carceris.
verses.english: But the king of the Assyrians discovered that Osee was conspiring for help. He had sent messengers to King Sua of Egypt and had stopped paying the annual tribute he used to pay. So, the king of Assyria besieged Osee and put him in prison.

verses.latin: Et depopulatus est omnem terram ascendens, et venit Samariam: et obsedit eam tribus annis.
verses.english: The Assyrian king then went up and laid waste to all the land of Israel, and he came to Samaria, the capital city, and besieged it for three years.

verses.latin: Anno autem nono Osee cepit rex Assyriorum Samariam, et transtulit Israel in Assyrios: posuitque eos in Hala et in Habor, juxta fluvium Gozan, in civitatibus Medorum.
verses.english: In the ninth year of Osee’s reign, the king of the Assyrians captured Samaria. He then deported the people of Israel to Assyria, settling them in Hala, and in Habor by the Gozan River, and in the cities of the Medes. This was the end of the Northern Kingdom.

verses.latin: Factum est enim, cum peccassent filii Israel Domino Deo suo, qui eduxerat eos de terra Aegypti de manu Pharaonis regis Aegypti, et coluissent deos alienos,
verses.english: This all happened because the children of Israel had sinned against the Lord their God. He was the God who had delivered them from the land of Egypt, from the tyranny of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. But they chose to worship foreign gods instead.

verses.latin: et ambulassent juxta ritus gentium quas consumpserat Dominus in conspectu filiorum Israel, et regum Israel: quia fecerant similiter,
verses.english: They had walked according to the rituals of the pagan nations whom the Lord had destroyed before the children of Israel, and according to the customs that their own kings of Israel had established. Because of this, the Israelites themselves had behaved in exactly the same way as those pagans.

verses.latin: et operuerunt filii Israel sermone non recto Dominum Deum suum, et aedificaverunt sibi excelsa in omnibus urbibus suis, a turre custodum usque ad civitatem munitam.
verses.english: The children of Israel had also spoken things that were not right against the Lord their God, and they had built high places for idol worship in all their cities—everywhere from the watchtowers of shepherds to the fortified cities.

verses.latin: Et statuerunt sibi statuas, et lucos in omni colle sublimi, et subter omne lignum nemorosum.
verses.english: They had set up pillars and sacred groves for idol worship on every high hill and under every shady tree, even though God had forbidden these practices.

verses.latin: Et adolebant ibi incensum super aras in more gentium quas transtulerat Dominus a facie eorum: et fecerunt verba pessima, irritantes Dominum.
verses.english: There, on these altars, they burned incense just like the pagan nations whom the Lord had driven out from before them. They committed the worst abominations, constantly provoking the Lord to anger.

verses.latin: Et coluerunt immunditias de omnibus quæ præceperat Dominus ne facerent.
verses.english: They worshipped all the defiling idols and did everything that the Lord had specifically commanded them not to do.

verses.latin: Et testificatus est Dominus in Israel et in Juda per manum omnium prophetarum et videntium, dicens: Revertimini a viis vestris pessimis, et custodite præcepta mea, et cæremonias meas juxta omnem legem quam præcepi patribus vestris, et sicut misi ad vos in manu servorum meorum prophetarum.
verses.english: The Lord had solemnly warned both Israel and Judah through all His prophets and seers, saying: "Turn back from your evil ways and keep My commandments and My ceremonies, according to all the Law that I commanded your fathers. Do as I sent to you through the hands of My servants, the prophets."

verses.latin: Qui non audierunt, sed induraverunt cervicem suam juxta cervicem patrum suorum, qui noluerant obedire Domino Deo suo.
verses.english: But they refused to listen. Instead, they stiffened their necks, just like their fathers had, those who had refused to obey the Lord their God.

verses.latin: Et abjecerunt legitima ejus, et pactum quod pepigit cum patribus eorum, et testificationes ejus quibus contestatus est eos: et secuti sunt vanitates, et vane egerunt, et secuti sunt gentes quæ erant in circuitu eorum, super quibus præceperat Dominus eis, ut non facerent sicut et illi.
verses.english: They rejected His statutes and the covenant He had made with their fathers, and they ignored the warnings by which He had testified to them. They pursued empty idols and behaved in empty ways, following the pagan nations around them, concerning whom the Lord had explicitly commanded them not to act like those nations.

verses.latin: Et dereliquerunt universa præcepta Domini Dei sui, feceruntque sibi conflatiles duos vitulos, et lucos, et adoraverunt omnem militiam cæli, et coluerunt Baal.
verses.english: They abandoned all the commandments of the Lord their God. They made two molten calves for themselves, and they worshipped Asherah poles, and bowed down to all the host of heaven—the stars and planets which were worshipped as gods. They also served Baal.

verses.latin: Et transduxerunt filios suos et filias suas per ignem: et divinationibus inserviebant, et auguriis: et commiserunt se ut facerent malum coram Domino, et irritarent eum.
verses.english: They made their sons and their daughters pass through fire as offerings to false gods. They practiced divination and used omens, giving themselves over to doing evil in the sight of the Lord, constantly provoking Him to anger.

verses.latin: Iratusque est Dominus vehementer Israeli, et abstulit eos a conspectu suo, et non remansit nisi tribus Juda tantum.
verses.english: So the Lord became extremely angry with Israel and removed them from His sight. Only the tribe of Judah was left.

verses.latin: Sed nec ipse Juda custodivit mandata Domini Dei sui: verum ambulavit in erroribus Israel, quos fecerat.
verses.english: Yet even Judah itself did not keep the commandments of the Lord its God. Indeed, they walked in the same errors that Israel had committed.

verses.latin: Projecitque Dominus omnem stirpem Israel, et afflixit eos, et tradidit in manu diripientium, donec proiiceret eos a facie sua.
verses.english: The Lord then rejected all the offspring of Israel, afflicting them and delivering them into the hands of plunderers until He finally cast them out from His presence entirely.

verses.latin: Siquidem scissus est Israel a domo David, et constituerunt sibi regem Jeroboam filium Nabat: qui avertit Israel a Domino, et peccare fecit peccatum magnum.
verses.english: For Israel had indeed been torn away from the house of David. They made Jeroboam, the son of Nabat, their king. He then turned Israel away from the Lord and caused them to commit a great sin.

verses.latin: Et ambulaverunt filii Israel in universis peccatis Jeroboam quæ fecerat: nec recesserunt ab eis,
verses.english: And the children of Israel continued to walk in all the sins that Jeroboam had committed. They never departed from these sins,

verses.latin: usquequo auferret Dominus Israel a facie sua, sicut locutus fuerat in manu omnium servorum suorum prophetarum: et translatus est Israel de terra sua in Assyrios, usque in diem hanc.
verses.english: until the Lord finally removed Israel from His sight, just as He had spoken through all His servants, the prophets. So, Israel was carried away from their own land into Assyria, and they remain there to this very day.

verses.latin: Adduxit autem rex Assyriorum de Babylone, et de Cutha, et de Ava, et de Emath, et de Sepharvaim: et collocavit eos in civitatibus Samariæ pro filiis Israel: qui possederunt Samariam, et habitaverunt in urbibus ejus.
verses.english: Then the king of Assyria brought people from Babylon, from Cutha, from Ava, from Emath, and from Sepharvaim. He settled them in the cities of Samaria in place of the children of Israel. These new inhabitants took possession of Samaria and lived in its cities.

verses.latin: Cumque ibi habitare cœpissent, non timebant Dominum: et immisit in eos Dominus leones, qui interficiebant eos.
verses.english: When they first began to live there, they did not fear the Lord. So the Lord sent lions among them, which killed some of them.

verses.latin: Nuntiatum est itaque regi Assyriorum, dicentibus: Gentes quas transtulisti, et habitare fecisti in civitatibus Samariæ, ignorant legitima Dei terræ: et immisit in eos Dominus leones, et ecce interficiunt eos, eo quod ignorent ritum Dei terræ.
verses.english: So it was reported to the king of Assyria, saying: "The nations whom you have deported and settled in the cities of Samaria do not know the statutes of the God of the land. Because of this, the Lord has sent lions among them, and behold, they are killing them, because these people do not know the custom of the God of the land."

verses.latin: Præcepit itaque rex Assyriorum, dicens: Ducite illuc unum de sacerdotibus quos inde captivos adduxistis, et vadat, et habitet cum eis: et doceat eos legitima Dei terræ.
verses.english: The king of Assyria then commanded, saying: "Bring back one of the priests whom you took captive from there. Let him go and live with them, and teach them the statutes of the God of the land."

verses.latin: Venit ergo unus de sacerdotibus his, qui fuerant captivi in Samaria, et habitavit in Bethel, et docebat eos quomodo colerent Dominum.
verses.english: So one of the priests who had been taken captive from Samaria came and lived in Bethel. He taught them how they should worship the Lord.

verses.latin: Et factæ sunt gentes singulæ, civitates singulæ, deos suos: et posuerunt in delubris excelsorum quæ fecerant Samaritani, gens et gens in civitatibus quibus habitabant.
verses.english: But each nation still made its own gods in each of their cities. They put these idols in the shrines of the high places which the Samaritans had built, each nation doing so in the cities where they lived.

verses.latin: Viri enim Babylonii fecerunt Soccoth Benoth: et viri Cuthei fecerunt Nergel: et viri de Emath fecerunt Asima.
verses.english: For example, the men from Babylon made Succoth Benoth, the men from Cutha made Nergal, and the men from Emath made Ashima.

verses.latin: Porro Hevæi fecerunt Nebahaz et Tharthac. Illi vero qui de Sepharvaim erant, comburebant filios suos igni, Adramelech et Anamelech diis Sepharvaim.
verses.english: Furthermore, the Avvites made Nibaz and Tartak. Those from Sepharvaim even burned their children in fire as offerings to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

verses.latin: Et nihilominus colebant Dominum: feceruntque sibi de novissimis sacerdotes excelsorum, et ponebant eos in delubris excelsorum.
verses.english: Nevertheless, they also worshipped the Lord. They appointed priests for their high places from among their own people, and these priests served in the shrines of the high places.

verses.latin: Et cum Dominum colerent, diis quoque suis serviebant juxta consuetudinem gentium de quibus translati fuerant.
verses.english: So, while they worshipped the Lord, they also served their own gods according to the custom of the nations from which they had been brought. This syncretism was an abomination to God.

verses.latin: Usque in præsentem diem juxta consuetudinem veterem faciunt: non timent Dominum, neque custodiunt cæremonias ejus, et judicia, et legem, et mandatum quod præceperat Dominus filiis Jacob, quem cognominavit Israel:
verses.english: To this very day, they continue to do things according to their old customs. They do not truly fear the Lord, nor do they observe His ceremonies, or His judgments, or His Law, or the commandment that the Lord had given to the children of Jacob, whom He had named Israel.

verses.latin: et percusserat cum eis pactum, et mandaverat eis, dicens: Non colebitis deos alienos, nec adorabitis eos, neque coletis, neque immolabitis eis.
verses.english: For God had made a covenant with the Israelites and had commanded them, saying: "You shall not worship foreign gods, nor bow down to them, nor serve them, nor offer sacrifices to them. You must worship only Me."

verses.latin: Sed Dominum, qui eduxit vos de terra Ægypti in fortitudine magna, et in brachio extento, ipsum adorabitis, et illi immolabitis.
verses.english: But you shall worship the Lord, who brought you out of the land of Egypt with great power and with an outstretched arm. You shall worship Him alone and offer sacrifices to Him alone.

verses.latin: Et cæremonias, et judicia, et legem, et mandatum, quod scripsit vobis, custodietis, ut faciatis omni tempore: et non timebitis deos alienos.
verses.english: And you shall carefully observe the ceremonies, the judgments, the Law, and the commandment which He wrote for you, so that you may do them at all times. You shall not fear foreign gods.

verses.latin: Et pactum quod pepigi vobiscum, non obliviscemini: neque coletis deos alienos,
verses.english: And you shall not forget the covenant that I made with you, nor shall you worship foreign gods.

verses.latin: sed Dominum Deum vestrum adorabitis, et ipse eruet vos de manu omnium inimicorum vestrorum.
verses.english: Instead, you shall worship the Lord your God, and He Himself will deliver you from the hand of all your enemies.

verses.latin: Illi vero non audierunt, sed juxta consuetudinem suam veterem faciebant.
verses.english: But they did not listen. Instead, they continued to do things according to their old, sinful customs.

verses.latin: Anno tertio Osee filii Ela regis Israel, regnavit Ezechias filius Achaz regis Juda.
verses.english: In the third year that Osee, the son of Ela, was king over Israel, Ezechias, the son of Achaz, began to reign as king over Juda.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et viginti novem annis regnavit in Jerusalem : nomen matris ejus Abi filia Zachariæ.
verses.english: He was twenty-five years old when he started his reign, and he reigned for twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Abi, daughter of Zacharias.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod bonum erat coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerat David pater ejus.
verses.english: And he did what was good and pleasing before the Lord, just as his ancestor David had done in all things.

verses.latin: Ipse dissipavit excelsa, et contrivit statuas, et succidit lucos, et confregit serpentem æneum quem fecerat Moyses : siquidem usque ad illud tempus filii Israel adolebant ei : et vocavit nomen ejus Nohestan.
verses.english: He himself tore down the high places of idolatry, broke apart the pagan statues, cut down the Asherah poles, and crushed the bronze serpent that Moses had made. This was because, up until that time, the sons of Israel had been burning incense to it, and he called it Nohestan, meaning "a piece of bronze."

verses.latin: In Domino Deo Israel speravit : neque enim post ipsum similis ei fuit de cunctis regibus Juda, sed neque ex his qui ante eum fuerant.
verses.english: He placed his hope and trust in the Lord, the God of Israel. There was no king like him among all the kings of Juda after him, nor among those who came before him.

verses.latin: Et adhæsit Domino, et non recessit a vestigiis ejus : fecitque mandata ejus, quæ præceperat Moysi.
verses.english: And he held fast to the Lord, not departing from His ways, and he kept His commandments, which He had commanded to Moses.

verses.latin: Unde et Dominus erat cum eo : et ad omnia quæ procedebant, prospere agebat. Rebellavit quoque contra regem Assyriorum, et non servivit ei.
verses.english: For this reason, the Lord was with him. And in all that he undertook, he acted prosperously. He also rebelled against the king of the Assyrians and no longer served him.

verses.latin: Ipse percussit Philisthæos usque Gazam, et omnes fines eorum, a turre custodum usque ad civitatem munitam.
verses.english: He himself struck down the Philistines all the way to Gaza, conquering all their borders, from the watchtower of the shepherds to the fortified city.

verses.latin: Anno quarto regis Ezechiæ, qui erat annus septimus Osee filii Ela regis Israel, ascendit Salmanasar rex Assyriorum ad Samariam, et obsedit eam :
verses.english: In the fourth year of King Ezechias' reign, which was the seventh year that Osee, the son of Ela, was king of Israel, Salmanasar, the king of the Assyrians, went up against Samaria and besieged it.

verses.latin: et cepit eam post annos tres, anno sexto Ezechiæ, id est, anno nono Osee regis Israel, capta est Samaria.
verses.english: And he captured it after three years, in the sixth year of Ezechias' reign, which was the ninth year that Osee was king of Israel. That is when Samaria was taken.

verses.latin: Et transtulit Salmanasar Israel in Assyrios : posuitque eos in Hala et in Habor, fluviis Gozan in civitatibus Medorum.
verses.english: And Salmanasar exiled the people of Israel to Assyria. He settled them in Hala and by the Habor River, which is in Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.

verses.latin: Quia non audierunt vocem Domini Dei sui, sed prævaricati sunt pactum ejus : omnia quæ præceperat Moyses famulus Domini, non audierunt neque fecerunt.
verses.english: This happened because they had not listened to the voice of the Lord their God but had violated His covenant. They did not listen to or obey all the commands that Moses, the servant of the Lord, had given them.

verses.latin: Anno quartodecimo regis Ezechiæ, ascendit Sennacherib rex Assyriorum ad universas civitates Juda munitas, et cepit eas.
verses.english: In the fourteenth year of King Ezechias' reign, Sennacherib, the king of the Assyrians, marched against all the fortified cities of Juda and captured them.

verses.latin: Tunc misit Ezechias rex Juda nuntios ad regem Assyriorum in Lachis, dicens : Peccavi : recede a me : et omne quod imposueris mihi, feram. Indixit itaque rex Assyriorum Ezechiæ regi Judæ trecenta talenta argenti, et triginta talenta auri.
verses.english: Then Ezechias, the king of Juda, sent messengers to the king of the Assyrians in Lachis, saying, "I have sinned; withdraw from me, and I will bear whatever you impose upon me." So the king of the Assyrians demanded from Ezechias, the king of Juda, three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.

verses.latin: Deditque Ezechias omne argentum quod reperiri potuit in domo Domini, et in thesauris regis.
verses.english: And Ezechias gave him all the silver that could be found in the house of the Lord and in the royal treasuries.

verses.latin: In tempore illo confregit Ezechias valvas templi Domini, et laminas auri quas ipse affixerat, et dedit regi Assyriorum.
verses.english: At that time, Ezechias broke off the doors of the temple of the Lord and the gold plates that he himself had affixed to them, and he gave them to the king of the Assyrians.

verses.latin: Misit autem rex Assyriorum Tharthan et Rabsaris et Rabsacen de Lachis ad regem Ezechiam cum manu gravi in Jerusalem : qui cum ascendissent, venerunt Jerusalem, et steterunt juxta aquaeductum piscinæ superioris, quæ est in via agri fullonis.
verses.english: But the king of the Assyrians sent Tharthan, Rabsaris, and Rabsaces from Lachis to King Ezechias with a great army to Jerusalem. When they arrived, they came to Jerusalem and stood by the aqueduct of the Upper Pool, which is on the road of the fuller's field.

verses.latin: Vocaveruntque regem : egressus est autem ad eos Eliacim filius Helciæ præpositus domus, et Sobna scriba, et Joahe filius Asaph cancellarius.
verses.english: And they called out for the king. But Eliacim, the son of Helcias, who was in charge of the household, along with Sobna the scribe and Joahe, the son of Asaph, the recorder, went out to them instead.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eos Rabsaces : Loquimini Ezechiæ : Hæc dicit rex magnus, rex Assyriorum : Quæ est ista fiducia, qua niteris ?
verses.english: And Rabsaces said to them, "Speak to Ezechias: 'Thus says the great king, the king of the Assyrians: What is this confidence in which you trust?'"

verses.latin: forsitan inisti consilium, et fortitudinem ut belligeres. In quo confidis, ut auderes rebellare ?
verses.english: "'Perhaps you have devised a plan and gathered strength to wage war. In what do you trust that you dare to rebel?'"

verses.latin: an speras in baculo arundineo, et confracto, in Ægypto, super quem si incubuerit homo, comminutus ingredietur manum ejus, et perforabit eam ? Sic est Pharao rex Ægypti omnibus sperantibus in se.
verses.english: "'Are you relying on that broken reed of a staff, Egypt, upon which if a man leans, it will shatter and pierce his hand? Such is Pharao, the king of Egypt, to all who trust in him.'"

verses.latin: Quod si responderis mihi : In Domino Deo nostro speramus : nonne iste est cui abstulit Ezechias excelsa et aras, et præcepit Judæ et Jerusalem : Ante aras istas adorabitis in Jerusalem ?
verses.english: "'But if you answer me, "We trust in the Lord our God," is it not He whose high places and altars Ezechias has removed, telling Juda and Jerusalem, "You shall worship before these altars in Jerusalem"?'"

verses.latin: Nunc igitur sponsorem da domino meo regi Assyriorum, et dabo tibi duo millia equorum, si poteris ex te præbere ascensores eorum.
verses.english: "'Now therefore, give a pledge to my lord, the king of the Assyrians, and I will give you two thousand horses, if you can provide riders for them yourself.'"

verses.latin: Et quomodo potes resistere uni principi de servis domini mei minimis ? an fiduciam habes in Ægypto propter currus et equites ?
verses.english: "'And how can you resist even one of the least of my master's servants? Do you have confidence in Egypt because of their chariots and horsemen?'"

verses.latin: Numquid sine Domino ascendi ad locum istum, ut disperderem eum ? Dominus dixit mihi : Ascende ad terram istam, et disperde eam.
verses.english: "'Have I come up to this place to destroy it without the Lord's permission? The Lord Himself said to me, "Go up against this land and destroy it."'

verses.latin: Cæterum dixit Eliacim filius Helciæ, et Sobna, et Joahe, Rabsaci : Precamur ut loquaris nobis servis tuis Syriace : siquidem intelligimus sermonem tuum : et ne loquaris nobis Judaice, audiente populo qui est super murum.
verses.english: Then Eliacim, the son of Helcias, and Sobna, and Joahe said to Rabsaces, "We beg you to speak to your servants in Aramaic, because we understand that language. Do not speak to us in the language of Juda while the people on the wall are listening."

verses.latin: Responditque eis Rabsaces : Numquid ad dominum tuum et ad te misit me dominus meus, ut loquerer sermones istos ? et non potius ad viros qui sedent super murum, ut comedant stercora sua, et bibant urinam suam vobiscum ?
verses.english: And Rabsaces answered them, "Has my master sent me to your master and to you to speak these words? Was it not rather to the men who sit on the wall, so that they might eat their own excrement and drink their own urine along with you?" This crude statement was meant to provoke fear and disgust among the common people.

verses.latin: Stetit itaque Rabsaces, et clamavit voce magna Judaice, et ait : Audite verba regis magni, regis Assyriorum.
verses.english: So Rabsaces stood up and cried out with a loud voice in the language of Juda, saying, "Hear the words of the great king, the king of the Assyrians!"

verses.latin: Hæc dicit rex : Non vos seducat Ezechias : non enim poterit eruere vos de manu mea.
verses.english: "Thus says the king: 'Do not let Ezechias deceive you, for he will not be able to deliver you from my hand.'"

verses.latin: Neque fiduciam vobis faciat super Dominum, dicens : Liberans liberabit nos Dominus, et non tradetur civitas hæc in manu regis Assyriorum.
verses.english: "'Nor let him make you trust in the Lord, saying, "The Lord will surely deliver us, and this city will not be handed over to the king of the Assyrians."'

verses.latin: Nolite audire Ezechiam. Hæc enim dicit rex Assyriorum : Facite mecum aliquid, et egredimini ad me : et uniuscujusque comedite de vinea sua, et de ficu sua, et bibite aquam de cisternis vestris,
verses.english: "'Do not listen to Ezechias! For thus says the king of the Assyrians: Make peace with me and come out to me. Then each of you will eat from his own vineyard and from his own fig tree, and drink water from his own cisterns.'"

verses.latin: donec veniam, et ducam vos ad terram quæ similis est terræ vestræ, terram frugum et vini, terram panis et vinearum, terram oliveti et olei ac mellis, et vivetis, et non moriemini. Nolite audire Ezechiam, qui vos decipit dicens : Dominus liberabit nos.
verses.english: "'Until I come and take you away to a land that is like your own land—a land of grain and wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive groves and oil and honey. You will live there and not die. Do not listen to Ezechias, who deceives you by saying, "The Lord will deliver us."'

verses.latin: Numquid liberaverunt dii gentium singuli terram suam de manu regis Assyriorum ?
verses.english: "'Have any of the gods of the nations truly delivered their land from the hand of the king of the Assyrians?'"

verses.latin: Ubi est deus Emath et Arphad ? ubi est deus Sepharvaim, Ana et Ava ? numquid liberaverunt Samariam de manu mea ?
verses.english: "'Where are the gods of Emath and Arphad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim, Ana, and Ava? Did they deliver Samaria from my hand?'"

verses.latin: Quænam sunt inter omnes terras dii, qui eruerunt terram suam de manu mea, ut possit eruere Dominus Jerusalem de manu mea ?
verses.english: "'Which are the gods among all the lands that have delivered their land from my hand, that the Lord might be able to deliver Jerusalem from my hand?'"

verses.latin: Et siluit populus, et non respondit ei verbum : mandaverat enim rex dicens : Ne respondeatis ei.
verses.english: But the people remained silent and did not answer him a single word, for the king had commanded them, saying, "Do not answer him."

verses.latin: Venit ergo Eliacim filius Helciæ præpositus domus, et Sobna scriba, et Joahe filius Asaph cancellarius ad Ezechiam scissis vestibus, et nuntiaverunt ei verba Rabsacis.
verses.english: So Eliacim, the son of Helcias, who was in charge of the household, along with Sobna the scribe and Joahe, the son of Asaph, the recorder, came to Ezechias with their clothes torn, and they reported to him the words of Rabsaces.

verses.latin: Anno tertio Osee filii Ela regis Israël, regnavit Ezechias filius Achaz regis Juda.
verses.english: In the third year of King Hosea, the son of Elah, who was the king of the northern kingdom of Israel, Hezekiah, the son of King Ahaz, began his reign over the southern kingdom of Judah.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et viginti novem annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Abi filia Zachariæ.
verses.english: Hezekiah was twenty-five years old when he started to reign, and he ruled for twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Abi, the daughter of Zechariah.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod erat bonum coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerat David pater ejus.
verses.english: Hezekiah lived a life that pleased the Lord, just as his ancestor David had done.

verses.latin: Ipse subvertit excelsa, et contrivit statuas, et succidit lucos, et confregit serpentem æneum quem fecerat Moyses: siquidem usque ad illud tempus adorabant filii Israël eum, vocavitque nomen ejus Nohestan.
