verses.latin: Quia dereliquerunt me, et sacrificaverunt diis alienis, irritantes me in cunctis operibus manuum suarum, et succensa est indignatio mea in loco hoc, et non extinguetur.
verses.english: "This is because they have abandoned Me and have sacrificed to foreign gods, provoking Me to anger with all the works of their hands. Therefore, My indignation has been kindled against this place, and it will not be extinguished."

verses.latin: Regi autem Juda qui misit vos ut consuleretis Dominum, sic dicite: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Pro eo quod audisti verba voluminis,
verses.english: "But to the king of Judah, who sent you to consult the Lord, thus you shall say: 'Thus says the Lord God of Israel: Because you have heard the words of the scroll,

verses.latin: Et perterritum est cor tuum, et humiliatus es coram Domino auditis sermonibus contra locum hunc, et contra habitatores ejus, ut fierent in stuporem et in maledictionem: et scidisti vestimenta tua, et plorasti coram me, et ego audivi te, ait Dominus.
verses.english: and your heart was humbled, and you humbled yourself before the Lord when you heard the words against this place and against its inhabitants—that they would become a desolation and a curse—and you tore your garments and wept before Me, I have heard you, says the Lord."

verses.latin: Idcirco colligam te ad patres tuos, et colligeris ad sepulchrum tuum in pace, ut non videant oculi tui omnia mala quæ inducturus sum super locum istum. Et retulerunt regi quæ dixerat.
verses.english: "Therefore, behold, I will gather you to your fathers, and you shall be gathered to your tomb in peace. Your eyes shall not see all the evils which I am about to bring upon this place.'" And they reported to the king everything she had said.

verses.latin: Misit ergo rex, et congregavit ad se omnes senes Juda et Jerusalem.
verses.english: So the king sent messengers and gathered to himself all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Ascenditque rex templum Domini, et omnes viri Juda, et universi qui habitabant in Jerusalem cum eo, sacerdotes et prophetæ, et omnis populus a parvo usque ad magnum: legitque cunctis audientibus omnia verba libri fœderis, qui inventus fuerat in domo Domini.
verses.english: And the king went up to the Temple of the Lord, and all the men of Judah, and all those who lived in Jerusalem went with him—the priests and the prophets, and all the people, from the least important to the greatest. And he read in their hearing all the words of the book of the covenant, which had been found in the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Annorum octo erat Josias cum regnare cœpisset, et triginta uno annos regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Idida filia Adaja de Besecath.
verses.english: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign. He reigned for thirty-one years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Idida, daughter of Adaja, from Besecath.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod rectum est coram Domino, et ambulavit per omnes vias David patris sui: non declinavit nec ad dexteram, nec ad sinistram.
verses.english: He did what was right in the sight of the Lord, and he walked in all the ways of his father David. He did not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.

verses.latin: Anno autem octavo decimo regis Josiæ, misit rex Saphan filium Eseliæ, filii Mesullam, scribam templi Domini, dicens:
verses.english: In the eighteenth year of King Josiah's reign, the king sent Shaphan, the son of Azaliah, the son of Meshullam, who was the scribe of the Temple of the Lord. The king said to him:

verses.latin: Vade ad Helciam sacerdotem magnum, ut pecuniam deponat, quæ illata est in templum Domini a janitoribus, quibus custodienda tradita est:
verses.english: “Go to Hilkiah, the high priest, so that he may gather the money that has been brought into the Temple of the Lord by the doorkeepers, who were entrusted with keeping it safe.

verses.latin: et det eam fabris operum, et tignariis, atque cæmentariis, qui operantur in templo Domini,
verses.english: And let him give this money to the workmen, to the carpenters, and to the masons, who are repairing the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: et iis qui parietes instaurare debent, et ut emant ligna, et lapides de cœsi ad instauranda loca templi Domini.
verses.english: And let them use the money to restore the walls, and to buy timber and cut stones for the repair of the places in the Temple of the Lord.”

verses.latin: Verumtamen non supputetur eis argentum quod accipiunt, sed in potestate habebunt, et in fide.
verses.english: However, the money that they receive for this work is not to be accounted for, but it is to be given to them based on their authority and trustworthiness.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Helcias pontifex ad Saphan scribam: Librum legis inveni in domo Domini. Deditque Helcias librum Saphan, qui legit illum.
verses.english: Then Hilkiah, the high priest, said to Shaphan, the scribe, “I have found the Book of the Law in the house of the Lord.” Hilkiah gave the book to Shaphan, and Shaphan read it.

verses.latin: Venitque Saphan scriba ad regem, et retulit ei quod præceperat: insuper et nuntiavit ei dicens: Pecuniam, quæ reperta est in domo Domini, dederunt servi tui, operariis, et iis, qui procurant opera in templo Domini.
verses.english: Shaphan, the scribe, came back to the king and reported what had been commanded. Furthermore, he informed the king, saying, “Your servants have given the money that was found in the house of the Lord to the workmen and to those who supervise the work in the Temple of the Lord.”

verses.latin: Narravitque Saphan scriba regi, dicens: Librum dedit mihi Helcias sacerdos. Quem cum legisset Saphan coram rege,
verses.english: Shaphan, the scribe, also told the king, saying, “Hilkiah, the priest, gave me a book.” And when Shaphan had read it in the presence of the king,

verses.latin: et audisset rex verba libri legis Domini, scidit vestimenta sua.
verses.english: and the king heard the words of the book of the Law of the Lord, he tore his garments in a sign of deep distress and repentance.

verses.latin: Et præcepit Helciæ sacerdoti, et Ahicam filio Saphan, et Achobor filio Micha, et Saphan scribæ, et Asaæ servo regis, dicens:
verses.english: Then the king commanded Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Achbor the son of Micaiah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah, the king's servant, saying:

verses.latin: Ite, et consulite Dominum super me, et super populo, et super omni Juda, de verbis libri hujus qui inventus est: quoniam iratus est furor Domini in nos, eo quod non audierint patres nostri verba libri hujus, ut facerent omnia quæ scripta sunt nobis.
verses.english: “Go, and consult the Lord on my behalf, and on behalf of the people, and on behalf of all Judah, concerning the words of this book that has been found. For the wrath of the Lord is greatly kindled against us, because our fathers did not listen to the words of this book, to do all that is written for us.”

verses.latin: Ierunt itaque Helcias sacerdos, et Ahicam, et Achobor, et Saphan, et Asaæ ad Holdam prophetissam uxorem Sellum filii Thecue, filii Araas, custodis vestium, quæ habitabat in Jerusalem in secunda, locutique sunt ad eam.
verses.english: So Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam, and Achbor, and Shaphan, and Asaiah went to Huldah the prophetess. She was the wife of Shallum, son of Tikvah, son of Harhas, who was the keeper of the wardrobe. She lived in Jerusalem in the Second Quarter of the city. They spoke to her.

verses.latin: Quæ respondit eis: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Dicite viro qui misit vos ad me:
verses.english: And she answered them, “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: ‘Tell the man who sent you to me:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce ego inducam mala super locum hunc, et super habitatores ejus, omnia verba libri quæ legit rex Juda.
verses.english: Thus says the Lord: Behold, I am bringing disaster upon this place and upon its inhabitants, according to all the words of the book that the king of Judah has read.

verses.latin: Quia dereliquerunt me, et sacrificaverunt diis alienis, irritantes me in cunctis operibus manuum suarum: et succendetur indignatio mea in loco hoc, et non extinguetur.
verses.english: Because they have abandoned Me and have offered sacrifices to other gods, provoking Me with all the works of their hands, My indignation will be kindled against this place, and it will not be extinguished.’

verses.latin: Regi autem Juda, qui misit vos ut consuleretis Dominum, sic dicetis: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Pro eo quod audisti verba libri,
verses.english: But to the king of Judah, who sent you to consult the Lord, you shall say this: ‘Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Because you have heard the words of the book,

verses.latin: et perculsum est cor tuum, et humiliatus es a facie Domini auditis sermonibus contra locum istum, et contra habitatores ejus, ut fierent in stuporem et in maledictionem: et scidisti vestimenta tua, et flevisti coram me, et ego audivi, ait Dominus:
verses.english: and your heart was moved, and you humbled yourself before the Lord when you heard the words against this place and against its inhabitants, that they would become a desolation and a curse—and because you tore your garments and wept before Me—I also have heard it,’ says the Lord.

verses.latin: Idcirco colligam te ad patres tuos, et colligeris ad sepulchrum tuum in pace, ut non videant oculi tui omnia mala quæ inducturus sum super locum istum. Retuleruntque regi quæ dixerat.
verses.english: Therefore, behold, I will gather you to your fathers, and you shall be gathered to your grave in peace. Your eyes will not see all the evil that I am bringing upon this place.” And they reported her words to the king.

verses.latin: Misit ergo rex, et congregati sunt ad eum omnes senes Iuda et Ierusalem.
verses.english: King Josiah then sent messengers, and all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem gathered before him.

verses.latin: Ascenditque rex templum Domini, et omnes viri Iuda, universique qui habitabant Ierusalem cum eo: sacerdotes et prophetae, et omnis populus a parvo usque ad magnum. Legitque coram omnibus verba libri fœderis, quod inventum fuerat in domo Domini.
verses.english: The king went up to the Temple of the Lord, and with him were all the men of Judah, everyone living in Jerusalem, the priests, the prophets, and all the people, from the youngest to the oldest. He read aloud to everyone the words of the book of the covenant that had been found in the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Stetitque rex super gradum: et percussit fœdus coram Domino, ut ambularent post Dominum, et custodirent præcepta eius, et testimonia, et cæremonias in omni corde, et in omni anima, et firmarent verba fœderis hujus, quæ scripta erant in libro isto: et adquievit omnis populus pacto.
verses.english: The king then stood by the pillar and made a covenant before the Lord, promising to follow the Lord, to keep His commandments, His testimonies, and His ceremonies with all his heart and all his soul, and to uphold the words of this covenant that were written in this book. And all the people agreed to the covenant.

verses.latin: Præcepitque rex Helciæ pontifici, et sacerdotibus secundi ordinis, et ianitoribus, ut proiicerent de templo Domini omnia vasa quæ facta fuerant Baal, et ascheræ, cunctæque militiæ cæli: et combussit ea foris Ierusalem in valle Cedron, et tulit pulverem eorum in Bethel.
verses.english: The king then commanded Hilkiah the high priest, the priests of the second rank, and the doorkeepers to remove from the Temple of the Lord all the vessels that had been made for Baal, for Asherah, and for all the host of the heavens—meaning, all the objects used for pagan worship. He burned these things outside Jerusalem in the Kidron Valley and carried their ashes to Bethel.

verses.latin: Et delevit aruspices quos posuerant reges Iuda ad incensum faciendum in excelsis per civitates Iuda et in circuitu Ierusalem: et eos qui adolebant Baal, et solem, et lunam, et duodecim signa, et omnem militiam cæli.
verses.english: He abolished the idolatrous priests whom the kings of Judah had appointed to burn incense on the high places throughout the cities of Judah and around Jerusalem. He also abolished those who burned incense to Baal, to the sun, to the moon, to the constellations, and to all the host of the heavens.

verses.latin: Palumque ascheræ, de domo Domini asportari fecit foras Ierusalem in convalle Cedron, et combussit illic, et redegit in pulverem, et projecit pulverem super sepulchra vulgi.
verses.english: He had the Asherah pole—a pagan idol—carried out from the Lord’s house, outside Jerusalem, into the Kidron Valley. He burned it there, ground it to dust, and threw the dust on the graves of the common people to defile them.

verses.latin: Destruxit quoque ædiculas effeminatorum, quæ erant in domo Domini, in quibus mulieres texebant quasi domunculas idoli.
verses.english: He also tore down the quarters of the male cult prostitutes, which were in the house of the Lord, where women wove garments for the idol Asherah.

verses.latin: Congregavitque omnes sacerdotes de civitatibus Iuda: et contaminavit excelsa, ubi sacrificabant sacerdotes, de Gabaa usque Bersabee: et demolitus est aras portarum in introitu ianuæ Iosue principis civitatis, quæ erat ad sinistram ingredientis portam.
verses.english: He gathered all the priests from the cities of Judah and defiled the high places where these priests had offered sacrifices, from Geba to Beersheba. He also tore down the altars at the gates, specifically the one at the entrance of the gate of Joshua, the governor of the city, which was on the left side as one entered the gate.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non ascendebant sacerdotes excelsorum ad altare Domini in Ierusalem: sed comedebant azyma in medio fratrum suorum.
verses.english: However, the priests from these high places were not allowed to ascend to the Lord’s altar in Jerusalem; instead, they ate unleavened bread among their fellow priests.

verses.latin: Contaminavit quoque Topheth, quod est in valle filii Ennom, ut nemo consecraret filium suum, aut filiam igni Moloch.
verses.english: He also defiled Topheth, which is in the Valley of Ben Hinnom, so that no one could consecrate his son or daughter by passing them through fire to Molech—a horrific pagan ritual.

verses.latin: Et abstulit equos quos dederant reges Iuda soli, in introitu domus Domini, iuxta exedram Nathanmelech eunuchi, qui erat præpositus in Pharurim: et quadrigas solis combussit igni.
verses.english: And he removed the horses that the kings of Judah had dedicated to the sun god, located at the entrance of the house of the Lord, near the chamber of Nathan-Melech, the eunuch who was in charge of the storerooms. He also burned the chariots of the sun with fire.

verses.latin: Altaria quoque quæ erant super tectum cænaculi Achaz, quæ fecerant reges Iuda, et altaria quæ fecerat Manasses in duobus atriis domus Domini, delevit rex: et currens inde comminuit, et redegit in pulverem, et sparsit super torrentem Cedron.
verses.english: The king also tore down the altars that were on the roof of Ahaz’s upper chamber, which the kings of Judah had made. And he destroyed the altars that Manasseh had made in the two courtyards of the house of the Lord. He ran from there, broke them into pieces, ground them to dust, and scattered the dust over the Kidron stream.

verses.latin: Excelsa quoque, quæ erant in Ierusalem, in dextera parte montis Offensionis, quæ ædificaverat Salomon rex Israël Astharoth idolo Sidoniorum, et Chamos idolo Moabitarum, et Moloch idolo filiorum Ammon, polluit rex.
verses.english: The king also defiled the high places that were in Jerusalem, on the right side of the Mount of Corruption—meaning, the Mount of Olives. These had been built by King Solomon of Israel for Ashtoreth, the idol of the Sidonians; for Chemosh, the idol of the Moabites; and for Molech, the idol of the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Et contrivit statuas, et succidit lucos: et replevit loca eorum ossibus mortuorum.
verses.english: He smashed the pagan pillars, cut down the Asherah poles, and filled their places with the bones of the dead—an act of severe defilement.

verses.latin: Insuper et altare quod erat in Bethel, et excelsum quod fecerat Ieroboam filius Nabat, qui peccare fecerat Israël: et altare illud, et excelsum subvertit. Et combussit excelsum, et redegit in pulverem, et succendit lucum.
verses.english: Moreover, he also tore down the altar in Bethel and the high place that Jeroboam son of Nebat had built, the one who caused Israel to sin. He overthrew that altar and that high place. He burned the high place, ground it to dust, and burned the Asherah pole.

verses.latin: Et conversus Iosias, vidit ibi sepulchra quæ erant in monte: misitque, et tulit ossa de sepulchris, et combussit super altare, et polluit illud iuxta verbum Domini, quod locutus est vir Dei, qui hæc prædixerat.
verses.english: Then Josiah turned and saw the tombs that were on the mountain there. He sent men to take the bones from the tombs, and he burned them on the altar, thus defiling it, just as the word of the Lord had declared through the man of God who had prophesied these very things.

verses.latin: Et ait: Quis est titulus iste quem video? Responderuntque ei viri civitatis: Sepulchrum est viri Dei, qui venit de Iuda, et prædixit hæc verba quæ fecisti super altare Bethel.
verses.english: He asked, 'What is that monument I see?' The men of the city answered him, 'It is the tomb of the man of God who came from Judah and foretold these very things that you have done against the altar of Bethel.'

verses.latin: Et ait: Dimitte eum, nemo commoveat ossa eius. Et intemerata permanserunt ossa eius cum ossibus prophetæ, qui venerat de Samaria.
verses.english: And he said, 'Leave him alone; let no one disturb his bones.' So his bones remained untouched, along with the bones of the prophet who had come from Samaria.

verses.latin: Insuper et omnes domos excelsorum per civitates Samariæ, quas fecerant reges Israël ad irritandum Dominum, abstulit Iosias: et fecit eis iuxta omnia opera quæ fecerat in Bethel.
verses.english: Moreover, Josiah also removed all the shrines of the high places in the cities of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had made to provoke the Lord to anger. He dealt with them in the same way he had dealt with all the works he did in Bethel.

verses.latin: Et immolavit universos sacerdotes excelsorum, qui erant ibi, super aras: et combussit ossa hominum super illis. Reversusque est Ierusalem.
verses.english: He slaughtered all the priests of the high places who were there, sacrificing them on their own altars, and he burned human bones upon those altars to defile them thoroughly. Then he returned to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Præcepitque rex omni populo, dicens: Celebratæ agite Phase Domino Deo vestro, secundum quod scriptum est in libro fœderis hujus.
verses.english: Then the king commanded all the people, saying, 'Celebrate the Passover to the Lord your God, according to what is written in this book of the covenant.'

verses.latin: Certe igitur non est factum Phase tale a diebus judicum, qui judicaverunt Israël, et omnium dierum regum Israël et regum Iuda,
verses.english: Indeed, no such Passover had been celebrated from the days of the judges who judged Israel, nor in all the days of the kings of Israel or the kings of Judah,

verses.latin: sicut in Ierusalem factum est Domino in decimo octavo anno regis Iosiæ.
verses.english: as it was observed for the Lord in Jerusalem in the eighteenth year of King Josiah's reign.

verses.latin: Sed et pythones, et ariolos, et therapeutas, et idola, et immunditias, et abominationes quæ fuerant in terra Iuda et Ierusalem, abstulit Iosias: ut statueret verba legis, quæ scripta sunt in libro, quem invenit Helcias sacerdos in templo Domini.
verses.english: Furthermore, Josiah also removed the mediums, the spiritists, the household idols, the pagan images, and all the detestable things that had been in the land of Judah and Jerusalem. He did this to fulfill the words of the Law that were written in the book which Hilkiah the priest had found in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Similis illi non fuit ante eum rex, qui reverteretur ad Dominum in omni corde suo, et in omni anima sua, et in omni virtute sua, iuxta omnem legem Moysi: neque post eum surrexit similis illi.
verses.english: Before him, there was no king like him, who turned back to the Lord with all his heart, with all his soul, and with all his strength, according to all the Law of Moses; nor did any like him arise after him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non est aversus Dominus ab ira furoris sui magnæ, qua iratus est adversum Iudam propter provocationes quibus provocaverat eum Manasses.
verses.english: Nevertheless, the Lord did not turn away from the fierceness of His great wrath, with which He was angry against Judah because of all the provocations with which Manasseh had provoked Him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus: Etiam Iudam auferam a facie mea, sicut abstuli Israël: et proiiciam civitatem hanc Ierusalem, quam elegi, et domum de qua dixi: Erit nomen meum ibi.
verses.english: And the Lord said, 'I will also remove Judah from my sight, just as I removed Israel. I will cast away this city of Jerusalem, which I chose, and the house about which I said, 'My Name shall be there.''

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Iosiæ, et omnium quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Iuda?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.latin: In diebus eius ascendit Pharao Nechao rex Ægypti contra regem Assyriorum ad flumen Euphraten: et ivit Iosias rex in occursum eius, et occisus est in Mageddo cum vidisset eum.
verses.english: In his days, Pharaoh Necho, king of Egypt, went up against the king of Assyria to the Euphrates River. King Josiah went out to meet him, and Pharaoh Necho killed him at Megiddo the moment he saw him.

verses.latin: Et asportaverunt eum servi sui mortuum de Mageddo: et pertulerunt in Ierusalem, et sepelierunt in sepulchro suo. Tulitque populus terræ Ioachaz filium Iosiæ: et unxerunt eum, et constituerunt regem pro patre suo.
verses.english: His servants carried his dead body from Megiddo and brought him to Jerusalem and buried him in his own tomb. Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz, Josiah's son, anointed him, and made him king in place of his father.

verses.latin: Viginti trium annorum erat Ioachaz cum regnare cœpisset, et tribus mensibus regnavit in Ierusalem: nomen matris eius Amital filia Ieremiæ de Lobna.
verses.english: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for three months in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Hamutal, daughter of Jeremiah, from Libnah.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino, iuxta omnia quæ fecerant patres eius.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, just as all his fathers had done.

verses.latin: Ligavitque eum Pharao Nechao in Rebla, quæ est in terra Emath, ne regnaret in Ierusalem: et imposuit mulctam terræ centum talentum argenti, et talentum auri.
verses.english: Pharaoh Necho imprisoned him at Riblah in the land of Hamath, so that he could not reign in Jerusalem. And Pharaoh imposed a tax on the land: one hundred talents of silver and one talent of gold.

verses.latin: Regnavitque Pharao Nechao Eliacim filium Iosiæ pro Iosia patre eius: et vertit nomen eius Ioacim. Porro Ioachaz tulit, et duxit in Ægyptum, mortuusque est ibi.
verses.english: Pharaoh Necho then made Eliakim, Josiah's son, king in place of Josiah his father, and changed his name to Jehoiakim. As for Jehoahaz, Pharaoh took him and brought him to Egypt, where he died.

verses.latin: Argentum autem et aurum Ioacim dedit Pharaoni, cum attenuasset terram, ut daret pecuniam iuxta præceptum Pharaonis: et unumquemque secundum vires suas, exegit argentum et aurum de populo terræ, ut daret Pharaoni Nechao.
verses.english: Jehoiakim gave the silver and gold to Pharaoh, after he had heavily taxed the land to pay the money according to Pharaoh's command. He exacted the silver and gold from each person according to their means, taking it from the people of the land to give to Pharaoh Necho.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat Ioacim cum regnare cœpisset, et undecim annis regnavit in Ierusalem: nomen matris eius Zebida filia Phadaia de Ruma.
verses.english: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for eleven years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Zebidah, daughter of Pedaiah, from Rumah.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino, iuxta omnia quæ fecerant patres eius.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, just as all his fathers had done.

verses.latin: In diebus eius ascendit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, et factus est ei Ioacim servus tribus annis: et rursum rebellavit contra eum.
verses.english: In Jehoiakim’s days, Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, came up, and Jehoiakim became his servant for three years; then he turned and rebelled against him again.

verses.latin: Immisitque Dominus in eum latrunculos Chaldæorum, et latrunculos Syriæ, et latrunculos Moab, et latrunculos filiorum Ammon, et immisit eos in Iudam, ut disperderent illam iuxta verbum Domini, quod locutus fuerat per servos suos prophetas.
verses.english: And the Lord sent against him raiding bands of Chaldeans, raiding bands of Syrians, raiding bands of Moabites, and raiding bands of the Ammonites. He sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of the Lord which He had spoken through His servants, the prophets.

verses.latin: Vere igitur iuxta verbum Domini factum est hoc in Iuda, ut auferret illum a facie sua propter peccata Manasses universa quæ fecerat,
verses.english: Indeed, this came to pass in Judah according to the word of the Lord, so that He might remove them from His presence because of all the sins of Manasseh that he had committed.

verses.latin: Misit igitur rex, et congregavit ad se omnes seniores Juda et Jerusalem.
verses.english: So the king sent out messengers and gathered to himself all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Ascenditque rex templum Domini, et omnes viri Juda, universique qui inventi sunt in Jerusalem cum eo, sacerdotes et prophetae, et omnis populus a parvo usque ad magnum: legitque, audientibus cunctis, omnia verba libri fœderis, qui inventus fuerat in domo Domini.
verses.english: And the king went up to the Temple of the Lord. All the men of Judah, everyone found in Jerusalem, the priests, the prophets, and all the people—from the least to the greatest—went with him. Then the king read, while everyone listened, all the words of the covenant book that had been found in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Stetitque rex super gradum: et percussit fœdus coram Domino, ut ambularent post Dominum, et custodirent præcepta ejus, et testimonia, et cæremonias in omni corde, et in omni anima, et firmarent verba fœderis hujus, quæ scripta erant in libro isto: et acquievit omnis populus pacto.
verses.english: The king stood on his royal platform and made a solemn covenant before the Lord: that they would walk after the Lord and keep His commandments, His testimonies, and His statutes with all their heart and all their soul. They also promised to confirm the words of this covenant, which were written in this book. And all the people agreed to this covenant.

verses.latin: Præcepitque rex Helciæ pontifici, et sacerdotibus secundi ordinis, et janitoribus, ut projicerent de templo Domini omnia vasa quæ facta fuerant Baal, et ascheræ, et omni militiæ cæli: et combussit ea foris Jerusalem in convalle Cedron, et tulit pulverem eorum in Bethel.
verses.english: Then the king commanded Hilkiah, the high priest, the priests of the second order, and the doorkeepers to remove from the Temple of the Lord all the vessels that had been made for Baal, for Asherah, and for all the host of the sky. He burned these items outside Jerusalem, in the Kidron Valley, and carried their ashes to Bethel.

verses.latin: Et deponere fecit aruspices quos posuerant reges Juda ad adolendum in excelsis per civitates Juda, et in circuitu Jerusalem: et eos qui adolebant Baal, et solem, et lunam, et duodecim signa, et omnem militiam cæli.
verses.english: He removed the idolatrous priests whom the kings of Judah had appointed to burn incense at the high places throughout the cities of Judah and around Jerusalem. He also removed those who burned incense to Baal, to the sun, to the moon, to the twelve constellations of the zodiac, and to all the host of the sky.

verses.latin: Et truncos ascheræ de domo Domini asportari fecit foras Jerusalem in convallem Cedron, et combussit eos ibi, et redegit in pulverem, et projecit pulverem super sepulchra vulgi.
verses.english: He had the Asherah poles brought out from the Temple of the Lord, outside Jerusalem into the Kidron Valley. There he burned them, ground them to powder, and scattered the powder over the graves of the common people.

verses.latin: Destruxit quoque domunculos effeminatorum, qui erant in domo Domini, in quibus mulieres texebant quasi domunculas idolis.
verses.english: He also tore down the living quarters of the male prostitutes, those who served false gods, which were in the Temple of the Lord, where women wove garments, like small shelters for idols.

verses.latin: Congregavitque omnes sacerdotes de civitatibus Juda: et contaminavit excelsa ubi sacrificabant sacerdotes, de Gabaa usque Bersabee: et demolitus est aras portarum in introitu portæ Josue principis civitatis, quæ erat ad sinistram portæ urbis.
verses.english: He gathered all the priests from the cities of Judah. He desecrated the high places where the priests had offered sacrifices, from Geba to Beer-sheba. He also tore down the altars at the entrance of the gate of Joshua, the governor of the city, which was to the left of the city gate.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non ascendebant sacerdotes excelsorum ad altare Domini in Jerusalem: sed comedebant azyma in medio fratrum suorum.
verses.english: However, the priests of the high places were not permitted to ascend to the altar of the Lord in Jerusalem. Instead, they ate unleavened bread among their fellow priests.

verses.latin: Contaminavit quoque Topheth, quod est in convalle filii Ennom: ut nemo consecraret filium suum, aut filiam igni Moloch.
verses.english: He also desecrated Topheth, which is in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, so that no one could consecrate his son or his daughter by passing them through fire to Moloch.

verses.latin: Abstulit quoque equos quos dederant reges Juda Soli, in introitu templi Domini, juxta cubiculum Nathanmelech eunuchi, qui erat præpositus in Pharurim: currus autem Solis combussit igni.
verses.english: He removed the horses that the kings of Judah had dedicated to the sun god, at the entrance to the Temple of the Lord, near the chamber of Nathan-melech, the eunuch who was in charge of the courtyards. And the chariots of the sun god he burned with fire.

verses.latin: Altaria quoque quæ erant super tectum cœnaculi Achaz, quæ fecerant reges Juda, et altaria quæ fecerat Manasses in duobus atriis templi Domini, destruxit rex: et festinanter currens contrivit de loco illo, et reduxit cinerem eorum in torrentem Cedron.
verses.english: The altars that were on the roof of the upper chamber of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had made, and the altars that Manasseh had made in the two courtyards of the Temple of the Lord—these the king destroyed. He quickly ran and broke them down from that place and brought their ashes to the Kidron torrent.

verses.latin: Excelsa quoque quæ erant in Jerusalem in parte dextra montis Offensionis, quæ ædificaverat Salomon rex Israël Astharoth idolo Sidoniorum, et Chamos idolo Moabitarum, et Moloch idolo filiorum Ammon, contaminavit rex.
verses.english: The high places that were in Jerusalem, on the right side of the Mount of Offense, which Solomon, king of Israel, had built for Ashtoreth, the idol of the Sidonians, and for Chemosh, the idol of the Moabites, and for Milcom (Moloch), the idol of the Ammonites—these the king desecrated.

verses.latin: Et contrivit statuas, et succidit lucos: implevitque loca eorum ossibus mortuorum.
verses.english: He broke the sacred pillars into pieces and cut down the Asherah poles. Then he filled their places with the bones of the dead.

verses.latin: Insuper et altare quod erat in Bethel, et excelsum quod fecerat Jeroboam filius Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël: et altare illud, et excelsum destruxit, atque combussit, et comminuit in pulverem, et succendit lucum.
verses.english: Furthermore, the altar that was in Bethel, and the high place that Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, had made—he who caused Israel to sin—both that altar and that high place Josiah destroyed. He burned it, crushed it to powder, and burned the Asherah pole as well.

verses.latin: Et conversus Josias, vidit ibi sepulchra quæ erant in monte: misitque, et tulit ossa de sepulchris, et combussit super altare, et contaminavit illud juxta verbum Domini, quod locutus est vir Dei, qui annuntiaverat hæc verba.
verses.english: Then Josiah turned and saw the tombs that were there on the mountain. He sent men, took the bones from the tombs, and burned them on the altar, thereby desecrating it, just as the word of the Lord had declared through the man of God who had proclaimed these words long ago.

verses.latin: Et ait: Quis est titulus ille, quem video? Responderuntque ei viri civitatis: Sepulchrum est viri Dei, qui venit de Juda, et annuntiavit verba hæc quæ fecisti super altare Bethel.
verses.english: And he asked, 'What is that monument I see there?' The men of the city replied to him, 'It is the tomb of the man of God who came from Judah and announced these very things that you have done against the altar of Bethel.'

verses.latin: Et ait: Dimittite eum: nemo commoveat ossa ejus. Et intacta manserunt ossa ejus cum ossibus prophetæ, qui venerat de Samaria.
verses.english: Josiah said, 'Leave him alone. Let no one disturb his bones.' So his bones remained untouched, along with the bones of the prophet who had come from Samaria.

verses.latin: Insuper et omnia fana excelsorum quæ erant in civitatibus Samariæ, quæ fecerant reges Israël ad irritandum Dominum, abstulit Josias: et fecit eis juxta omnia opera quæ fecerat in Bethel.
verses.english: Moreover, all the shrines of the high places that were in the cities of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had made to provoke the Lord to anger, Josiah removed. He did to them exactly as he had done in Bethel.

verses.latin: Et immolavit universos sacerdotes excelsorum qui erant ibi, super aras: et combussit ossa hominum super illis: reversusque est Jerusalem.
verses.english: He sacrificed all the priests of the high places who were there on the altars, and he burned human bones upon them. Then he returned to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Præcepitque rex omni populo, dicens: Celebrate Phase Domino Deo vestro, sicut scriptum est in libro fœderis hujus.
verses.english: The king commanded all the people, saying, 'Celebrate the Passover to the Lord your God, as it is written in this covenant book.'

verses.latin: Neque enim factum est Phase tale ab diebus judicum, qui judicaverunt Israël, et omnium dierum regum Israël, et regum Juda,
verses.english: For such a Passover had not been celebrated since the days of the judges who judged Israel, nor in all the days of the kings of Israel or the kings of Judah.

verses.latin: sicut in octavodecimo anno regis Josiæ, hoc Phase factum est Domino in Jerusalem.
verses.english: But in the eighteenth year of King Josiah's reign, this Passover was celebrated to the Lord in Jerusalem with great devotion.

verses.latin: Sed et pythones, et aruspices, et statuas, et idola, et omnes abominationes quæ fuerant in terra Juda et Jerusalem, abstulit Josias: ut statueret verba legis, quæ scripta erant in libro quem invenit Helcias sacerdos in templo Domini.
verses.english: Furthermore, Josiah abolished the mediums and spiritists, the household gods and idols, and all the abominations that were found in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem. He did this to uphold the words of the law that were written in the book which Hilkiah the priest found in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Similis illi non fuit ante eum rex ab omni corde suo, et ex omni anima sua, et ex omni virtute sua, juxta omnem legem Moysi: neque post eum surrexit similis illi.
verses.english: There was no king like him before him, who turned to the Lord with all his heart, with all his soul, and with all his might, according to all the Law of Moses. Nor did any like him arise after him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non est aversus Dominus ab ira furoris sui magnæ, qua iratus est furor ejus contra Judam propter irritationes quibus provocaverat eum Manasses.
verses.english: Nevertheless, the Lord did not turn away from the fierceness of His great wrath, with which His anger burned against Judah because of all the provocations by which Manasseh had provoked Him.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus: Etiam Judam auferam a facie mea, sicut abstuli Israël: et projiciam civitatem hanc Jerusalem, quam elegi, et domum de qua dixi: Erit nomen meum ibi.
verses.english: And the Lord said, 'I will also remove Judah from my presence, just as I removed Israel. I will cast away this city of Jerusalem, which I chose, and the house about which I said, 'My Name shall be there.''

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Josiæ, et universa quæ fecit, nonne scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: In diebus ejus ascendit Pharao Nechao rex Ægypti contra regem Assyriorum ad flumen Euphraten: et abiit Josias rex in occursum ejus, et occisus est in Mageddo cum vidisset eum.
verses.english: In his days, Pharaoh Neco, king of Egypt, went up to attack the king of Assyria by the Euphrates River. King Josiah went out to meet him in battle, and when Josiah saw him, he was killed at Megiddo.

verses.latin: Et asportaverunt eum servi sui mortuum de Mageddo: et pertulerunt in Jerusalem, et sepelierunt eum in sepulchro suo. Et tulit populus terræ Joachaz filium Josiæ: et unxerunt eum, et constituerunt regem pro patre suo.
verses.english: His servants carried his dead body from Megiddo, brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own tomb. Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz, Josiah's son, anointed him, and made him king in place of his father.

verses.latin: Viginti trium annorum erat Joachaz cum regnare cœpisset, et tribus mensibus regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Amital, filia Jeremiæ de Lobna.
verses.english: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for three months in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Hamutal, daughter of Jeremiah, from Libnah.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerant patres ejus.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, just as all his fathers had done.

verses.latin: Alligavitque eum Pharao Nechao in Rebla, quæ est in terra Emath, ne regnaret in Jerusalem: et imposuit mulctam terræ centum talentis argenti, et talento auri.
verses.english: Pharaoh Neco imprisoned him at Riblah, in the land of Hamath, so that he could not reign in Jerusalem. He also imposed a fine on the land: one hundred talents of silver and one talent of gold.

verses.latin: Posuitque Pharao Nechao Eliacim filium Josiæ pro Josia patre ejus: et vertit nomen ejus Joacim. Joachaz vero tulit, et duxit in Ægyptum, et mortuus est ibi.
verses.english: Pharaoh Neco made Eliakim, Josiah's son, king in place of Josiah his father, and changed his name to Jehoiakim. As for Jehoahaz, Pharaoh took him away to Egypt, and he died there.

verses.latin: Argentum autem et aurum dedit Joacim Pharaoni, cum taxasset unumquemque juxta vires suas: et exegit argentum et aurum de populo terræ, ut daret Pharaoni Nechao.
verses.english: Jehoiakim gave the silver and gold to Pharaoh after he had levied the amount from each person according to their means. He exacted the silver and gold from the people of the land to give to Pharaoh Neco.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat Joacim cum regnare cœpisset, et undecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Zebida, filia Phadaiæ de Ruma.
verses.english: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for eleven years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Zebidah, daughter of Pedaiah, from Rumah.

verses.latin: Et fecit malum coram Domino juxta omnia quæ fecerant patres ejus.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, just as all his fathers had done.

verses.latin: In diebus ejus ascendit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, et factus est Joacim servus ejus tribus annis: et rursum rebellavit contra eum.
verses.english: In his days, Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, came up, and Jehoiakim became his servant for three years. Then he rebelled against him again.

verses.latin: Fecitque Dominus super eum latrunculos Chaldæorum, et latrunculos Syriæ, et latrunculos Moab, et latrunculos filiorum Ammon: et immisit eos in Judam, ut disperderent illam, juxta verbum Domini quod locutus fuerat per servos suos prophetas.
verses.english: The Lord sent against him raiding bands of Chaldeans, bands of Syrians, bands of Moabites, and bands of the Ammonites' sons. He sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of the Lord, which He had spoken through His servants the prophets.

verses.latin: Quia juxta verbum Domini factum est in Juda, ut auferret illam a facie sua propter peccata Manasse, universorum quæ fecit,
verses.english: For indeed, this happened in Judah according to the word of the Lord, that He might remove them from His presence because of all the sins of Manasseh and all that he had done.

verses.latin: Misit ergo rex, et congregati sunt ad eum omnes senes Iudae et Ierusalem.
verses.english: So King Josiah sent out orders, and all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem were gathered to him.

verses.latin: Ascenditque rex templum Domini, et omnes viri Iudae, et universi qui reperti sunt in Ierusalem, sacerdotes et prophetae, et omnis populus a parvo usque ad magnum: legitque cunctis audientibus omnia verba libri foederis, qui inventus est in domo Domini.
verses.english: The king then went up to the Temple of the Lord, God’s holy dwelling, and with him were all the men of Judah, and everyone who was found in Jerusalem—the priests, the prophets, and all the people, from the youngest to the oldest. He read aloud for all to hear all the words of the book of the covenant, the rediscovered ancient law of God, which had been found in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Stetitque rex super gradum: et percussit foedus coram Domino, ut ambularent post Dominum, et custodirent praecepta ejus, et testimonia, et caeremonias in omni corde, et in tota anima, et confirmarent verba foederis hujus quod scriptum erat in libro isto: et acquievit omnis populus pacto.
verses.english: The king stood by the pillar and made a solemn covenant before the Lord, promising that he and his people would walk after the Lord, and would keep His commandments, and His testimonies, and His sacred rites with all their heart and with all their soul. They vowed to confirm all the words of this covenant which were written in this book. And all the people confirmed their agreement to the covenant.

verses.latin: Praecepitque rex Helciae pontifici, et sacerdotibus secundi ordinis, et janitoribus, ut proiicerent de templo Domini omnia vasa quae facta fuerant Baal, et Aserae, et omni militiae caeli: et combussit ea foris Ierusalem in convalle Cedron, et tulit pulverem eorum in Bethel.
verses.english: The king then commanded Hilkiah the high priest, the priests of the second rank who assisted him, and the Temple doorkeepers, to remove from the Temple of the Lord all the items that had been made for the worship of Baal, and for the goddess Asherah, and for the worship of all the celestial bodies—the host of heaven. Josiah had these items burned outside Jerusalem in the Kidron Valley, a place of defilement, and had their ashes carried to Bethel, a site historically associated with Israelite idolatry.

verses.latin: Et deponere paravit augures quos constituerant reges Iudae, in fanis, et in civitatibus Iudae, et in circuitu Ierusalem: qui adolebant Bahal, et soli, et lunae, et duodecim signis, et omni militiae caeli.
verses.english: He then removed the pagan priests whom the kings of Judah had appointed to burn incense on the high places, in the cities of Judah, and in the areas around Jerusalem. These priests had burned incense to Baal, to the sun, to the moon, to the twelve constellations of the zodiac, and to all the celestial bodies—the host of heaven.

verses.latin: Palumque de Asera foras propulit de domo Domini in vallem Cedron Ierusalem, et combussit eam ibi, et redegit in pulverem, et aspersit super sepulchra vulgi.
verses.english: He brought the Asherah pole, an idolatrous cult object, out from the Temple of the Lord to the Kidron Valley in Jerusalem. There he burned it, ground it into dust, and scattered the dust over the graves of the common people, further defiling it.

verses.latin: Destruxit quoque domunculas effeminatorum, quæ erant in domo Domini, in quibus mulieres texebant quasi domunculas Aseræ.
verses.english: He also tore down the living quarters of the male cult prostitutes, which were located within the Temple of the Lord, where women wove hangings for the Asherah.

verses.latin: Congregavitque omnes sacerdotes de civitatibus Iudae, et contaminavit excelsa, ubi sacrificabant sacerdotes ab Gabaa usque Bersabee: et demolitus est aras portarum in introitu portae Iosue principis civitatis, quæ erat ad sinistram portæ civitatis.
verses.english: Josiah then brought all the priests from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem. He defiled the high places where these priests had offered sacrifices, from Geba in the north all the way to Beersheba in the south. He also demolished the altars at the entrance of the gate of Joshua, the governor of the city, which was to the left of the city gate.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non ascendebant sacerdotes excelsorum ad altare Domini in Ierusalem: sed tantum comedebant azyma in medio fratrum suorum.
verses.english: However, those priests who had served at the high places were not permitted to ascend to the altar of the Lord in Jerusalem; instead, they were only allowed to eat unleavened bread among their fellow priests, but not participate in the sacred Temple rituals.

verses.latin: Contaminavit quoque Topheth, quod est in valle filii Ennom, ut nemo consecraret filium suum, aut filiam igni Moloch.
verses.english: He also defiled Topheth, which is in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, to prevent anyone from consecrating their son or daughter by passing them through fire as a sacrifice to the pagan god Moloch. This practice of child sacrifice was abolished.

verses.latin: Abstulit quoque equos, quos dederant reges Iudae soli, in introitu templi Domini, juxta cubiculum Nathanmelech eunuchi, qui erat præpositus in Pharurim: currus quoque solis combussit igni.
verses.english: He removed the horses that the kings of Judah had dedicated to the sun god, which were at the entrance of the Temple of the Lord, near the chamber of Nathan-Melech, the eunuch who was in charge of the sacred courtyard. He also burned the chariots of the sun with fire.

verses.latin: Altaria quoque quæ erant super tectum cænaculi Achaz, quæ fecerant reges Iudae, et altaria quæ fecerat Manasses in duobus atriis domus Domini, destruxit rex: et festinanter conminuit, et aspersit pulverem eorum in torrentem Cedron.
verses.english: The altars that were on the roof of the upper chamber of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had built, and the altars that Manasseh had built in the two courtyards of the Temple of the Lord, these the king tore down. He quickly broke them into pieces and scattered their dust into the Kidron Valley.

verses.latin: Excelsa quoque quæ erant ex adverso Ierusalem, et in parte dextra montis Offensionis, quæ ædificaverat Salomon rex Israël Astaroth idolo Sidoniorum, et Chamos idolo Moab, et Moloch idolo filiorum Ammon, polluit rex.
verses.english: King Josiah also defiled the high places that were opposite Jerusalem, to the right of the Mount of Offence—also known as the Mount of Olives. These had been built by Solomon, the king of Israel, for Ashtoreth, the detestable idol of the Sidonians; for Chemosh, the detestable idol of Moab; and for Milcom, the detestable idol of the Ammonites. Josiah rendered these sites unusable for worship.

verses.latin: Et contrivit statuas, et succidit lucos: replevitque loca eorum ossibus mortuorum.
verses.english: He smashed the sacred pillars, cut down the Asherah poles, and filled their places with the bones of the dead, further desecrating these pagan sites.

verses.latin: Insuper et altare, quod erat in Bethel, et excelsum, quod fecerat Ieroboam filius Nabat, qui peccare fecit Israël: et altare illud, et excelsum destruxit, atque conbussit, et comminuit in pulverem, et succendit lucum.
verses.english: Furthermore, Josiah destroyed the altar at Bethel and the high place that Jeroboam son of Nebat had made, the very one who led Israel into sin. He pulled down that altar and the high place, burned them, crushed them to dust, and also burned the Asherah pole.

verses.latin: Et convertit se Iosias, et vidit ibi sepulchra quæ erant in monte: misitque et tulit ossa de sepulchris, et succendit ea super altare, et polluit illud juxta verbum Domini, quod locutus est vir Dei, qui hæc prædixit.
verses.english: As Josiah turned around, he saw the tombs that were on the mountain nearby. He sent and took the bones from those tombs, then burned them on the altar, thus defiling it. This action fulfilled the word of the Lord that had been spoken by the man of God, the prophet who had foretold these very events.

verses.latin: Et ait: Quis est titulus ille, quem video? Responderuntque ei cives illius civitatis: Sepulchrum est viri Dei, qui venit de Iuda, et prædixit verba hæc quæ fecisti super altare Bethel.
verses.english: And Josiah asked: 'What is that monument I see there?' The people of the city answered him: 'It is the tomb of the man of God, a prophet who came from Judah and foretold these very things that you have done against the altar of Bethel.'

verses.latin: Et ait: Dimitte eum, nemo commoveat ossa ejus. Et manserunt ossa illius cum ossibus prophetæ qui venerat de Samaria.
verses.english: So Josiah said: 'Leave him be; let no one disturb his bones.' Thus, his bones were left undisturbed, along with the bones of the prophet who had come from Samaria.

verses.latin: Insuper et omnes domos excelsorum per civitates Samariæ, quas fecerant reges Israël ad irritandum Dominum, abstulit Iosias: fecitque eis juxta omnia opera quæ fecerat in Bethel.
verses.english: Josiah also removed all the shrines of the high places in the cities of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had built to provoke the Lord to anger. He dealt with them in the same manner as all the things he had done in Bethel, thoroughly destroying them.

verses.latin: Et immolavit universos sacerdotes excelsorum qui erant ibi, in altaribus: et combussit ossa hominum super illa, reversusque est Ierusalem.
verses.english: He sacrificed all the priests of the high places who were there, offering them on their own altars. He also burned human bones on those altars, further desecrating them. After these purifications, Josiah returned to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Praecepitque omni populo, dicens: Celebrata phase Domino Deo vestro, sicut scriptum est in libro foederis hujus.
verses.english: Then King Josiah commanded all the people, saying: 'Celebrate the Passover to the Lord your God, exactly as it is written in this book of the covenant.'

verses.latin: Porro non fuit factum phase tale a diebus judicum, qui judicaverunt Israël, et omnium dierum regum Israël et regum Iudæ:
verses.english: Indeed, such a Passover had not been celebrated from the days when the judges ruled Israel, nor during all the days of the kings of Israel and the kings of Judah.

verses.latin: sicut in octavodecimo anno regis Iosiæ, hoc phase celebratum est Domino in Ierusalem.
verses.english: It was in the eighteenth year of King Josiah’s reign that this Passover was celebrated for the Lord in Jerusalem, a celebration of unparalleled devotion.

verses.latin: Sed et pythones, et ariolos, et theraphim, et idola, et omnes abominationes, quæ fuerant in terra Iudæ et Ierusalem, abstulit Iosias: ut statueret verba legis, quæ scripta erant in libro, quem invenit Helcias sacerdos in templo Domini.
verses.english: Moreover, Josiah removed all the mediums who consulted the dead, the spiritists, the household idols known as teraphim, the detestable false gods, and all the other abominations that had been present in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem. He did this to establish the words of the Law that were written in the book which Hilkiah the priest had found in the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Similis illi non fuit ante eum rex, qui reverteretur ad Dominum in omni corde suo, et in tota anima sua, et in omni virtute sua, juxta omnem legem Moysi: neque post eum surrexit similis illi.
verses.english: No king before him had turned to the Lord with all his heart, with all his soul, and with all his strength, according to all the Law of Moses. Nor did any like him arise after him. Josiah’s devotion was truly exceptional.

verses.latin: Verumtamen non est aversus Dominus ab ira furoris sui magna, qua iratus est furor ejus contra Iudam propter provocationes quibus provocaverat eum Manasses.
verses.english: Nevertheless, the Lord did not turn away from the great fierceness of His burning anger, with which His wrath had been kindled against Judah because of all the provocations that Manasseh, a former king, had caused.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus: Etiam Iudam auferam a facie mea, sicut abstuli Israël: et proiiciam civitatem hanc Ierusalem, quam elegi, et domum, de qua dixi: Erit nomen meum ibi.
verses.english: So the Lord said: 'I will also remove Judah from My presence, just as I removed Israel, the northern kingdom. I will cast away this city of Jerusalem, which I chose, and the Temple, about which I said: My Name shall be there.' This signified a complete rejection due to the people's persistent sin.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Iosiæ, et omnium quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Iudæ?
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, are these not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.latin: In diebus ejus ascendit Pharao Nechao rex Ægypti contra regem Assyriorum ad flumen Euphraten: et abiit Iosias rex in occursum ejus, et occisus est in Mageddo cum vidisset eum.
verses.english: In those days, Pharaoh Necho, the king of Egypt, went up to attack the king of Assyria by the Euphrates River. King Josiah went out to confront him, and was killed at Megiddo as soon as he saw him in battle.

verses.latin: Et asportaverunt eum servi sui mortuum de Mageddo: et pertulerunt in Ierusalem, et sepelierunt eum in sepulchro suo. Tulitque populus terræ Ioachaz filium Iosiæ: et unxerunt eum, et constituerunt regem pro patre suo.
verses.english: His servants carried his dead body from Megiddo and brought him to Jerusalem, where they buried him in his own tomb. Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz, Josiah’s son, anointed him, and made him king in place of his father.

verses.latin: Viginti trium annorum erat Ioachaz cum regnare cœpisset, et tribus mensibus regnavit in Ierusalem: nomen matris ejus Amital, filia Ieremiæ de Lobna.
verses.english: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for three months in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah, from Libnah.

verses.latin: Fecitque malum coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerant patres ejus.
verses.english: He did evil in the sight of the Lord, just as all his predecessors, his fathers, had done.

verses.latin: Et alligavit eum Pharao Nechao in Rebla, quæ est in terra Emath, ne regnaret in Ierusalem: imposuitque mulctam terræ centum talentis argenti, et talento auri.
verses.english: Then Pharaoh Necho imprisoned him at Riblah, which is in the land of Hamath, to prevent him from reigning in Jerusalem. The Pharaoh also imposed a tribute on the land: one hundred talents of silver and one talent of gold.

verses.latin: Constituitque Pharao Nechao Eliacim filium Iosiæ regem pro Iosia patre ejus: et vertit nomen ejus Ioachim. Porro Ioachaz tulit, et duxit in Ægyptum, et mortuus est ibi.
verses.english: Pharaoh Necho then made Eliakim, Josiah’s son, king in place of his father Josiah, and changed Eliakim’s name to Jehoiakim. As for Jehoahaz, Necho took him away to Egypt, and he died there.

verses.latin: Argentum autem et aurum dedit Ioachim Pharaoni, cum indicto: ut daret unicuique juxta viam suam, et exigeret de populo terræ, et daret Pharaoni Nechao.
verses.english: Jehoiakim paid Pharaoh the silver and gold he demanded, collecting it by imposing a tax on each person according to their means. He exacted the money from the people of the land and gave it to Pharaoh Necho.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat Ioachim cum regnare cœpisset, et undecim annis regnavit in Ierusalem: nomen matris ejus Zebida filia Phadaia de Ruma.
verses.english: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for eleven years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Zebidah, the daughter of Pedaiah, from Rumah.

verses.latin: Fecitque malum coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerant patres ejus.
verses.english: He did evil in the sight of the Lord, just as all his predecessors, his fathers, had done.

verses.latin: In diebus ejus ascendit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, et factus est Ioachim servus ejus tribus annis: et rursum rebellavit contra eum.
verses.english: In his days, Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, came up against Jerusalem. Jehoiakim became his servant for three years, but then he rebelled against him.

verses.latin: Et immisit Dominus in eum latrunculos Chaldæorum, et latrunculos Syriæ, et latrunculos Moab, et latrunculos filiorum Ammon: et immisit eos in Iudam, ut disperderent illud, juxta verbum Domini, quod locutus est per servos suos prophetas.
verses.english: And the Lord sent against him raiding parties of the Chaldeans, and raiding parties of the Syrians, and raiding parties of the Moabites, and raiding parties of the Ammonites. He sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of the Lord, which He had spoken through His servants the prophets.

verses.latin: Propter iram enim Domini factum est hoc in Iuda, ut auferret illum a facie sua propter peccata Manasse, juxta omnia quæ fecit:
verses.english: Indeed, this came upon Judah by the anger of the Lord, so that He might remove them from His presence because of the sins of Manasseh, according to all that he had done.

verses.latin: In diebus illis ascendit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, et factus est ei Joakim servus tribus annis, et rebellavit contra eum.
verses.english: In those days, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon marched on Judah, and Jehoiakim, king of Judah, became his vassal for three years, but then Jehoiakim rebelled against him.

verses.latin: Et immisit Dominus in eum latrones Chaldæos, et latrones Syriæ, et latrones Moab, et latrones filiorum Ammon: et immisit eos in Judam, ut disperderent illam, juxta verbum Domini, quod locutus fuerat per servos suos prophetas.
verses.english: And the Lord God sent against Jehoiakim raiding parties of Chaldeans, and raiding parties of Syrians, and raiding parties of Moabites, and raiding parties of the Ammonites. He sent them into Judah to destroy it, just as the Lord God had declared through His servants, the prophets.

verses.latin: Et quidem juxta verbum Domini factum est in Juda, ut auferret illum a facie sua, propter peccata Manasse, universorum quæ fecit,
verses.english: This happened in Judah precisely as the Lord God had declared: He removed them from His sight because of all the sins of Manasseh, everything that Manasseh had done,

verses.latin: et propter sanguinem innoxium, quem effudit, et implevit Jerusalem innoxio sanguine: et ob hanc rem noluit Dominus propitiari.
verses.english: and because of the innocent blood that Manasseh had shed, filling Jerusalem with innocent blood. Because of this, the Lord God refused to forgive them.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joakim, et universorum quæ fecit, nonne hæc scripta sunt in libro sermonum dierum regum Juda?
verses.english: All the other deeds of Jehoiakim, and everything he did, are they not written in the Book of the Annals of the Kings of Judah?

verses.latin: Dormivitque Joakim cum patribus suis: et regnavit Joachin filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Jehoiakim died and was buried with his ancestors. Then his son Jehoiachin reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Et ultra non processit rex Ægypti de terra sua: tulerat enim rex Babylonis, a rivo Ægypti usque ad fluvium Euphraten, omnia quæ quondam fuerant regis Ægypti.
verses.english: And the king of Egypt never again left his own territory, because the king of Babylon had taken all the lands that once belonged to the king of Egypt, from the Brook of Egypt all the way to the Euphrates River.

verses.latin: Decem et octo annorum erat Joachin cum regnare cœpisset, et tribus mensibus regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Naesthra filia Elnathan de Jerusalem.
verses.english: Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem for three months. His mother's name was Nehushta, daughter of Elnathan, from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque malum coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerat pater ejus.
verses.english: And Jehoiachin did evil in the sight of the Lord God, just as his father had done.

verses.latin: In tempore illo ascendit exercitus regis Babylonis in Jerusalem, et circumdata est civitas munitionibus.
verses.english: At that time, the army of the king of Babylon marched up to Jerusalem, and the city was put under siege.

verses.latin: Et venit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis ad civitatem, obsidentibus eam servis suis.
verses.english: King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon himself came to the city while his servants were besieging it.

verses.latin: Egressusque est Joachin rex Juda ad regem Babylonis, ipse et mater ejus, et servi ejus, et principes ejus, et eunuchi ejus: et suscepit eum rex Babylonis anno octavo regni sui.
verses.english: So Jehoiachin, the king of Judah, surrendered to the king of Babylon—he, his mother, his servants, his princes, and his eunuchs all surrendered. The king of Babylon accepted his surrender in the eighth year of his own reign.

verses.latin: Et asportavit inde universos thesauros domus Domini, et thesauros regis: et concidit universa vasa aurea quæ fecerat Salomon rex Israël in templo Domini, juxta verbum Domini.
verses.english: Nebuchadnezzar carried away all the treasures from the House of the Lord God and all the treasures from the king's palace. He also cut into pieces all the golden vessels that King Solomon of Israel had made for the Temple of the Lord God, just as the Lord God had declared.

verses.latin: Et transtulit omnem Jerusalem, et universos principes, et omnes fortes exercitus, decem millia, in captivitatem: et omnem artificem et claustrarium: et non sunt relicti nisi pauperes populi terræ.
verses.english: He deported all of Jerusalem's inhabitants, all the leaders, and all the mighty warriors—ten thousand of them into captivity. He also took every craftsman and every blacksmith, leaving behind only the poorest people of the land.

verses.latin: Transtulit quoque Joachin in Babylonem, et matrem regis, et uxores regis, et eunuchos ejus: et potentes terræ in captivitatem de Jerusalem in Babylonem.
verses.english: Nebuchadnezzar also deported Jehoiachin to Babylon, along with the king's mother, the king's wives, his eunuchs, and all the powerful men of the land were taken captive from Jerusalem to Babylon.

verses.latin: Et omnes viros robustos, septem millia: et artifices, et claustrarios, mille, omnes viros fortes et bellatores: et adduxit eos rex Babylonis captivos in Babylonem.
verses.english: And all the strong men, numbering seven thousand, and a thousand craftsmen and blacksmiths—all of them strong and capable warriors—the king of Babylon brought them as captives to Babylon.

verses.latin: Et constituit rex Babylonis Matthaniam patruelem ejus pro eo, imposito nomine Sedeciæ.
verses.english: And the king of Babylon then made Mattaniah, Jehoiachin's uncle, king in his place, changing his name to Zedekiah.

verses.latin: Viginti et unius anni erat Sedecias cum regnare cœpisset, et undecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Amital filia Jeremiæ de Lobna.
verses.english: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem for eleven years. His mother's name was Hamutal, daughter of Jeremiah, from Libnah.

verses.latin: Fecitque malum coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerat Joakim.
verses.english: And Zedekiah did evil in the sight of the Lord God, just as Jehoiakim had done.

verses.latin: Iratum est enim Dominus contra Jerusalem et contra Judam, donec projiceret eos a facie sua. Peccavit quoque Sedecias in regem Babylonis.
verses.english: For the Lord God was so angry with Jerusalem and with Judah that He eventually cast them out from His sight. Zedekiah also rebelled against the king of Babylon.

verses.latin: Factum est autem anno nono regni ejus, mense decimo, decima die mensis, venit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, ipse et omnis exercitus ejus, in Jerusalem: et circumdederunt eam, et extruxerunt circa eam munitiones in circuitu.
verses.english: It happened in the ninth year of King Sedecias’ reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month. Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem with his entire army. They surrounded the city and built siege works all around it.

verses.latin: Et obsessa est civitas usque ad undecimum annum regis Sedeciæ.
verses.english: The city remained under siege until the eleventh year of King Sedecias’ reign.

verses.latin: Nona die mensis, prævaluit fames in civitate, et non erant panis populo terræ.
verses.english: On the ninth day of that month, a severe famine gripped the city, and the people of the land had no bread left to eat.

verses.latin: Et interrupta est civitas: et omnes viri bellatores fugerunt nocte per viam portæ, inter duos muros quæ ducit ad hortum regis (Chaldæis obsidentibus urbem in gyro), et rex abiit per viam campestrem.
verses.english: The city’s defenses were breached, and all the fighting men fled by night through the gate between the two walls that led to the king’s garden. The Chaldeans were surrounding the city at this point. The king himself escaped by way of the plain.

verses.latin: Et persecutus est exercitus Chaldæorum regem: et comprehenderunt eum in solitudine Jericho: et omnes bellatores qui cum eo erant, dispersi sunt ab eo.
verses.english: The Chaldean army pursued the king and captured him in the desert plains near Jericho. All the soldiers who had been with him were scattered away from him.

verses.latin: Apprehensum ergo regem, duxerunt ad regem Babylonis in Reblatha, quæ est in terra Emath: qui locutus est cum eo judicium.
verses.english: So, the captured king was brought to the king of Babylon in Riblah, which is in the land of Hamath. There, Nebuchadnezzar pronounced judgment against him.

verses.latin: Filios autem Sedeciæ occidit Nabuchodonosor coram eo: et oculos ejus effodit, et vinxit eum compedibus, et adduxit eum in Babylonem.
verses.english: Nebuchadnezzar then killed Sedecias’ sons right before his eyes. After that, he gouged out Sedecias’ eyes, bound him with bronze chains, and took him to Babylon.

verses.latin: Mense quinto, septima die mensis, ipse est annus decimus nonus regni Nabuchodonosor regis Babylonis, venit Nabuzardan princeps exercitus, servus regis Babylonis, in Jerusalem.
verses.english: In the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month—which was the nineteenth year of the reign of Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon—Nabuzardan, the commander of the royal guard and a servant of the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et incendit domum Domini, et domum regis, et domos Jerusalem, et omnem domum combussit igni.
verses.english: He set fire to the Temple of the Lord, the king’s palace, and all the houses of Jerusalem. Every important building was burned down.

verses.latin: Et muros Jerusalem in circuitu destruxit omnis exercitus Chaldæorum, qui erat cum principe militum.
verses.english: The entire Chaldean army, who were with the commander of the royal guard, tore down the walls of Jerusalem all around the city.

verses.latin: Reliquam autem partem populi qui remanserat in civitate, et perfugas qui transfugerant ad regem Babylonis, et reliquum vulgus transtulit Nabuzardan princeps militiæ.
verses.english: Nabuzardan, the commander of the royal guard, carried away into exile the rest of the people who had remained in the city, along with those who had deserted to the king of Babylon, and all the other common people.

verses.latin: Et de pauperibus terræ reliquit princeps exercitus vinitores et agricolas.
verses.english: However, the commander of the royal guard left behind some of the poorest people of the land to be vine dressers and farmers.

verses.latin: Columnas quoque æreas quæ erant in domo Domini, et bases, et mare æreum quod erat in domo Domini, confregerunt Chaldæi: et transtulerunt æs omnium in Babylonem.
verses.english: The Chaldeans also broke into pieces the bronze pillars that were in the Temple of the Lord, as well as the movable stands and the great bronze basin known as the Sea, which was also in the Lord's Temple. They carried all the bronze from these items away to Babylon.

verses.latin: Ollas quoque æreas, et trullas, et tridentes, et scyphos, et omnia vasa ærea, in quibus ministrabant, tulerunt.
verses.english: They also took away the bronze pots, shovels, snuffers, ladles, and all the other bronze vessels used in the Temple service.

verses.latin: Necnon et thuribula, et phialas, quæ aurea aurea, et argentea argentea, tulit princeps militiæ.
verses.english: The commander of the royal guard also took away the fire pans and the sprinkling bowls, distinguishing those made of solid gold and those made of solid silver.

verses.latin: Columnas duas, et mare unum, et bases quas fecerat Salomon in templo Domini: non erat pondus æris omnium vasorum.
verses.english: As for the two pillars, the one great Sea, and the movable stands that Solomon had made for the Temple of the Lord, the amount of bronze in all these vessels was immeasurable.

verses.latin: Altitudo columnæ unius decem et octo cubitis: et capitellum æreum super illam trium cubitorum: et reti, et malogranata super capitellum columnæ, omnia ærea: et secundum hæc columna secunda habebat.
verses.english: Each pillar was eighteen cubits high, with a bronze capital three cubits high on top. Over the capital, there was bronze lattice work and pomegranates, all made of bronze. The second pillar was identical to this one.

verses.latin: Tulit autem princeps militiæ Saraiam sacerdotem primum, et Sophoniam sacerdotem secundum, et tres janitores.
verses.english: The commander of the royal guard also took away Saraias, the chief priest, Sophonias, the second priest, and the three doorkeepers.

verses.latin: Et de civitate unum eunuchum, qui præfectus erat super viros bellatores: et quinque viros de his qui stabant juxta regem, quos reperit in civitate: et Sopher principem exercitus, et sexaginta viros de populo terræ, qui reperti sunt in civitate.
verses.english: From the city, he took one eunuch who was in charge of the fighting men; five men who served as the king's close advisors, whom he found in the city; Sopher, the commander of the army; and sixty men from the common people of the land, who were also found in the city.

verses.latin: Quos tollens Nabuzardan princeps militiæ, duxit ad regem Babylonis in Reblatha.
verses.english: Nabuzardan, the commander of the royal guard, took all these men and brought them to the king of Babylon in Riblah.

verses.latin: Et percussit eos rex Babylonis, et interfecit eos in Reblatha, in terra Emath: et translatus est Juda de terra sua.
verses.english: There, in Riblah, in the land of Hamath, the king of Babylon struck them down and put them to death. So, Judah was carried away from its own land into exile.

verses.latin: Populo autem qui relictus fuerat in terra Juda, quem dimiserat Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, præfecit Godoliam filium Ahicam filii Saphan.
verses.english: As for the people who had been left behind in the land of Judah, those whom Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, had permitted to remain, he appointed Godolias, the son of Ahicam, the son of Saphan, over them.

verses.latin: Quod cum audissent omnes principes militum, ipsi et viri qui cum eis erant, quod præfecisset rex Babylonis Godoliam, venerunt ad Godoliam in Maspha, Ismaël filius Nathaniæ, et Joanan filius Caree, et Sarea filius Thanehumeth Netophathitis, et Jezonias filius Maachati, ipsi et socii eorum.
verses.english: When all the army commanders—they and their men—heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Godolias as governor, they came to Godolias in Maspha. These were Ismael, son of Nathanias; Joanan, son of Caree; Sarea, son of Thanehumeth the Netophathite; and Jezonias, son of Maachati, along with their companions.

verses.latin: Et juravit Godolias eis, et sociis eorum, dicens: Nolite timere servos Chaldæorum: manete in terra, et servite regi Babylonis, et bene erit vobis.
verses.english: Godolias swore an oath to them and their companions, saying: 'Do not be afraid of serving the Chaldeans. Stay in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it will go well for you.'

verses.latin: Factum est autem in mense septimo, venit Ismaël filius Nathaniæ filii Elisama, de genere regio, et decem viri cum eo: et percusserunt Godoliam, qui mortuus est, sed et Judæos et Chaldæos qui erant cum eo in Maspha.
verses.english: However, in the seventh month, Ismael, the son of Nathanias, the son of Elisama, who was of royal lineage, came with ten men. They struck down Godolias, who died, and also killed the Jews and Chaldeans who were with him in Maspha.

verses.latin: Timuerunt autem omnis populus a parvo usque ad magnum, et principes militum: et consurgentes abierunt in Ægyptum, metuentes Chaldæos.
verses.english: Then all the people, from the least to the greatest, along with the army commanders, were afraid. So they rose up and went to Egypt, fearing the Chaldeans’ retaliation.

verses.latin: Factum est vero trigesimo septimo anno transmigrationis Joachin regis Juda, mense duodecimo, vicesima septima die mensis, sublevavit Evilmerodach rex Babylonis, anno regni sui primo, caput Joachin regis Juda de carcere.
verses.english: It happened in the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Joachin, the king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month. Evilmerodach, the king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, released Joachin, the king of Judah, from prison.

verses.latin: Et locutus est cum eo benignè: et posuit thronum ejus super thronum regum qui erant cum eo in Babylone.
verses.english: Evilmerodach spoke kindly to him and set his throne above the thrones of the other kings who were with him in Babylon.

verses.latin: Et mutavit vestes ejus carceris: et comedebat panem semper in conspectu ejus cunctis diebus vitæ suæ.
verses.english: Joachin was allowed to change out of his prison clothes, and he was given food to eat continually in the king’s presence for the rest of his life.

verses.latin: Allocatio quoque ejus statuta est a rege, cibus singulis diebus, donec moreretur, cunctis diebus vitæ suæ.
verses.english: The king also provided him with a regular daily allowance of food for the remaining days of his life, until his death.
